Premetto mai usato un tapis rouland prima d'ora, amavo fare lunghe passeggiate, ma una fastidiosa tallonite mi ha limitato l'autonomia, per cui ho pensato all'acquisto di un attrezzo che mi consentisse di fermarmi se il dolore diventa troppo fastidioso. Lo uso da circa una settimana e sono veramente soddisfatta dell'acquisto fatto in presenza di uno sconto veramente interessante, poco ingombrante, pedana utile piuttosto confortevole (42x109 cm la pedana), ingombro totale molto contenuto, facilissima l'installazione (unica cosa da sapere che a fianco del cavo di alimentazione c'Ã¨ un interruttore da accendere) e facile da ripiegare se non lo si vuole tenere aperto. Quando si spegne non si ferma di botto ma decresce la velocitÃ  per qualche secondo, poco rumoroso, ottimo per chi.vuole camminare. Per la corsa non so, non credo sia l'ottimo, la velocitÃ  massima del mio modello Ã¨ 6km (per me va bene non sono giovanissima), ma della stessa ditta ce ne sono a 8km e forse anche piÃ¹ veloci. Io riesco benissimo a camminare anche senza l'ausilio della barra e a simulare l'andatura del nordic walking con l'ausilio delle braccia. Vorrei provare con degli elastici legati alla barra (da provare perchÃ© non deve chiudersi) o alle ruotine per vedere di aumentare lo sforzo delle braccia, ma ancora non l'ho fatto. Io mi sento di raccomandare questo TR, unica cosa verificate il modello di cui avete bisogno, su Amazon ne stanno comparendo molti!

Il miglior articolo acquistato nel 2020.
Consegna super rapida (stimata 2 settimane, arrivata dopo 2 giorni).
Arriva giÃ  montato e con nastro lubrificato, bisogna solo utilizzarlo appena tolto dalla scatola.
Altezza sul punto massimo 12cm precisi (indispensabile per me che ho un letto a 12,5 cm... Entra perfettamente sotto).
Abbastanza silenzioso, ottimo per la corsa leggera a 8 km/ora e per le camminate.
Col bluetooth integrato le canzoni dalle casse hanno un suono niente male, magari il volume poteva essere piÃ¹ alto ma comunque si sente perfettamente (e di sicuro meglio che dal cellulare).
La lubrificazione automatica Ã¨ la ciliegina sulla torta: quando c'Ã¨ bisogno si accende una spia che ricorda di aggiungere il lubrificante, sul lato superiore sinistro della base câÃ¨ un piccolo tappo arancione che copre il buco dove inserirlo (nella confezione Ã¨ incluso un flaconcino da 15 ml), nelle istruzioni comunque c'Ã¨ scritto tutto il procedimento.
Il poggiamani si apre e chiude in 2 secondi, e ha tutte le funzioni che servono. Il coperchio per i pulsanti riesce a tenere un cellulare (ha anche un filo di gomma antiscivolo), anche se purtroppo i tablet non li regge. Ã presente anche un telecomando, volendo, se non si vuole usare i comandi sul manubrio.
La larghezza del nastro Ã¨ assolutamente perfetta, per me che sono alto 182cm (di meno sarebbe stato davvero troppo poco).
Nonostante abbia le rotelline posteriori, durante la camminata o la corsa non si sposta di un millimetro, e risulta stabile e il passo ammortizzato.
Lo uso tutti i giorni almeno 45/60 minuti continuativi e non fa una piega.
Insomma... Con questo prezzo davvero non potevo chiedere di meglio!

rev_det.name:
As the title says I was incredibly impressed after using this this treadmill the last 48 hours. I don't always write reviews mainly because I'm a very blunt and harsh critic and also a detailed perfectionist. Very few products will actually inspire me to do a review and only on the extreme end of either very good or terrible product. I can say with full confidence this is a five star product and I am pleasantly surprised and happy with my purchase. I will now list all the reasons that I checked and how I came to my final rating.
1. Unboxing- True to the claim on the webpage that the treadmill was preinstalled and didn't need any bolting screw driving or any other outside mechanical items. In the past with other treadmills companies they usually claim this but in my experience I have found there is always at least one to or sometimes multiple items that I need to install just to get the machine working. Not in this case!!
2. instructions Manual- Small size - The instructions were very thorough and concise with pictures and very easy to read and even the editing/grammar was flawless. usually ding two or 3 stars simply just if the instruction manual is not coherent in its instructions. It took me about 3 minutes to read the instructions from front to back and that is also the last half of the manual was showing how to keep the maintenance and they even give lubrication bottle for two maintain the track belt. As for the instructions it was step-by-step on how to set it up with no confusion or incoherent jargon that other instruction manuals fall prey too with other different treadmill products. Honestly it took me about 3 minutes to read (front to back) and I was actively looking for flaws so another person would take shorter time.
2. Setup- It does take less than 60 seconds to get this machine up and running. I timed it at 36 seconds on my stopwatch for my first time. I thought at first I had made a mistake because of how simple and easy the process was that I went back to the instructions just to see if I missed anything. Nope everything was in order and it's literally that simple!
3. Safety- There is a bright red/orange magnetic cord that you clip onto your shirt or shorts which in case you fall/trip it will immediately turn off the treadmill so no further damage will happen. I stimulated falling and tripping several times to test the cord and it worked perfectly.
4. Operation - Wow! It really is silent. Let me reiterate it is the most silent treadmill I've ever experienced in the last 14 years. Running was smooth and how the design is with the bottom of the treadmill having a gap in the middle on the floor has easily been a comfortable experience. Usually my knees ache on most treadmills even with super expensive treadmills that I have tried in the past; but not this time. This alone justified the low price of the treadmill as other treadmills which are easily double the price don't come anywhere close to the comfort I've had on this treadmill.
5. Customer support- I wanted to test how active and responsive this company was since I had never used them before. I call it usually a practice run just in case if something ever happened I could see how the company reacts before a possible problem ever occurred. Usually customer support for most companies are pretty substandard in my opinion but not this Advenor company. I got same day responses and excellent customer service and I could see based on their professionalism that they are company that is customer driven to be happy with their product.
Conclusion- Wow this is without a doubt the first review that I would actually give six stars if it was possible instead of the limit of five on Amazon. Seriously don't waste money on other old company brands of treadmills that sell you super priced features and shoddy quality. This Advenor Treadmill is worth every penny and I am supremely happy with my purchase. 6 STARS!!!

I received this foldable treadmill today and I could not wait to unpack it! The treadmill was lightweight and easy to setup by myself with back problems. I had the complete setup within 20 minutes or less. The display was very bright and the buttons were easily accessed. I appreciated the slim fit of this treadmill as I had limited space to work with in my garage. Even though it is slim fit and light it packs a PUNCH with allowing me to power walk. I highly recommend this wonderful treadmill for a great home workout! Iâm excited!!!

rev_det.name: Really love this machine so far! I work in a very quiet cubicle space with 15 or so others. This treadmill is super easy to use, works great and is actually pretty quiet! Only the people right next to me can hear anything. The motor doesnât make any noise, but there is some light sound from the belt moving and my actual walking. It beeps loudly multiple times when starting and once when you change speeds, which is a little annoying. But once you get going, the only sound is from the belt and walking. When I received it, I was able to remove it from the box myself and wheel it into position. Itâs not overly heavy. Simply plug it in and itâs ready to go. Instructions say to apply silicone lubricant beneath the belt beforehand. There is no application hole, so I just squeezed some of the provided lubricant under the belt on both sides. The remote takes AAA batteries, which were surprisingly included. I have used it 2-3 hours each day while I worked. Itâs very easy to get used to, and doesnât affect my ability to type or get work done. While walking, the display rotates between 1) distance walked, 2) calories burned, and 3) time spent on the machine. The feet on the machine do create an indentation in the carpet, so you may want to consider a mat underneath. The speed goes from 0 to 6 in .5 increments. I walk comfortably at 3.5 or 4 and can start breaking a light sweat after 20-30 minutes. You might want to consider a small fan to have at your desk. The 6 speed would accommodate a very light jogging speed. With standard shipping, it arrived 12 days from the date I placed the order. Very pleased with this purchase so far. Now Iâm just hoping it lasts a decent amount of time since Iâll be using it frequently!

Small enough to fit in the corner of my small bedroom. Light. Compact. Easy to move. Sleek. No set up or assembly. I jog and walk on it. Only goes up to 6.0 so if you run really really fast probably not the treadmill for you but Perfect treadmill for my needs at a great price.

Received this yesterday and I love love love it! The only sounds it makes besides the countdown beeps is the sound of my shoes hitting the belt as I walk. All I had to do was get it out of the box, wheel it under my desk, and plug it in. Great for standing desks!
Really bad quality product stopped working after one day. Need to return.

My treadmill came with the wrong remote that does not work with the product. Multiple other recent reviews and feedback have just recently stated the same problem as of Aug/Sept 2020 and the company has not responded. I have tried changing the battery, the instruction manual only contains a different remote entirely, and have also tried downloading the Gfit app mentioned in the Amazon listing. There are no instructions for the app in the user's manual and there is no way for the treadmill to be picked up by bluetooth as the app describes.
This is a scam product, probably scam app, and should not be purchased. It appears this USED to be legit- I read a lot of reviews - but something has recently changed. They used to only have 6% negative review feedback and now have over 50% negative in the last 30 days with numerous people reporting the same unsolved problems.
Appears to be used equipment. Cord has bite marks and the walking pad has markings indicating it has been used prior. I purchased ânewâ so this is a big disappointment.

I love this treadmill! It's very easy to assemble, use, and store. I recently started working from home (been off due to covid19) and was very worried to be sitting at my desk all day and this little treadmill has given me peace of mind. I am doing everything I can within my power to not let a desk job give me 10 pounds of fat around my hips.
The remote that came in the box didnt match what was on the user instructions, so it took me a little while to figure out how to use it, but after getting a new battery and playing with it, I figured it out. Its really very easy.
Best purchase ever. Its small enough to put anywhere. Iâve been using it every day to run. Itâs great!

Perfect for our low ceiling basement! So far this treadmill works great! Comes fully assembled, just plug in and go. Highest level is 6 which is perfect for jogging! The remote is very convenient. Folds up for easy storage!
The treadmill shortens the power fuse when plugged in even not being used, also requires very specific location of the remote to change speed and turn on/off

rev_det.name: I like it!! ð

This was a great purchase. Spent a week straight hunting for the right affordable treadmill. Below is a list of things I was personally looking for in a treadmill, and this has passed all those marks:
-can reach at least 7mph
-a belt wide enough to run on
-simple interface the whole family could use
-easy folding
-cupholders
-comfortable treadway, for even the most worn out joints
-does not shake like there's an earthquake when in use
-under $400
I don't do video reviews often so sorry about the repetitive speech.
If you're hunting for that affordable treadmill, you're seeing all these neat luxuries on more expensive ones that you think you need. For example:
-bluetooth speakers [you probably own better bluetooth speakers, or will use headphones]
-video screen/special FX [you're there to get fit, not enjoy a matinee]
-High inclines [beneficial but not necessary]
Yeah, you don't need all that nonsense
This took me 30 minutes to assemble by myself. Instructions are poorly written, but there were NOT many pieces
I gave this 4 stars because I cut myself on a piece that was broken and jutting out, which is the equivalentof being slapped by someone you just met.
The screen can be difficult to view and the cupholders are poorly placed. The system has limited memory--not much return function so keeping track of things can be difficult. The preset workouts are very odd and not well balanced at all.
Despite that, I strongly recommend this treadmill

So far so good it was easy to assemble with a lil bit of muscle to help. I truly like the size of the machine Iâm 5 feet 145lbs itâs perfect for me. I bought this specific machine because of the belt size. Other machines belts were 12.5 wide this one is 17. If your looking for equipment on a budget this is the winner!

Package arrived early. Postal service damaged it during shipping. However, reached out to Amazon and they connected me with the vendor. The vendor said they will send me a new part to replace the damaged one. They were prompt but will update review once I receive it. Otherwise the treadmill seems nice. Im 5'9 and it fits me well and is sturdy when I did a slight jog.

The treadmill did not work out for us but I am giving them four stars do to their customer service and fast response they worked with me until we found the solution that would work best for us I really appreciate that!

ð Easy to put together. Some parts should and could already be assembled but they're not
ð The additional 1" wide belt helps us. I usually hit the sides on full-size mills and this was a + for us
ð Simple functional screen with the workout details. (Calories, distance, time, speed, etc. are all included)
ð Easy to operate the folding mechanism
ð Quick enough to jog/run on it
ð The screen is hard to see at certain angles. If you're 5' tall, this is not a problem. It has that type of digital screen where you have to be angled just right to be able to read it. At this price, the screen could be better.

I very much like the overall design and all the easy to use functions of the treadmill. Nice and compact for home use. My wife and myself purchased it for our 30 minute daily walking exercise to keep us fit and health. We really enjoy it.
BM

I bought this treadmill as part of a Wellness Program at work. I had a $300 limit and I did not want to spend more than that. I needed something a can use indoors to walk. This treadmill is great for that. Easy to assemble as well, my 16 year old son put it together quite easily. I did end up paying $30 out of pocket but this product was worth me coughing up a little more than expected. I think this is a great treadmill and I am extremely happy with it so far.

Amazing customer service, very fast and courteous. Strong motor, awesome & solid treadmill all around. I conducted a regression analysis using 15 different variables from 11 different treadmills, this was the winner. It is the best! I am a runner, hitting my 14 year mark in the Army, and this is the treadmill for me. Thank you!
Treadmill works perfectly, but came slightly damaged. The damage doesnât affect the functionality, itâs just really annoying. Works well for the size and prize.

I looked at several small treadmills on the internet and had a particular one picked out and then quite by accident came across this one. It had more HP and a wider belt. I received it about 2 weeks ago and had no problem assembling it. I use it primarily to walk on in the winter months or if the weather is not conducive to walk outside. I set my own pace and time. I have tried a couple of pre-programed settings but they either go too slow or too fast during the workout. Of course, you can manually adjust the speed any time. There is an adjustment for a slight incline on the machine. The controls are conveniently located. I found some damage to the plastic by the handles of the treadmill when received but it did not affect the use of it. So far I am very pleased with this treadmill.

I am upgrading my review from a zero to a 4. Reasons:
1) Instructions are close to impossible to follow, not clear at all, and in the link they send you can't really see what he's doing.
2) It is very heavy, you need 2 people to put it together.
3) Once we finally got it put together (even though some parts didn't really match up correctly) the tread started to move back and forth, and we had to adjust it multiple times - a LOT of work putting it together!
4) Runs great so far. If that changes I will re-review it.

Great little treadmill for walking/jogging, if you are on a budget it is affordable. It came pre-assembled and is a space saver. I feel it works better for not very tall people. It is very easy to use. It has programs in it from 1-7, it is great for indoor workout. The incline does not really change from flat much. I recommend this product!

I'm 5 ft 4 inch tall and weigh about 140 lbs. This little machine is perfect for me to go on a run when the weather isn't permitting. It's small, fits in tight places, and works like a charm. HOWEVER it says it fits up to 220 pounds and I call BS on that. My husband is 6ft 5 inch and weighs 210. The machine literally bends when he runs on it. The sound it makes is scary. Every time he gets on it I am afraid he's going to put his foot right through the middle of it. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone over 6ft or maybe 180lbs?

At this price, I expected much less of a machine. I have used it several times and it has exceeded my expectations. It is sturdy and quiet. There is almost no motor noise. The base is a bit shorter than treadmills I am accustomed to, but my stride fits fine. I am 5'7" and find the panel a bit too short, but beyond that, this treadmill is perfect. It is heavy-- getting it upstairs required 2 people. Once I got it opened though, it was easy to put together. The safety switch and pre-set programs are nice options, and ones I would have expected in a more expensive treadmill. I researched many treadmills in this price range, and am happy with this purchase.

So far this treadmill is holding up very well. 2 of the screws did not fit but I really didnât need them. I accidentally put the treadmill on an incline while doing the assembly and was wondering why just walking was a bit of a struggle. Finally figure it out and fixed it. Workout are a lot easier now. My daughter and I both use it at least twice a day. The arm handles could be a bit wider apart but I am able to deal with it. Sometimes I accidentally stop my workouts due to the button on the arm handles that control the start and stop. Overall I really like the treadmill and have been using it about a month

I received my treadmill a lot earlier than estimated which was super nice, but when I looked at the package you can tell it was not taken care of through the shipping process... not sellers fault. Upon opening the package I notice a crack in the left handle (pictured) which I notice by some others reviews it was the same handle and place my crack was on thereâs. Isnât that big of an issue for me doesnât affect the treadmill at all or bother me... I would LOVE to give this a 5 start rating because the treadmill is super sturdy, Iâve had no issues with it running and it was super easy putting it together. BUT the reason why I rated 3 stars and not 5 is because I bought this because of the covid that lift and lower factor of the treadmill and unfortunately I canât not lift mine. (Pictured) you can see that my treadmill is lopsided when it is lifted for some reason, the handle stops it from being lifted and when I push up really hard it does go past but then the orange incliner part completely stops it from being lifted. Thereâs no way to push it up anymore around the plastic piece. Hoping the company will reach out to help me fix the problem.

They said it was easy to put together I had to ask someone to come and pay them to bring it up my stairs only to find out that the metal is bent and damaged it cannot be put together and now I have to figure out how to get it back to mail it to return and it is very extremely heavy even with two people we could not lift it this is the worst thing that I have ever purchased and I deeply regret it

Itâs seems good we have not used it perhaps more than three or four times. Moving So itâs packed and Our use is on the back burner. The length of tread is short. My wife is 5â2â Iâm 5â10â I canât get a full stride. So itâs hers and mountain biking is for me.

This treadmill is decent value for money. Arrived earlier than expected date and the seller support was awesome.
Top panel got damaged in shipping but they sent the replacement part almost immediately.
This is very easy to move and fold in case you have small space. Almost a month in, used it everyday for brisk walking and mild running. Pretty sturdy and not too noisy. Belt kind of drifts to side sometimes but nothing that caused any issues so far.

My treadmill arrived damaged - front panel covering the motor was cracked. I was able to work with the seller to get a replacement part and was compensated for my troubles. The treadmill works great and is wide enough and long enough for the purposes for which I purchased it. I am very happy with this treadmill and the seller.

We only use the treadmill to walk on, so based on that the unit should be fine. The design, however, is poor. Both my wife and I have to bend down to hold the handles and it is uncomfortable. A slightly longer bed would also help a great deal.
Great product Iâm so happy
This treadmill works great. My stepson put it together with ease.

Extremely disappointed. I assembled the treadmill, pressed the power button makes a sound and the treadmill belt doesn't move. Tried powering off again and powering on, can't see anything stuck and clearly don't have the expertise to figure out the issue. Extremely disappointed after lugging it all the way in.
Has done a perfect job of holding the floor down while making the perfect clothes hanger.

Treadmill came pretty much all assembled, just a few bolts and screws to attach. I'm 5'8" this smaller size works just fine. Everything about this treadmill works great. Happy with this purchase. Hope it lasts.
Easy to setup and adjust the belt. It's working very well. I like it that's so cheap and wonderful.
Easy to assemble, and good value for money spent. I live in Florida and I can use the treadmill on very hot or rainy days. The size is perfect and will fold up if necessary.

I canât determine if it has an incline, Iâve been trying to ask the question, but donât know where to go with it? Thatâs the main part that I am disappointed about because it doesnât have an incline, Iâve read all through the book.other than that, I like it for the price I paid for it..
Dim LCD display, hear rate is not accurate.

Walking surface too hard and handles too low. Button to turn on at base and with my arthritis it is difficult to bed down to turn on.
It is quiet though and has a basic program

Treadmill is small. I let my husband pick this treadmill out for my daughter and he did not pay attention to the size. Not a big deal for my daughter and I because we are short, but he is not! Great treadmill for a smaller person!

Easy to assemble itâs also sturdy
Not hard to look at either
Works fine
I liked that there are different programs that is pre-set for you. It can really help when you don't know how to start a schedule for running on this machine.
Instructions never mention you have to turn on the toggle switch up front by the cord to get the treadmill to work.
Nice, easy to assemble treadmill. Not gym quality but not gym price. It meets my needs for in home exercise without breaking the bank.
Product is damaged. Crack is clearly seen in photo.
I just love it some of my family members want me to give it to them i said no way. I will tell you were i bought it from but you can't have this one.
I like that it was easy to set up
Great machine many programs to choose from.Sturdy well made.yed I recommend it
Both my wife and I really enjoy .

I enjoy my tredmill very much, what I didn't like is that the panel was broken looks like during the transport my package was dropped because the box itself had a hole in it, good thing is that the screen was ok and it works fine
For the money ! Yes very satisfied .

I bought this great treadmill so I could keep doing cardio exercise without needed to join a gym. This treadmill was supper easy to put together, because it already mostly assembled when arrived. And youâll find that the electric treadmill is quiet and runs well, this monitor could shows time, distance, calories burned, heart rate and speed. Extremely to easy to fold, and has wheels for easy movement and storage. The compact treadmill is perfect for our vacation home. Overall, Iâm very pleased with this purchase and would recommend this treadmill.

Do not waste your money on this product. It is the epitome of "you get what you pay for". Within a couple of months not only did this equipment breakdown but I also had to spend a couple of days going back-and-forth between their customer service to determine what the issue was. Not only did the motor have to be replaced but they sent me a replacement motor that was broken as well. If you are as serious about exercising, safety and durability as I am, do yourself a favor and do not invest in this product.
very nice ð perfect to my apartment very easy to use ð
This is great for what I need it. The only cons would be the machine make a slight noise when you start going past 1.5 and it is meant for smaller people, it is not wide.

I used to be a gym member of YMCA. Since I purchased this treadmill I realized I wasted all my money on the gym membership. I barely go there to do exercise. Either I am too lazy to drive there or I am always so tired after work. I don't have any motivation. So I just wanted to give a try for this treadmill. I did all research on this brand---Echanfit before I purchased it.
First, one thing really caught my eyes is the treadmill can be folded. It saves me a lot of space. I can put it away easily when I am done using it. Perfect for my home. Second, the handle arms has speed control, I don't need to use the screen and the running machines supposed to be quiet. Third, they provide 24/7 customer service. So that is why I choose this treadmill.
Let me tell you about my experience..
It takes about two weeks for me to receive the package. No damaged, the treadmill is in a good condition. It is well made and sturdy. No complaints. It does take two people to assemble because someone has to hold the console piece while you connect with one of the wire. It took me 30 minutes to finish up. There is a switch at the bottom in the front that turns on the treadmill after you plugging it into the wall. I would say It is pretty easy and simple to assemble. It comes with a large LCD display and 15 pre-set programs just as the website describe. I can monitor the correct time data for each exercise. I am 6 feet and 150 pounds. It works perfectly for me for home exercise. I can run anytime I want at home. I can run anywhere I want because it is foldable I can easily move around. I am extremely happy with this purchased.

This is my late Christmas gift to my self, This machine is my favorite routine every morning, is strong and a good size for you apartment, I'm 5"5/140 pounds, looking forward to see a great results for summer! Give it a try, Did mention?I ordered this machine in January 2nd , they said I will receive it in January 27, but it arrived January 8th, I'm so pleased with the shipping process...

Every piece was clearly marked and setup took no longer than 15 min. All the controls were intuitive and I was using it no problem as soon as I plugged it in. Because it can be folded up, itâs easy to move out of the way to clear up space If needed. Great addition for indoor cardio when the weather outside isnât good for running.

rev_det.name:
This is a great, simple, sturdy treadmill. I didn't want something big and bulky, or too sleek that it's flimsy, and this treadmill is perfect.
It comes already put together in the box. You just have to add 2 screws and a lock-pin and that's it.
The directions are clearly written by someone who speaks a different language, but it's still clear enough to figure it out. What they don't spell out in the instructions, and is buried in a bunch of fine print is the belt lubricant. Just lift up each side and squeeze it under the belt from top to bottom, and then turn on and let run for 5 minutes and you're good to go.
I didn't need to tighten or loosen the belt at all, it worked great right out of the box, with no skipping or lagging.
All in all, this is a great treadmill to lose a few of those pesky quarantine pounds on. It gets 2 thumbs up from me for ease of use, sturdiness, size, and simplicity.

Overall a decent treadmill for the price. Its not too noisy. The quality looks decent the only thing is if your 5"10 like me you do feel like your towering over it but its fine. It folds nicely and small even though it couldnt fit under my bed it takes up little space as you can see i squeezed it into our small bedroom. It was easy set up straight out of the box. Everything much is manual. Lightweight and can be moved easily.One thing i dont like is once you start a workout you cant PAUSE and come back.

This treadmill is great for the price and perfect for small spaces. I needed something affordable to keep active during my busy schedule as well as something with a high weight limit and this was exactly what I needed. Took less than 10 mins to put together (longest part was taking it out the box-a little on the heavy side). Being that I keep it in my guest room its super easy to fold up and put in the closet. Totally worth every penny!

We were looking a compact foldable treadmill that was affordable and we found just that! This treadmill was easy to assemble less than 10 minutes to put together and it was perfect for my family to all use during this pandemic! Worth the buy so far so good! I did purchase the insurance that comes with this treadmill if for any reason this machine malfunctions but so far itâs been very useful and worth the buy!

I specifically searched for a treadmill that was suitable for at least 300lbs and the description of the treadmill I chose clearly stated max user weight 300lbs but after receiving the item and reading the instruction manual the max user weight states 100kg which converts to 220lbs....I am furious that I did not receive what I paid for and returning to the seller is a nightmare as I am supposedly responsible for return shipping and the shipping label doesn't give the seller name or address in English so how do I know where the item is going and am I expected to pay a ridiculous amount to return an item I am unsatisfied with?

It is a simple to set up and use treadmill.
I've had the treadmill 2 weeks now and use it most days.
It has a monitor that tells you how much time you've spent on it, your speed, and distance calories burnt. I bought it to use in conjunction with long walks to help keep myself fit during this lockdown. It folds away nicely to fit in a cupboard out of the way and when I want to use it I can take out and set up within a couple of minutes. I find the resistance settings really good for my beginner level, and so far it's been an excellent way to increase my fitness levels and strength in my legs. I would 100% recommend this treadmill to anyone looking to lose weight and who doesn't feel comfortable in the gym or in public to do so.
Running 5k a day I have managed to lose 1 stone in 10 days, unbelievable and could not have done it without this treadmill! I will be saving money to add to my collection of Himimi, extremely good quality and value for money. In my eyes this is worth every single penny!

I'm loving my treadmill!
So easy to put together and easy to move. Quiet with different mode settings. Perfect for me!!
Definitely recommend!

Pros: - good resistance levels - foldability allows compact storgae - some screws already pre fitted - lcd monitor is good to keep track of the treadmill, it shows calories, time, speed, distance, pulse. Compact, does not require too much space, so I keep it unfolded. Love that it can be folded away and opened out within seconds - you just unscrew, open out and screw again. Cons: - was a bit fiddly to set up but just follow instructions. Nice smooth action once you get the hang of it.
I bought it for walking, but my kids have tried it too, so I can say it's definitely good at high speed running! If you're looking for something that is budget friendly and helps get those steps in safely, I'd recommend this.

Easy to assemble & fold.
I like that it is somewhat small & compact & doesn't take up much room when not in use.

Customer service was helpful in resolving an issue with the shipping on this item, though they did initially confuse my order with a different treadmill which had supposedly been damaged during transit. While my product did arrive late, it was still intact at least. The product sits at a slight incline, which affords a more intense workout experience; however, the highest speed setting provided is a 6.0, which differs wildly from that of a larger, more powerful machine found at the local gym. With my long legs I can speed walk up to a pace of roughly 5.0 with this treadmill, which would be a good solid run on a similar machine at any recreation center with state of the art equipment. Itâs a relatively compact and lightweight contraption, easily moved from one room to the next when company is expected. I do wish the machine had some sort of shelf attached to it up top, to help hold a smartphone or iPad securely when in use. Overall, I would recommend this product.

rev_title.name: Worth it for a decent treadmill
Perfect little treadmill for heavier people!
Easy to put together, move and use!

rev_det.name:
Arrived damaged. One of the assembly screw holes arrived cross threaded. Screw would just spin and never tighten.
Company expects buyer to pay to ship a hundred plus pound box back to them. Despite it being the seller's fault for shipping the product damaged. Avoid this company.

Assembly was a bit of a struggle. I recommend really taking your time. Do not force screws into position. You may strip them or break something. Once I was able to assemble it, it was great. Itâs sturdy. The digital display works well. For the price, you really couldnât ask for more. This is not a top of the line treadmill. Itâs not meant for performance athletes or fitness experts. It is a very basic machine intended for beginners or those seeking to add walking or jogging to their exercise routines. And in that way, it meets expectations.
I ordered this product for a small area in my living room, fits perfectly and gets the job done!

Package shipped in a timely manner. All parts accounted for. A good deal of assembly needed, unfortunately holes for bolts on right handle bar were way off. I did have necessary tools to finally get things in order. The tool supplied is not sufficient for the job. I worked on assembly for a good hour before having to go to big box store to obtain addition nuts a bolts to complete assembly. It took a bit of rigging to get this up and running. Truthfully once assembled it works fine. I cannot fine fault with its operation. Unfortunately, the difficult assembly does not recommend this machine.
Easy to assemble and relatively light weight. Easily folded and moved.

This treadmill works well once you figure out how to put it together. Coming out of the box
It looked simple enough to put together but you have to move/adjust pieces to get it right. But once you get it
Together it works well. Not to loud and easily supports my 190 pounds. Not to heavy and not to big.

I loved this product when I received it, only there was a000000008 problem, it would not turn on. I got in touch with JAXPETTY service and they were absolutely fantastic to work with, they tried everything to sort out the problem, unfortunately the problem was not fixed so they refunded my money. I would recommend this seller.
I love it!

So the band is not that thick, so if you tend to be heavyset, maybe this is not for you. So far this works for me. I had one side of the treadmill that was difficult to assemble-the screws kept bouncing out. However, I used a hammer to kind of get it going and then continued to screw it in. Iâve been concerned about the motor blowing out based on previous reviews, but so far this works for me. If you want to put your phone in the cup holder, Iâd suggest you have a smaller phone if you still want to be able to see the screen. Customer service was really good, however, and they answered my questions about shipment times right away. Overall, Iâd say itâs hit or miss.

Item arrived before Christmas and assembled well despite rather scanty instructions. I did have trouble understanding how to activate the preset programs and contacted Jaxpety by email via amazon. They replied promptly by simply sending me a copy of the relevant page in the user manual. I tried again to follow these instructions and was successful. Simple, clean, portable, quiet, all for less than $300 ... what's not to like?

Great treadmill (so far) for the price. I am very petite (5â1â) so itâs perfect. My husband is able to use it but canât have a very long stride. Only about 4 screws needed to put it together but we did have to use a drill vs the tool it came with. It was just too hard to get the screw in w that tool. The only thing I dislike is the size of the cup holder. It is extremely small and a Kroger water wonât even fit in it.

I was hesitant with all these negative reviews on how difficult it was to assemble, but I set it up myself in 15 minutes. There's only four steps / 6 bolts. This treadmill is mini and perfect for small spaces and short strides. You won't be marathon or sprint training on this, but you should assume that with the price. I'm able to get a good sweat with the presets they have and the free walking too!

I did so much research before deciding on making the purchase. I was worried that it wouldn't be a great investment but the quality is pretty great. The only thing I'm not a fan of is the bolts - you have to take them out in order to fold the treadmill and put away. I wish it was easier.
I read some reviews saying it was hard to assemble and the manual wasn't really clear...it literally took me less than 15 mins to assemble the whole thing and the manual has simple pictures with labeled item numbers telling you where to place them.
Overall, I would recommend, it was a great purchase and my mom and I have been using it everyday and it's been running well (I use it for about an hour switching between walking, jogging and running).

I really like this treadmill because it is compact, light and very functional. Our whole family is currently using it each day. It's perfect for small spaces, but big enough for a large man to use. (I am a 6'4" 220lbs. man). We will probably use it this winter and store it away for the summer because we can walk outside. It reads out distances in kilometers, which is only a problem for my wife who doesn't understand the metric system. The heart rate monitor has been off too, but regardless I am pleased with this purchase. 100% would buy it again.

I didnt expect much from this product since it was cheap but dont let the price fool you. This treadmill went BEYOND MY EXPECTATIONS. Honestly I dont run alot but when I do I stay on level 5 because its fast for me so I cant even imagine level 10! Also this treadmill is a space saver I live in a apartment and does not take up space and is not bulky. I deff recommend.

Buyer beware! This is not a reputable company. Tried to call them about the product. Phone not operable. Plus the company makes you pay for the return which is not cheap. Itâs made for a very short person with short legs. Would not buy again. Not very stable either.

Love it! I recently found out im pregnant and didn't want to go to an actual gym due to covid and I bought this treadmill so I could still keep up with my steps! and I absolutely love it!!!! very small, you can fit it any where
Fast delivery. Although upon arrival, a small part was damaged. The company quickly replaced the part. I am pleased overall. It's not a large treadmill, but meets my needs very well.

My husband assembled this without problems. It is not very big. So if you are looking for something on a grandeur scale then move on, but for me it has been perfect!!! It doesnt take up much room, it's very functional and does what I need it to.

I returned it. The frame was slightly bent, and so it wasn't flat on the floor and the uprights were at an angle. One of the screws that holds the console didn't work. The actual mechanics (treadmill, controls) worked fine.

rev_det.name:
During this period of Covid-19 and with our public gyms and fitness centers closed, it is difficult exercising as before. I tried walking but I felt I needed a more rigorous program. With limited space at home, exercise equipment is not practical. However, I found this particular treadmill, a smaller version of the traditional treadmill and it fits perfectly in an empty space in my bedroom. It really requires no installation outside of tightening some bolts and its ready to go. I had visions of storing it under the bed when not in use but this did not work because when folded it doesn't fit. Therefore I leave it in the open position and it's ready whenever I am. While it doesn't give you various settings found on the traditional treadmills, you can set the speed as it does register the distance and time which is all I need. It's a great addition and am very pleased with it.
During this difficult time, it helps keep an exercise regimen in the comfort of your home and I would recommend it most highly.

This has been the greatest thing I own, we live in a 600 sqft home and I am able to store this behind my couch. Assembly is easy but becomes a pain doing it every time you work out so I found a place to keep it up. Overall I already got my money out of it!

Took it out of the box and the wire that connects the part of the machine to use was cut. This is so unacceptable. As the item is too heavy for me to bring somewhere to return- this seller needs to send me another machine ASAP and have someone come and schedule for a carrier to pick up this damaged product. Ugh, Iâm so mad.

Havenât been able to use it do to the fact that they forgot to put the safety key in the box and everyone knows that the machine doesnât work with out the safety key. Iâve tried to reach out to seller and no one has gotten back to me. Over all the product is good quality sturdy and well put together. My advice is buy a safety key when you order this so you donât run into the same problem Iâm having.

I Have noticed that the walking pad has started shifting to one side which is concerning (if it continues). All that being said, for the money, it is compact, cute in the white and pink color, and reliable (so far) for a basic walking treadmill.

This is perfect for someone who has no space for a big treadmill but still wants to workout as a woman I find this perfect so I do not have to go on runs alone! Itâs very quiet and the speed settings are great! They are fast I usually stay on 3
Good product and good value.

Packaging was great, easy to move, did have a problem with the power & emailed the company. They got back to me in less than 24 hours with a video on a possible fix. It worked & have had no problems since. The bar is squeaky & slightly wobbly but not scary wobbly when holding on (book or tablet is a little fuzzy), you may want a sound mat for the thudding of the steps (I am on a vinyl/pergola type floor with only concrete under it which may be enhancing the sound). I'm enjoying getting a walk or run in w/o worry about weather/allergies.

I live in a small studio. I got this threadmill last Friday and so far it has been great! Have done 3 workouts since. I've been able to run/jog on it and have a great sweat session. I wasn't able to store it under my couch, but I placed it on an empty corner and pop it out when I'm ready for a workout. So far I'm loving this threadmill :) Will update in case anything changes. Glad I bought it!!

I love it itâs awesome the color is perfect; it works great perfect for the job; Iâm staying in shape !
Great value for the money. Folds away neatly.

rev_det.name:
Just what I was looking for. Relatively quiet so it won't wake up my kids in the next room Fits perfectly under my desk so I can walk while working, I only give it 4 stars because the remote has no wrist band to use in case you drop the remote and the speeds are only in .5 increments (which is really fine since while working I don't do more than 2.5 but would be nice to maybe do 2.3). But those are the only complaints. Very lightweight. I roll to my bedroom in the evening when done working and continue walking there. I did buy a small mat to put under it as I have carpet. AND it arrived a e week early!! Put my Apple watch on my ankle and go!
EDIT: itâs quiet at slower speeds. Remember itâs not a full-sized treadmill. So you will get some noise. I wouldnât run on it. I do that on my regular treadmill. This is just to get some walking in while working for me.

I am seriously impressed with the customer service of this company and the treadmill was of better than expected quality.
The treadmill arrived exactly as described and It really is pretty much take it out of the box and you're done there is no assembly. Unfortunately I did not factor in a few things before my purchase that turned out to be pretty important.
First, if you are older like me you may find that not having anything to hold on to when you are walking on a moving surface 6 inches above your floor is not really safe. I can do it but i found myself having to position the treadmill next to a wall to help my balance a little. I've used treadmills for years and love them and had no idea that not having those handrails would be an issue. I mean i walk all the time with no handrail right? That reasoning was flawed for obvious (now) reasons.
Second, and this was the issue that caused me to have to return this, if you are planning on moving this treadmill to 3 or 4 locations in your house some with carpet some with tile some with hardwood, you may end up having to re level the machine each time you move it to a new spot. This should have been obvious to me but was not for some reason. Don't get me wrong, the treadmill is great and made to be moved but maybe just from a storage spot to a use spot not all over the house and on different surfaces and carpets each time you use it. This is user error not the machines fault.
In the end the company helped me return the product and actually even arranged the pick up for me at any time that was convenient. Seriously? What company does that? So impressed! And the product was actually really nice too boot. If you are not planning on moving it all over your house and you are comfortable with no rails I would recommend this treadmill and this company.

So far, this is great! I set it to 2.5 and work away. It helps my focus, and Iâm back to getting over 10k days according to Fitbit. Great alternative for busy ppl who work at a desk over 8 hours a day.

Great treadmill. I was looking for something that could easily be moved around the house, didn't take up much space, and worked well. Completely happy with this purchase. Mainly use it for walking. It's perfect for what I was looking for.
I like that itâs compact and I can move it easily around my apartment. It took a little time to get use to as far as not having a handrail and it being not as long. Iâm happy with my purchase.

This treadmill is light enough were you do not need help moving it; however, thats were anything good ends. I put it up to speed 7 and is only a brisk walk pace not running like any other treadmill. Once you get pass speed 4 it starts making loud noises that will distract you from the slow walk pace. Not worth the money for a treadmill!

rev_det.name: I received the treadmill yesterday and was super excited. I found there are NO instructions on how to adjust the belt tension properly, or info on what the belt tightness should be. It only says not to adjust it to tight or it could burn the motor. So , I was concerned and loosen it by just 1/2 turn on each side and the belt seemed to slip under my feet at 2.8 speed I changed it back and now it seems to stick or not spin as smooth. Also, my son came in and was changing the volume on the TV which started to jack up the speed on the treadmill and I had to jump off, not knowing what was happening. It turns out the TV remote is controlling the treadmill! Using the channel changer button turns the treadmill on and off (so i can't change the channels while on the treadmill), and the TV volume control changes the Treadmill speed (So I can not change the TV volume while on the treadmill)! This is Extremely inconvenient, as I was Planning on turning the TV on and watching stuff while I walk... I can not figure out how to disable that. It's too early to say how good the treadmill work, besides the belt slipping under my feet , which almost made me fall a couple times. So far , first impression regrets... I wish I bought the one with arm support that fold down and that I could maybe run on eventually (faster speed options), and one that Does Not have blue tooth speakers for music (which I will never use), but has an on/off and pace control on a touch screen vs. a loose remote. The TV remote controlling the treadmill is a problem.

I read an article recently about turning a standing desk into a walking desk and came here on Amazon to search for some "walking pads". I had never heard of these before and always assumed treadmills were these big bulky machines. I wish I knew about this earlier in quarantine, but ah well. Anyways, after reading through tons of reviews, I settled on this item just because of the pricing. I don't need something with a ton of bells and whistles and just wanted something simple to use while I'm working. Overall, delivery was quick and the setup was easy right out of the box. The only reason why I'm giving this product 3 stars is because I've had numerous instances where the treadmill slows down or speeds itself up. The remote was always in front of me on my desk and the buttons were not in fact stuck. This is dangerous, especailly since there are no handles, and is a major problem that needs to be fixed. Be cautious if you're considering this product!!

This is just what I needed. Something for a small space. Itâs quiet as well. For anyone who thinks it doesnât work â thereâs an on/off switch under the top left part of the machine. It took me a half hour to figure out haha! Itâs pretty heavy to move though!

This is a really good under desk treadmill. It has an elegant design that works for both men and women. It is very simple to lubricate unlike my previous treadmill from Goplus that was a mess to lubricate. This one, all you need to do is wait for the red light to appear and lubricate it every 62 miles. Then touch the remote control key for 10 seconds to reset for the next 62 miles.

Just received the machine an hour ago, the remote does not work so I cannot start the machine. I even went to the store and bought a new battery for the remote but still does not work! Gonna have to go through the hassle to return this useless big piece of junk.

Iâve had the treadmill for a week and Iâm obsessed with it! I commute 1-1.5 hours to work each way and Iâm sitting for a prolonged period of time, to basically go straight to sitting again due to online school during this pandemic. I get over 10k steps a day now. I am able to do my homework and I walk on a slow speed while typing. When a lecture is going on in class I walk at a fast speed and I definitely get my sweat on! It has a built in speaker that is great quality as well! You HAVE to turn the switch on at the bottom in order for the remote to turn on the treadmill. It isnât rocket science on how to navigate the thing.

I have had this treadmill for 2 months now. If you were to ask me last week what I thought, I would have told you that I love it. I use this as a walking desk, placed under my desk and it is great for small places as you can easily place under a bed after use.
My review has changed greatly as the treadmill is not usable for my walking desk purpose anymore. For some reason, the treadmill changes speed on its own. I walk at a slow speed since I am working on my laptop at 2.0 mph. All of a sudden, it shoots up to 3.8mph without touching the remote (there is no other remote usage in the house). While 3.8 is not a super fast speed, it is when you don't expect it and you have no railings to help your balance. I almost fell off in the middle of a meeting. The treadmill now only works at 3.8mph and is difficult to turn off so I have to jump off without railings.
The product is clearly defective now but did work great for 2 months. I am so disappointed as I spent a lot of time researching treadmills and thought I selected the best product for my needs. Hopefully there is an easy fix for this but buyer beware.

I donât write reviews. I thought the machine would be sufficient but it turns off randomly. Iâve done a slow jog before and found myself being fearful it would just shutoff and Iâd face plant into the floor. For the money there are
Other machines out there that would be worth the money. I ended up buying a different machine.

I originally gave this five stars, but after a few days downgrading to 2. The remote works fine; however, the bluetooth function does not pair so it constantly interacts with other bluetooth devices turning it off and on even when not in use. You have to turn it off with the switch when not using and while using, well hope there are no TV, Ipod, etc. bluetooth devices anywhere in the entire house in use. This is very disruptive and probably not safe. Eventually someone will get hurt and sue but meanwhile you have that faulty situation if you keep the treadmill. Bummed because otherwise it is nice size and price.
I love the fact that itâs easy to move... quiet run. The Bluetooth sound is great

Itâs perfect size and look mostly great though I didnât order a refurbished one? Maybe it wasnât used but the wheels are covered in caked mud and the front looks like it hit a wall a few times an was polished out. But does it work? Works great!
Love this for my work from home set up!

What the instructions do not tell you is the power switch on the bottom of the treadmill. Still trying to figure out the belt not making it wobbly when its slow but so far so goood its pretty heavy so thank goodness for the wheels
Completely assembled works great right out of the box and the built-in Bluetooth speakers sound great ð

I am so glad I purchased this treadmill! I have been working from home for almost a year and now I can stay fit all while getting my work done. This treadmill is light weight and slides right under my bed at the end of the day.
Very sturdy and yet quiet. Has a remote. We have been doing our usual evening brisk walks on this and its been wonderful..no complaints!!! We are glad we got this treadmill.
Great item, so easy to use.
I love my machine I use it every day. Itâs sleek, easy to operate and fun to use.
It arrived damaged. The front right corner was crushed and there is a hole where the plastic should be. However it seems to work perfectly fine, at least for now.
Itâs advertised as a walk/run treadmill. The guy in the picture is even sprinting, yet it only goes to spreed 3.4. Basically you can only do a fast pace walk.

I received the treadmill yesterday and was super excited. I found there are NO instructions on how to adjust the belt tension properly, or info on what the belt tightness should be. It only says not to adjust it to tight or it could burn the motor. So , I was concerned and loosen it by just 1/2 turn on each side and the belt seemed to slip under my feet at 2.8 speed I changed it back and now it seems to stick or not spin as smooth. Also, my son came in and was changing the volume on the TV which started to jack up the speed on the treadmill and I had to jump off, not knowing what was happening. It turns out the TV remote is controlling the treadmill! Using the channel changer button turns the treadmill on and off (so i can't change the channels while on the treadmill), and the TV volume control changes the Treadmill speed (So I can not change the TV volume while on the treadmill)! This is Extremely inconvenient, as I was Planning on turning the TV on and watching stuff while I walk... I can not figure out how to disable that. It's too early to say how good the treadmill work, besides the belt slipping under my feet , which almost made me fall a couple times. So far , first impression regrets... I wish I bought the one with arm support that fold down and that I could maybe run on eventually (faster speed options), and one that Does Not have blue tooth speakers for music (which I will never use), but has an on/off and pace control on a touch screen vs. a loose remote. The TV remote controlling the treadmill is a problem.

I read an article recently about turning a standing desk into a walking desk and came here on Amazon to search for some "walking pads". I had never heard of these before and always assumed treadmills were these big bulky machines. I wish I knew about this earlier in quarantine, but ah well. Anyways, after reading through tons of reviews, I settled on this item just because of the pricing. I don't need something with a ton of bells and whistles and just wanted something simple to use while I'm working. Overall, delivery was quick and the setup was easy right out of the box. The only reason why I'm giving this product 3 stars is because I've had numerous instances where the treadmill slows down or speeds itself up. The remote was always in front of me on my desk and the buttons were not in fact stuck. This is dangerous, especailly since there are no handles, and is a major problem that needs to be fixed. Be cautious if you're considering this product!!

This is just what I needed. Something for a small space. Itâs quiet as well. For anyone who thinks it doesnât work â thereâs an on/off switch under the top left part of the machine. It took me a half hour to figure out haha! Itâs pretty heavy to move though!

This is a really good under desk treadmill. It has an elegant design that works for both men and women. It is very simple to lubricate unlike my previous treadmill from Goplus that was a mess to lubricate. This one, all you need to do is wait for the red light to appear and lubricate it every 62 miles. Then touch the remote control key for 10 seconds to reset for the next 62 miles.

Just received the machine an hour ago, the remote does not work so I cannot start the machine. I even went to the store and bought a new battery for the remote but still does not work! Gonna have to go through the hassle to return this useless big piece of junk.

rev_det.name: I really recommend this treadmill because it is really affordable and it fits in small spaces .. it came a day late but itâs alright .. it brought all the things it showed the picture ... I was speechless and itâs good because I live in a small apartment and it fits .. I really recommend it
It was a little difficult in getting it. But once it arrived, I am extremely happy with this purchase.

When I say this thing is tiny, I mean it's miniscule. I looked at the specs before I ordered it but, until you see this thing right in front of you, you just don't realize just how small it really is. Thank goodness my wife is barely over five feet tall and has a short stride or this treadmill would be useless.
It arrived slightly damaged but runs (and I'm trying to coordinate a replacement part for the damaged one with the seller) though the "programs" don't seem to work. The packing was very brittle styrofoam and was crushed into tiny, static-charged pieces that were a bit tough to clean up.
It doesn't REALLY fold up but the retaining bolts can be removed and THEN you can fold it though it is unstable unless you also remove the retaining bolts on the handle/control module and lay the whole thing flat.
Don't buy this unless the user is a very small adult (or regular kid-sized).
It included a bottle of lubricant but no instructions about where or how to apply lubricant. I contacted seller and they asked me to send a video of problem! The programs don't seem to work either.

As many other people have done since the outbreak of covid, I bought more exercise equipment. I wanted to be able to continue walking throughout the winter and I just wanted a basic treadmill. And for $200 that's what I got. On the description I was mislead to the fact that it was sturdy, when I try to pick up the pace and jog, the top half will start to wobble and shake. Also it stated that it was quiet, which it really isn't. It also says that the slope can be adjusted but there is nothing in the instructions that indicates how. Lastly I would also like to mention that it says 'miles' in the description, but when I turned it on it is set to kilometres. Like I said though, it is basic and it does serve its purpose despite the given description. So please make sure you do all the research possible before investing in something like this.
TRAINING WITH HIGH PERFORMANCEã: Combining maximum performance, optimal comfort and ultimate efficiency, this 600W folding treadmill equipment for home use is a great assistance to reach your fitness goals. This professional fitness treadmill features a large running surface, built-in pulse sensor grips and an LED display console, helping track your speed, time, distance, pulse and calories well.
ðªãSTURDY AND ERGONOMIC BUILDã: Made of high-performance advanced materials, this folding running deck is undoubtedly sturdy and durable. Strong chassis and nonslip texture running belt help reduce impact on your joints as you exercise, supporting a maximum user weight of 220 lbs.
ðªãINNOVATIVE MODES AND ADJUSTABLE SPEEDã: Designed for both walking and running, this indoor treadmill can achieve speeds between 0.6 mph and 6.2 mph, which can be instantly changed by the on-console sensor button. Three modes as flat mode, climbing mode and mountaineering mode are available by adjusting the slope to meet your workout intensity.
ðªãENTERTAINMENT AND SAFETYã: BA device holder is also equipped for mounting your smart device to make your workout enjoyable. Comes with a safety key and close sensor button, the treadmill can be stopped immediately for safety guarantee.
ðªãFOLDING TRANSPORTATION AND EASY ASSEMBLEã: With portability in mind, the transportation wheels are designed to move the treadmill. And the folding design allows you to effortlessly store by turning the frame locks. Detailed operation and installation instructions are included for easy assembly and proper usage. Moreover, a cup holder is also attached for convenient use.
Great small sized threadmil easy to put together and quiet when in use . Would recommend for anyone to use on those rainy days when you canât get outside .

This is a very basic treadmill for someone who prefers to walk at a steady speed. I usually dont run, so this is fine for me. I dont think you can do much with this basic treadmill like rolling hills and all. I know it says that there are set programs for something similar, but you cant use it really. I tried using one of those and it abruptly increased the speed from 4 to 8mph suddenly, which I found was risky. So, if you just intend to walk simply on a budget like me, go for it!

I think the greatest thing for me with this machine is it came with in two days. After reading the reviews I was worried that I had to wait forever. Its amazing how it easy was to assemble, I was able to do it in few mins. Please do not pay for professional assembly.

Itâs very tiny and comes out of the box almost entirely put together. The highest speed on the machine is 8, and I was at a higher paced jog. It sounds so clunky when you run on it, definitely not quiet while running on it. I will keep it, because Iâm not a crazy runner and I actually got this to train my dog, so it will serve its purpose. I donât see a way to fold it up after every use unless you unscrew the base, so thatâs disappointing because I donât have a lot of space. If someone knows how to do that..let me know.
I am happy I decided to make this purchase.

It doesnt have much features like rolling hills and others
A girl can assemble it and move it arround
Small, loud, but decent for someone who just needs to move.

rev_det.name: The treadmill has been used for more than two weeks. It was surprised me that the installation process of this one is quite simple. There are only screws that need to be installed and the screwdriver is available in the package. The running noise of this treadmill is very low. There are several running modes to choose . The slope can be adjusted, and the heart rate can also be monitored. For me, the width of the treadmill just fits my body shape, I hope it can be a little wider. I won't say it's super, but it's good enough for the beginner. If you are unprofessional people who tried to put the machine in your living room or bedroom so that you could use it occasionally while watching the TV, this is a good choice. Hope my comment can be helpful.

This is the my second excise instrumentï¼this treadmill is easy to build up.I like the speed/start button that on the side to easy control. The noise is small which is very important for me because I live in the apartment in second floor. I also like the 3 gears that could protect my knee during the running.Now i can enjoy my lose weight experience.

So far so good.
Easy to assemble; It took my husband about 15 to 20 mins.
I still havent played with the programs, I have walked and ran on it, to test it.
Not too big or bulky, it fits in my at home work office

I was hesitant to buy a treadmill knowing I would have to put some money in to it. This is a great treadmill for those people who are maybe like me just starting out on a treadmill.
It was simple to assemble with basically just a couple of steps out of the box. (Although it is quite heavy) Fortunately, since it is mostly put together, you can pretty much just drag the box where you want it to live.
It is much quieter than I expected. I thought for the price I would get belt squeaking noise or thunking on my linoleum floors. Oh.and i.forgot to.order a mat but it does not slip the way my recumbant bike does. And I appreciate the oversized waterborne or drink holders.
The speed can be adjusted from under 1 mile per hour to about 8 miles per hour. I honestly have not messed with any of the other settings but I know.there are programs available as well.
I think the max weight on this is like 350 lbs and I bet it would easily hold more. I bet the only issue that could be problematic is that the track is not that wide. I have heavier thighs and wide hips so I am using up that space for footing.
Overall, I am really happy with this purchase. My entire family uses it at least 3-5 times a week each.

Mixed feelings. I must admit with the reviews and all I expected more. This is definitely a "Starter" treadmill and I am also very hesitant to test the weight as relayed at 300lbs max. It's very easy and out of the box assembly. Literally 6 side screws. It's not heavy like some have said I carried this to my basement and installed it by myself in about 20min. It's "Ok" for the price but I won't like I feel like I should have spent an extra $100 for something more sturdy. I don't see this lasting more than a year maybe 2 if I'm lucky and I certainly would NOT run on this. Strictly for walking. Another issue I have is the size ... despite my pics this is Small in width and length. I don't know what to tell ya but this is my review...it's not horrible but not the best either but I already spent $400+ bucks so I'll make the best of it for my he gym

I bought this treadmill a week ago. I used it a few times before writing this review.First of all, to my amazement, it is light enough for two person to move it around. That means I can store or take it out wherever and whenever I want with the help of my family.This treadmill has different defult programs, speed levels and 3 manual incline Positions. Based on my experience, the speed of 0.6KM/h is suitable for the elderly and children to walk slowly, 1.5KM/h is good for jogging, and 2KM/h + for running.I compared to some other brands of treadmills and found that some of these required to download and configure their own applications before using them. However, this product has digital windows to show speed, time, heart rate, distance and calories intuitively without any APP. It is convenient and no technical difficulty for all ages who want to augment their daily outside walking and jogging. It is fully functional and easy to use.I used to work out at a gym, but didn't soldier on. I hope I can keep at it this time.

We are very satisfied with the purchase of our new tread mill. The OMA for home is a very good value and is sturdy & yet not cumbersome taking up too much space. Was concerned it might not be built strong enough to hold a heavier weighted person but it is fine!!!! Very happy with our purchase

When deciding on a treadmill, I was reading the reviews and thought to myself, "there is no way a treadmill is easy to assemble". I wanted a treadmill, but was on a very tight budget and decided to chance it, and let me just say it is impressive. I was able to assemble this by myself in about 10 minutes, and there were six, count them six, screws to put into the holes and tighten-period. It took more effort for me to take the box to the trash then it did to assemble this. I am 230 pounds and thought that the belt would stutter with my weight even though there is a 300 pound limit. I stepped on, held my breath, and no stutter. The belt moved with no problem and it was very smooth. I would caution that the belt is not as long as some of the higher end models, but for the price point and convenience I say buy it; this is amazing.

This treadmill has different defult programs, speed levels and 3 manual incline Positions. Based on my experience, the speed of 0.6KM/h is suitable for the elderly and children to walk slowly, 1.5KM/h is good for jogging, and 2KM/h + for running.I compared to some other brands of treadmills and found that some of these required to download and configure their own applications before using them. However, this product has digital windows to show speed, time, heart rate, distance and calories intuitively without any APP. It is convenient and no technical difficulty for all ages who want to augment their daily outside walking and jogging. It is fully functional and easy to use.I used to work out at a gym, but didn't soldier on. I hope I can keep at it this time.

We received this treadmill about 2 weeks ago. Iâve been adding running and fast walking to my workout routine and I use it 4 time a week. Itâs been a important part of our family. Iâm surprise with the quality of the treadmill within itâs cheap price point, great value overall.
Super easy to install and set up, the machine itself is very smooth. I likely to get some cardio in the morning so the small noise of the treadmill was great so I wonât wake up my family members. My favorite function would be the heart rate monitor .It's a overall great purchase, everyone in my household is getting more active and healthier.

This exceeded my expectations honestly.
Works perfectly and has some nice safety features. Also really glad it came with some belt lube so you donât have to purchase that separately for a while.
Assembly was incredibly easy, just make sure to assemble it where ever you want it to stay since it is heavy (not to bad to move when itâs in the box still).
Side note, it comes packaged on the top incline so just be aware of that if you want to start off flat. Even though itâs manual, adjustment is super easy so thatâs a plus.
All in all definitely worth the money for me!
(For context: Iâm only planning to use it for walking and light jogging since I canât run well due to medical issues.)

This is a budget treadmill. I can't speak to durability, which really is the difference. If it lasts, this will be a good buy. If not, its trash.
As for the operation, set up was a snap. It says it takes two people but I did it easily by myself. I am 5'8" 155 so not big.
Once set up, it's easy to start running. The device itself is a little noisy, but not as bad once you go faster. I did 9 minute miles easily. The tread is narrow- this is a compact device. The control device is almost indecipherable- speeding up or slowing down and stopping are all that I can figure out. Don't buy this for the workout programs or raising or lowering pitch.
However, its cheap, small, and seems to work well for non-speed effort runs, for a person my size.
I am happy with this purchase, and hope the device lasts.

Bought this treadmill a month ago and have been using it almost daily ever since. One of the best feature about this is that it is compact and foldable. Very suitable for my apartment. It also has pretty good features such as heart rate, and calorie count. You are also able to program your style into the machine and it will run according to your liking. Their safety feature is also standard just like many other treadmills. Overall I have a 5 stars considering itâs price point and functionality.

*** it broke within two months and the customer service info they gave with the warranty card led to a dead end email. Do not recommend, don't waste your money, it was a 100% disappointing experience*
It was easy to assemble, low profile when disassembled, I was able to do it on my own with determination and a dolly. So far so good with the product itself, but I have only just opened it and as I was putting the screws in I noticed a sizeable chunk was missing from the base. This chunk now makes it possible for little fingers to be poked into the base of the tread and I can only guess by the large warning sign right beside the hole - this is bad. I'm disappointed I paid so much for a new product and received something damaged in a spot it really isn't okay to have damage. The entire thing was padded and I did not manhandle it, this was within the box damage. I cannot afford a return shipping cost for such a large item and waited most of a month for this item to arrive.

this running machine is awesome. We love it so much. First, it was very easy to installation, probably took 20 minutes, all set. And then the machine is very quite when We are running. In addition, the phone holders I like it. I can listen music or watch tv when I do exercise, Not feel boring anymore. Hahhhh. This machine also have many functions, speed control, heart rate monitor,etc. super awesome, and worth the money.

I don't write reviews but because this was my first big purchase from Amazon I wanted to share. My husband and I were in the market for a treadmill but due to the pandemic your big box sporting good stores have limited stock. When I'm investing into a big purchase I prefer to see it in person. The big box sporting good stores had basic treadmill in stock but after carefully reading the reviews for this treadmill and the box store treadmill I decided to go with OMA. This treadmill has exceeded my expectations. I was nervous ordering this treadmill because I had never heard of the brand. I'm so happy I did. I weigh 288lbs and it is very sturdy and runs smoothly. Great value for the money!!

It's been more than a week since I received the treadmill, and now it still works well. This is a very suitable treadmill for my house. Because my living room is very narrow, and also put a lot of other fitness equipment, the size of this treadmill is just right. It's not too long, and it can be folded, which really saves space. It came in well packed and undamaged, and It's very heavy and needs to be moved by two people. Its installation is really simple and just need to fix six nuts, so I finished it by myself. It took about 20 minutes to install. It's very convenient to use and not noisy. Now that I've lost two pounds through running, I'm really happy.

I've now had this treadmill for 10 days now, it is easy to assemble, 15 minutes. With the onset of Covid-19, going to the gym is not an option for me. This treadmill is fine for walking. That's MY need. runner's will find the deck a little short if they are at at or above 9.0 height . This is a good treadmill. Good quality, oh, it folds well and can be moved easily. The operation is simple, the sound is very small, and the interface is clear at a glance. If you are an aggressive athlete, this is not the unit for you. Hope this helps.

I got it for my parent to exercise due to recent issue with all the asian attacks in the city. It has been great and my parents love it and use it every now and then to exercise. It is easy to install and it serve its purpose. i did some running myself with it as well when im lazy to travel to the outside gym. It has all the basic functions like the 3 tilt options and the pulse checker. Menu is easy to navigate for my parents. I recommend it to everyone who is looking for a entry level treadmill to add into their home space.

Iâve put a few hundred miles on this treadmill so far and Iâm pretty happy. It does make an odd clicking noise which Iâm not real happy about but it gets the job done. I donât like how small the running surface is and the controls are very basic. I wish it had more options like adjustable incline but for the price Iâm good with it
