Hope my comment can be helpful.

This is the my second excise instrumentï¼this treadmill is easy to build up.I like the speed/start button that on the side to easy control. The noise is small which is very important for me because I live in the apartment in second floor. I also like the 3 gears that could protect my knee during the running.Now i can enjoy my lose weight experience.

So far so good.
Easy to assemble; It took my husband about 15 to 20 mins.
I still havent played with the programs, I have walked and ran on it, to test it.
Not too big or bulky, it fits in my at home work office

I was hesitant to buy a treadmill knowing I would have to put some money in to it. This is a great treadmill for those people who are maybe like me just starting out on a treadmill.
It was simple to assemble with basically just a couple of steps out of the box. (Although it is quite heavy) Fortunately, since it is mostly put together, you can pretty much just drag the box where you want it to live.
It is much quieter than I expected. I thought for the price I would get belt squeaking noise or thunking on my linoleum floors. Oh.and i.forgot to.order a mat but it does not slip the way my recumbant bike does. And I appreciate the oversized waterborne or drink holders.
The speed can be adjusted from under 1 mile per hour to about 8 miles per hour. I honestly have not messed with any of the other settings but I know.there are programs available as well.
I think the max weight on this is like 350 lbs and I bet it would easily hold more. I bet the only issue that could be problematic is that the track is not that wide. I have heavier thighs and wide hips so I am using up that space for footing.
Overall, I am really happy with this purchase. My entire family uses it at least 3-5 times a week each.

Mixed feelings. I must admit with the reviews and all I expected more. This is definitely a "Starter" treadmill and I am also very hesitant to test the weight as relayed at 300lbs max. It's very easy and out of the box assembly. Literally 6 side screws. It's not heavy like some have said I carried this to my basement and installed it by myself in about 20min. It's "Ok" for the price but I won't like I feel like I should have spent an extra $100 for something more sturdy. I don't see this lasting more than a year maybe 2 if I'm lucky and I certainly would NOT run on this. Strictly for walking. Another issue I have is the size ... despite my pics this is Small in width and length. I don't know what to tell ya but this is my review...it's not horrible but not the best either but I already spent $400+ bucks so I'll make the best of it for my he gym

I bought this treadmill a week ago. I used it a few times before writing this review.First of all, to my amazement, it is light enough for two person to move it around. That means I can store or take it out wherever and whenever I want with the help of my family.This treadmill has different defult programs, speed levels and 3 manual incline Positions. Based on my experience, the speed of 0.6KM/h is suitable for the elderly and children to walk slowly, 1.5KM/h is good for jogging, and 2KM/h + for running.I compared to some other brands of treadmills and found that some of these required to download and configure their own applications before using them. However, this product has digital windows to show speed, time, heart rate, distance and calories intuitively without any APP. It is convenient and no technical difficulty for all ages who want to augment their daily outside walking and jogging. It is fully functional and easy to use.I used to work out at a gym, but didn't soldier on. I hope I can keep at it this time.

We are very satisfied with the purchase of our new tread mill. The OMA for home is a very good value and is sturdy & yet not cumbersome taking up too much space. Was concerned it might not be built strong enough to hold a heavier weighted person but it is fine!!!! Very happy with our purchase

When deciding on a treadmill, I was reading the reviews and thought to myself, "there is no way a treadmill is easy to assemble". I wanted a treadmill, but was on a very tight budget and decided to chance it, and let me just say it is impressive. I was able to assemble this by myself in about 10 minutes, and there were six, count them six, screws to put into the holes and tighten-period. It took more effort for me to take the box to the trash then it did to assemble this. I am 230 pounds and thought that the belt would stutter with my weight even though there is a 300 pound limit. I stepped on, held my breath, and no stutter. The belt moved with no problem and it was very smooth. I would caution that the belt is not as long as some of the higher end models, but for the price point and convenience I say buy it; this is amazing.

This treadmill has different defult programs, speed levels and 3 manual incline Positions. Based on my experience, the speed of 0.6KM/h is suitable for the elderly and children to walk slowly, 1.5KM/h is good for jogging, and 2KM/h + for running.I compared to some other brands of treadmills and found that some of these required to download and configure their own applications before using them. However, this product has digital windows to show speed, time, heart rate, distance and calories intuitively without any APP. It is convenient and no technical difficulty for all ages who want to augment their daily outside walking and jogging. It is fully functional and easy to use.I used to work out at a gym, but didn't soldier on. I hope I can keep at it this time.

We received this treadmill about 2 weeks ago. Iâve been adding running and fast walking to my workout routine and I use it 4 time a week. Itâs been a important part of our family. Iâm surprise with the quality of the treadmill within itâs cheap price point, great value overall.
Super easy to install and set up, the machine itself is very smooth. I likely to get some cardio in the morning so the small noise of the treadmill was great so I wonât wake up my family members. My favorite function would be the heart rate monitor .It's a overall great purchase, everyone in my household is getting more active and healthier.

rev_det.name: WARNING DO NOT BUY! Ripped off! Item has a 60 day warranty noted on the itemâs page for the obvious reason that it will fail early. Treadmill stopped working and displayed on error message. Tried to troubleshoot it every way possible and nothing worked. Contacted the seller, Best Choice Products, and they told me the item is out of their 60 day warranty and they WILL NOT REPLACE OR REFUND. WILL NEVER BUY FROM THIS COMPANY AGAIN!!! Your company ripped one person off but hopefully this will save hundreds of people that read this from buying from your shady company!

Purchased this treadmill in November 2017. At first it met all our expectations, then in May 2018 the treadmill stopped abruptly while my husband was walking on it. The error code was "E8" Over load error - User may have exceeded max weight. The maximum weight for the product is listed as 250 lbs; my husband only weighs 150 lbs. Luckily, he was walking when the treadmill stopped; it would have been have very dangerous had he been running. On a regular basis, the treadmill now abruptly stops with this error after about 45 minutes of use. We called Best Choice Products customer support and were told this is a known issue, but because the warranty period had expired they would do nothing to remedy the problem. Buyers, please take note of this dangerous issue and do not buy this treadmill.

I've had this for 6 weeks and bought it to replace an old manual treadmill I had. The space it fits in, is about 5 feet long and it took only 30 minutes to put together. It has 5 speeds, a heart monitor, and start/stop as well as speed adjustment buttons on the handrails for convenience. There's a couple of cup holders. I use one for my drink and the other for my phone. I can also rest my tablet on the magazine holder. And the color...Pink!! Need I say more? If you're looking for something small, easy to use and super cute...this may be the treadmill for you!

I decided to buy a cheaper treadmill because I'd just be using it walking while I watched TV to add to my exercises periodically throughout the week. Everyone thought I was crazy since we have treadmills in the basement of our apartment building, but I said the heck with it. Well, it turns out I use it far more than I ever thought! It's small enough that it fits into my LR well. I run 5-6 miles per day, 6 days a week on it & it's still going strong. Granted, I did buy the 2-yr warranty so that puts my mind at ease with the fact that I'm using the crap out of it. I find I like to run more often and in the evenings, so having this in my own place makes it super convenient to do so! It's true it doesn't incline at all, but I didn't want that feature going into it. It has convenient buttons on both handle-bars for heart-rate monitor and speed adjustment so works well for left-handed people as much as right-handed.
The only minor issue I've had with it so far is I periodically have to manually adjust the belt. It's super easy to do. I was more put-off by the fact that I had to continually adjust it as soon as I got it more so than having to do it at all. Since that first week of adjustments, I've only had to do it a handful of times so I call that a win. It still makes some odd noises sometimes, but runs just fine for what I need it to.
I noticed before buying it that there were comments that this treadmill is ridiculously small. I can see where someone would say that (now, as far as it being only large enough for dogs... that's not true). I'm 5'3, fit, 120lbs (hopefully soon to be 110lb. with this bad boy) so it fits me just fine. However, if you are really overweight or tall, this wouldn't be the treadmill for you. The track is narrow and short. I have a short stride and it just about fits me so if you have a long stride from being taller, this wouldn't work for you.
I'll be more than satisfied if this treadmill lasts me for 2 years considering the amount of use I'm putting it through. It's obvious that you're not going to get a highly innovative, comfortable, state-of-the-art treadmill you're used to at the gym for this price, but if you want a simple machine to keep you active for little investment, I highly recommend it.
An added bonus: I throw a narrow cardboard box across the bars and set my laptop on it to use as a temporary treadmill desk when I'm working longer hours at home.

I bought this June 2017. It was working fine then at first, the dashboard plastic came off after 6 months of using the machine. (I only used it 1-2 times a week) Then, 2 picture as you can see in front of the fedel part came off last November. Not worthy to spend $200. ( Not safe either)
When I contact the manufacture, sorry "no part can be replaced. Please throw it"

Very cheap and unsafe.
I was running on it and then the ban got stuck and it started making a crazy noise. It wasnât a weight issue I am 120lbs.
Very cheaply made! Please donât purchase. Very unsafe. Returned immediately, since waiting for my refund.

Well like others it came with a few scratches and dings on it but nothing major that effected product.It works fine Itâs Nothing spectacular but I was looking for a small treadmill that fit in a small room and thatâs what I got! The pink is super cute.The runway is short and I wasnât used to that so just be careful and donât stop for a sec as there isnât much space and youâll end up on the floor behind it lol.There is a extra speed button and stop on the handle bars.Listen if your looking for cute,smaller side,cheap no bells and whistles than this is your treadmill.Also there is no heart rate or incline but I knew this and not a big deal.

Good treadmill for the price (at the time of my purchase, it was a little less than two hundred with free shipping). I see it has gone up $10 since I bought it. IMO if it goes over two hundred, I would purchase a different treadmill that can withstand running on it. The treadmill is just as advertised. It's compact, which is exactly what I was looking for. It's not a running treadmill, but a fast walking treadmill, and for me, I'll be able to jog on it. My husband has a good stride when jogging and his stride is too long (wide?) for the length of the running belt. The running belt is 13 inches wide and 38 inches long. If you have a wide (long) stride, this probably isn't for you. I like everything about it, except the sound. For me, if it's not 'talking' to me or playing music, there is no reason for it to make noise. It does not have any feature that plays music, talks, or has a jack for mp3 players. The speakers are solely for the annoying beeping. With every incremental increase or decrease in speed, it makes a piercing beep. When turning off and on, it makes a series of loud beeps. For me, they are abnormally loud (compared to the soft beeps from the treadmills in the gym, for instance). I taped over the speakers, it dulled the sound a bit. The beeping noise would not deter me from purchasing this treadmill again, but it would be very nice if the audio was a feature I could turn off. It has two beverage holders which are generous in size. The media shelf for tablets, books, and phones is perfect. I have a touchscreen laptop and I can place it one the shelf without any noticeable vibration while I walk. It was easy to assemble. The display monitor is one unit (monitor plus handles). You do need two people to easy place it onto the treadmill. One person could do it, but it might be a bit tricky. It is bulky to store and not as easy as I thought it would be. When I remember to snap a photo of it stored upright, I'll update the review. All in all, I'm very pleased with it. I deducted one star due to the noisy beeping that doesn't have an option to turn it off.

First off, I spent weeks going over reviews for treadmills that were on the cheaper side. I wanted something to use to run on in the winter- because in Michigan itâs cold most of the time. I didnât want to pay for a gym membership either.
Now most of what I wanted was a simple treadmill that I could run/jog on.
What I discovered in a lot of reviews was how narrow the tracks are, how hard it is to put together, and how tall you could be.
I decided on this treadmill because out of the rest of them, it had average scores. I realize Iâm paying an average price so I can put up with the annoying parts.
Pros- cheap but works- even though the track is narrow it isnât something you canât get used too. Iâm 5â11 and 195 pounds and Iâm able to run comfortably on this.
Cons- it came with the right handle foam messed up. Itâs somethint little, bit I feel like for the price I paid, nothing should be messed up.
It was hard and weird to put together. The instructions are vague and the washers they want you to use to screw in the screws are super weird so it takes a lot longer then it should. Over all though Iâm yaooy with my purchase

This was the first time it was taken out of the box and fully assembled. It failed to work properly upon first power up testing. At first, I heard sound and saw light from the machine, but soon after the machine would not power on all together. I tested the outlets to see if it was that, but the outlets were working. The treadmill still did not power on. Even worse, after I returned it, I had to fight tooth and nail to get a refund. These people are scammers. Amazon had to step in because after following Best Choiceâ return policy, Best Choice still refused to issue the refund. Donât go through the trouble of dealing with this brandâs faulty products and terrible service. Take your money elsewhere.

rev_det.name:
I almost didn't buy this because of the reviews. (And let's face it, the pictures aren't great either)
I scoured the internet looking for a treadmill that had great reviews but also had features I needed. Ultimately the size and price on this one were hard to beat. Considering the size of my home and also being on lockdown during the quarantine, I decided to take a chance and buy it.
My treadmill arrived with no issues. It was easy to set up. I love that my phone hooks right up via Bluetooth. The only thing I don't like is not being able to use it if you lose the remote. There may be a way to do this but I haven't really looked into it because I have just been enjoying using it.
I can see why size may be an issue for some. But in comparison to all the other treadmills on Amazon that are made with space saving in mind....I think this one is the biggest. I am female...5'9" and 145 pounds. I can lift it up, wheel it in my closet and lean it against the wall when I'm done...which is awesome. ð
This works great for me and I have no regrets so far. Hopefully it continues to work for the long run! I didn't buy the warranty because I wasn't sure if I was going to like it and I didn't want to waste my money if I had to return it. Now I'm kind of wishing I had just in case.
If anything changes I will update but so far so good!

Itâs Easy to set up. The remote control is so useful. Much better than reaching for a control panel. The Bluetooth speaker is convenient; it turns your treadmill into a moving dance floor! Just plug in, turn on, the audio pairs instantly. Itâs a well-made, sleek machine. It Fits so nicely in the room, people never realize I have one. I hardly notice that I am exercising when I use it, because itâs so fun and convenient! Track is comfortable; I did have to get in the habit of walking right at the front of the belt. It is helpful to use a scrap piece of carpet underneath it and cover it, to avoid dust and pet hair getting inside. Most importantly, this Company has exceptional customer service. The best I have ever encountered. You can rest assured when ordering Cool products from them. This is the second treadmill I have bought from them.

I love this treadmill. I gained a few pounds during quarantine and I wanted to do something about it. To start: Iâm not a runner!!! This treadmill has a speed setting (up to a 10 pace) which allowed me to do some jogging. As time passed, I went from a ONE MINUTE jog at a 6.5 pace, to a full mile at a 10 pace! This is HUGE for someone like me. (Overweight and dislikes running ð) I actually accomplished running goals that I didnât know I had. Granted, there is no incline so itâs a lot easier than running through my hilly neighborhood. Iâve lost some weight and âbeatâ a few of my running records! This machine actually built my courage to try a little bit of outdoor running. The Bluetooth setting is a bonus. Itâs doesnât have a top notch sound but it works well.

This is the absolutely perfect treadmill for me and my family. It is small and light enough to move around the house and most especially to hide. Yet, it is powerful enough to run on, even to the point of almost sprinting. It might not be a perfect length for a tall man, but for us it's incredible. I set up a light, cheap tv on a tripod type stand placed in front and hook it up to my phone and watch my shows as I speed walk. I look forward to exercise now! When I'm done I can just lean it against the wall out of the way. It takes up no space.
The only downside is that you can only control it through a remote control, which can easily get lost. It happened to me despite worrying about it so much that I taped it to the bar. Well, the tape wasn't strong enough and somehow it vanished. I blame the dogs. I was so upset, considering how much I had warned my kids about this very thing happening. I was scared that the seller wouldn't respond, but they did and sent me a new remote promptly. I am incredibly, incredibly grateful, because we LOVE this treadmill! Excellent customer service!

I'm a writer, and since the pandemic started, I just haven't been getting enough exercise. I'd always been intrigued by the idea of a walking desk, though, so I looked for a basic, affordable way to make that dream a reality. This fit the bill perfectly.
This isn't the type of treadmill you'd find in any gym--it's much smaller, lighter, and more basic than that. It doesn't have an incline function, for example, and the belt is both shorter and narrower than standard. Although it does go faster than most walking-desk treadmills, I haven't yet tried to run on it.
I've been using it for at least an hour a day -- my aim is to get up to two hours a day. I find I can walk 3 mph while reading or typing. Things like editing (which require more manual dexterity with a cursor) are much harder while walking, so I save those tasks for the times when I'm sitting.
Overall, this is a great little treadmill. It is perfect for what I needed it for. Highly recommend.

This might be the very best thing I've invested in. Since Covid has forced me to work from home and spend many hours at a desk, I decided it was time to get up. I started researching treadmill desks and saw how expensive they were, so I opted for a cheaper resolution. This folding treadmill pairs well with a standing table I purchased for around $60, and together, is less than half the price of a standing table treadmill. It's not as lightweight as I would like, and I wish it did recline, but I realize I can't necessarily have every feature I desire plus convenience of price and space saving. I've walked up to 5 miles while reading and grading papers. I've only had it for a couple weeks... so I can't report too much on overall physical changes as far as weight loss at this point, but I can say that I feel SO MUCH BETTER. I'm SO MUCH more alert and awake than when I was working from a chair. Also, I use it when I'm catching up on a Netflix series. I use this as a supplement to my original workout plan. It's not a replacment, but it is an added bonus to adopting a healthier lifestyle. I use it mostly for work purposes. If you want to feel more alert while working on things that might normally put you to sleep, OR if you just want to improve your posture, your overall mood, and health in general, it's fully worth it. Honestly, I think society in general should start considering why the norm is "sitting" when it comes to desk jobs.

I knew this was a cheap treadmill but I didn't expect it to be so poorly made/tested. When it arrived, it would not turn on at all (it showed an "E07" error message on the display that was not documented in the very terse instructions). I emailed the support email that was given in the instructions and was given steps for taking apart the handle to try and fix this on my own. It ended up being the safety switch sensor was not attached inside the handle which I fixed sufficiently so that it would turn on. At that point, the treadmill would turn on but it would only go up to the 4.0 speed (units is not clear, km/h?) with the handle up. I discovered with the handle down, it would allow the speed to increase up to 12.0 ð± (definitely not safe to do without the handle and safety switch). I emailed support again and was given more step by step instructions for disassembling and investigating the wiring to find the problem. It turned out to be the tilt sensor for detecting when the handle was up was not attached and was also relatively easy to fix.
So, at this point, the treadmill works and is functional enough that we'll keep it. I feel like the price was low enough that I'm not going to return it just to pay more for another but I definitely wouldn't recommend purchasing the product given all the defects it had when it arrived and the expectation by support that you take the thing apart and fix things yourself. I don't expect that it will last very long but maybe (given the low price) we'll have gotten our money's worth.

I bought this treadmill about 3 weeks ago and so far is working very good. I really like the size is perfect for my place and the phone holder is great and i love the bluetooth i can listen to my music while i run.

Just got this in the mail yesterday, set up was really easy! I tested it out and itâs a little choppy going slower but for the price and the compactness of the treadmill and the price it is a great buy. Iâm terrible with running outside in the winter but we live in a two bedroom condo so this was a great way to keep up running in the cold season while not taking up too much space in our home. I will say I wish the power chord was longer, itâs very short so Iâm going to have to get an extension chord so we can put it a bit off to the side. Only other small complaint is the cell phone holder is too small for my iPhone 11 Pro Max with an OtterBox case on it. Also, it is a little heavy but the wheels are helpful when moving around. All in all though would definitely recommend!

I LOVE my treadmill. Still havenât figured out how to connect with Bluetooth for music. I honestly donât remember much instruction outside of assembly which was simple. I didnât attach the hand bars bc I wouldnât be able to fold it up. I feel like the ability to collapse it is the best feature. It is very heavy but itâs also easy enough to move around. I wasnât sure if I would ever use it for more than walking. But I was to surprised to discover my love of running with this little treadmill! This machine may have quite literally saved me from pandemic depression.

rev_title.name: Surprised how much I love this treadmill after all the bad reviews!
This thing is great & easy to store. Itâs like walking on a moving dance floor
I jogged. I ran. I conquered.
Turned my standing desk into a walking desk!
Great value for overall health and well-being.

Finally a treadmill that REALLY doesnât require the space a home gym!!

rev_det.name: I love how small the treadmill is. It fits perfectly under my sofa. The only thing you need is the Alan key to move the bars up and down between uses.
This works absolutely great. I love how it can store right under my couch for easy storage because we live in a tiny town house. Works beautifully for us.
Great treadmill my living is small and the treadmill fits perfectly, it runs great, I use it every other day. I would recommend it, does the same thing these other expensive ones do, great price!

This affordable, basic little treadmill has everything I wanted. Easy to assemble and operate, doesnât take up much space, and has a holder for my iPad. My only complaint is that it isnât easy to fold down flat. Six screws are involved in that process. Also, I wish it was made in the USA.

The belt came completely off center. Every time I would adjust it, it would slip right back to the left side within minutes of walking on it. Itâs a good small size for a small living space but just doesnât work properly.
Very very well worth it we love it
Itâs a nice little machine. Itâs not as study as I would like but for the price it gets the job done.
This treadmill is very durable , it can be easier to slide under the bed and the arms should be able to go down without screwing , other than that this is just what I needed for my small space
I love this treadmill it was so easy to put together less than 5 minutes I was worried it would be too big for my apartment but itâs perfect and so convenient!!! Buy it
Great treadmill for a small space . This treadmill is good for walking and jogging in the home. Quiet and easy assembly.

Love this treadmill. The box was torn to pieces. I thought for sure it would be damaged...it was not. It is very well made! As the description states it is quiet. I did purchase a treadmill mat. Perfect size for condo or office.

This treadmill was easy to assemble. If the arm rail/handles are in the down position it will only go up to 2.5 mph, if the arm rail/handle is in the upright position it can go up to 7.5 mph. It is quiet and has wheels which makes it easy to move around. Great for small spaces or for being mobile.

My daughter asked me to buy this for her. I thought it looked fancy and trivial, but when it arrived, I was surprised by its outstanding quality. I use it once a week now. It can meet our sports needs, it's very good and worth recommending

Just Amazing! When I had taken about a week going through many adverts telling us they are the best, then I saw this Dripex at full price and showing it was a best seller and was expecting to get another product less expensive, but decided "You only get what you pay for" as this looked so stylish and compact, when I order it Two days ago I was expecting it within a week but arrived this morning less than 48 hours and the packaging(protection) it came in perhaps the best I have ever seen in my 77 years and the credit at least must go to the suppler/importer for the care taken to ensure there was no damage to their product.
I found it easy to put 4 bolts and two screws in with the excellent tools supplied with it.
My wife and myself have already tried it out and think it is fabulous and very quite in operation and so neat and tidy with no sharp edges and a great safety device in case we stutter on our feet(hope not).
The displays are very clear and tidy with a simple remote control that the young ones would love (see no hands), but we must hold onto the well balance arms I'm sure.
By and large this product is well worth the Â£399.99 and should suit any age group.
Lastly if it improves our walking for health reasons it will have done it's job well.

I have given this a two star and thats only for the customer service, thanks to joyce. The product when arrived didnt work well - running belt stuck/ stuttered badly, followed the instructions to fix and it made no difference, contacted joyce about the fault and she sent more videos to help but that didnt work either- i asked for a replacement and it arrived a few days later which was good but when it did arrive the outer casing was smashed, the phone holder is smashed and the casing was lose - good news though the actual treadmill worked. I contacted joyce about this and they offerred a 100 discount or a new treadmill.
As it was cosmetic damage i took the discount and i didnt want a 3rd treadmill as they dont want the faulty ones back !!! I have to say the workmanship was absolute rubbish and i think most of the reviews must be fake if mine is an example of the quality of the product - i cannot see how i can get two faulty ones in a row and everybody else seems to have no issues. Anyway - like i said at the start joyce is the only reason for the stars.

Research getting a treadmill for weeks before deciding, best decision I've made in 2020.
Quite heavy for one person but still manageable, and means that it's sturdy when running. Struggled to put the handles on as the bolts could do with being a bit longer but I've ended up leaving them off, which doesn't affect the functionality of the treadmill. Great display at the bottom which I keep focused on and it stops me from losing my stepping (I'm prone to falling over). Haven't tried the speaker yet but I'm fine using my phone or earphones. Machine runs really quietly, compared to a treadmill I had in the past which was a lot bigger and bulkier. Remote control is very handy and a good idea but the finger pad is also very sensitive and works really well.
Would recommend this to anyone, especially if you have limited space or want it to have a prominent place in the house (not the garage) to keep your motivation up to use it, rather than out if sight out of mind. It looks good and can be easily moved around the house. My jogging speed is about 6km and the machine was really comfortable at that, haven't taken it to full speed yet. I had concerns before buying it that the belt would be quite small, but this hasn't been an issue and I would say that there was quite a lot of room for me to jog at a decent stride (I'm 5'7" tall).
Need to also comment on the delivery company: kept me informed, arrive 6 days ahead of schedule, arrived in the time frame they texted me and the driver lifted it into the house for me as well. Couldn't fault them.
Really impressed, exactly what I need to sort myself out, in lockdown, in bad weather etc.

I go out walking most days but as we are moving into winter, I bought this treadmill to use when I canât get out - canât go to the gym because of coronavirus. It arrived as stated, but the box had a massive break which when I opened the package had damaged the treadmill in a couple of places. I contacted the seller who were brilliant, they reacted quickly, gave me a discount and had replacement parts sent to me - which is great considering it clearly wasnât their problem and had been damaged in transit.
In terms of the treadmill, it is a bit flimsy but operates perfectly well and considering the price, I think it is good value and would still rate it highly.
The product came with the display completely shattered. The treadmill just lights up but doesnât work. I spent 400Â£ on nothing. Frauds!

I found it very fiddly and therefore it took a long while getting the 4 bolts into the side rails. So, for me, it wonât be folding flat with them fitted, as Iâm not going through that every time. Not sure yet what it would be like without the side rails fitted as someone else has mentioned, early days. Otherwise it looks good. Shame Iâm still a bit cross about the side rails.

This is a brilliant treadmill. I usually run on a machine 4 times the size of this one but its broken at the moment so I ordered this as a stop gap. However this is now my permanent machine and I love it. I can run in any room of the house and it packs away into a small cupboard.
Customer service is also brilliant. Mine arrived with a small broken part which was replaced in matter of days after one email.
I love how small the treadmill is. It fits perfectly under my sofa. The only thing you need is the Alan key to move the bars up and down between uses.
This works absolutely great. I love how it can store right under my couch for easy storage because we live in a tiny town house. Works beautifully for us.
Great treadmill my living is small and the treadmill fits perfectly, it runs great, I use it every other day. I would recommend it, does the same thing these other expensive ones do, great price!

This affordable, basic little treadmill has everything I wanted. Easy to assemble and operate, doesnât take up much space, and has a holder for my iPad. My only complaint is that it isnât easy to fold down flat. Six screws are involved in that process. Also, I wish it was made in the USA.

The belt came completely off center. Every time I would adjust it, it would slip right back to the left side within minutes of walking on it. Itâs a good small size for a small living space but just doesnât work properly.
Very very well worth it we love it
Itâs a nice little machine. Itâs not as study as I would like but for the price it gets the job done.
This treadmill is very durable , it can be easier to slide under the bed and the arms should be able to go down without screwing , other than that this is just what I needed for my small space
I love this treadmill it was so easy to put together less than 5 minutes I was worried it would be too big for my apartment but itâs perfect and so convenient!!! Buy it
Great treadmill for a small space . This treadmill is good for walking and jogging in the home. Quiet and easy assembly.

I ordered the blue treadmill which is a lovely colour
I think that the treadmill is of good quality it works nicely and goes through the speeds well
It is vey good at a walking speed 4.5 have not tried it at running speed
The treadmill folds well , only thing is if you need to use the handles that come with it they need to come off before it will fold flat and this needs an tool that is supplied but not quick to do
If you are stable enough to use Treadmill without the handles this wont be a problem

Very quick delivery, they even tried to deliver it a few days early which I sadly missed, but shows great response speed. Instruction manual very helpful and easy to understand, just as simple to setup only real difficulty came in the form of allen key which didn't quite fit in one of the bolts to secure the balance arms on the side. Once fastened no issues.
With the phone holder and bluetooth connection, easy to watch something or listen to music through it if you wish while working out, most treadmills only go up to 6, with this one going up to 12 it lets you get into a nice run to work with, so its wonderful for home fitness if your not someone who actively goes out much, Remote has a slight delay so do be careful if using it to speed up/slow down, tapping it lightly does control speed easier/safer so do be warned if you hold button down you might accidently go too fast too quickly if not ready for it.
I'm very happy with this so if you are looking for a home treadmill that has a little more speed to it than most, minimal setup and not taking up that much space, go for it! Thank you to the providers/makers this is gonna do me wonders! This is practically gym level so the only thing I'll warn against it is don't go for this if your looking for a walking treadmill for the elderly.

Great machine, very easy to use. My only real criticisms are a few design features that could easily be improved. The arms currently need to be removed before you can fold it flat, for example. Having them attached to the side of the frame and collapsible might change the look, but would mean I didn't need to dig out the screws every time I want to use it. Also, the wheels on the base only face forward, which makes it tricky to slide horizontal (ie to store under the sofa). That said, its a great treadmill if you have limited space. Very sturdy and good quality.

Easy to install, although the hand rails are very very tricky to attach. Gave up after getting one done. Itâs a really nice machine. My only problem is that the speed seems to be wrong. 4k for example feels more like 6k on other treadmills. But doesnât matter too much.

Great treadmill. Mine arrived damaged but the customer service team were great and sent out a replacement for the damaged piece quickly. The only fault I've found is that the handle which locks in the bar is incredibly stiff and difficult to turn. This is more of an issue for me as I put mine up and down after each use.
Not happy with it good for the first months now keeps cuting out try oiling fixing the blet still cut a lot of money wasted buying one donât get one
Great treadmill, fits under my sofa (though you have to leave off the arm struts. Have used it every weekday for six weeks and it's great.

The treadmill arrived quickly and was easy to assemble using the instructions, but unfortunately it didnât work.
The customer support from Joyce was absolutely amazing, and after many very helpful emails and videos, and a new motor - success!
I am now happily using the treadmill which is great, albeit slightly noisy.

I never leave reviews on thing but felt I should as treadmills are such a sensitive but and you honestly donât know if youâre buying the right one. Please please take the advise of the other reviews this treadmill is fantastic itâs an ideal home treadmill easy to set up and easy to store, I cannot recommend it enough.
Fantastic for the price. Really happy so far with it. Ideal for walking, jogging and running. Bluetooth speaker is great with a good high volume for work outs.
Several settings, connects to blue tooth, so far so good

It arrived with blue paintwork scratched so not happy but too big to send back it must have been scratched before packing no damage to box etc looks like a sturdy piece of equipment but disappointed about scratched paintwork

This treadmill is perfect. The 12k maximum speed allows for quality interval training, the size means it can be stored under the sofa, and the customer service is fantastic. So happy I bought this treadmill.
Excellent product keep you fit excellent value ð
Use this in a number of ways: under desk to create walking desk, walk pad to warm up or down and to run on & at top speed itâs faster than I can manage at this time. Live the Bluetooth speaker too!
Problem with the screws that donât fit the holes made for the hand rails. No customer service number to call you as can only email, they did reply but it would be quicker to speak on the phone.
Absolutely love this machine its definitely a must buy
Very happy with this purchase. Easy to assemble, easy to use, holds my weight and easy to move it around. Great quality treadmillðð»Definitely recommend.

Loved the treadmill nice and sleek and easy to use
Delivery company delivered a day late but other then that great item I love it!
Great product
Excellent. Simple to assemble. Clear monitoring of speed and distance.

Great machine simple to use.
Highly recommended
Well compact size.
I simply love it

rev_title.name: Good quality machine, but could use some design improvements
Folds away and takes up little space, but only if you don't attach the arms.
Great treadmill and great customer service
Worth the wait - great compact treadmill
Simple, clear and just the job!

rev_det.name: i AM A 87 YEAR OLD MALE @ 170 LBS. MY ONLY REASON FOR THIS IS WALKING. COULD NOT RUN IF I WANTED. WALKING THOUGH IS VITAL FOR MY HEALTH. IT CAME EARLY. IT WAS EXTREMELY WELL PACKED. MY SON HELPED ME TO GET IT INTO THE ONE STORY HOME, WITH 5 STEPS TO THE FRONT DOOR. WE DID NOT TRY TO CARRY THE BOX INTO THE HOUSE. RATHER GOT IT OUT OF THE BOX, THEN USED THE WHEELS TO ROLL IT UP THE STAIRS, ONE AT A TIME. WITH THE TWO OF US THIS WAS VERY EASY. ONCE IN THE HOUSE I SET IT UP MYSELF IN LESS THAN 15 MINUTES. THIS IS A VERY WELL MADE PRODUCT. STURDY, STRONG & VERY SHARP LOOKING. WHILE I HAVE ONLY HAD IT 4 DAYS, i AM VERY HAPPY WITH IT. USING IT ON A WALL TO WALL CARPET WITH NO PROBLEM. IT IS VERY STABLE, WITH 3 TANDUM LIKE LEGS (9 INCHES LONG) ON EACH SIDE.(FRONT, MIDDLE & BACK). EVERYTHING SHOWN & STATED IN DESCRIPTION, IS EXACTLY SPOT ON. ALSO COMES WITH A BOTTLE OF SILICONE OIL THAT WILL LAST ALMOST A YEAR, DEPENDING UPON USE.

I searched, and searched like most of you .... comparing prices, comparing sizes for my limited space! I can HONESTLY say that by far...I am BEYOND PLEASED! It was shipped to me fast, I received it sooner than expected. I took it out of the box, 10 minutes set up...them BAM! All ready for me to start my walking/running. I even delayed posting a review....because I didn't want to post GREAT things, only to come back and retract my words. I've had my treadmill for a SOLID MONTH now, and so far it has been AWESOME! I cancelled my gym membership and saved that money by running on my treadmill and working out at home. Thank you for delivering such a quality product! So far, I've nothing bad to say. THIS IS DEFINITELY WORTH THE PRICE !!!!

I really live this treadmill , I had certain requirements and expectations I was looking for in a treadmill. Small apt . I needed a wide running belt , quiet because people live below me , foldable yet cute enough to leave open This folds FLAT. I wanted incline , but I would then lose some of the other requirements that made me buy this one. I was an every day gym member ,till corona ruined that . If I could post more videos I would. The seller was nice enough to help with a little shipping glitch I give them 5 stars. And the equipment 5 Stars GET THIS Machine. !!!

I ordered this treadmill because I just wanted something compact to walk and run on, without all the fancy bells and whistles. I've had this for about a week and a half and so far so good. I'm a fairly athletic women and I have no issues folding this up or moving it around (A friend and I also managed to carry the box up 2 flights of steep stairs). I had it up and running within about 30 minutes of opening the box. I love how compact it is. I live in an apartment and I have this in my living area between my couch and tv. When not in use I can fold it up to the side of the tv and still have the full space for doing other workouts. I use it on a carpet rug which seems to keep the noise and any extra movement down. Its not as easy on the knees as a professional treadmill, but I was surprised at how comfortable it is to run on. It has a button to slow the speed down to 2.5mph when you are done running. The one small complaint I have its that it doesn't have a speed up button so it takes a while to get over 6mph by holding the up button down.

I have owned larger treadmills but this one feels more solid when walking and running on it. I love that it was ready to operate right out of the box with nothing more than the plastic device holder to add on. I am very happy with its performance and would highly recommend this treadmill for anyone looking for a sturdy machine, no assembly required, with limited space. I was worried about it handling my size and weight (6â2â- 235 lbs) but I run comfortably and it doesnât sound or feel like Iâm stressing the treadmill at all.

Really easy to use. The only downside is that it was heavy trying to get it out of the box. It runs smoothly, it doesnât sound like youâre clonking around when youâre running on it, itâs absolutely perfect. When I am on it I increase and decrease the speed constantly for my workouts and it keeps up perfectly. It was held by the post office past the day it said itâd be delivered, I emailed the sender and they got back to me quickly stating they contacted the courier and my treadmill was delivered the next day. Very responsive. Wish there was more in stock so I can get another for my mom.

Iâve had this treadmill for about 1.5 months now and use it at least an hour every other day for brisk walking and light jogging. Itâs super quiet and I fold it upright and roll it into another room when Iâm done with it, which... itâs pretty heavy (Iâm a female with some muscle but not super strong or anything). Itâs narrow enough to fit through a standard bedroom door. Only two things I didnât like: there is no pause button so if you stop your workout to get water (no cup holders on this thing, which I donât mind but others might), everything resets when you âresumeâ your workout. The other thing are the arm handles. Because the treadmill isnât that wide, when I have the arm handles up I was whacking my arms into them while I was walking. The arms do fold down easily so I keep them down. Iâm 5â5â. The belt is long enough for me, even with my long stride.
Overall Iâm happy so far. It was fricken heavy to drag into the house by myself. It was left leaning up against my house next to the garage. Iâd highly recommend two people to get it into the house and to assemble it, though it is possible to do it yourself.

This treadmill was affordable and completely worth the investment. I bought it because there are very few accessible walking/running paths around me, and because winter is coming up and I know my steps decrease with the cold weather. I like this treadmill even more than I anticipated. Iâm a very small person (4â11â) and I was able to set this up in minutes to use after it was delivered. Iâm able to move it around and fold it up to store with ease. I only gave it a 4 for sturdiness because if youâre running on it and havenât tightened the mechanisms tight enough after unfolding it seems a little less unstableâbut this shouldnât be a problem after tightening it! I like the size of it because it can fit in a tight corner and not take up too much space. I would recommend this for anyone who has a tight space and wants to have a treadmill that doesnât look too bulky. The option to turn the handles down is great if you donât want to feel too constricted while jogging. I put the handles down and set up extensions from a dog gate to sit on the handles to set a laptop on for getting steps in while working from home. Overall it gets 5 stars from me!

Updated Feb 2, 2021
Would raise my rating to 5.5 stars if it were possible.
Treadmill motor handled my 12 mile run @6.7MPH with ease and no skipping. And, I uncovered a very useful undocumented feature.
In the workout I learned the treadmill can run INDEFINITELY! When the time display reaches 99:59 (MM:SS), rather than turn off like most treadmills do, the OVICX Q2S simply rolls the clock over and keeps going.
I ran on the treadmill nonstop for 108 minutes with no issues at all. There was no need to restart the treadmill to get in a workout lasting more than 100 minutes!
The display adjusts the decimal place and rolls over when needed to keep âcountingâ. My 12 mile run was:
Time â 00:00 to 99:59 then roll over to 00:00 and finish at 08:00
Calories â 0.00 to 9.99, then 10.0 to 99.9, then 100 to 999, then rollover back to 0.00 and finish at 110
Distance (miles) â 0.00 to 9.99, then 10.0 to 12.0
Ordered Jan 3, 2021 and received four days later (not Prime). Unboxed three days later.
My requirements: treadmill motor capable of 8MPH+, no bulky console, no fancy programming. I just want to get my miles as a long time runner, marathoner, and pace leader. The OVICX Q2S exceeded my expectations.
Display is MPH. Pleasantly surprised! I was expecting KPH due to the foreign manufacturer origin.
Speed display is 100% accurate. I tested 2MPH, 3MPH, 5MPH, 7MPH, and 8.7MPH. Without any load, the tread speed matched the display. I tested by measuring the tread distance traveled (113.5 inches) per rotation and timed the revolutions.
The motor is excellent based on my workouts. This was my most important requirement. I ran all kinds workouts and the motor was perfect each time. No jerkiness or skipping to throw off my cadence. Example of runs I did to test the motor (I also rechecked the treadmill speed accuracy after a workout):
Run/walk 7 miles - 6.0MPH, short walk, 6.1MPH, short walk, etc. (using the shift feature)
Run 8 miles, negative split, 6.3MPH to 7.0MPH (overall avg 6.8MPH)
Run 5 miles, negative split, 2.5MPH warmup, 6.5MPH to 7.3MPH (overall avg 7.0MPH)
Walk 4 miles at 4MPH
More than 40 miles in about 18 days of use and no issues whatsoever.
The motor was more quiet than I expected. I had no issues hearing the music from my iPad. For me, no need to use earbuds.
The intelligent speed reduction is perfect for run/walk training or interval training. Touch the shift button and the treadmill gradually slows down to 2.5MPH. Touch the shift button again and the treadmill automatically goes back to whatever speed you had before the first shift. While in speed reduction mode, you can manually adjust your speed up or down from 2.5MPH.
There is no incline feature. I didnât want to add weight and bulk to the treadmill. I have enough hills in my neighborhood.
The safety sidebars can be raised or lowered independently of each other. This gives flexibility for room placement. You could have one bar up and the other one down. I simply have both bars down since I donât rely on them (see photo). My wife likes the right sidebar up when she uses the treadmill. Adding to the quality, the sidebars are solid metal, not plastic.
Tread length and width is just right. My stride does not weave side to side, so the 17 inch width is more than adequate. The tread length is also more than sufficient for my stride length.
The device holder could be a tad better. The blue plastic ledge comes with a tacky pad (think TENS massage pad tacky) to adhere your device. The pad is so tacky that pulling the device off is a challenge. My workaround: I exposed only a small portion of the pad, just enough keep my iPad attached. Then, I use two rubber bands as tie downs (see photo).
No speakers, but Bluetooth enables the FitShow app to control the treadmill and save workout history. It was easy to register and connect the app. I did not try much of the app features because I didnât purchase the treadmill for the app.
I like the slim and compact design. If I wanted, I could fold up the treadmill and slide it into my Prius to take it somewhere. This treadmill is not boxy or bulky.
The heart rate monitor feature isn't the easiest to use. You must touch three of the four touchpads (two fingers from one hand, one finger from the other hand) to get a reading.
The console is simple, with just a few buttons. No complicated display to figure out. The console is very steady at any speed, no wobbling or shaking. This treadmill is very sturdy.
What convinced me to take a chance and order this treadmill? A YouTube video showing one of the employees running on the treadmill at the max speed 14KPH (8.7MPH) the entire video and the treadmill never shook or wobbled.

I like the compactness of the item and its features. It is so easy to set up. That said I cannot adjust the belt which is almost hitting on one side and there is a constant squeak when I am walking on the machine. Not if I just turn it on and let it run but when I stand on it. Its very annoying and I am now regretting the purchase UPDATE DO NOT BUY this machine true it is compact but you get what you pay for...the constant squeak in the machine is driving me NUTS it starts to squeak the minute I step on it. I added the silicone bought a mat have tried different positions It was a mistake and I will have to put up with the squeak until it breaks down which will probably be soon so I can buy a decent treadmill

I have researched treadmills for several weeks and tried to make sure I got the best deal. I found this treadmill and had trouble finding anything seriously negative listed in the reviews, so made the decision to purchase it.
First, I ordered on January 21st. I was told it would arrive between February 2-8. It arrived on January 25th. Impressive. The box was in pretty bad shape and I was concerned the machine would be damaged. It is packed fairly well with lots of styrofoam and the foam did it's job. There was no damage to the machine.
Second, we set it up straight from the box and were able to use it within 2 minutes of opening it. The only assembly is putting the blue shelf on top of the handle bars and attaching the safety strap. There are a variety of body sizes in our family, ranging from 200 lbs to 250 lbs. We all tested out the machine and it performed quite well with us all. It is as quite as any treadmill that I have ever used. I spend about 30 minutes walking on it and my husband says it is not disturbing while sitting within 8' of me.
We feel the unit is very stable and sturdy. The attached video is made with a 6'2 man weighing 200 lbs using it. None of us run, so I cannot attest to its performance under those circumstances.
It is too heavy (around 95 lbs) to move upstairs or over surfaces that are not level unless you have two people, but it does roll fairly easy. It is easy to fold up and lean up along a wall. It requires almost 10" to stand up along the wall I would assume it would roll under a bed if you have at least 15" clearance. The position of the wheels means it does not roll when the unit is almost horizontal.
I would HIGHLY recommend this product.

There is absolutely NO SHOCK ABSORPTION at all. Feels like I was running on hard pavement- not good at all. I don't recommend. Also, the controls are in light font on the device you can't even read what they say and the machine when I tested it yesterday while it was still working, kept stopping on me in the middle of my workout. It might be because I accidnetally hit the slow button I have no idea but apparently I did it three times so there is an issue. I would NOT buy this treadmil, especially for the money. There are better ones out there with shock absorption and other options for controls, etc. Stay clear of this one.

I got this for $375 When I bought it, quite a steal for what it offers in my opinion. I did a lot of research, it is made in china, comes with a nice box, manual and treadmill lube with instructions. It does fold and takes up less space than most. I like that I can put phone or a tablet on the blue stand it comes with.

Iâve been using everyday since late July, and itâs been going well. Iâve lost 5 pounds so far. I donât go outside often so this is a nice way to do exercise. There is a newer model and the new model folds easily but not mine. Nevertheless I am satisfied with my purchase, especially price wise.

My wife and I are octogenarians. We used to use a treadmill in a nearby gym, but the pandemic ruled that out. So we did lots of walking together outdoors, but the cold weather stopped that, too. We needed a treadmill that would fit into the very small space we found in my wife's "matting room" (she's an artist). The photos show the treadmill tucked into the corner of this very small room, and my wife beginning her exercise routine.
This machine arrived on November 1st (almost 3 months ago.) It was too heavy for us to bring into the house by ourselves, so we got someone to help us. Once it was in the right space, however, it was simplicity itself to set up. The user's manual was easy to follow.
Let me tell you: This machine is rock solid. It doesn't wiggle or waver when we're on it; we feel very secure. And it has plenty of power to develop speed without any sign of strain. It does what it claims -- easily, with power to spare.
This treadmill is designed to run on the flat -- with no incline. That suits us just fine, and we get a good workout with it. The shock absorbers work well; there's no jolting on our knees. One feature we especially like is the button which, when pressed, slows the treadmill down to 2.5 miles an hour. Press it again, and it accelerates to your original speed.
After her first workout, my wife of 59.5 years turned to me and said, Oh Paul, you got just the right machine -- you're so smart! Needless to say, that made my day.

We had a huge treadmill in our dining room and just updated to this smaller one. Itâs compact and sleek. I jogged a few times on it about 5 mph and it was fine. I love the fact that you can store it behind a door since itâs thin. When we have guests over we can easily move it to our bedroom for extra space.

I liked this treadmill so much because it meets all my requirements, its perfect for saving space and very easy to move it, the control is very simple and easy.
One of the good things I loved is the Bluetooth control by the Fitshow app, this app give me too much programs and by just One Click on the mobile phone I can run the program on the treadmill, I think there is another advantage of using this app is that these programs are not limited, as we know with any app you have unlimited updates, means that there are new programs.
Another important thing: Running belt width is 16.93â and length is 49.21â which is perfect and not easy to find this belt width and length with any other treadmill
although this treadmill is 3HP which means that its very strong, in the same time its very quite, which is very important for me because I live in apartment in second floor
overall for me it perfect and I highly recommend it

The product is working well . After 5 months of use Iâll give a general review. This treadmill weights 94 pounds. More than 50 . I was seeing the pain from the one delivery guy to get it on my third floor appartement. I think it would be fair for this weight that 2 persons handle the delivery. And I think UPS should think about it for the well-being of their employee

While looking for a sturdy easy to use treadmill to maintain health I noticed this stylish OVICX Q2S Plus treadmill. I like the design and appearance. The functional control panel has the necessary switches to start and stop, and adjust speed. Panel Indicators display elapsed time,current speed, and distance traveled. Heart rate is displayed when you touch the clips on each side of the display panel of the front handlebar.
I ordered this treadmill only for walking, and to keep fit. In operation it is quiet and comfortable to walk on.
I received it the same week I ordered. Inside the box the treadmill was packed securely with Styrofoam.
Moving the box into the house took a little muscle at my age, I recommend a couple of those
Little 4 wheel furniture dollies to get the box into the house and move to a set up location.
Once Inside the house and out of the box it was easy to move around.
It was ready to operate right out of the box with nothing to do but unwrap the protective wrapping, and snapping on a shelf.
A nice accessories box includes a manual, wrench, and a bottle of Silicone oil with instructions. There is a handy port on the treadmill for inserting the lube. Lubrication appears much easier than on other treadmills.
Tread length of 49 inches and 16.93 inches width is larger than typical in this price range.
Overall this treadmill seems solid, skillfully engineered, and Ideal for safe indoor exercise. My wife likes it as much as me. The âOVICX teamâ has been quick to answer my questions.

I've been using this as an under-desk treadmill for the past 2 months, walking at about 3 mph for an average of 2 hours per day. It's now giving me error code er11 and no longer works at all. Another reviewer also asked a question about er11, so I'm not the only one to have this issue. There's minimal info online about how to fix it. I spent a couple hours disassembling it to try to find the problem and came up empty, so I'm giving up and ordering another brand.
2 stars because I loved this thing until it died. Real shame.

i AM A 87 YEAR OLD MALE @ 170 LBS. MY ONLY REASON FOR THIS IS WALKING. COULD NOT RUN IF I WANTED. WALKING THOUGH IS VITAL FOR MY HEALTH. IT CAME EARLY. IT WAS EXTREMELY WELL PACKED. MY SON HELPED ME TO GET IT INTO THE ONE STORY HOME, WITH 5 STEPS TO THE FRONT DOOR. WE DID NOT TRY TO CARRY THE BOX INTO THE HOUSE. RATHER GOT IT OUT OF THE BOX, THEN USED THE WHEELS TO ROLL IT UP THE STAIRS, ONE AT A TIME. WITH THE TWO OF US THIS WAS VERY EASY. ONCE IN THE HOUSE I SET IT UP MYSELF IN LESS THAN 15 MINUTES. THIS IS A VERY WELL MADE PRODUCT. STURDY, STRONG & VERY SHARP LOOKING. WHILE I HAVE ONLY HAD IT 4 DAYS, i AM VERY HAPPY WITH IT. USING IT ON A WALL TO WALL CARPET WITH NO PROBLEM. IT IS VERY STABLE, WITH 3 TANDUM LIKE LEGS (9 INCHES LONG) ON EACH SIDE.(FRONT, MIDDLE & BACK). EVERYTHING SHOWN & STATED IN DESCRIPTION, IS EXACTLY SPOT ON. ALSO COMES WITH A BOTTLE OF SILICONE OIL THAT WILL LAST ALMOST A YEAR, DEPENDING UPON USE.

I searched, and searched like most of you .... comparing prices, comparing sizes for my limited space! I can HONESTLY say that by far...I am BEYOND PLEASED! It was shipped to me fast, I received it sooner than expected. I took it out of the box, 10 minutes set up...them BAM! All ready for me to start my walking/running. I even delayed posting a review....because I didn't want to post GREAT things, only to come back and retract my words. I've had my treadmill for a SOLID MONTH now, and so far it has been AWESOME! I cancelled my gym membership and saved that money by running on my treadmill and working out at home. Thank you for delivering such a quality product! So far, I've nothing bad to say. THIS IS DEFINITELY WORTH THE PRICE !!!!

I really live this treadmill , I had certain requirements and expectations I was looking for in a treadmill. Small apt . I needed a wide running belt , quiet because people live below me , foldable yet cute enough to leave open This folds FLAT. I wanted incline , but I would then lose some of the other requirements that made me buy this one. I was an every day gym member ,till corona ruined that . If I could post more videos I would. The seller was nice enough to help with a little shipping glitch I give them 5 stars. And the equipment 5 Stars GET THIS Machine. !!!

I ordered this treadmill because I just wanted something compact to walk and run on, without all the fancy bells and whistles. I've had this for about a week and a half and so far so good. I'm a fairly athletic women and I have no issues folding this up or moving it around (A friend and I also managed to carry the box up 2 flights of steep stairs). I had it up and running within about 30 minutes of opening the box. I love how compact it is. I live in an apartment and I have this in my living area between my couch and tv. When not in use I can fold it up to the side of the tv and still have the full space for doing other workouts. I use it on a carpet rug which seems to keep the noise and any extra movement down. Its not as easy on the knees as a professional treadmill, but I was surprised at how comfortable it is to run on. It has a button to slow the speed down to 2.5mph when you are done running. The one small complaint I have its that it doesn't have a speed up button so it takes a while to get over 6mph by holding the up button down.

I have owned larger treadmills but this one feels more solid when walking and running on it. I love that it was ready to operate right out of the box with nothing more than the plastic device holder to add on. I am very happy with its performance and would highly recommend this treadmill for anyone looking for a sturdy machine, no assembly required, with limited space. I was worried about it handling my size and weight (6â2â- 235 lbs) but I run comfortably and it doesnât sound or feel like Iâm stressing the treadmill at all.

Really easy to use. The only downside is that it was heavy trying to get it out of the box. It runs smoothly, it doesnât sound like youâre clonking around when youâre running on it, itâs absolutely perfect. When I am on it I increase and decrease the speed constantly for my workouts and it keeps up perfectly. It was held by the post office past the day it said itâd be delivered, I emailed the sender and they got back to me quickly stating they contacted the courier and my treadmill was delivered the next day. Very responsive. Wish there was more in stock so I can get another for my mom.

Iâve had this treadmill for about 1.5 months now and use it at least an hour every other day for brisk walking and light jogging. Itâs super quiet and I fold it upright and roll it into another room when Iâm done with it, which... itâs pretty heavy (Iâm a female with some muscle but not super strong or anything). Itâs narrow enough to fit through a standard bedroom door. Only two things I didnât like: there is no pause button so if you stop your workout to get water (no cup holders on this thing, which I donât mind but others might), everything resets when you âresumeâ your workout. The other thing are the arm handles. Because the treadmill isnât that wide, when I have the arm handles up I was whacking my arms into them while I was walking. The arms do fold down easily so I keep them down. Iâm 5â5â. The belt is long enough for me, even with my long stride.
Overall Iâm happy so far. It was fricken heavy to drag into the house by myself. It was left leaning up against my house next to the garage. Iâd highly recommend two people to get it into the house and to assemble it, though it is possible to do it yourself.

This treadmill was affordable and completely worth the investment. I bought it because there are very few accessible walking/running paths around me, and because winter is coming up and I know my steps decrease with the cold weather. I like this treadmill even more than I anticipated. Iâm a very small person (4â11â) and I was able to set this up in minutes to use after it was delivered. Iâm able to move it around and fold it up to store with ease. I only gave it a 4 for sturdiness because if youâre running on it and havenât tightened the mechanisms tight enough after unfolding it seems a little less unstableâbut this shouldnât be a problem after tightening it! I like the size of it because it can fit in a tight corner and not take up too much space. I would recommend this for anyone who has a tight space and wants to have a treadmill that doesnât look too bulky. The option to turn the handles down is great if you donât want to feel too constricted while jogging. I put the handles down and set up extensions from a dog gate to sit on the handles to set a laptop on for getting steps in while working from home. Overall it gets 5 stars from me!

Updated Feb 2, 2021
Would raise my rating to 5.5 stars if it were possible.
Treadmill motor handled my 12 mile run @6.7MPH with ease and no skipping. And, I uncovered a very useful undocumented feature.
In the workout I learned the treadmill can run INDEFINITELY! When the time display reaches 99:59 (MM:SS), rather than turn off like most treadmills do, the OVICX Q2S simply rolls the clock over and keeps going.
I ran on the treadmill nonstop for 108 minutes with no issues at all. There was no need to restart the treadmill to get in a workout lasting more than 100 minutes!
The display adjusts the decimal place and rolls over when needed to keep âcountingâ. My 12 mile run was:
Time â 00:00 to 99:59 then roll over to 00:00 and finish at 08:00
Calories â 0.00 to 9.99, then 10.0 to 99.9, then 100 to 999, then rollover back to 0.00 and finish at 110
Distance (miles) â 0.00 to 9.99, then 10.0 to 12.0
Ordered Jan 3, 2021 and received four days later (not Prime). Unboxed three days later.
My requirements: treadmill motor capable of 8MPH+, no bulky console, no fancy programming. I just want to get my miles as a long time runner, marathoner, and pace leader. The OVICX Q2S exceeded my expectations.
Display is MPH. Pleasantly surprised! I was expecting KPH due to the foreign manufacturer origin.
Speed display is 100% accurate. I tested 2MPH, 3MPH, 5MPH, 7MPH, and 8.7MPH. Without any load, the tread speed matched the display. I tested by measuring the tread distance traveled (113.5 inches) per rotation and timed the revolutions.
The motor is excellent based on my workouts. This was my most important requirement. I ran all kinds workouts and the motor was perfect each time. No jerkiness or skipping to throw off my cadence. Example of runs I did to test the motor (I also rechecked the treadmill speed accuracy after a workout):
Run/walk 7 miles - 6.0MPH, short walk, 6.1MPH, short walk, etc. (using the shift feature)
Run 8 miles, negative split, 6.3MPH to 7.0MPH (overall avg 6.8MPH)
Run 5 miles, negative split, 2.5MPH warmup, 6.5MPH to 7.3MPH (overall avg 7.0MPH)
Walk 4 miles at 4MPH
More than 40 miles in about 18 days of use and no issues whatsoever.
The motor was more quiet than I expected. I had no issues hearing the music from my iPad. For me, no need to use earbuds.
The intelligent speed reduction is perfect for run/walk training or interval training. Touch the shift button and the treadmill gradually slows down to 2.5MPH. Touch the shift button again and the treadmill automatically goes back to whatever speed you had before the first shift. While in speed reduction mode, you can manually adjust your speed up or down from 2.5MPH.
There is no incline feature. I didnât want to add weight and bulk to the treadmill. I have enough hills in my neighborhood.
The safety sidebars can be raised or lowered independently of each other. This gives flexibility for room placement. You could have one bar up and the other one down. I simply have both bars down since I donât rely on them (see photo). My wife likes the right sidebar up when she uses the treadmill. Adding to the quality, the sidebars are solid metal, not plastic.
Tread length and width is just right. My stride does not weave side to side, so the 17 inch width is more than adequate. The tread length is also more than sufficient for my stride length.
The device holder could be a tad better. The blue plastic ledge comes with a tacky pad (think TENS massage pad tacky) to adhere your device. The pad is so tacky that pulling the device off is a challenge. My workaround: I exposed only a small portion of the pad, just enough keep my iPad attached. Then, I use two rubber bands as tie downs (see photo).
No speakers, but Bluetooth enables the FitShow app to control the treadmill and save workout history. It was easy to register and connect the app. I did not try much of the app features because I didnât purchase the treadmill for the app.
I like the slim and compact design. If I wanted, I could fold up the treadmill and slide it into my Prius to take it somewhere. This treadmill is not boxy or bulky.
The heart rate monitor feature isn't the easiest to use. You must touch three of the four touchpads (two fingers from one hand, one finger from the other hand) to get a reading.
The console is simple, with just a few buttons. No complicated display to figure out. The console is very steady at any speed, no wobbling or shaking. This treadmill is very sturdy.
What convinced me to take a chance and order this treadmill? A YouTube video showing one of the employees running on the treadmill at the max speed 14KPH (8.7MPH) the entire video and the treadmill never shook or wobbled.

I like the compactness of the item and its features. It is so easy to set up. That said I cannot adjust the belt which is almost hitting on one side and there is a constant squeak when I am walking on the machine. Not if I just turn it on and let it run but when I stand on it. Its very annoying and I am now regretting the purchase UPDATE DO NOT BUY this machine true it is compact but you get what you pay for...the constant squeak in the machine is driving me NUTS it starts to squeak the minute I step on it. I added the silicone bought a mat have tried different positions It was a mistake and I will have to put up with the squeak until it breaks down which will probably be soon so I can buy a decent treadmill
