rev_det.name: The package itself was really heavy. Once it was unpacked it probably weighed about 80lbs. I like the bluetooth speaker and the streamlined display. It is a little rickety which I do not like and there is no incline despite that being in the product description. No inline sucks. It should be standard on any treadmill. Especially for the 600 dollar tag. I made a mistake getting a no name brand product. Speed is kind of low as well with a top speed of 9mph. I have had better for cheaper. I haven't used it yet but it will be helpful during this pandemic so I can somewhat maintain a level of fitness. Feeling a bit disappointed because the quality is on the lower end.

For the price tag, Iâm pleasantly surprised at the quality of this treadmill. This will be just what I need to help reach 10,000+ steps during these upcoming winter months. Setup was really easy, but youâll need 2 people to move it to where itâs going to stay. I was a little nervous with some of the reviews saying you canât really run on this treadmill, but thatâs not the case for me. I will use this for walking/running. The speed goes up to 9, and is way faster then I ever plan to use lol!
I will say (as you can see from the video) it does shake a bit, but itâs not enough to bother me. Here are some things Iâm not crazy about:
- My devices donât really stay put on the holder, itâs almost not a deep enough shelf. My phone slides right off of it. Thankfully I can wrap my Ipad cover around it to stay in place gwhile I watch and walk!
- Thereâs no where to hold your water bottle
- I donât think it accurately tracks distance. It always says Iâm way ahead of my apple watch (ie Iâll hit 1 mile on the treadmill but my watch says .75miles)
The bluetooth feature is pretty cool and easily hooks up to my phone/Ipad for music or tv sound.
Overall, this is perfect for what I bought it for and am excited to use it all winter.

Very heavy to move the box and get it unpacked. I definitely recommend having 2 people and a lot of space. Instructions could definitely be improved but after some reading and thinking, we got it done. The pictures of two of the screws don't show any nuts but there are nuts on them so we just took them off. Then in the list of screws there were some that weren't listed but that were included in the instructions... Then when it said to turn it on it took a bit to find the on button. It is at the very front bottom. Now that we got it together it works well so far. We chose this one because of reviews of lighter ones saying that they rocked when people ran on them and this is a tiny bit wider than most. This is very stable. You can fold it up but you have to unscrew 4 screws to do so and it will still take up a lot of space. Not the best for portability and small spaces and for a person by themselves but if you have a helper and enough space it is good and stable.

Over all it's good and fits it's purpose 75% of it, But I think it was a bad idea to put the start/stop button on the handles so close to the sensors because some times when you go to grab the sensors and touch the stop button it ruins your flow/ rhythm Then you have to start all over again O and the should of added a pause button as well.

Really smooth, belt does not lag or pinch. Strong motor. 9mph all day for 185lb runner. Simple operation, iPhone 3 aesthetic. No incline, but this was perfect for me as I never use incline at gym. Highly recommend.
Cons: Belt a tad narrow, but expected at price. Phone âtrayâ has no lip, or edges, and doesnât do a good job keeping phone in place with vibrations potentially sending it flying. Could use a cup holder.

Seems well constructed, was easy to assemble, and had a stronger motor than others in its price range. So far so good.
There is supposed to be an app, the qr codes are too blurred to scan and I can't find the app in the play store.
Very nice, although the box came damaged, the iPad and iPhone holder a small dent. But other than that is a very good treadmill, not bulky and the belt is wide enough with room

Used this to gain strength once I got out of rehabilitation then now more surgery I'll be stronger before and after I hope this helps the machine holds my weight 260 and I'm 510 so it's good for my sexy height
Worth Every Penny!
I love the size of the belt. Perfect size. Very close to actual mileage when compared to outdoor running. Love it.

Excellent / Wasnât looking for anything fancy just a basic treadmill that was a decent quality and basically no assembly - which is what this is. Some treadmills have displays which show you jogging in the mountains or the beach which is cute but you pay the price and not what I wanted. Iâd give it 10 out of 10 for what I wanted.
The integrated speaker? Total garbage. Sounds terrible and isnât loud enough. If thatâs what you want, donât get this. Otherwise, itâs a decent treadmill. Especially for the money.
The product arrived on time and was very easy to use. I really enjoyed having this product
This treadmill is so much better than my other ones! Iâm very happy I found it. Thank you so much Amazon

So if you're a beginner, this is for you. It's Bigger than I thought, which is a good thing. Because small treadmills wear down too fast. It's only been day one. But I think I'm gonna love this one.
Edit: so if you plan to put in 5+ days of "running" I wouldn't recommend. Light jogging but more of walking, then this is more for you. Built great but not to really put in good work for heavy long runs. Motor will overheat. My routine is 90 minutes. I'll do 1hr running 30 minutes of walking and jogging. 5/6 days a week. Hope this helps some someone and gives a perspective on their ideal usage.

I purchased this for my 87 yo mother for Christmas. The very first use threw her for a loop which put her in the ER! She is battered and bruised, but otherwise ok. It scared the holy bejebus out of us.
As she was adjusting her book up top her right hand slid very slightly forward. The +/- button is located centimeters past where your hand sits for the heartbeat pulse. It sped up so quickly there was nothing she could do. I have wrapped rubber bands along the handle to block her from sliding forward into the speed buttons so that she does not accidentally speed up again. Overall, this is a very nice treadmill but safety is incredibly important in design. We ask that the manufacturer address this immediately.

This is the second treadmill I bought, and the previous one broke down after a short time. This one is better and bigger than before. The buttons above are all LCD. Very nice. The sound of the machine is very small when running, and Bluetooth can also connect to the iPhone, which is very convenient. There are switches on both armrests, and the details are exquisite. Now that the epidemic is serious in winter, it is best to exercise at home. This treadmill is so good that everyone in the family likes it.
This treadmill is easy to use, easy to operate, and equipped with LED lights, I don't have to go outside to run in winter and I can run at home.

rev_det.name: So happy with this purchase. I researched for weeks trying to make a decision and finally decided on this treadmill.Such good quality running machine, very easy to assemble, packaged very neatly and protectively. Lightweight but durable, silent powerful 2.5HP motor provide good stability and durability. Iâm 5â9 and the treadmill easily accommodates a long stride, it is more than long enough to walk or run. Itâs 3- Independent LCD Monitor is my favorite, easy to track the real-time training data. Well, the dual position mobile phone holder is great, I can enjoy the perfect training and entertainment in 2 different viewing angles, making it easier to keep exercising. I love the incline feature, very quiet and easy to store. It takes little space when fold it up for storage at room. It was a very good investment for not only myself but my family. I am a very satisfied customer and recommend.

My previous treadmill was far more expensive and robust, so by comparison this one is almost adorable itâs so petite. Lol. That said, I just wanted it for walking on particularly cold or busy days when I couldnât get to the woods, so I love its small footprint.
Positives:
â¢Super easy to assemble solo. I got it in front the porch and assembled it independently, so that was nice.
â¢Iâm a larger woman and was concerned about the weight limit that Iâm near, but the unit doesnât seem stressed by my walking on it. Itâs obviously not as solid as my last one, but thatâs okay.
â¢Affordable.
â¢Doesnât have a bunch of unnecessary dashboard tools that hardly anyone would use anyhow.
â¢Love adjusting the speed on the handrail.
Negatives:
â¢I absolutely HATE that itâs so narrow that I must keep my hands bent and up or they constantly hit the handrails. I wish the handrails were more like little nubs there for if one became unbalanced but out of the way otherwise.
â¢The speed isnât accurate. At all. Itâs indicating 5mph when I am absolutely notâplease trust meâwalking at that speed.
â¢The buttons on the dashboard are the kind of slightly puffy but thicker plastic you just know are going to crack after a couple years. You know the kind.
Overall Iâm pleased with this affordable, small treadmill.

As I've mentioned from my initial entry, this is a progressive review. I changed it to 5 stars and here is why: Advenor customer service was great, at least from my experience. They have been keeping in touch for the update of the replacement part via email and phone. From this, I could tell that they want to better their products. The treadmill performance have been amazing, my wife and I really enjoyed using it for a week now. If not for the broken motor casing when it was delivered, I would have given this product a 5 star review at the beginning for the price and performance (i.e. quiet motor, smooth running).
Initial review:
Like the other reviews, this one arrived broken. I will give a one star for the product for now and 3 stars for the customer service since the wait was not that bad. The customer rep said that they will keep in touch via email. This is a progressive review, I will update the comment once they fix the issue.

This is the perfect size of treadmill. No damage to the outside of the box. Assembly went quick. When Iâm done working out folds up nicely to store. The release bar to unfold is really nice, Treadmill gently unfolds down to use. The point is that I want to voice out my experience as follows:
1. ADVENOR customer service is excellent .
2. The unit is light and has roller wheels.
3. Space saving size.
4. Running length/width is excellent.
5. Motor is Powerful and stable.
6. Rich exercise program.
It's easy enough for my kids to use also. Overall a great item.
Really worth recommending to my friends who are thinking of exercising at home .

I want to buy a workout equipment but couldn't find anything wide enough, powerful enough, up-to-date enough, quiet enough nor the right price in the want ads. This NEW treadmill was the right price, the right size, the right everything to fit my needs! I recently purchased this and I LOVE IT!! I am impressed with all it can do to be so powerful. Dual holders on the console are so good for me to put iPad or mobile phone on 2 different positions. BTW, ADVENORâs slogan "Running Is An Attitude" moved me very much. Exactly, I am sure I have more courage and confidence to be awakened and actively face the challenges in life. I definitely recommend this treadmill and will be getting one for my young brother!

Over the past few months I have been slowly amassing an assortment of exercise equipment preparing for the inevitable closure of gyms (again). An avid gym goer I frequented the gym 4-5 times a week pre Corona. I have quite a bit of equipment and machines at home now. Because I already own some expensive pieces such as a Stairmaster, stationary bike, and barbell weights, I did not want to invest too much money on a treadmill. I was looking for a very simple yet effective model. I was hesitant about purchasing such an item online, but I figured Amazon is great with returns so I should be okay. Also I purchased the 2 year service plan by Asurion. I completed lengthy research because there are so many options. I wanted a folding model to conserve space. Other options either had ridiculous mandatory features such as ifit or horrible customer service reviews (even big name companies). For my usage purposes, I see absolutely no reason to need anything like ifit. I construct my own training sessions and don't follow programs and all I really need for a work out are my Beats, heart rate monitor, and old school training journal. I was familiar with this company because I ordered their weight bench recently. I love the bench so I figured I'd try the treadmill. The treadmill was extremely easy to set up. It is very sturdy and constructed well. I like that when you release it from the folded up position to the walking position it is a slow release... much less danger of accidently crushing a pet or your feet! I haven't really played around with the programs but the console is exactly what I wanted: a way to simply track calories and distance. I like that it has controls on the arm rests too. It runs pretty quietly. I am a petite person (5'4'' and petite build) and the machine is a perfect size. I don't know if the size would be adequate for a larger individual as there is a weight limit of 220 lbs and also the width is not the same as a standard teadmill. I don't intend to run on the machine as I prefer steady state cardio- walking at a moderate to fast pace. Because of this I cannot attest to how well the machine will hold up for running. The only suggestions I have so far is to find a way to turn off the beeping noise when you press start or stop and to enclose the back of the control panel so the wires are completely covered. But those are minor cosmetic suggestions. The most important thing is how the machine runs and so far great! I will update this review as necessary. Oh yeah, it was packaged very securely and the toolkit it came with was very handy. There's also a video on YouTube for set up instructions. I would recommend 2 people complete the set up because the machine is heavy.

THREE MONTH FOLLOW UP:
Happy to say that this will be short because 3 months out weâre still very happy with this treadmill. Just as the booklet said, the belt stretches a bit with initial use so you have to adjust it to keep it tight. Itâs very easy to do and the tool that came with the treadmill is well designed and helpful. Zero issues with the treadmill at this point. Also (duh) we figured out that the distance is in km not miles so that explains why the distance seemed pretty off. It doesnât look like you can switch to miles but that doesnât matter to us. Weâre focused on time running more than distance. Plus we really should be using metric because the imperial system is just dumb.
Hereâs our detailed original review:
This is a review based on our first few days of ownership. I will update after a few months to report how the treadmill is holding up. Iâve broken the review down by subject.
Packaging: We researched several different treadmills and one common issue for many was that the packaging didnât protect the treadmill in shipping which occasionally resulted in damage. Because treadmills are not easily returned, this is an issue. We noted that this was NOT a complaint with the Advenor treadmill, and ours arrived very well packed. Everything was protected and well secured.
Assembly: Assembling the Abvenor treadmill was very easy and the instructions were clear and well written. One person could probably do it but two people will make it much faster and easier. All necessary tools were included and they were of surprisingly high quality. The Allen wrench has a grip and it is very helpful for adjusting the belt to ensure it is centered. That was also an easy thing to do. Centering the belt is critical because it avoids belt wear and will extend the life of the treadmill. Also included was lubricant that was well sealed and has a well designed applicator.
Quality and Features: Given that we were spending less than $400 on this treadmill we went with a very simple display and simple features. I would be suspicious of an inexpensive treadmill with too many features and a fancy display. More features means higher build cost and at <$400, it means something is getting sacrificed elsewhere. The Advenor treadmill has a very basic digital display with all the basic information you need: time, distance, calories burned, and heart rate monitoring. It is also programmable for time. It may have other programmable features but so far weâve only set time and speed. The distance calculator seems off (too generous) but that doesnât matter - weâre focused on time running and checking heart rate here and there. The treadmill folds very easily and has a pneumatic lowering feature that is very nice. It fits perfectly against our home gym wall and is a great space saver. The treadmill has small wheels that enable one person to move it relatively easily. The build quality is good. As expected, itâs not as heavy duty as a professional gym treadmill but those are $2,000+ treadmills getting near constant use and they do not fold. The Advenor treadmill feels sturdy and solid for us (our family membersâ weight ranges from 115 lbs to 205 lbs). This is perfect for a home gym. It is comfortable to run on. One nitpick is that the cup holder sits at a bit of an angle but it hasnât been an issue with our water bottles. Just odd: it should be designed to hold the bottle straight up and down. The other holders are a good size and we can easily put our phones in a couple of spots. The display also has a holder that comfortably fits a phone or a small tablet in front of you if you want to watch videos while running.
Value: Our initial impression is that this is a great low priced treadmill. Hopefully it will hold up over time. Weâll refresh our review in a few months to document how it is doing.

Pros - The tread width is perfect. Easy to adjust the speeds. Easy to top and start. Many programs available. Foldable but somewhat heavy.
Cons - The start and stop buttons on the arms are too close to the pulse monitor. They could be moved up by and inch and would not be in the way. I find myself stopping it sometimes. Difficult to lube track. Unboxing: you need two two people to get it out of the box.
For me at 74 I just use it for walking and it's perfect for adjusting the speeds as you walk. I know there is plenty of speed for running.
**I would definitely recommend this unit for walkers. I looked at many treadmills for two months and I'm happy I chose this one. Not disappointed.

Easy to assemble and has a slow safe let down feature.
I wasnât expecting it to be as small as it is. Comparing it to the size of other treadmills at gyms this is definitely way smaller.
Be mindful of the motor size 2.5. For my 13 year old itâs not bad running at a speed of 5 or 6. In order for my run to be effective I need to run at a speed of 8. Gym machines running at a speed of 6 kills me. If you are looking to have something as a starter machine or just basic walking this is the machine for you. If you are an avid runner or gym rat looking for a challenge it will disappoint you.
Issues-Sometimes when using your hands to check pulse or to hold on itâs easy to hit the stop button. You cannot take really long strides so I wouldnât recommend it for tall people. Iâm 5â4 and I struggle. Itâs not super durable; my son misstepped and stepped on the bottom and it cracked even with the screw. I added photos to show what it should look like vs how it cracked. Be mindful the manufacturer sent me a product with zero damages. The machine is extremely delicate. There is ZERO incline.
OVERALL: I think it is a decent machine. Iâm not disappointed with the purchase. I would recommend it for those who donât want to break the bank like myself and still be able to do some form running or walking.

This treadmill is all that it advertises. It is designed and built and sold with customer in mind. I prefer the seller's efforts to create products and real page promotion without ostentation. It did make it harder to move up my stairs, but easy to assemble. Everything is as expected. So easy to use all the programs that cover a variety of desired exercises. Very quiet, very smooth operation. This is a very practical treadmill priced very well for the features it provides.
BTW, before you go buying a good quality, best value for money home treadmill, check out this treadmill. It is a good investment as far as I am sure.

I LOVE this little treadmill!!!!! Easy to assemble, the track does not need to be lubed or messed with. I paid 409 for it and came back two months later to write my review. I noticed it is now 379! What a deal!! I am a Walker/jogger/runner. When I read reviews I learned the importance of the horsepower of treadmills if you plan to run. I bought this in Late February. My husband and I both do about 4-6 miles a day each. We have only taken a few days off of excerise but this treadmill is amazing for a petite machine that has been used almost everyday for two months! Iâm so excited I have been losing weight, I can run at home and it takes up barely any space! I must tell you the mph, pulse and distance are not accurate at all! But I donât care about that because I track my pulse with a watch or pulse ox. Besides itâs the time of your excerise that matters not all the other numbers that will never be accurate on any machine. If you are looking for an affordable treadmill thatâs petite, packs power, not loud at all and is completely reliable this is your product! Iâm so so happy with it! Maybe equally as excited about my weight loss which I owe to my lil trusty Advenor!!! Donât forget to purchase a black gym mat to place under the machine. Not only does it add the quietness it looks good! I spent days reading reviews on treadmills and Iâm so glad I went with this petite 2.5 HP Advenor. I started off walking and now Iâm running 5 miles a day! Love Love Love it!!!!!

Nice and quiet machine. Works well. Don't trust the readings.
I am an EMT, so I was concerned to see the pulse check to be HALF of where I actually was. I was told by Advenor staff that I should "go to a professional medical institution for measurement". So if you have a heart condition or high blood pressure, please use a different tool for measurement. This is not safe for folks in this case.
He also told me the MPH doesn't calibrate as well as the KMH, even though the majority of the people who purchased this machine are from the US. Example: In 25 minutes I ran 2 miles?! I was running fast (level 6) and it would take me anywhere from 17-19 minutes to reach 2 miles; which means the calibration is waaaaay off and it's not a "little discrepancy." I understand this is a relatively cheap machine but these settings should be reflected accurately or close to, for health and safety reasons.
For those of you who may have the same questions or concerns, please see the email reply from Advenor below:
1) The factory default speed of the treadmill is KMH. When you change the speed to MPH, there is a little tolerance in the programming when KMH is converted to MPH, so the distance value after a long run will show a little discrepancy from the actual distance.
2)Please understand that this heart rate monitor is not a professional medical-grade heart rate measurement device, and the test results are not only related to personal constitution, but also may be affected by many factors. This value is for reference only. For more accurate heart rate data, please go to a professional medical institution for measurement.
I'd return the machine but it's a beast of a return so I won't bother.
Thank you for reading. Take care.

I wanted to start by saying their customer service is amazing. This treadmill is super easy to assemble (although heavy, so it took two of us) but it wouldn't turn on. I reached out to them via phone and they emailed me additional instructions immediately. Within minutes, I had it working. I super appreciate their kind, informative, and prompt reply. Here are my tips:
Make sure the connector in the right arm base is attached.
Make sure the two connectors at the top of the right arm are attached (they only attach in one way, one has five pins and one has four pins)
In my case, I had to unscrew the motor cover and attach a connection that came loose in shipping. Took two seconds, just had to know what I was looking for.
I'm an amateur when it comes to cardio so the speed is perfect for me (I can lightly jog comfortably). It holds up well so far (no shaking, no rattling, no noise). Intuitive to use and easy to fold up and down. I'm pretty pleased so far.

I was looking for a sturdy, dependable treadmill. I didn't need a heavy-duty one as I only wanted one for walking. I read the reviews for both this model and the 3 hp model. I selected this one and am very pleased. It is sturdy, was easy to assemble and is very easy to raise and lower the platform. It does record speed and distance in kilometers, but it can be changed to mph (I found out how by reading the Q & A). I suspect neither are accurate, but that isn't important to me. The pulse monitor isn't any good either. Once again, not important to me. All in all, if you're looking for an affordable, solid, well built treadmill for home use, I definitely recommend this one.

Love this treadmill. Iâve been using it for a couple months. It is small enough that it doesnât take a lot of space in my house. I simply use it for a 3 mile walk everyday. Itâs helped me so much. My only complaint is that it could be a little wider. I find myself stepping off this side or bumping the handrails a lot. Also, be careful while assembling. I broke some of the plastic off of the handrail during assembly but that was completely my fault.
It has enough space for me to place my phone or iPad, my tv remote and a PS controller all at the same time for those whoâd like to know.

I seriously love this treadmill. It was SO easy to assemble! I had it up and running within 20 minutes. It fits my kindle and my e-reader or phone, plus a water bottle! Sure, itâs not the fancy gym treadmill that costs over $1000. This fits my needs and didnât have the big price tag. Iâll update later if I have any issues, but so far Iâm incredibly pleased!

When assembling this treadmill, I was impressed by the robust feel of the track and arms, as they are made entirely out of metal and high-quality plastic. I was slightly disappointed, then, to see that the quality dips with the center consoleâThe material feels sturdy enough, but Itâs left as a hollow shell with some of the wiring visible (granted, you wonât be able to see the wires or hollow bottom while running). The display panel is coated with a sort of glossy laminate that feels alright, but looks cheap when caught by the light because itâs slightly warped or peeling in some places.
Revisiting the track, I noticed that the rubber is wrinkled where they had to meld the ends together to make a continuous loop. It looks taught everywhere else.
My final criticism is that the whenever you press something, the console makes a high-pitched, obnoxious beeping sound. Would be better quieter and lower-pitched.
All of that being said, I didnât exactly expect supreme quality at such a low price, and the machine seems to work.

The assembly of this treadmill was really easy. My husband and I were able to get it set up and working in 30 minutes. (You definitely need two people)
I keep it set up in the garage so I havenât had the need to fold or store it.
I use it at least 5 days a week and so far so good. I am pleased with this purchase.

So far with very little use this seems okay. Very easy to assemble took 10 to 15 minutes. My biggest complaint which I took pictures of is all the power comes in through one cable clip which came in completely destroyed. I would think and hope they would package that better so that the main electricity component isn't destroyed in shipping. But anyways, with a little bit of ingenuity and some electrical tape I got it to work, just not an ideal solution.
*
Update:
The company proactively reached out to me to offer some assistance due to the broken clip so based on the excellent customer service I am updating this to 5 stars!

I've only had this for about a month, but so far it has been exactly what I needed. It is beyond easy to put together, the display is easy to use and easy to read, and it folds easily and unfolds slowly and safely. I didn't want any fancy stuff on the display or any weird sounds or mathematical functions. It is just a simple, sturdy surface to walk and run on and it will keep track of time, distance, calories, and pulse. What more do you need?

My treadmill arrived quickly. It was easy to assemble once I watched a YouTube video. For me, the written instructions were a little confusing. I'm more of a visual person so watching a video just was easier for me. I purchased my treadmill to help me be more active. I'm not training for a marathon and I don't consider myself a runner. I mostly use my treadmill for power walking/jogging. I'm not sure if this treadmill would work for someone that is more of a runner or a tall person. I'm 5'0" and when I do "run" I feel like I there's just enough space for my little legs, but not sure if a taller person would have enough space. I also wish the treadmill folded completely, but that was my error in not researching more. I've included pictures of the treadmill folded for reference. With all that said, I truly love my treadmill. The price, fast delivery, ease of assembling, and serving my needs/goals make this the perfect treadmill for me.

This treadmill was one of a million that I was researching for my family to have in our basement. I am worried about buying such a large item on Amazon, but I am glad I did it. The packaging is in very good condition. It is very easy to assemble, only takes 10 minutes, and the material and design are very good. Family members who commented on the matter said it was great. It has a mobile phone holder and an iPad holder, I really like this feature. I watched it on TV, but I can still hear all the sounds, but the sound is not too loud. The motor runs very stably, the power is very strong, and the big guy runs without any lag. The price is very good, such a large product is unmatched by you! Definitely would recommend!

Things I like and thing I dont. Like, easy to put together, easy controls not very loud, easy to fold and unfold. Things that I don't like, The arms are too narrow, depending on your height, running can be hard for arm placement. If walking its not any better (taller is better if running) the track isn't very long, so if you have a long stide it gets tricky next the cup holder is too small. It is not very big none of my sports bottle fit in it. Last the wheels are on the back side of bottom rails. So either run facing wall, have it in the middle of a room, or try and wiggle behind it and push it away from the wall.
The quality is better than I have had of similar price. I would buy again and recommend it.

Cute little treadmill. It is very lightweight and definitely designed for smaller people. Iâm 130 and 5â4 and I felt like quite the giant on it given other treadmills. Update- after using this machine for a couple of weeks and keeping the incline at 0, I am content with this treadmill. There is cushion and give when walking and running and the digital screen making walking and basic timed runs easy. I like that the on/off switch is hidden and that the handles also have their own buttons. If you want something easy for basic exercise, this is a good machine to buy.
This was pretty easy to assemble solo. I guess you get what you pay for. This treadmill feels cheap, and is so loud. I wanted to use this with my tray for my laptop for work, but I canât even hear myself think. Itâs a combination of the motor and the belt. I am hoping the rest of the lubricant helps soften it. I definitely regret not spending the money for a better machine.

If I could give you no stars I would. It took 3 weeks and showed up with the box basically destroyed. Even the styrofoam packing is broken in the box. When I opened the box it looks like part of the electrical wiring is held together by glue. This is a complete piece of crap. Do not waste your money

This is a good, basic electric treadmill. Iâve been using it for a month (I put it together - it wasnât difficult) and have not had any problems. If you need a sturdy, functional treadmill with some l extras, this treadmill will give you what you need at an affordable price.

This was a gift for my gf and she loves this thing. It was important for us to be able to easily fold and move the treadmill around and it literally just take you to bend down and pull the track area up super easy and it has wheels if you want to move it. For the price its a good quality treadmill it is a little narrow like most treadmills in this price range but didn't effect us.

The treadmill arrived well packaged and instructions were easy to follow.
There was a problem with the wiring inside the motor case which caused the treadmill to short out the circuits. I called customer service at Advenor and a technician got back to me in a few hours. I was given step by step instructions with pictures to correct the issue.
It works now and I am impressed with how sturdy the item is at this price.
Advenor followed up to be sure I was satisfied otherwise they would refund the money or send a replacement.
The other reviews were right,GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE AND PRODUCT!
Donât hesitate just order if you want an at home workout.

During assembly, I had to adjust (with a few deft strokes of a framing hammer) the fit of one of the uprights so that I could align the bolt holes. Other than that five minute diversion, it went together well and easily. Believe the instructions when they say two people makes the job easier. I probably could have done it alone, only with significantly more cursing. Once together, I took it out for a spin. It works. Does what it is supposed to do. The angle of the handle bars isn't the most comfortable, but I can work around that. I'm exercising. Yay!

This little treadmill is a gem. I did a lot of research before expecting to drop a lot of money. Most treadmills (including very high-end machines) lacked the customer service I wanted. The 100% customer service rating on the Advenor store ultimately made the decision for me. This treadmill arrived before the delivery date with no damage. It was very easy to assemble (my husband and I had it together in 30 min), it is super quiet, and ticks all the boxes for my walking needs. I walk around 3-4 miles/day, and it logs my speed, time, calories burned and miles walked (my readings started in miles, not kilometers). It gets very hot in the summer where I live, and I really needed to be able to exercise indoors (still cannot get to the gym). The one thing that is missing in the directions is where the on/off button is.......it is on the base frame of the treadmill at the front (not on the console)....it sounds silly, but it needs to be shown in the âname of partsâ. It semi-folds easily, but is a little harder to move. There is a shelf for an ipad, so I listen to music or binge-watch a show and just go. You absolutely cannot beat the price! I Iâve only had this a few weeks, but I am very happily pleased, and always look forward to my next workout! I will update in a few months:))

Got this for my Father during the CA wildfires and he is pleased with the purchase. Still uses it on bad air quality days and cold weather. Works very well for its purpose (he walks, doesnât run so canât speak to that). Wasnât too bad to assemble, it did take a little time, maybe an hour or so, but nothing too hard. It would have been a lot more challenging with just one person though as it did have some bigger and heavier parts that would have been harder to maneuver or hold with just one. Havenât tried to move it since it isnât incredibly lightweight and it is being used pretty often. Still working well and no complaints so far.

Great little tradmill. Wish the arm rests were longer like when i am speed walking I am 5'9...ALSO the start/stop button is where you put your hand so if your not careful you will hit STOP (the reason for a 4 star)
Husband set it up like in 20min. Easy he said!
For the money you can't beat it. Super sturdy. I am 5'9 like I said and I jog/run/ walk nooo problem. I love it...named her June Osborn (Handsmaid) because this treadmill is STRONG and BASASS!
My 13yr old finallly decided to exercise ..she uses it everyday! That alone makes it worth it to me!

Itâs small and practical nothing fancy but it gets the job done. Itâs very easy to fold and the speed is great and it has a manual incline. Itâs not going to be like the treadmills you see at the gym but itâll still let you run your miles and all. Also itâs a bit small so you canât take big steps because the width is very limited. Neither of those things are a problem for me since I am a petite person and this works out for me. But for a tall person Iâm sure it may be more uncomfortable but you could find a way to make it work for you my brother heâs 6â0 ft makes it work for him so Iâm sure someone his height or taller could too.

*review is after setting up and first use*
Treadmill was exceptionally easy to put together (even all by myself). It is definitely a small treadmill. I am 5â5â ~120 lbs and it fits me fine, but for a larger/taller person it might be challenging. Easy to use and perfect for a simple at home gym. Comfortable cushion on the running base. Love the water bottle holder too (lots of treadmills in this price range donât have them). Only downside Iâve noticed (other than size) is the mph/speed is not at all comparable to larger models (in traditional gyms, etc). For example, I is usually start running/comfortable jog at a 5.0 to warm up at the gym. On this treadmill, my warm up speed was an 8.0 on this machine (max available is 13.0 on this machine). And the treadmill calculates distance run off of speed, so it was drastically overestimating how far I actually ran. It doesnât bother me too much cause I can just use my Apple Watch for distance, but just something to be aware of. Otherwise, itâs a good product for the price.

Arrived today! The box is heavy af but me being the bad chick I am, got it up a flight of stairs... by myself! But i def had muscle failure and will walk away with some bruises. Highly recommend a team lift. All parts were accounted for and nothing damaged. The assembly took me about 30 minutes. Seems to work fine. The cup holder is small though. Folds up easily. Not exactly the most quiet treadmill ive been on but that would be the only downfall so far.. seems good for the price...

I bought this for rehab walking not running. Itâs a little noisy, the mileage etc. is a little off but Iâm only using the timer really. It does the job. Was easy to assemble but I see that the rubber track had to be tightened a bit and still doesnât always lay completely flat but it works and serves my purposes. Pretty pricey for what it is but I was not willing to go higher. Iâm sure theyâll all be worthless at the end of Covid restrictions.

I wish I ordered this treadmill last year but glad I did so this year. Iâm still not comfortable going to my local gym because members there do NOT wipe down the equipment after use. Now Iâm glad to have my own treadmill I can clean and maintain. Got a good run out of it and feel very happy with it. The only downside is that you have to manually adjust the incline. But overall, a very good treadmill.

After a couple of weeks intensely reading reviews and Best Of guides, along with many videos, I settled on this Advenor 2.5. The final deciding factor was that many reviews mentioned it was SECURELY PACKAGED. Many others brands had good potenial - but reviews often stated treadmills were busted upon arrival due to poor packaging. This made me crazy!! So I took a chance on this fairly new treadmill company-- and could not be happier! Safely packaged-- well built/ sturdy -- quiet-- belt wide and long enough. Easy to fold / unfold-- maybe not super easy to roll around but I keep mine in place. Have put 2 rugs underneath instead of a matt. Good customer service was also imperative for peace of mind --which was positively mentioned in many reviews. Have enjoyed it daily for short walks since December 1st. Hope it lasts a very long time. It definitely checks all my boxes. So far, so good! I hope this review can be helpful. Way to go, Advenor!

The treadmill runs smoothly quietly and I think itâs going to be a fine piece of equipment. I look forward to learning all the interval features.
That said
Assembly is a bear. The legs for folding the unit are held up by a piston that is supposed to collapse. It didnât. I contacted the company, and they promised to send a new part. Three weeks later I disconnect the piston. There is very tight clearance to put in certain screws and nuts
Overall I like the unit but assembly is difficult

I am happy to report that this product is exactly what I needed in a treadmill. It has a great manual incline as well as programs that will fit whatever workout routine you may be needing. I am currently training for a 5k marathon with this product and I feel like the workout is more intense using this treadmill. Everything is simple and not complicated. I feel worked out every run or walk I take. Worth the price and buy. I do not regret purchasing. In fact I can not say no to a workout or have any excuses to not workout with this in my house. I love it and am starting to see more results with each use.

It was easy to put together although the directions are a little scattered. in the middle of assembly they would talk about safety and use. There were extra nuts and bolts which is handy but a little confusing at first. We find it nice and study and are enjoying using it daily since we haven't felt safe going to the gym. We haven't tried folding it as we are using it everyday.

We couldn't believe how easy this treadmill was to assemble!!! Just a few screws and bolts and it was ready to go! We saw that other reviews said that folks had to adjust the belt or use the oil right away, but we didn't have to. It was amazing how well it worked right away. We bought it for my sister, assembled it at our place, and delivered it to her. Super happy with our purchase!

I am recovering from an injury and this is a great tool for my rehab. The convenience of the hand/finger controls help me vary my work out routines and the variety of programs already on the control panel give me lots of workout options, AND itâs very quiet. Great value for the price.
Good treadmill for running. Smaller than our commercial grade Nordic track but a big guy can run on it. We added rubber treadmill pads to go under the back to quiet it down.

I got this product crack in two places and it doesn't work. The power does not come on. This was very disappointing. Don't buy it. They still have not gave me my money back or no one telling me how to send it back. This is horrible to send some a product which doesn't work and they will not do anything about it
Treadmill is well built and works well. Use it every night. quiet and easy to adjust belt. Programs are a great addition.

I bought this a few weeks ago for at family use and its been great so far. It was fairly easy to assemble and all the functions like speed and programs are very clear cut and easy to use. The display screen is decently big and the machine is fairly quiet so no one in my family has their sleep disrupted by my brother when he uses it in the early mornings.
Wife likes using it 3 to 5 times a week

rev_det.name: Have been using this 2 in 1 treadmill everyday for my jogging and walking activity at home. The one step folding mechanism is very useful and conveniently easy. The size is what makes it a really great for my home. I can store it under my sofa or bed. It is very stable and quiet when turned on. I have been using this treadmill for over a month without any issues. It is very easy to fold/unfold the handrails. No assemble required. Comes with Bluetooth capability.
Keep in mind that there is no incline/decline option. But for running on a flat surface this is a great & affordable treadmill.

Wow impressed with this treadmill.
At first I was going to purchase the Nordic track because of the name and I honestly did not think a treadmill for 300$ would work well especially for me being over weight at 263lb.
However this thing works great! Folds easily and can fit it under my bed, no assemble needed it showed up ready to go.
Very impressed, I especially like the Bluetooth speakers!
This product is very easy to store and use. Convienient.
only three days of use and it died. this error is on the screen CODE E06

It takes me some time to figure out how to start it at the very beginning. But after I spend half an hour with it almost every day, I find I am getting used to it and enjoy jogging on it. Although it is not comparable to the commercial-grade treadmill at the gym, it certainly meets all my expectations and needs. And actually, it is more stable and quiet than I expected.
And I do have some advice for others to start up this treadmill.
1. remember there has a button at the bottom in the front part. You need to turn it on before you can remote control it.
2. the APP name for this treadmill may be different from the name provided with the manual. The name is just "MAXFREE," rather than the "MAXFREE treadmill"
