My one star rating (there isn't an option of 0) is due to lack of reliability of this machine and no clarity (delay) on the time to get the replacement part. I understand that things can go wrong but a better support in terms of atleast a faster delivery would have prompted me to give a better rating.

I am going to preface by saying that I have only had the treadmill for 3 days and we have done 4 work outs. Because I know I read reviews for the product and not necessarily the person I am buying it from, I will be brief in stating that delivery was pushed back twice by the delivery company and after arranging my schedule for my original delivery date, this kind of pissed me off.
As for the treadmill itself, I was able to assemble it by myself with the exception of putting on the piston (I needed my husband to lift the running deck.) in about 3 hours. It connected to the internet quickly and I was able to go on a hike within about 15-20 minutes of final assembly. The fans work great and the sound is pretty great through bluetooth.
Slow console.. treadmill stopped working in 6 months.. no customer service.. waiting for part.. they donât care after selling low quality product.. stay away

I was looking for a treadmill so I no longer have any excuses as to why I didn't work out. It's been about two months since I bought this treadmill and I'm quite happy with it so far. It comes with a one-year iFit membership, which has running classes where it controls your treadmill. I gotta say - the part where your treadmill is auto-controlled is very cool! And the hidden benefit is that it takes "more work" to lower the setting so you're more likely to stick with the program as long as you make time for exercising.
The console is quite big. I thought of ordering the bigger treadmill for the bigger console but I was happy with this screen size. The one with the bigger console is much more expensive, but I also found out it has a steeper incline, which some trainers mention + use during classes.
One downside: the console is buggy and slow. Very. Slow. It constantly updates information and it doesn't seem like they cache very much information (I'm an engineer). The frame rates are also very low, making it feel very sluggish.
Overall: I'm pretty happy with this machine. I no longer have any excuses about why I didn't get a workout in since it's in the corner of my living room.

I wish I could give zero stars. Had treadmill two days and the console wouldn't work. Called NordicTracka and they said they will send a new console in 2 to 3 weeks and then schedule a technician to come install. After three weeks no console, called back and told they are so busy there will be a delay so another 2 to 3 weeks. Told it woild likely ship the week of Christmas (which was more than 3 weeks). Here we are 7 weeks after it stopped working and guess what no console. Called back again and they gave the same story. Asked to be escalated up to someone else and told there is no one for me to talk to and there is nothing they can do. It will be another 2 to 3 weeks maybe. At this point I'm out $2,500 and it appears NordicTrack has no intention of honoring their warranty. It's not like I had it several years, it only worked two days!

I did not rate ease of assembly, Amazon services set-up. They did a great job. 2450 has been an excellent machine so far, only minor complaint is tactile response of screen and speed/incline buttons could be more responsive. Only other machine I considered was the Peloton tread. Although I thoroughly enjoy Peloton's classes (I have a Peloton bike), I did not think Peloton tread's price tag was justified and the 2450 was a far better value.

Treadmill was great for 6 months. After 6 months the treadmill broke down and I have been struggling with NordicTrack customer support ever since. The treadmill has a 5 year warranty, but the warranty does no good if the company will not come out to fix it.

The machine is amazing! The incline/decline is fun while you are walking etc. The Ifit is the smartest thing ever to keep you engaged and wanting to come back every morning to continue your series. ( I have gone to the Serengeti, Antarctic, Scotland, New Zealand, and the Grand Canyon.... all while walking on my machine. I love this machine

We did a lot of research on treadmills before purchasing this one. It was pretty heavy to bring downstairs, but the set up was not too bad with the easy to follow video. Super easy to use with a good amount of cushion. Great trays for water, phone, etc.
I absolutely love working out with iFit. It is a game changer for my future exercises. So much variety, you donât even notice youâre continually running on a treadmill.

Pretty awesome so far. I didnât realize the screen was an actual tablet... works just like my iPad. I havenât even begun to get into all the different video workouts yet, but you really get what you pay for with this one. Not only a far better quality treadmill than the $1k and under versions, but the tablet-video-workouts make it fun again!
I just hope it lasts.

The trainers and stuff that come with IFIT are awesome. John Peel is one of them and is very motivating. The programs last 20 workouts and they increase gradually. Once itâs together, everything about this machine will help you get in shape.
Note: if you decide to assemble this yourself, itâs very heavy! It will take two strong people to move it. Also, donât tighten bolts until it tells you. The engineers made sure that some were difficult to get to during assembly. One star for the engineers. Finally, you need to tighten the belt before use, it shipped loose. We started with quarter turns but switched to full turns then quarter turns. Also, donât try and lift the tread until fully assembled because you can sever the cords.

I've had my 2450 now for 3 months and I love it. I have been using my machine regularly now for about 12 weeks. I have only 1 complaint but overall my experience is this is a great machine for a budget oriented user. I was skeptical about he iFit programs but they really do make running more enjoyable with the scenery and different trainers. I find the machine to be smooth and at 200 lb's it handles my weight with no issues- even when at speeds and at an incline the motor never seems taxed nor does it slip. My only complaint is I cant see how to set manual timed programs, it's just run until you're done then manually initiate a cool down, but otherwise the machine is powerful, smooth and stable- highly recommend

This treadmill is exactly what I wanted. My smaller house has limited space and so I love how easy this is to tuck away when it's not being used. It has wheels and can be moved by one person. It comes down slowly and gently with just one touch of your foot which engages the mechanism under the treadmill and then it comes down without you having to strain your back. As far as treadmills go, this one is pretty quiet. I highly recommend this treadmill if you're looking for quality.

The commercial NordicTrack treadmill is well built and easy to use. It weighs 339 lbs so setup is a challenge for one person, but instructions are good and all parts were supplied with no deficiencies. The fold up function is great for storage, but the deck is heavy to lift for my wife. iFit makes all the difference and teh 14" screen is large enough to work with iFit. I would not recommend the 10" screen which would make the iFit subscription less fun.

Purchased for in-home workouts. Paid for the pro installation, which was a good deal. However, one of the techs pointed out that it was making an unexpected noise. I called for support and waited on hold for a very long time. Although I had also paid for the premium support, I was told that it would be WEEKS before anyone could come out to diagnose the issue, and then WEEEKS to wait for a part if any was needed. They offered some general suggestions, none of which worked and even suggested that I just return it, but could not get me a replacement for WEEKS. So I'm stuck with a defective treadmill that I'm not expecting to last, having paid for premium support, which is apparently worth nothing. IF it worked well, this would be a good treadmill. But beware and heed those other many reviews that indicated that I am no the only one to receive very poor support if something is wrong.

Great product if you only want to use in manual mode. However, electronic features require a subscription with an annual $500 cost. Without it you can only use in manual mode, will not even allow saving workout statistics. The subscription is reported to be free for the first year but requires entry of a credit card to activate and I have read other reviews of problems with people being charged when activated and struggled to have the fee refunded.

Do NOT buy Nordictrack products. I have had a problem with the 2450 Commercial treadmill since I got it. Itâs under warranty plus I purchase the extended warranty. Customer service is awful and I canât get anyone to fix the treadmill. Better off setting your money on fire. Horrific.

Overall, we are pleased with this purchase. It was delivered quickly and very easy to assemble. 4 stars instead of 5 because the belt did not arrive pre-lubricated and it took several weeks to diagnose that as the issue.
EDIT: Dropping a star because the locking mechanism already broke (treadmill doesnât stay up when stored) and the middle of the platform is starting to sag.

My wife has always wanted a nice treadmill so I finally bit the bullet and bought this for her back in May. Over these past three months she has fallen in love with this treadmill. She uses it just about every day and absolutely loves the videos of the different trainers from all over the world. She loves the auto incline adjust that follows the terrain the trainers are running on as well as the live classes available throughout the day. It is super easy to fold up and store if we ever need to and we were super surprised that the treadmill is as quiet as it is. Overall, we are very happy with this and have no regrets about purchasing whatsoever.

This is an excellent treadmill! It is a higher quality treadmill than I have found at almost every gym I've belonged to (I'm 38, so I've belonged to several). We have had it for about 9 months, and it is running as smoothly today as it did the first time we used it. I know this treadmill will last for years. It is very simple to use. I like to create my own workouts, but did try one of the iFit videos and found it fun and engaging.
My husband assembled it by himself without any trouble. I couldn't be happier with our purchase and highly recommend!

My wife and I like this treadmill, mostly. Assembly was fairly straightforward, the interface works just fine, and iFit is really amazing and a great motivation tool. The treadmill itself is okay in terms of running comfort, but nothing spectacular.
Unfortunately, right out of the box ours made a thumping sound accompanied by a bump feeling as you walked. It's annoying, but the treadmill is still usable. We've had the full technician visit and they said "everything is mechanically sound" and that maybe it would go away after another few months. For a $2k+ machine, that is unacceptable.

Iâve had this treadmill now for 3 months and it has changed my life. Iâve lost over 20 lbs and I canât wait to get on the treadmill every day. I really like the iFit membership that goes with it because it gives me my own personal trainer videos to follow based on the type of workout Iâm looking for. I did have some initial issues with videos pausing because of my wifi but realized it was my old router causing the problem. Make sure you get a newer router model and you wonât have issues. Ever since I upgraded my router, I have had no issues at all.
Only reason I didnât give easy to assemble a 5-star rating is that the whole thing weighs over 350 lbs and it took the entire family to move it to our basement. Once it was down there, it was very easy to assemble by myself.
Only thing I might have done differently would be to buy the next version up for the larger screen. Regardless, I love this machine. Worth every penny.
My brand new unit came with several marks and blemishes - including these in both sides. Not real thrilled considering price

Worked great for three months! Then the console blew, got approved for a new one, but they didnât have any in stock. They also didnât know when theyâd have more. Still waiting for a new one two months later. I the meantime my purchase remorse grows and I think maybe I shouldâve spent the extra $2k and gotten a peloton

By far the worst thing I've ever bought on Amazon. I don't often write reviews or give critical feedback on products, but the NordicTrack treadmill I bought was absolutely awful.
The assembly pieces were defective, screw threads didn't fit screws, I discussed with customer support and they sent me new parts, the assembly still didn't work. Maybe they're being careful because of COVID and trying to make the product more compact, but I think it's just poorly made. It might be good if the white-glove assembly is available (not during COVID), but if not, I would not recommend it. It's too expensive to not be functional.

I can't say enough about my NordicTrack treadmill. I love the free one year iFit subscription. It gives me various workouts to keep me active. I love the way it follows the trainers on inclines and declines. The negative 3 decline actually feels like you're running downhill for a realistic run. I like the Google map feature that allows me to create a route to run. I look forward to going on a run everyday and around the world from the comfort of my home.

After wearing out my last treadmill, I was looking to take a step up. I settled on this NordicTrak Commercial 2450 and Iâm VERY glad I did. This is a PRIMO machine and is super smooth and quiet. The treadmill came with a year of iFit so right now itâs all good. The only drawback that I have found with it is this: To create and save your own workouts you must have a current iFit subscription.
If youâre able to spend the extra money, this machine is WORTH IT, in my opinion.

The Nordictrack 2450 came very well packaged. I thought the bolts coming numbered and vacuum sealed helped in the step to step process of assembly. I use it pretty much everyday and sometimes more than once a day. I like the treadmill very much, it's smooth, keeps running track of my weekly progress. I haven't got into the interactive fitness part yet but I plan to soon. The blue tooth sound system is awesome and the fans are a big plus but I wish they had 3 or more speeds.

With Covid and no longer being able to go to the gym safely I converted my guest bedroom into a work out room. I highly recommend this treadmill and spend the $89 to have it professionally assembled which I did. It took the technician several hours to put it together and he knew exactly what he was doing. The work out programs through I fit which comes with a free one year membership are fun and motivating.

I have had it a month and am so far very happy with it. Do have someone put it together for you as it is super heavy. One note, I had to practically beg the delivery company to bring it in the house as they said they only had to drop it on the property. It took two of them and me to get into the front door and that is as far as they would take it. They actually were going to just leave this super heavy and very large box sitting there in the yard. So be forewarned, ordering it through Amazon may not mean they will bring it in the house.

I love my Nordictrack 2450. The thing is huge. Fortunately, I had great delivery people that put it together quickly (for a little extra $). I have had it about two months now. It is very easy to learn. The IFit program is great if you like variety. I love that the program regulates my tread (you can override that) because I think it pushes me harder. I only wish I could easily pair my AirPods to it. I really do love it.
So far I have NOT been disapointed with it. Everything works as I expected it to. It was less expensive at the time of purchase to buy it here and not at NordicTrack's website. Saved a lot of $$$.

This is awesome treadmill!
Have a large screen so following the I-fit videos is a pleasure. It came with one year Ifit subscription and I even got one more year for as low as 120$!
With this treadmill you can follow the trainers or customize your workout during the time of your workout.
Cons- every time when you are turning your treadmill on it took about 10 minutes to get ready for working out.
But... everything else is great!

Took a long time to assemble. Machining is quite poor. Ground screw hole was not open enough to accept the ground screw, so poorly machined it was stripping the screw with no possible way it would fit. Ultimately required I take a drill and slightly open it up little by little until the ground screw would go in and I could continue on. The side mounts also encounter the same issue. The manual notes you should not use power tools for the screws utilized in both the ground screw and side rail mounts, but they are so poorly machined it takes that force (albeit gentle) from a drill to seat the screws. Once up and running the free year of iFit is nice and the treadmill operates smoothly so far.

Love the screen on the treadmill and iFit is absolutely the best. We've been motivated to use the treadmill because of the kind of programming. One negative is that the big screen doesnt pivot like a Peloton, limiting visibility while doing HIIT exercises. There's also a metallic clanging noise every time you run on the treadmill while incline is changing. These are minor annoyances, but overall, treadmill is great. Nice wide track, bright, responsive screen and innovative programming with iFit.
One caveat: We didn't assemble this machine. Seemed too daunting of a task, so we hired Amazon's installation team. Worth every dollar.

Easy to assemble. powerful motor to do mix workouts. came with ifit which is good inspiration for beginners (Advance athletes can create their own routine and schedule on their calendar) especially there are pre-recorded workout session at different part of the world to add some mix to your workout. Quiet and powerful motor for longer workouts. one hand lift for space savings. Bluetooth connectivity for playing music. Overall I am satisfied with the product so far. Would recommend to anyone who would like to keep themselves fit and healthy.

Fairly large expenditure. We are happy with the treadmill and the IFIT technology. We purchased the 2450 model. The biggest disappointment even though it has features showing the "Blue Tooth" it does not connect to Bluetooth. We sent an inquiry into Nordic Track of how to connect and they said our model doesn't allow this. Why the heck does one machine has the feature of the "Bluetooth" sign and all the instructions on how to connect and it doesn't have it? Very disappointing. So now when one works out, the whole room and most of the home can hear the trainers talking etc. Be careful of this.

Great machine. The IFit makes it all worth it. The screen seems much bigger in person than what it seems in the pictures. I wish I could have paid for assembly. It was a heavy and tedious job but we were able to assemble it with just two people. Overall Iâm very happy.

My wife and I have been using treadmills at the gym for years and NONE of them perform like the NordicTrack! The interactive programs are awesome, the incline is amazing, and the decline really makes you feel your running on a road or trail outdoors. Weâve been using it for about four months now and actually look forward to working out and exploring different venues. As you can see we have a TV in the workout room but usually just use iFit and follow the trainer and scenery. Love it!

This is a great machine. It replaced my old circa 2004 era treadmill and the advances on this machine are just amazing. I love just how sturdy the machine is and the little extras that are there. It has a nice powerful motor, which is relatively quiet for a treadmill motor. The built in fan is a nice extra while running to help keep me cool. I was pretty skeptical on the ifit programs at first, but I have found I really enjoy the routes w/ the trainers and the fact that the treadmill auto adjust speed and incline/decline automatically is great for providing a nice varied workout.

This treadmill is trash. The belt snags and the incline stopped working after about 4 months. If you start looking for solutions to the incline issue, youâll find itâs a known problem with this machine.

I love this treadmill! I even love the iFit subscription that comes with it. The treadmill is quiet, responds well with the iFit program and makes running all those miles so much more bearable. The fans are the best Iâve ever had on a treadmill too.

This treadmill has changed my life. I wanted one for running on days when it is raining, as it often does here, and for when I would be running after dark or alone. I LOVE the iFit features, the stability of the treadmill itself, and the relative ease with which we were able to assemble it. You will need 2 people for assembly, this thing is heavy! So far the set up has been simple, the year of iFit will be well utilized, and the machine is far superior to those at the gym. This is perhaps my favorite purchase ever.

Great treadmill! I bought it in August 2020 and use it 5 out of 7 days a week. Easy to use, big and sturdy platform. This is a big machine, so it is strong and heavy. Love the IFit app. You can also customize a map where you want to run. Very please with the machine. No more excuses for not working out.

In less than a years Iâm having issues with fans not working, rust on sensor handles and sudden shut downs of treadmill with the workouts still playing on the screen. I would save a little more money and get a PELOTON treadmill. Iâm very disappointed with the rust issue with the emergency key magnet and metal sensors on handles (heart rate)

Our first one had a bent frame it was a nightmare having to return and get a different one. Probably wouldn't order another one through Amazon just for the reason of pain in the butt to return. Loved the machine once we got one that was in all working condition
I purchased it in August 4th, 2020. In November 30, 2020, it is not working. It is no longer running. The quality is not good as it is advised. It is not worth for over $2600.

As many other reviewers stated - It was dead on arrival. After spending 2.5 hours assembling everything, it never worked. The main console is dead.
There is clearly power in the system (static sound in speakers and flashing bluetooth light), but everything else is dead.
I'll return and I recommend everyone to stay away. Still no idea how the return of this 300lbs weight is going to go

Honestly, this is one if the best purchases Iâve ever made. Iâve always hated cardio, but I find myself using this treadmill every single morning. The reason is the iFit trainers that are greeting me every morning. I find myself immersed in the experience of hiking up Mount Fuji, hiking around Lake Tahoe, running on a beach in Kauai, through the streets in Iceland, or through the streets of India. The treadmill itself is very smooth, and has declines of -3 all the way up to incline of 15 degrees. The speed and incline adjust automatically according to the training program you are following. Itâs really an awesome machine that has gotten me off my butt. Highly recommended.

Great when it works. The iFit app is terrible. It hasn't automatically loaded for months. And if your WiFi goes out forget about using it, even in manual mode. I'll never buy a treadmill that has iFit on it again. And it constantly squeaks. I would skip this brand and look for something else.

I bought one of these, and after using it every other day for a month, the right side felt like it was about to break in 2 when I took a step on it. I checked the floorboard and it wasnt cracked. Nordictrack couldnt tell me what the problem was, so I returned it and got a replacement through amazon. This time the same thing happened after using it 5-6 times. I weight 233, the max weight is supposedly 300. Nordictrack still cant help me, so I'm retunring this one and never using them again
Purchased in Feb 2021, received older model NTL172219. New model is NTL17221. Let just say I was not happy to pay the same price offered by Nordictrak for the newer model.

This is great product for your home. I have it in my office and it runs very quiet and I love the large screen. It also folds up really nice to save space and is easy to get the track back down. The fans work great and the touch screen is very responsive. I did pay extra to have it installed as it's not a one person job and is semi-complex. Overall, I couldn't be happier.

It is a great machine and as all the reviews say, it is probably the best you can get for your home gym. I love the fact that it has enough space for you to run and you do not feel like you are in a tight space. Also the screen is awesome and the content through iFit makes running experience a very engaging experience. Highly recommended.

Great Treadmill! It was always hard and time consuming to get to the gym, but it's also boring to work out at home. ifit makes it enjoyable to work out at home while pushing you to your limits. I end up working out much more than I did before and I'm finally learning how to be a runner!
I HAD THIS MACHINE FOR ONLY THREE MONTHS AND THE RUNNING BOARD BROKE IN THE MIDDLE DURING EXERCISE.

I set up the treadmill in the garage. Assembly was not too difficult. The treadmill works great and is getting a lot of use from 4 family members. We love the iFit coach and the large selection of workouts. The sound system and cooling fan are major pluses. The workout time just flies by. A couple of the parts were damaged in transit (nothing major). Due to CoVid-19 delays, it took a bit of time to receive replacement parts, but they did come eventually.
Love the 14 inch screen and free iFit! It was more challenging to put together than I expected.
It completely met my expectations!

Love this piece of equipment and the iFit membership that comes with it. It's not as loud as we expected, and the extra assembly service was a must. Beware Amazon's standard delivery as they may simply get it inside your house and not drop to the desired location, so this is good to determine in advance. Regardless, the product is great!

The Nordictrack 2450 has to be one of the greatest treadmills Iâve even ran on. It has a smooth running belt and when you turn on the belt softener it gets even smoother. I truly have to say that the iFit workouts are something else, they really make you feel like youâre in the destination you choose. Nodictrack spared no expense on this treadmill. Iâd highly recommend this treadmill for a experienced runner or someone looking for something different on a day to day basis. GREAT JOB NORDICTRACK!!!

The product was delivered in a timely manner. Unfortunately when unloading the item or prior to loading 3 pieces of the equipment had broken. The gentleman we hired pointed them out and thankfully did not affect the use of the treadmill. Just a little upset after paying so much we already have digs and broken pieces. Hoping I will Be able to get them replaced.

I use this treadmill about 4 times a week and 4 to 5 miles a day and so far so good. I have a good time using this treadmill. My husband put it together and the only time I needed to help him, was when I had to hold up the treadmill as he was fixing the lift part.

The return policy will cost you - even if the frame was bent in manufacturing. Iâm out $400 for a restocking fee on a machine that I used for less than a week. Maybe this is how Bezos is a billionaire. Robbing me of $400.

This Nordictrack treadmill is AMAZING! Perfect for working out. Glad I went with the 14â screen. Itâs more expensive than the 10â one but definitely worth it. The belt is big enough to walk or run. The assembly part was tough so I had to get the Amazon service guy to do it. He did a fairly good job and was able to do it quickly.
I would recommend getting iFit with it because their workouts are awesome! And I definitely recommend this product!!

I was able to use the iFit 2 times before the screen started to have trouble. There was a long wait to get help when calling, over 45 minutes. I need to get a new screen, so will have to wait even more time before being able to use it. So, my year free subscription is not getting used.

Excellent machine. I bought it based on independent reviews as well as Amazon customers without a test run. I am not disappointed. It is an excellent product and would recommend it. The iFit is not my favorite as I use the manual run feature the most but my wife enjoys the trainer assisted interval workouts. We will see if I continue it after the 1 year subscription however, the 14 inch screen is a plus. Assembled myself in about 90 minutes. Last two screws in the display were the hardest, but all in all an easy assemble.
Love the product with the integrated IFit membership. Had a problem right out of the box and it took a few weeks to get all the the right parts and work as expected, but all better now.
Stopped working less than a month after having it. Stuck in decline decline position. Also super creaky when running. Very surprised for a brand new treadmill. We would not recommend.

While assembly is a bit of a challenge, 2 people can do it in a few hours. The treadmill itself is performing very well. The iFit training is excellent and motivating. I highly recommend this equipment.

Iâm a big dude, 6â4â and range anywhere from 275-300. I was a bit skeptical that the Nordictrack would put up with me. I have been more than happy with the machine. The combination of the treadmill with the Ifit trainers is superb, and in one word, I am AMAZED at the system as a whole! Iâve gotten accustomed to âtravelingâ on my morning workouts; I suggest walking the guided tours of Japan with Masato.
I LOVE this commercial treadmill! It is well built and easy to assemble. My husband and I have used it for a couple of days now & like it better than the Sole we had previously.

rev_title.name: Constangtly malfunctioning & the WORST Customer Service!! BUY A PELOTON!
Beware of non-existent support from Nordictrack.
Almost Commercial, and a Very solid piece of Equipment, but bad Customer Service
I was a skeptic until...I fell in love.
Very impressed up to this point.
Research deeply before buying. Falls below expectations on a few levels
Would not buy again. This treadmill will rust!
Great treadmill ruined by clunky iFit
Not the quality of older generation NordicTrack - Horrible tech support.
Very good treadmill for running-lengthy wait for replacement parts
Very poor quality product and useless support
Great to have a treadmill at home!
Operational for 4 months DO NOT PURCHASE
Constangtly malfunctioning & the WORST Customer Service!! BUY A PELOTON!
Beware of non-existent support from Nordictrack.
Almost Commercial, and a Very solid piece of Equipment, but bad Customer Service
I was a skeptic until...I fell in love.
Very impressed up to this point.
DO NOT BUY!!!!! Motor already broken! After only 6 months since purchase.
Best treadmill I have ever had
IT'S HUGE!! It's also pretty awesome!!
Disappointing customer service and noisy treadmill
Think twice, iFit software controls the entire machine
Happy with my purchase and love the scenic runs!
I was expecting a treadmill, and in return received much more than that.
Awesome Treadmill! Commercial quality, and the iFit experience is amazing!
Great treadmill, quiet and stable platform (which you can adjust).
Treadmill was dead on arrival, no support from NordicTrack
Our whole family is thrilled with this treadmill!
Great machine to run on, but could use some features.
Defective new unit arrived. 9 hours wasted
Malfunctioned within five months, slow in repair
Worked 2 days and NordicTrack has still not honored warranty 7 weeks later
Great features and value in the 2450
Has been broken down for 7 months
The greatest thing I have ever purchaed for myself
Easy to stand up and put down!
Excellent product for manual exercising but features hold you financially hostage.
Created an Addict...In a Good Way!
Great treadmill if you don't get a lemon
Completely worth the money and reliable - so far !
I give this product my personal mark of excellence !!!
Excellent workout machine to stay fit and healthy at home. No Gym membership needed.
The interactive interface with the trainer
If youâre going to submit yourself to this torture do it with one of these!
Relationship Status: In Love with This Treadmill
Easy to use, big and sturdy platform.
Too expensive for very cheap materials!
Great product, Love the I-fit workout
Dead on arrival - as with many other reviewers.
Waste of money and Nordictrack is not helpful
A great machine to keep you motivated
RUNNING BOARD BROKE IN THE MIDDLE
Love it!! Sturdy and great for working out!

prod.pname: 2 in 1 Folding Treadmill with Incline, Manual Running Treadmill Walking Jogging Machine, Portable Cardio Fitness Exercise with LED Display Screen for Home Office Gym

rev_date.rev_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2021
Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2021

rev_det.name: For $200.00 (which includes shipping cost) I received a manual treadmill that has a slippery, jerky belt and a frame that shifts dangerously during use. The included "instructions" must have been written by a child or non native English speaker as they are vague and incoherent, and the included pictures are tiny and blurry, even with a magnifying glass. I have never spent so much money on such garbage, much less garbage that could potentially cause me bodily harm. Nevermind actual exercise, if you value your safety, I highly recommend NOT purchasing this product!
Excelente me gusta mucho

prod.pname: Fitness Reality TR3000 Maximum Weight Capacity Manual Treadmill with 'Pacer Control' & Heart Rate System

rev_det.name:
Intoduction: In general, manual treadmills, those without motors, are certainly cheaper than motorized ones. The biggest pro is cost. The next biggest pro is weight - manual treadmills will weigh rather less than any motorized unit worth getting. The con is that your body dictates the speed, and how you walk on the unit can cause the unit to stop. Meaning you should be positioned toward the middle of the platform and not close to the front, or a bit farther back, for a more consistent walk. Since your body powers the belt, this means your body has to start it up. This does add momentary wear'n'tear to one's preferred knee. Those with arthritis would find this to be a potential downside.
Also, for any treadmill, have a pair of NEW shoes, dedicated SOLELY for the treadmill. That way it doesn't get covered in muck and stuff. Also, get some good insoles like memory foam to help out your joints.
What's good:
* The TR3000 is largely pre-assembled out of the box. It took me about 15 minutes to unpack and set up the unit.
* It comes with oil to lubricate to reduce friction - READ THE MANUAL about how and when to use it, my booklet has age 15 devoted to the section "Lubrication".
* feels very sturdy, even right out of the box
* 75 pounds makes it easy to move
* has 2 incline settings, I've kept it at the default one for a nice gentle mild up-hill feel. Will look into the other setting eventually. :)
* 300LB weight limit
What's not good:
* It's a bit louder than I'd have thought, hearing the tread scruff against the metal. Then again, not many treadmills are going to be quiet.
* okay, the litty bitty wheels to move the unit with are arguably too small if you have carpeted floors. But the whole unit weighs so little it's ultimately not much of an issue (for most) to carry if needed.
What's surprising:
* The magnetic resistance feature, even at setting 1, is pretty cool. Higher settings do lead to more stress on the knee, FYI
* Documentation for which plug-in goes where for the heart rate and MPH sensors isn't well-defined. But with two heart sensors, one for each handle, it's not too hard to guess which goes where. :)
* Width of track is thinner than I'd thought but works for my moderate build.
Summary:
Obviously one can't become an Olympic runner on any manual treadmill, but for basic fitness and even walking during a rainy day and such, this is a pretty great unit and especially for the price. There's not much to nitpick at all about this unit. It's effortlessly easy to set up, sturdy, one can easily walk 3.5MPH on it for some time, even with the angle. The relative loudness is distracting, but minor. The sturdiness is to be commended, so many models have people saying they're wobbly and rickety.

My husband and I are thrilled to finally have a little fitness center in our basement. This treadmill was the finishing piece.
Pros: It's lightweight, relatively quiet, uses no electricity (except for the battery-powered monitor), and is very compact.
Cons: It's got very stiff resistance. The incline settings are pretty steep, and there is no "flat" setting. Even at the lowest setting, we find ourselves working much harder. There's no way to gradually work your way up from easy to vigorous. I thought maybe it was the incline, so I placed a 1" thick board under the back to reduce the incline. I added some more oil for good measure, just to be sure it was lubricated enough. Turns out it's even HARDER to walk on if it's flat! The incline actually helps to move the belt because of your body weight pulling it down.
But I still like it, because I get a good workout. I'm used to walking long distances, so I'm in reasonably good shape. Anyone who is sedentary and wants to build up their stamina had better start with a different treadmill, or maybe just walk around the neighborhood for a couple of months first.

I love how early this was delivered. My partner put it together for me in less than 30 minutes. I'm about 280 lbs and this holds my weight which is what matters to me. It's small enough to fit in my livingroom. Another bonus since I can watch movies. I live in a flat area so the incline helps give an extra amount of exercise.
One thing that I do not really like is the resistance options. I have the resistance at the highest level but I am not noticing a difference. I purchased a pair of sneakers for using this treadmill but I find that barefoot is better for the resistance. My sneakers have solid grips so, maybe that has an effect on how well it works? That is my only little complaint. I can go barefoot to get some good exercise as long as I am just walking.
I was missing my daily walking routine so this machine is a lifesaver!

After reading all the reviews about this machine and another one that is identical, I felt sure that when I received the treadmill there would be something negative to say. There is not.
I haven't had it long enough to speak of any issues that are time related, but ,so far, I am very pleased. The box was not damaged. Everything inside was well cushioned. The setup was simple. It does not move at all when in use. It is sturdy. And (some reviews spoke of noise) there is nothing coming from the treadmill that is noisy. The only sound is that of my feet coming down, and even that doesn't sound as load as it did on the motorized treadmill that I had. That my be because I am pushing the belt backwards with my foot rather than just dropping my foot and having the belt pull it backwards.

It was difficult to use compared to the powered ones I'm accustomed to. But after a few minutes, it became easier. It is very sturdy and has a wide track with the long handrails to hold onto. I think it's your safest bet for an elderly person or someone recovering from and accident or surgery to get some basic exercise.

I'm an older woman who can't get around the neighborhood any more. This looked right for me. I didn't need those fancy bikes where you can talk to 1,000 other bikers and a trainer etc. etc. This is manual, I can go at my own pace, and I'm still getting exercise. It also didn't cost $900.

-First of all, the electronic are scary looking. Haphazardly put together with dried hot glue strings everywhere.
-The difference in resistance between level 1 and 8 is minimal. I am ordering a fishing magnet to
increase magnetic resistance.
-The wheels for transportation are almost useless. They are too small, making scratching the floor very likely and not smooth to move over carpet.

We bought this as a gift for our Aunt, and had it shipped directly to her as a gift. The area around the computer was cracked affecting her ability to enjoy and use the product well. The seller will not repair of replace their defective product. Do not purchase this if you expect a well-designed, working product.

I have been working out for 15 years. I am not a beginner.
So this advice is for the beginners. Take this machine seriously. Its not a joke and should be treated with respect. While you are on this machine keep your mind on your movements because if you do not take control over this manual treadmill , you could slip and fall.
I use this machines for a high intensity workout . I do not use the handles when I run but when I walk I have no choice but to use the handles.
This is a 5 star machine and this is one of the best investments

Motor powered (rather than user body weight on the incline) tread mill operation is more stable and predicatble, setable. For the lighweight, low cost, and simple use and maintaince of the this type of device I get a great workout of the type I need as a fat burning diabetic. I am slightly taller (6'00") than the usual ergonocs of thins like wheel chair or hand rail handles and also for altering position I added a couple of ropes on I can use to keep a stable place on the tread as well as work alittle truned to the right, left, straight up, or leaning forwards body positions. Initially (I weigh 230 pounds) the magnet resistance system did not slow me enough and I added some plywood under the rear support to lower the platform angle. Because of either a move on the floor or the tread working in some way, the angle was fine and I removed the platform. It is wonderful slow walk burn to watch TV, YouTube walking in forest videos, bikine contests, or music videos, or TV news or sci fi movies. I easily can go into a full run at for me say 5 or 5.5 mph, and at that speed the device works most easily and its best. Turning the resistance dial works well. I usse a high power fan far away or a quiet small fan nearby so the TV is not interfered with. What I like best is that if I used for 30 minutes in the morning the timer stops when I stoop using it and at lunch it starts at 31 minutes. This continues up to 99 minutes or you press RESET on the computer panel. I have set a goal for 99 mins a day at least, which is much like a step counting goal.
As it wears in to normal lube level, etc., it is working great and I am discovering it is the ultimate low impact faster than power walk slow run or fast run, at the machines best. Excellent muscle usage moving the treadmill means very high caloric expenditure without having to hammer knees and joints at faster speeds keeping up the motor doing the work. As light jog or jog/powerwalk gate no hand rails needed as I use it, keeps even good pace.

Simple very consumer friendly, it's a snap t0 put together..I was on the fence with this treadmill, I never knew they made no motor treadmills,after some quick research I picked this model..well let me tell you something,..you don't need a plug in model,I have seizures and walk best with a cane ,this machine is the one to buy

Very pleased! It is very good quality and next to no assembly is required. It comes with a FULL SIZE instruction manual. The only negative is the size of the wheels. I have to move my unit frequently and the tiny wheels are annoying. Otherwise, I would have given 5 stars.
easy assembly. Added lube oil immediately for easier movement...kept it at level one. Nice workout. I started at 230 pounds ! So far so good.

Received the product, assembled it (very easy), and.... it does not work. The sensor that is supposed to sense the treadmill motion is not working. I tried sensing it with a voltmeter, and nothing comes out of it.
Tried calling support. They have voice mail stating "email us". I emailed them. After 48 hours, got an answer from support. Lets see what happens.
Update: after one week, they went quiet. Amazing.
Not good, don't buy.

Wanted a small cheap treadmill to walk on but this one has been a disappointment. No difference in resistance levels, broken console on delivery, belt slides to one side, have to hold on to rails even on lowest incline-the highest incline is a joke...no resistance to keep you on. Skip this one.

works well, is quiet, gives a good workout.
only problem is if the batteries are left in the control console, it does not turn of after a certain amount of time and the batteries are dead the next morning. solved that problem by removing them after workout, works fine, am very happy otherwise

This unit is a terrible, DANGEROUS design which allows the rear end of the ramp to suddenly drop when the user steps near the rear end of the walker forcing the front upward, tipping the user to the floor..a back breaker..
Nice little treadmill. It is a lot harder to walk on a manual treadmill vs an electric treadmill. More workout for you $.LOL Seems well made, sturdy and folds up nicely.

Treadmill arrived early....that was good....plastic control box was cracked....useable but unsightly....not a very sturdy treadmill.....wiggles when you are on it....it came mostly assembled, but the few parts that had to be attached were difficult to do .....not worth the sale price.....it is more of a toy than a piece of gym equipment....
My wife very much likes this manual treadmill. She uses it daily and it helps strengthen her heart and gives her more energy. She is very pleased. It is very sturdy.
It's nice but does not flatten completely. You will always walk at an incline..

Easy set up and not as large as electric models. Using it daily. Safe and easy for the kids. You have to hold the handles to keep enough momentum going, but it doesn't bother me. Put 25 miles on it so far.

Besides being from China and the package beating all the Hell by the time I got here it was full of bugs. I set out glue traps everywhere and didn't take long for them to get half way full at least the ones around the Box.
I want compensation.

The company very unreliable. Piece missing and company would or could not replac. Kept getting the same answer each time I inquired about the piece âthey will send a return labelâ. End result they wanted to give me back 10% of what I paid for the machine.
One of the few things my girlfriend asked for was a treadmill and I found this one. Got it quick and she loves it!

First off, I like the product. The customer service however is close to non-existent!! The product arrived with a broken knob that is used to hold the deck in the vertical position. I put the pin and spring back into the unit and put tape around the two halves of the plastic knob to hold them. That seemed to work but didn't look all that great. I put the legs on the unit, which is the onlt sssembly that is required, and tested it. It worked great from walking up to a light jog but the heart rate monitor was the only function that worked. I found that the Sensor with Wire was the culprit. This is the sensor that drives every function but the heart rate. I googled it and found an adjustment procedure that called for loosening the sensor mounting screw and rotating the sensor to be as close to wheel as possible without touching it. That did not work.. The timer, odometer, calories burned, current distance traveled, etc. Every function relies on this one component and it was DOA. I registered my product with ParadigmHW, the maker of the unit. And promptly submitted a request for service on 1/25/2018. I then called customer support on 1/29/2018 to make sure my registration and part request was processing. I got no answer on the phone after two separate attempts. So, I went to their website and chatted with a customer service agent. After 15 minutes of providing my info ans the serial number, I was asked if I had a ticket number from the service request. But they do not give ticket numbers. I got a screen saying that you for registering. I asked if my product was even registered. I was asked to wait for the third time and after a minute or two I was disconnected from the chat. I clicked the chat button to re-engage a customer service agent and got a message that chat service was not available. Frustrated and annoyed, I decided to just request a refund. And im glad I did. The next day, I get an email saying there is no record of my email in their system.
What annoyed me more than anything.. is that this one sensor is a known issue. It's all over the net and in the product reviews. So instead of hassling your customers, why not just replace the part. The website states customer service is 24/7.. but of course its not. You can fill out a form and be contacted later.. thats not 24/7 customer service. Since the box was pretty beat up and the styrofoam was crushed in many places, i had to pay for it to be repacked for the return shipping. I should rhave just rejected the delivery and had them pick it back up
I basically liked this product! it is VERY unfortunate that it arrived broken. Any warranty is utterly useless if the manufacturer wont stand behind it and actually deliver the support that it promises.
Great for the price and very sturdy. Just wish there was a flat position for beginners.
woyld not purchase this equipment it is not sturdy and the belt slips
Every thing just fine.
this machine is just what we needed. The cost was good and it works for us.
This is nice. Very sturdy and almost put together out of the box. Recommended.
Product was cracked upon opening the box. Hope to have it replaced without issues.
It arrived when it was supposed to. The plastic around the monitors was cracked. Within 2 days, the screen no longer works. It is very stop and go, difficult to maintain a steady pace.

Good manual treadmill. Takes some getting used to compared to expensive gym electric treadmills. the balance is an issue, if your not careful you can tip this machine on yourself. but its to be expected for a cheap manual treadmill. gives me a workout while watching tv for cheap. too bad fedex shipped this product poorly, and had a nice crack in plastic, luckily still works...

At 225 lb.s, I needed the 325 lb rating of this product. There is no wobble whatsoever. It took 10 minutes out of the package to using it. Delivery was ahead of time promised and there were no problems with the product. It works great; it was a very satisfying purchase.
It was the easiest workout equipment I have ever assembled. The workout is just what I wanted for an inclined manual treadmill.

It came super fast. I love that it does not have to be plugged in. I have it a 4 because when I received it then box had many holes and the silver display was broken on the base. It still works fine. Im hoping this will motivate me.

I do like the equipment everything works well the only problem I have is that the monitor doesn't stay in the position I would like it to stay in it falls backwards or just slide all the way down when you can't read it that part sucks but the readings are pretty accurate
It met my expectations in every way. It was easy to assemble, and very sturdy for its price.
Itâs okay. The quality feels decent the resistance feels very inconsitent, and unless you hold on youâll fall off it. Would have liked better incline settings and the ability to make it flat.
I love this treadmill. It was easy to assemble. I use it every day. It's good for beginner.

It came in a crushed box. A wire was cut. No instructions for use and putting together for use.
Not easy to walk on.
I almost feel like I got the cheaper model not the 3000

Easy to out together. No issues so far. Still not sure if you can run on it or not. Been getting mixed messages on that. The description and video here says you can run on it but the manual says it's only for walking. Other than thay, the product works fine.
great for working out. i got more workout on this than i do at the gym. totally worth the money. so happy i invested in it.
Piece of junk. Unable to walk correctly on it. Tension is a joke. Don't buy it.

This treadmill is rated for up to 325 lbs. I weigh 285 and it just passed 34 miles on the odometer and half of the screws that hold down the deck are completely BROKEN, not just loose. Maybe they meant to rate it for 225lbs but heavy people beware.

The machine looked very nice and easy to assemble when it arrived tonight. I was very eager to use it. However, when my husband opened the box to put it together a piece was broken off the top. We are in the process of returning the machine. Bummed :(
Shipping was faster than scheduled. Arrived almost fully assembled. Love it. Would buy again.

Works fine but did not realize that it will not go level. I bought this for my mother who has a lot issues and elevated is making it tougher to encourage her to use it. But I should have read the description more in-depth.
Dont buy this if you need a 0 incline. The least it goes down to is 8% grade
Love it!!!
For the price this is awesome.
Very poor product, seems little interest in correcting.
The holes are to small for the screws I am unable to mount the part that tells me how many miles I walked very disappointed

While this product does function, I don't like it because, the motion is sometimes not fluid, the incline is too steep and the product lifts off the ground from the front when you hold onto the handles while walking. You have to exercise too much care when using it. A part was either missing or damaged. I requested the parts replacement and got them. However, one of replacement part would not fit into the hole on the unit. When I contacted them about it, I was told I had to order the part. I just decided to leave the issue alone. It's usable but I'm not satisfied with it.

Arrived broken. I was sent a replacement console piece but getting it connected is not very easy so I am trying to use this without any resistance settings. I was trying to save money and get moving and I got what I paid for. Determined to get my money's worth but its a struggle
Still learning how to use it.
It isn't what I thought it would be, the incline is too high and couldn't figure out how to lower it. Only used a few times before I completely gave up... now collecting dust.

I was looking for a treadmill that supports 300+ lbs and this was advertised for that feature. Setup was easy and quick. Thatâs where the pros stop. Unless youâre already in shape, there is no way to walk slowly and get faster as your fitness improves. The tension wheel doesnât make much difference at all. Iâve yet to find a way to walk at a very slow speed (I am over 100 lbs overweight and in terrible shape). The belt is not smooth, it sticks, but that really isnât the reason for my complaint. The incline is too high and therefore it speeds up as you walk. Very disappointed with my purchase, but returns arenât an option and customer service is horrible! FB page is unmonitored, no phone calls are accepted, and emails get routed somewhere else and when they finally ârepliedâ, It requested I resubmit ALL the info I put in my initial email (plus my sales receipt).
I do not recommend this unless you are starting in good physical shape.

If anyone is looking for a cheap incline treadmill for endless hiking repeats, I really recommend looking into the FITNESS REALITY TR3000. Yeah, it's a freakin manual treadmill, but it cost less than $200, has various levels of magnetic resistance, pretty quiet for Netflix binges, runs smooth as butter (I can climb in place on it without using my hands), and most importantly goes up to 13% incline for some intense climbing sessions. I trained for several Mountain races with the FR TR3000, really helps to get ready for those long endless climbs; with Summer Mountain season right around the corner, would like to give a shout out to this machine for anyone looking into getting an incline treadmill, without having to spend 3-4 times more for an electric one. Bought mine at another store, btw.

This is a nice treadmill but once you get on it, you can't stop without jumping off. It has No resistance. If you were training for the Olympics, this would still be to Fast. If I had to turn back time to save Lois Lane, I would beat superman there. I have neuropathy and I just wanted to take a nice slow walk, not compete for the Gold.

My husband & I are both enjoying the treadmill. We easily set it up and it works great. It gives a good workout because you're always walking up an incline. Good for me the way it is but my husband ratchets the resistance up which makes it a bit harder workout. We are very happy with it. No wires at all. Gravity gets you started because of the incline. When it was delivered the box was really beat up. It's long and heavy for 1 delivery person to maneuver. Holes showed where he had tried to get a better hold on it. They should pack it more securely. Nevertheless it was unscathed & works great.

I am 65, and I like having a treadmill in the house, as I live in the mountains where the weather gets snowy and cold in the winter, inhibiting outdoor walking at my age (fell and broke my arm last year). The only problem I have with it, is the manual really doesn't explain how to set the settings on the computer. I used it again today, and still can't get a reading on the speed and distance. Perhaps someone can she some light on this. Maybe I am just not walking fast enough nor long enough to register a speed on the computer? Not that it's all that important, because I am still going to walk for as long and as fast as I want, it would just be nice I guess, to know.
I had difficulty attaching handlebars. I reached out to Amazon community and got a good answer. Now I am ok and ready to exercise,

Arrived quickly. Very easy to put together - easier than the instructions describe; seems like they've done much of it at the factory prior to shipping. Works well; fits is a limited space and doesn't make much noise. It's still a treadmill, so there's a certain amount of loathing, but that's not about the product!

I recently bought the treadmill and have begun a walking program. It arrived on time. Easy to assemble. Instructions clear. The computer housing was broken on arrival. Replaced in 3 days. No hassle or worries. Very pleased with my treadmill.

I have been working out for 15 years. I am not a beginner.
So this advice is for the beginners. Take this machine seriously. Its not a joke and should be treated with respect. While you are on this machine keep your mind on your movements because if you do not take control over this manual treadmill , you could slip and fall.
I use this machines for a high intensity workout . I do not use the handles when I run but when I walk I have no choice but to use the handles.
This is a 5 star machine and this is one of the best investments

Motor powered (rather than user body weight on the incline) tread mill operation is more stable and predicatble, setable. For the lighweight, low cost, and simple use and maintaince of the this type of device I get a great workout of the type I need as a fat burning diabetic. I am slightly taller (6'00") than the usual ergonocs of thins like wheel chair or hand rail handles and also for altering position I added a couple of ropes on I can use to keep a stable place on the tread as well as work alittle truned to the right, left, straight up, or leaning forwards body positions. Initially (I weigh 230 pounds) the magnet resistance system did not slow me enough and I added some plywood under the rear support to lower the platform angle. Because of either a move on the floor or the tread working in some way, the angle was fine and I removed the platform. It is wonderful slow walk burn to watch TV, YouTube walking in forest videos, bikine contests, or music videos, or TV news or sci fi movies. I easily can go into a full run at for me say 5 or 5.5 mph, and at that speed the device works most easily and its best. Turning the resistance dial works well. I usse a high power fan far away or a quiet small fan nearby so the TV is not interfered with. What I like best is that if I used for 30 minutes in the morning the timer stops when I stoop using it and at lunch it starts at 31 minutes. This continues up to 99 minutes or you press RESET on the computer panel. I have set a goal for 99 mins a day at least, which is much like a step counting goal.
As it wears in to normal lube level, etc., it is working great and I am discovering it is the ultimate low impact faster than power walk slow run or fast run, at the machines best. Excellent muscle usage moving the treadmill means very high caloric expenditure without having to hammer knees and joints at faster speeds keeping up the motor doing the work. As light jog or jog/powerwalk gate no hand rails needed as I use it, keeps even good pace.
