rev_det.name:
I bought this treadmill in February and wanted to use it for a while before writing a review. I was looking for a good basic treadmill that could sustain running, had a small footprint and was light enough for one person to move around. This treadmill met my needs, but it doesn't have a lot of fancy features. It has different running programs, 3 incline options and a pulse checker.
I used to run 8-10 miles a day on the treadmill for several years, but stopped due to a back injury. I got this treadmill to gradually get back into shape after back surgery and use it about 3-4 times a week for about an hour each time.
1. It is very sturdy for running. Although it's smaller, it feels roomy because of the shorter sides. It has a little give and cushion when your foot strikes, so it absorbs some impact. That was a big plus for me because of my back issue.
2. You can control speed/turn it on & off, and check your pulse on the handles, which is very convenient.
3. The cup holders are very small and fit a small/medium water bottle. Bigger water bottles will fit, but will bounce off during a workout.
4. I had to buy a separate clear rack to hold my iPad because there isn't anywhere to put it. The top of the display is curved, so I used velcro stickers to keep the rack in place since it slid around during runs.
5. Mine arrived with a damaged box and some visible damage to the right side of the treadmill. I still haven't gotten around to contacting the company to discuss, but my treadmill is a little crooked when I fold it up and I have to adjust the belt once a week. Adjusting the belt is super easy.
6. It is light enough for one person to move. It was a little awkward at first to get it tilted into rolling position, but once you do it's easy to move around.
7. So far, I'm quite pleased with it and would recommend it if you want a good, basic treadmill without a lot of bells and whistles.

I bought the Sunny SF-T7603 treadmill for $339.95 in March 2017. I have used it daily for over a year with only a few missed days. I am 6'1" and weigh 140 pounds. I walk at 4.0 mph for 25 minutes a day. I can't comment on the programs and features I don't use, but for my specific use the treadmill has worked great. It does exactly what I need for a reasonable price.
Here are the treadmill actions I take each session.
1. Turn the power on at the base.
2. Stand on the belt and connect the safety key's clip to the front of my shirt.
3. Press the Mode button on the console.
4. Press the + button on the console until the time display shows 25:00 minutes.
5. Press the Start button on the console.
6. Wait for the 3-second countdown to complete and show a speed 0.5 mph.
7. Press the 4 mph button on the console to change the speed to 4.0 mph.
8. Walk for 25 minutes until the belt stops automatically when the time is up.
9. Unclip the safety key from my shirt.
10. Turn off the power button at the base.
I'll comment on several things that some people might like to know.
During installation the bolt I used to connect the right upright to the console turned freely in the hole without tightening. The bolt's threads were faulty. Luckily, the bolt I removed from the safety block in one of the first steps was the same size. I used the safety block's bolt in the right upright and it worked perfectly.
I followed the instructions in the manual to adjust the belt several times during the first few weeks. After I finally got it just right I didn't have to adjust it anymore.
Oiling the running board underneath the belt is awkward and messy. I use the bent wire end of a large paperclip to lift up the edge of the belt on each side for oiling. I let the console tell me when it's time to oil again, which the manual says is every 188 miles. The container of oil that came with the treadmill has lasted a year.
The pulse monitor does not work as I expected and I don't know how to interpret the results. The instructions say to hold the pulse monitors for 5 seconds to display your heartbeat in beats per minute. If I hold the pulse monitors for 5 seconds, the display says my pulse is 72 no matter how long I've been walking. If I continue to hold the pulse monitors as I walk the display slowly climbs to 140-150. If I let go and hold for 5 seconds again, it shows 72 again and slowly climbs again. I asked Sunny Technical Support how to interpret those readings. They answered that it gives an estimate of my heart rate and is not medical grade. I know my heart rate doesn't slow to 72 and slowly climb to 150 every time I release and hold the pulse monitors. I'm guessing that when the display finally stops climbing it is showing my heart rate, but that may not be correct and I have no confidence in the readings.
At the end of my 25 minutes the belt slows to a stop and a few seconds later all the data on the console clears to zeroes. If you're not attentive and quick to read the data you won't see how far you walked or how many calories you burned.
The display shows the speed in large digits and uses much smaller digits for the time, distance, calories, and pulse. My speed is always 4.0, so that number is of the least interest to me, but it is the only one I can easily read without my glasses.
I like to swing my arms when I walk. I have to be very careful not to let my hands hit the handles.
The manual says, "Your product is intended for use in cool, dry conditions." I do not use air conditioning and my treadmill room is frequently 90Â°F in the summer. So far the treadmill has worked flawlessly without overheating.
The attached pictures show the console, the left handle, and the right handle.

Buyer beware! The customer service and tech support for this treadmill are horrible. My treadmill started malfunctioning after a few months (speed going up and down by itself). The only way to contact the manufacturer is by email. They sent me instructions to calibrate the treadmill that didn't make sense ("press the Prog and Mode buttons simultaneously and play with the number that appears until it is calibrated"). I was able to even out the speed experimenting with this number but then the belt was running at twice the speed set on the display. When I called the phone number in the email that they sent me, I spoke with three different reps, and none of them could explain how to calibrate the machine (there are three settings that come up for calibration: F1 (the one they referred to), F2 and F3. Nobody could explain what F2 and F3 settings are for. When I told one of the persons (Jay) that I was trying to set the speed to the one on the display (it was running at about double the indicated speed), he told me to "ignore the display and just use it at a comfortable speed".
I had to contact a technician online that explained to me the controls and I was able then to set the speed correctly.
The customer support people are ignorant about the treadmill, no tech support is available, and there is no much online for this brand, only a very generic video in YouTube. I sent a photo of the controlling board and motor to a technician who told me that the controller and motor are the cheapest he had seen in a long time, the controller has no potentiometer, which is used to manually regulate the motor speed, so my problem had no solution and he was surprised the treadmill lasted as long as it did...

UPDATE: It was great until it wasnât! I have used this treadmill almost daily for 4 to 8 mile runs for the last 10 months. Never had any problems and maintained it per the manual. Then yesterday during my morning run, it just stopped working. The treadmill lost power, had a burning smell and now it wonât turn on. My husband is an engineer and he says the issue is electrical. Iâm glad we got the warranty because I called to report the issue and was given a full refund within a few minutes. Definitely purchasing another extended warranty for the next treadmill, which wonât be from Sunny.âUPDATEDâI waited 2 weeks to write this so I could give a true reviewâI bought this treadmill after my gym was closed due to covid-19. I was a little weary about it because it was inexpensive but due to the 4 star reviews, I went for it and bundled the protection plan. THE GOOD: It was incredibly easy to set up and get started using. It took about 20mins and most of that was taking it out of the box since there was a lot of protective packaging. My boyfriend is a manufacturing engineer and even he mentioned how well it was packaged and the high quality of the packaging for protection. I typically run approx 25 to 30 miles/week at the gym and I was worried about the sturdiness since the weight max is 220lbs. At 5â4, 145lbs, this is more than sturdy enough and it can handle long runs and fast/sprint runs. I havenât been using the lift and roll option much since I have a designated space for it but that works fine also. THE BAD: the incline is manual meaning that once you start a run, youâre on the same incline until you get off and adjust it. I usually like to change incline during runs to challenge myself so this is a drawback but itâs not a huge one. Also, I use this treadmill for running (6.5mph+) only; not walking. My boyfriend, who usually walks on a high incline, says the slower speeds (under 2mph) are jerky. This doesnât effect me at all though; maybe itâs because heâs bigger than I am? OVERALL: this is an insanely good treadmill for the price. I very glad that I took a chance on it.

I have had this treadmill for about a week now using it daily. It took me about 30 minutes to set up to fully functioning, out of the box. I'm not very handy, so I was pleased with that. I recommend following the instructions to lubricate the belt before use. The treadmill lubricant is included in the package, no need to purchase separately. The treadmill is very quiet - I watch TV while walking/jogging and the TV only needs to be a reasonable volume to hear it over the treadmill. It is also very lightweight for a treadmill, yet very sturdy. Some low-cost treadmills feel like the wobble or shake when running on them - not the case here. I purchased an equipment mat to place under it which has helped, though I'm not certain if it would be necessary depending on the surface you're using it on. It also came well packaged preventing any damage in transit. Very pleased with the product through a short time of ownership. Provided that it holds up long term, I'd recommend to anyone looking for a treadmill in this price range.

It took a month to ship, and finally used the machine around June of this year 2020. In mid July, I noticed the machine started skipping. So I had my husband look at it, the belt sounded straining as if itâs ready to snap. I messaged Amazon, and they were quick to response. I contacted the company Sunny Fitness and Health, we were in exchange of email back and forth for a week. A representative said that the sound was normal. How can he say that just by watching a short clip of video I sent him as he requested. I emailed the company SHF again to let them know that the machine is not in a good working condition. In fact, I even purchased an extended two years warranty when I purchased through Amazon. Never heard back from them again. So I guess my next step is to write to BBB.
Warning to consumers, Never buy this product as the company Never deliver the warranty on this bogus product!!!

I was really excited to get this treadmill and initially loved what I got for the reasonable price I paid. I generally used it 4-5 times a week for 30 minutes at 6 mph, but after only 3 months of use, the speed suddenly began to undulate uncontrollably. I contacted Sunny Health and Fitness multiple times and was sent the same video 3 times with instructions to re-calibrate the treadmill, which I did over a dozen times. This still didn't fix the problem and now the treadmill just continues to speed up no matter what speed it is set on. I'm really disappointed that it stopped working so soon after purchase and that they tech support was unable to listen to what was wrong. I sent them 3 videos of the problem and it did not change their response on how to fix it even though their recommendations didn't work. I specifically bought a brand new treadmill to avoid having to take apart and get rid of a used one that stopped working, but this one stopped working well before any of the used ones I purchased ever did.

I am not a fan of a treadmill, but due to time limitations, I bought one for my wife and I (marathon runners both) to use while living near the GSM in WNC. This little machine delivers! In fact, the work out is excellent! Better yet is the support. The display went bad after about 2 weeks of use. I contacted the company, and within a week had a new display. No questions asked. It was easy to install, and has worked perfectly ever since. This treadmill works great...the price was right...it has great support...what more can you ask for?

I wanted to wait 2 yrs before posting a review because no one wants to pay $300 and have a product last 1 yr. So I bought this May 2018 and a few months ago it started making this loud noise. I took off the cover and canât see the problem. Warranty is for 6 months. Now my treadmill is useless. You really do get what you paid for. The water bottle nook does not fit anything and the fold-up feature leaves the treadmill diagonal so you really donât save space. Iâm sad I made this purchase.

I've had this for about a year and it works pretty good. I gave it 3 stars because when I put it together, the deck does not fold up very easily since the handle bar is slightly bent (I'm assuming it happened during shipping). I have to pull the handle to the side as I put it up/down and have pinched my fingers a few times. Also the belt rubs on one side, I've tried adjusting it several times but it never stays centered once tightened. Will probably have to replace the belt within the next year. But that being said, I knew I was buying a lower end treadmill.

Great treadmill to have at home. It is very compact and takes up as little space as it possible can. Compared to my previous, and more expensive, treadmill it feels a lot sturdier and less hollow when stepping. I find this treadmill to be pretty quiet too. I wish it had a space to hold a phone or a tablet to make walking a little more enjoyable. Who needs two bottle water holders? I rather they made space for a tablet. ð
All in all, I recommend this machine.

I have had the treadmill for three weeks and have not run only one day so far. I am 5 foot 6 weight 190 and run 30 to 40 minutes anywhere from 5 mph to 6 mph. Itâs held up really well so far. If the treadmill lasts me 6 months minimum I will be satisfied. The treadmill can handle jogging but I wouldnât go past 6 mph because I donât the think the motor could handle that. Will update in a month.
January 10th update. I have had the treadmill for 51 days, of which I have ran 48 days. My runs are longer than before, 40-50 minutes and surprisely the treadmill can handle that. I would say the treadmill is around 160-170 miles in. It has been able to handle 6 mph with some 6.50-7 mph. Will update further.
February 1st, 2021. The treadmill has nearly 300 miles and has held really well. I run with some occasional sprinting. Will update further as durability is only question to be answered.
Feb 27, 2021. Has over 400 miles still running and looking new. I do lube the treadmill every 110 miles or about once a month to extend the life as I do notice that lubing the machine makes it run more smooth. Over 500 miles still working fine. Upped time of running to about an hour. 4 months in. I do live the machine more often than recommended and I believe itâs played a role in the longevity.
5 months in over 600 miles and itâs still working great. At this point havenât kept track of the months but I think itâs 6 and 1/2, treadmill still running great well over 700 miles. I bought an extra motor in case the motor gives out as based on the reviews I figure it would be the motor that gives out before anything.

This product falls under "you get what you paid for". It's junk. The treadmill worked less than 6 months and when I called the company, I was told they would send me a new motor which I could install. Unbelievable. I'm a small person under 125, anyone weighing more will maybe have 4 months of use. Lots of luck trying to get it back to the vendor. No shipper will pick it up because of the weight, and it is nearly impossible to package (unless you keep the original box).

I have been using for two months now, and it does make a bit of noise, but it is bearable. I have not gone full blown, only use up to 3.5 speed, so could not comment as to how noisy it will become because I notice the faster the noisier. Other than that its working as expected. For me, not easy to assembled, but paid someone and the person did it in about 10 minutes!

So... 2 things you need to know:
1. This is an inexpensive, simple treadmill that would work perfectly well for the vast majority of people who just need a simple treadmill to augment their daily outside walking and possibly a little jogging. I would rate it a 5 star for that...except for one kinda annoying thing...
2. ...buying the $80 motor every year and replacing it myself. Okay, I say "every year"...I bought this on January 1 2018. I only use it when it's dark, cold, and rainy here in the Pacific Northwest and walk and jog outside as much as I can. In February 2019 the motor starting jerking while I ran and eventually quit. Sunny was easy to work with when selling me the $80 motor. It's now November of 2019 and, you guessed it, herky-jerky motor...again...
Understand, I use this to walk on, occasionally jogging for a minute or two just to get my heart rate up, but really only walking 4000-7000 steps a few days a week.
So, it's a tough situation. If you don't mind replacing the $80 motor every year or so... I was patient the first time, but now I'm annoyed. It seems like a fundamental flaw. BTW, the motor is pretty easy to replace...
But remember! It's very inexpensive! So, you know...ya gets whatcha pays fer....
Had to return it, did not work properly and was misrepresented on size. I am 5 foot 8 inches tall and could not run on it. It is only big enough for walking at a moderate pace.
I like the features on this

, and huge major plus, itâs like 99.9% preassembled, to me that is a huge advantage.
Taking the treadmill from delivery to finished product:
When ordering fitness equipment, no matter if in store or online, itâs good to know what it will take just to get the box inside to get setup. This unit for most may require a partner to help with the box. At just about 120 lbs, itâs pretty heavy, but no heavier than most electric treadmillâs Iâve worked with in my life. The good news is that the actual weight of the treadmill is less (about 103 lbs) and the finished product has smart features for helping to move it around after setup. After getting the box inside and the treadmill out of it, one person could easily manage the rest.
Everything is packed tightly inside (tape and foam), but what really surprised me, is the assembly on this guy. Assembly is always something to face with fitness equipment, I have never had a piece fully assembled (especially that you buy new) and some that were literally 100 pieces or more. I've put together, for myself and friends, at least a dozen pieces of equipment over the years and this treadmill from Sunny Health was literally 99.9% pre-assembled, all I had to do was add-on a couple plastic covers, and add-in about 8 screws (all the same so thereâs nothing to confuse). Leaving the 8 screws and 8 washers out, there are only 3 total main pieces to assemble. That is crazy easy to manage. The hardware comes with an Allen key and a wrench screwdriver. The tools are good quality and I didn't need anything more than what was provided.
The treadmill bed is 100% assembled. The console and arm supports are preassembled and practically âunfoldâ to where they need to be. The instruction manual is easy to follow; with pictures, and of course a limited number of parts to actually deal with. When starting to raise the console assembly, there is part that is removed from the treadmill called a âsafety blockâ. Do yourself a favor and keep this somewhere for any future use. It will make packing the treadmill up so much easier if you ever have to move houses in the future.
Any fitness equipment out there, just like a car, can use some regular user maintenance including bolt tightening and applying new grease. This particular treadmill comes with a bottle of lubricate oil, and you will want to lubricate the belt before first use (all explained in the manual). Itâs easy to lift the belt, apply, then spread it with a cloth. After that, the manufacturer recommends reapplying oil every 188 miles and there is a built-in reminder to let you know when itâs time, like that feature so I donât have to remember. Also the belt is easy to adjust and tighten as needed using the included Allen key. Don't forget these important steps to keep this, or any fitness equipment you buy lasting a good long time.
As mentioned earlier, the belt can be raised off the ground for storage. You know those cabinet doors and drawers that you canât slam? That automatically âslow closeâ to prevent the loud âbangâ? This treadmill, when lowering the running deck, has a similar feature so there is no need to bend to lower the bed, it will gently lower all on its own, so smart and cool. When the belt is lifted, it locks in place so I can tilt the treadmill back, and roll it on its caster wheels for storage in another room.
Like cars that have hands-free controls on the steering wheel, this treadmill has quick controls on the handrails. For me this means safer stability and control, without having to take my hands off the safety rails to reach to the main console in front of me. I can control speed on the right handle, start/stop on the left handle. The treadmill also has a pulse rate system by grabbing the handrails, so far it works just fine.
For safety there is a magnetic key that is required to allow the machine to operate. Itâs also a safety feature to shut down the treadmill in case of accidental falls. What I like about this is that when the key is removed, the treadmill canât even turn on, meaning kids canât mess with it.
The absolute minimum speed is 0.5MPH (and where the machine starts at use), absolute maximum speed 9.0MPH. There are quick speed buttons for 2MPH, 4MPH and 6MPH and the treadmill has 9 programmed exercise routines. There is incline (3 levels), itâs manual and easy to adjust with feet on the back with locking pins
Overall, there is so much more to this

than I thought and I have plenty of room to grow with it. I think it is a great choice for those on a budget. I've owned several machines from the big ICON guys (think ProForm, Golds Gym, Weslo, etc.) and this one is just as good as most of their entry level line too, even better in several regards including bonus features and easy, fast assembly. There is plenty of room on the belt for me (both length and width) and mostly I walk vs run (I like low impact). But this would be a good amount of space for runners out there too, especially with a top speed of 9MPH. The console keeps track of time, speed, distance, and calorie's burned, and itâs all wall powered, no batteries to manage.
Fitness equipment show's it's true self over time, right now a week in I'm very happy with this unit, but if I have any problems or concerns, I'll come back to this review and update. So far Iâm very happy with this treadmill and canât get over how easy assembly was.

After reading the reviews with claims it took anywhere from 10 minutes to 2 hours setting this up, I really had no idea what I was In for. I was Able to drag it into my home and lift it out of the box, no problem. The machine essentially comes put together. All it needed was some screws to tighten the top to the bottom. Easy! Took me 30 minutes. Didnât need any help - and works like a dream. So glad I ended up choosing this inexpensive yet efficient model. Itâs exactly what i was looking for. Iâll never go to the gym again !

This treadmill started off great, easy to assembly and fold up. HOWEVER, after a few times using it the computer screen went to junk. Once turned on it would either automatically start on it own and only go up to 0.5 in speed and need to be unplugged to turn off or it would not start at all. My husband took the screen off twice and unplugged/replugged the wires and that did seem to help for a few more uses but it happened again and to honest, Iâm not unscrewing the screen each time to use it, especially since Iâve had for about month. Still waiting to hear back from customer service.

I have been using this treadmill for the last month. It was easy to assemble and I really like it. There are not a bunch of bells and whistles but I knew that when purchased. Itâs in my living room so I have my own fan and music. I donât need much else. My kids and I both use it and have had zero issues. Would recommend this simple treadmill at the price point.

I bought this treadmill in February and wanted to use it for a while before writing a review. I was looking for a good basic treadmill that could sustain running, had a small footprint and was light enough for one person to move around. This treadmill met my needs, but it doesn't have a lot of fancy features. It has different running programs, 3 incline options and a pulse checker.
I used to run 8-10 miles a day on the treadmill for several years, but stopped due to a back injury. I got this treadmill to gradually get back into shape after back surgery and use it about 3-4 times a week for about an hour each time.
1. It is very sturdy for running. Although it's smaller, it feels roomy because of the shorter sides. It has a little give and cushion when your foot strikes, so it absorbs some impact. That was a big plus for me because of my back issue.
2. You can control speed/turn it on & off, and check your pulse on the handles, which is very convenient.
3. The cup holders are very small and fit a small/medium water bottle. Bigger water bottles will fit, but will bounce off during a workout.
4. I had to buy a separate clear rack to hold my iPad because there isn't anywhere to put it. The top of the display is curved, so I used velcro stickers to keep the rack in place since it slid around during runs.
5. Mine arrived with a damaged box and some visible damage to the right side of the treadmill. I still haven't gotten around to contacting the company to discuss, but my treadmill is a little crooked when I fold it up and I have to adjust the belt once a week. Adjusting the belt is super easy.
6. It is light enough for one person to move. It was a little awkward at first to get it tilted into rolling position, but once you do it's easy to move around.
7. So far, I'm quite pleased with it and would recommend it if you want a good, basic treadmill without a lot of bells and whistles.

I bought the Sunny SF-T7603 treadmill for $339.95 in March 2017. I have used it daily for over a year with only a few missed days. I am 6'1" and weigh 140 pounds. I walk at 4.0 mph for 25 minutes a day. I can't comment on the programs and features I don't use, but for my specific use the treadmill has worked great. It does exactly what I need for a reasonable price.
Here are the treadmill actions I take each session.
1. Turn the power on at the base.
2. Stand on the belt and connect the safety key's clip to the front of my shirt.
3. Press the Mode button on the console.
4. Press the + button on the console until the time display shows 25:00 minutes.
5. Press the Start button on the console.
6. Wait for the 3-second countdown to complete and show a speed 0.5 mph.
7. Press the 4 mph button on the console to change the speed to 4.0 mph.
8. Walk for 25 minutes until the belt stops automatically when the time is up.
9. Unclip the safety key from my shirt.
10. Turn off the power button at the base.
I'll comment on several things that some people might like to know.
During installation the bolt I used to connect the right upright to the console turned freely in the hole without tightening. The bolt's threads were faulty. Luckily, the bolt I removed from the safety block in one of the first steps was the same size. I used the safety block's bolt in the right upright and it worked perfectly.
I followed the instructions in the manual to adjust the belt several times during the first few weeks. After I finally got it just right I didn't have to adjust it anymore.
Oiling the running board underneath the belt is awkward and messy. I use the bent wire end of a large paperclip to lift up the edge of the belt on each side for oiling. I let the console tell me when it's time to oil again, which the manual says is every 188 miles. The container of oil that came with the treadmill has lasted a year.
The pulse monitor does not work as I expected and I don't know how to interpret the results. The instructions say to hold the pulse monitors for 5 seconds to display your heartbeat in beats per minute. If I hold the pulse monitors for 5 seconds, the display says my pulse is 72 no matter how long I've been walking. If I continue to hold the pulse monitors as I walk the display slowly climbs to 140-150. If I let go and hold for 5 seconds again, it shows 72 again and slowly climbs again. I asked Sunny Technical Support how to interpret those readings. They answered that it gives an estimate of my heart rate and is not medical grade. I know my heart rate doesn't slow to 72 and slowly climb to 150 every time I release and hold the pulse monitors. I'm guessing that when the display finally stops climbing it is showing my heart rate, but that may not be correct and I have no confidence in the readings.
At the end of my 25 minutes the belt slows to a stop and a few seconds later all the data on the console clears to zeroes. If you're not attentive and quick to read the data you won't see how far you walked or how many calories you burned.
The display shows the speed in large digits and uses much smaller digits for the time, distance, calories, and pulse. My speed is always 4.0, so that number is of the least interest to me, but it is the only one I can easily read without my glasses.
I like to swing my arms when I walk. I have to be very careful not to let my hands hit the handles.
The manual says, "Your product is intended for use in cool, dry conditions." I do not use air conditioning and my treadmill room is frequently 90Â°F in the summer. So far the treadmill has worked flawlessly without overheating.
The attached pictures show the console, the left handle, and the right handle.

Buyer beware! The customer service and tech support for this treadmill are horrible. My treadmill started malfunctioning after a few months (speed going up and down by itself). The only way to contact the manufacturer is by email. They sent me instructions to calibrate the treadmill that didn't make sense ("press the Prog and Mode buttons simultaneously and play with the number that appears until it is calibrated"). I was able to even out the speed experimenting with this number but then the belt was running at twice the speed set on the display. When I called the phone number in the email that they sent me, I spoke with three different reps, and none of them could explain how to calibrate the machine (there are three settings that come up for calibration: F1 (the one they referred to), F2 and F3. Nobody could explain what F2 and F3 settings are for. When I told one of the persons (Jay) that I was trying to set the speed to the one on the display (it was running at about double the indicated speed), he told me to "ignore the display and just use it at a comfortable speed".
I had to contact a technician online that explained to me the controls and I was able then to set the speed correctly.
The customer support people are ignorant about the treadmill, no tech support is available, and there is no much online for this brand, only a very generic video in YouTube. I sent a photo of the controlling board and motor to a technician who told me that the controller and motor are the cheapest he had seen in a long time, the controller has no potentiometer, which is used to manually regulate the motor speed, so my problem had no solution and he was surprised the treadmill lasted as long as it did...

UPDATE: It was great until it wasnât! I have used this treadmill almost daily for 4 to 8 mile runs for the last 10 months. Never had any problems and maintained it per the manual. Then yesterday during my morning run, it just stopped working. The treadmill lost power, had a burning smell and now it wonât turn on. My husband is an engineer and he says the issue is electrical. Iâm glad we got the warranty because I called to report the issue and was given a full refund within a few minutes. Definitely purchasing another extended warranty for the next treadmill, which wonât be from Sunny.âUPDATEDâI waited 2 weeks to write this so I could give a true reviewâI bought this treadmill after my gym was closed due to covid-19. I was a little weary about it because it was inexpensive but due to the 4 star reviews, I went for it and bundled the protection plan. THE GOOD: It was incredibly easy to set up and get started using. It took about 20mins and most of that was taking it out of the box since there was a lot of protective packaging. My boyfriend is a manufacturing engineer and even he mentioned how well it was packaged and the high quality of the packaging for protection. I typically run approx 25 to 30 miles/week at the gym and I was worried about the sturdiness since the weight max is 220lbs. At 5â4, 145lbs, this is more than sturdy enough and it can handle long runs and fast/sprint runs. I havenât been using the lift and roll option much since I have a designated space for it but that works fine also. THE BAD: the incline is manual meaning that once you start a run, youâre on the same incline until you get off and adjust it. I usually like to change incline during runs to challenge myself so this is a drawback but itâs not a huge one. Also, I use this treadmill for running (6.5mph+) only; not walking. My boyfriend, who usually walks on a high incline, says the slower speeds (under 2mph) are jerky. This doesnât effect me at all though; maybe itâs because heâs bigger than I am? OVERALL: this is an insanely good treadmill for the price. I very glad that I took a chance on it.

I have had this treadmill for about a week now using it daily. It took me about 30 minutes to set up to fully functioning, out of the box. I'm not very handy, so I was pleased with that. I recommend following the instructions to lubricate the belt before use. The treadmill lubricant is included in the package, no need to purchase separately. The treadmill is very quiet - I watch TV while walking/jogging and the TV only needs to be a reasonable volume to hear it over the treadmill. It is also very lightweight for a treadmill, yet very sturdy. Some low-cost treadmills feel like the wobble or shake when running on them - not the case here. I purchased an equipment mat to place under it which has helped, though I'm not certain if it would be necessary depending on the surface you're using it on. It also came well packaged preventing any damage in transit. Very pleased with the product through a short time of ownership. Provided that it holds up long term, I'd recommend to anyone looking for a treadmill in this price range.

It took a month to ship, and finally used the machine around June of this year 2020. In mid July, I noticed the machine started skipping. I was really excited to get this treadmill and initially loved what I got for the reasonable price I paid. I generally used it 4-5 times a week for 30 minutes at 6 mph, but after only 3 months of use, the speed suddenly began to undulate uncontrollably. I contacted Sunny Health and Fitness multiple times and was sent the same video 3 times with instructions to re-calibrate the treadmill, which I did over a dozen times. This still didn't fix the problem and now the treadmill just continues to speed up no matter what speed it is set on. I'm really disappointed that it stopped working so soon after purchase and that they tech support was unable to listen to what was wrong. I sent them 3 videos of the problem and it did not change their response on how to fix it even though their recommendations didn't work. I specifically bought a brand new treadmill to avoid having to take apart and get rid of a used one that stopped working, but this one stopped working well before any of the used ones I purchased ever did.

I am not a fan of a treadmill, but due to time limitations, I bought one for my wife and I (marathon runners both) to use while living near the GSM in WNC. This little machine delivers! In fact, the work out is excellent! Better yet is the support. The display went bad after about 2 weeks of use. I contacted the company, and within a week had a new display. No questions asked. It was easy to install, and has worked perfectly ever since. This treadmill works great...the price was right...it has great support...what more can you ask for?

I wanted to wait 2 yrs before posting a review because no one wants to pay $300 and have a product last 1 yr. So I bought this May 2018 and a few months ago it started making this loud noise. I took off the cover and canât see the problem. Warranty is for 6 months. Now my treadmill is useless. You really do get what you paid for. The water bottle nook does not fit anything and the fold-up feature leaves the treadmill diagonal so you really donât save space. Iâm sad I made this purchase.

I've had this for about a year and it works pretty good. I gave it 3 stars because when I put it together, the deck does not fold up very easily since the handle bar is slightly bent (I'm assuming it happened during shipping). I have to pull the handle to the side as I put it up/down and have pinched my fingers a few times. Also the belt rubs on one side, I've tried adjusting it several times but it never stays centered once tightened. Will probably have to replace the belt within the next year. But that being said, I knew I was buying a lower end treadmill.

Ok at first. Dissatisfied is my review now. Bought in 2018. It was never a strong treadmill but was ok because Iâm small (112 lbs/5.1). Used it occasionally the first 2 years but when the pandemic started I tried to work out more for my mental health and it started going slower that what it was displayed; I was ok with that, but then started to Swift like a short hiccups that almost tripped me a few times. Canât used it, Iâm afraid to fall. It was oiled when needed and kept in good condition. I know was a cheap one but was expecting a little more... sad.

3 days in, and satisfied so far. I'm not a big runner, but I've gotten 2+ hours of walking in already. I dithered for a couple weeks before ordering - mainly this is about survival through the winter. So far, I'm quite pleased with it.
0) It was well packed - plenty of padding and spacers to minimize banging around. Amazon had 2 guys to put it on my porch. No damage observed anywhere when I unpacked. All tools/screws/instructions present. Everything lined up fine for assembly.
1) I was able to set it up myself (5'3" 135lb 51F) because I'm impatient. But I also used a hand truck, sliding cloth for the wood floors, and careful use of leverage /tilting allowed me to set it up. YMMV. **make note of which side is the "Heavy" end (marked on the box) - that's the front, so you don't have to rotate it around last minute. And of course, which side should go "up".
2) lubricating under the belt is awkward but essential. If I understood correctly, you're supposed to get all the way across under the belt. I dug out a clean paint stick, rag + rubber band to help with that, and used 2/3 of the bottle, trying to work as much up / down the track as possible.
3) Track adjustment - I did make some tweaks - just took it very easy and walked on it for a bit. I probably did 4 tweaks, the last couple at 1/8 turn rather than 1/4 turn as recommended to dial it in. Just be patient and use it for a few min to let it settle in.
4) Operation is easy, I like the buttons on the arms as well as on the console. The water bottle holders are minuscule, and there's no place to put my cellphone / nalgene. That's called out in other reviews, too. But for $340, I'll manage.
4) Sound: very quiet if you're not walking/running. In use, you can hear the belt sliding and of course your lumbering footsteps on the running surface. Not too bad. I have cheap noise canceling earbuds and they work well enough so I can listen to an audio book.
TBD how it does over the long run, but 3 days in - quiet satisfied!
Timely delivery. Easy assembly. Works perfect. Great price.
This thing is the worst- truly terrible. I opened the box and itâs cracked in a ton of places. Totally useless. Now I have to figure out how to return the item

This is a well-made machine
It is slender and easily movable.
Once oiled (easy to do) I was surprised at how quiet it was.
This is great for new to intermediate walkers and runners but it does not have any advanced incline or a ton of bells and whistles so if your training for the Olympics it will not work for you.
It has some cool features )heart rate monitor) convenient speed and on/off switches on the rails.
If you want to lose weight, get in shape and be able to outrun your crazy ex-girlfriend stalker...this will do nicely.

What I liked:
- Easy to set up
- Nice flow between speeds
- Readout is easy to follow
- Buttons are easy to push. I especially like that it has a button for each 2, 4, and 6 mph setting so I don't have to hold a ^ button forever.
- Does not shake when I run, even at higher speeds. It feels very sturdy. My larger husband can walk on it no problem.
What I didn't like:
- No real space on the console to store a phone. The water bottle holders are barely there
- The tread is narrower than I'm used to but I have had no issues so far

How tall were Sinatra, Crosby and Bogie? 5'6" to 5'8", depending on your source. Regardless, this would suit any of them fine. But I'm a 6'1" male, and therein lies the problem with this treadmill. The handle bars are considerably lower than the one it replaces--by my hips nstead of between my stomach and my chest. As a result, when I reach between 3 and 4 mph during a brisk half-hour walk, I'm not standing erect in a circumscribed tight circle but am leaning forward--and soon my legs are off the treadmill, banging against its hind side or the metal on either side.
I don't recall any warning about height or indications that the handles were not height-adjustable. I guess I should have taken more seriously the audience--decidedly female--that this item was being pitched at. On the other hand, a young woman who stands 5'10" said she finds the handles too low and the belt too short even for her. Maybe the length of the belt is an equally important factor, but I think handles with adjustable height might be sufficient to keep me in line.
Later: I've adjusted to the low handle bars and put adhesive cycle tape over the plastic grips, which were excessively slippery from perspiration after the first 10 minutes. Also, I've taught myself to stand straighter with less reliance--or "leaning"--on the handle bars. For the money, this is a machine that should get the job done (my weight is 170 to 180). The programs are practically infinite in terms of speed and time, and the surface tilt can be raised and lowered--manually, but still with little difficulty. It's $200 less than the last treadmill I purchased from Amazon --ten years ago--and so quiet as to be noiseless (from my perspective--a complaint came from the lady on the floor below me--whatever she's hearing, I'm not!). I'm raising my rating to 4.

I received this treadmill as a Christmas gift from my boyfriend this year, and am overall very happy with it.
Pros:
- At $299, it's a great affordable option
- It was easy to assemble (it took my boyfriend about a half an hour)
- It was delivered quickly
- It's a great space-saver option
- It works well for what I needed it for: a quick 2-mile warm-up run before strength training
Cons:
- It doesn't track distance accurately when doing interval running. For example, I'll run for 20 minutes doing intervals between 6.0 and 7.5, and the distance won't even equal 2 miles. However, if I run for 20 minutes and stay at 6.0 the whole time, it tracks 2 miles.
- I find it a bit too narrow for walking. I'm 5'5 and 125 lbs, with a fairly slender build, and I often hit my hands on the handrails while walking on it. This isn't a problem while running though, since my arms/hands stay above the handrails.

I was very disappointed with the shape in which the box was in when delivered. I bought this as a gift, expecting it to at least be functional when the person received it. Unfortunately it was not! There were pieces in the box that I have no idea where they came from. Very poor instructions on how to proceed if damaged. All it ever did was throw an error code about something wrong with the motor or power source. Paid an electrician to tell me it was not my power. So, if you decide to purchase this item, make sure to open it right away (within 30 days) to make sure it works, or you will have paid almost $400 for something that will wind up at the dump, like me!

So I waited for a month before writing a review for this treadmill as I wanted to see how it performs. I was actively looking for a budget treadmill for some brisk walking to keep my lower back in shape and weight in check.
When I ordered it the first time, it got auto-cancelled as it was damaged during transit. While I do appreciate the honesty of Amazon in that regard, I donât liked the fact that they didnât refund my money for next 24-48 hours.
Ordered it a second time with a preferred room delivery. The delivery guys promptly delivered it to the exact place in my basement where I wanted it. Geez this thing was heavy. The installation was pretty easy..you just fit couple of screws and on your way.
Now to the workings. Itâs a pretty basic treadmill..has a manual incline which I recommend to set per your comfortability before first use. Has a weird kind of bottle holder but fits okay. So far Iâve used it only upto speed 3 and has worked fine. However, the stopping of the belt isnât that smooth. It suddenly stops with a jerk which can shock you a bit especially after the workout.
Itâs not a very fancy treadmill so if your expectation is to use it for a brisk walk, youâll be fine. Value for money.

First off it arrived on time which I love. Second it was super easy to assemble and get it ready for use.
I bought this to use while I work from home. I built a standing desk that straddles it and I just used it for the first time. Walked 2 miles at a speed out 2.2 mph. This was smooth and comfortable. The belt had no slippage or sliding side to side. The speed stayed consistent and was easy to enjoy a stroll while I worked.
My only complaint is the width of the belt. It is rather narrow and it can be easy to catch the edge. Just be aware of what your doing and you'll be fine.

I just received mine and can only comment on packaging and assembly at this point and will update this at a later time. This is pretty heavy (121 pounds in the box) so you will likely want some help moving it and removing it from the packaging. Grab a trash bag because you will have copious amounts of packing materials to dispose of (a good thing).
Packaging was excellent, fully protecting the treadmill. One end of the box was a little squished but large pieces of styrofoam prevented any damage to the treadmill itself.
Assembly was simple and I can't see it being any simpler. The only tool needed is the provided Allen wrench.
You remove one screw to remove some safety plate (the purpose of which is a mystery to me) then screw in 6 bolts at the bottom of the console/handlebar support, then add 2 more to keep the console/handlebars in place, then tighten two pre-installed screws. After that lubricate the belt, then run it and check the belt for alignment.

Absolutely LOVE this treadmill!! I ordered it on a Saturday and it showed up on Wednesday. Earlier than what it was supposed to. It's extremely heavy and awkward to drag it by yourself into a small bedroom but I got it done. Lol.... They pack it really nicely and there was zero issues with the appearance or functionality of it. Easy to put together. I'm not really that great at assembling things, so it took me about an hr, but it's pretty simple. I highly recommend this company. Unlike another company who was deceitful with not shipping their treadmill and blamed it on FedEx or UPS and other people had the same issues with that company as well. So all in all, if given a chance, I would have given this treadmill a 10 star rating. :)

I looked and so many reviews of treadmills and couldn't find any that didn't have complaints. This one seemed to have fewer and was the only one I could find that was small enough to fit in the space we have. When it first arrived, it was cracked in a few places and one of the brackets was bent. I notified the company directly right way (with photos) in case there was any issue (even though returns are through Amazon). Their customer service was very quick to respond. Luckily the set up didn't take too long because we had to pack it all up again to return it. We ordered a replacement and everything is fine. It works really well and I love that it is simple and small. It's so nice to be able to jump on it at random times to exercise, rather than plan something more involved.

I brought Sunny Treadmill in late may 2020 and it was delivered to me in June first week. I was able to successfully setup the treadmill myself and had used it on and off for few months. After about 4-5 months the Treadmill motor starting blowing the fuse of the room and I have been trying to reach sunny product support from them on. Sunny customer and tech support is the WORST I have seen, I am highly disappointed. I have raised 3 tickets on their site, left voice messages on their support phone, have tried to reach them on their support line daily and no luck in speaking to anyone at Sunny support team.
STAY AWAY FROM ANY OF THEIR PRODUCTS!!! if it breaks you are stuck with a machine that you cannot use and cannot return. SHAME ON THE SUPPORT TEAM FOR NOT RESPONDING TO ANY ISSUES.

Great treadmill! Comparing to the ones you get at a fitness center, although smaller, this one definitely gets the job done. The assembly was pretty easy. The only thing that took forever was centering the belt. Other than that, I love my treadmill. I've already spent a couple days on it running/walking for 30 min each time. My daughter has also spent about 30 min on it as well. It fits in my 12Ã12 room with my Queen sized bed just fine.

To be fair, I have only been using this for two weeks. I bought this because I have very limited available space. I've been tread milling for years both at home and the gym. I'm 68 yo so I don't do a whole lot of running but you can run on this baby. Manually inclines and has a nice soft fold up and down strut. Easy as pie to set manually or you can use any of the preset programs which you can make changes to. Belt is a little narrow but works for me. I'm 5'7" @ 155 lbs. For the cost and features, this is hard to beat. Seems to be well made and was easy to assemble using the supplied 8 bolts. I even sprung for the ridiculously priced extended warranty. Manufacturer's product description is accurate.

I did lots of research before I made this purchase. I am recovering from a health issue and knew I needed to start exercising again. I was looking for a quality product at a decent price. Sunnys reviews were good so I made my purchase and could not be happier!
Pros
Compact
Easy to assemble
Great quality
Controls on handles
Works perfectly
I have owned my Sunny for 3 months and dont have any complaints. It did come with a small crack near the base but you can't see it now that it is set up. The box was pretty damaged because it is really heavy. Overall, it fits my needs at the right price.

The package was delivered completely smashed and mostly opened due to aggressive mishandling in shipment. Unpacking it slowly, many broken off pieces of plastic fell out and many aspects of the shell have been smashed and damaged. The machine turned on and is working, so far after one use. I do not have much hope for the longevity of use due to how it arrived and so many broken elements. Time will tell, but this has been a nerve wracking and horrible experience so far on day 1. All above has been photo documented. I would appreciate some kind of financial reimbursement for the horrible condition it arrived in and will wait to see how long this lasts.

El pedido me llegÃ³ antes de lo previsto. Lo Ãºnico que no me agrado que al habrir el paquete pude observar que ya venÃ­a completamente ensamblada toda las piezas. Eso inmediatamente me hizo pensar que no venÃ­a completamente nuevo el producto cÃ³mo yo hubiese deseado, fue exacto, se podia ver unos pequeÃ±os rasguÃ±os en varias areas de la cinta de correr, la he usado solo 4 veces y hace un ruido muy fuerte. Algo que no deberÃ­a suceder en una cita de correr nueva, tenÃ­a la opciÃ³n de devolverla pero es demasiado pesada para cargar con ella, asi que opte por quedarmela aunque sea para uso de ooco tiempo, esto es un riesgo que siempre puede ocurrir, hacer gastos costoso en productos que ya an sido usados por otras personas

I am 5â tall, but for some reason I keep drifting forward on this treadmill. When I tried to move further back, I moved my hands further back as well, forgetting the 2 speed buttons are on the right handlebar. I fell & hurt both my knees. (Didnât have the shutoff cord attached close enough). Would like to keep using the treadmill, but canât figure out how to remove the buttons on the right handlebar.

I did a lot research before buying this treadmill. I ultimately chose this one for affordability, ease of assembly, and quality. Great price for what you get which is a basic, no frills treadmill. I was able to assemble myself but I could see how someone with less strength abilities might not be able to. Had my husband help get it in the room and I unboxed and put together on my own. Most of it is already assembled. You just have to add handle and a few pieces at the bottom. Itâs getting it separated from the box that I struggled with. Iâm a petite woman and I was still able to do it, though. My only complaint would be the location of the handles in relation to how my arms move while I walk. I donât know if the handles on my old treadmill were just wider set, but I almost always hit my arm on it multiple times while I walk to warm up. Running is fine as my arms are moving differently. Obviously it wasnât a deal killer since I kept the machine, but just something to be aware of. Overall great purchase for my needs.

Make no mistake, this machine is HEAVY. Moving it to the basement was a huge (but successful) effort. Once there, set up was relatively easy. It is a sturdy treadmill that offers a simple change incline method, good graphics for time and distance elapsed, water bottle holder, safety clip-on. I use it nearly daily and and am completely satisfied.

I was worried and skeptical about buying a treadmill because so many brands have bad reviews. However, this treadmill blew me away. Super easy to assemble and it is so quiet, like when Iâm upstairs I canât hear my BF using it down stairs.
I also love how sturdy it is. Itâs a very basic machine and thatâs all I need it for. Because of COVID, I cancelled my gym membership but still need something to get some cardio in and this absolutely does the job. Iâm very happy with my purchase!!

Fair quality for the price. A little narrow and awkward handle placement- I tend to smack my hands on the ends of the handles occasionally when walking. The screen is a little difficult to see if you're not at the right angle, but it's not that big of a deal. Otherwise, hasn't given me any problems and runs quietly.

I love the way I am able to just use this at home. I weigh 220 and it holds up amazing. Only issue I have with it is that it doesn't fold 100 percent to store under the bed. It's good enough to leave in the corner and safe with a slow motion glide when opening to use. Highly recommended

Great product for the price. I agree that itâs a little more narrow than I would like but Iâm dealing with it. Also, I donât know how precise the control panel is as far as speed and pulse go. The numbers seem a little off. But overall and for this price I am very happy with my purchase. The shock absorption is good and the noise level is tolerable. I also like how it came almost completely assembled out of the box and how easy it is to fold up. I also own a Sunny bike and I feel like itâs an affordable brand I can trust.

I wanted to jump start my work out routine, but getting a Peloton didn't seem reasonable; not to mention, I have access to a gym for free, but don't use it. All of that being said, I figured if I could get a treadmill and use it consistently, I could slowly start to build up a home gym and, omg, I LOVE this thing! It's not wide, so it easily fits into my small living room area and works great for the simple work outs that I enjoy!
I was able to get this bad boy through the door and assemble it alone, so if you're worried about that, I did it and so can you!
I HIGHLY recommend this treadmill!

For 2 years it ran fine then the motor went and was tripping the circuit breaker. I always oiled it whenever it wanted oil. Adjusted the belt according to the manuals specs. I ended up installing new motor and EFI part(100 dollars total for the both) and after two months its shutting off randomly again. Now they are telling me I have to replace the control board too for 50 dollars. Customer support is terrible. You have to go back and forth in emails because they refuse to deal over the phone. When it does run the belt slips and i've tuned it according the the manual numerous times. As someone else stated the motor is terrible basically. I would never purchase this again. I guess you get what you pay for... I cant stand that I will most likely have to add to the worlds problems but putting this into a landfill soon.

Nothing to complain about other than the cup/phone holders on the control panel. It is so small and none of the modern smartphone would fit in the slots. I have dropped my phone so many times. Everything works great and I get great workout out of it every time.

Great for the cheap price, not any bells or whistles but I only needed it for running so it's perfect. Super compact, barely takes up any space and easy to fold up. I had the product assembly done by Amazon and it was super quick with 2 of them. Only thing with this treadmill is they say it comes with water bottle holders, lol. That video of it is a lie, the "holders" are at maximum 1 1/2 wide so they wouldn't even hold a 16oz plastic water bottle. I did find a way to oddly fit my phone into it so that worked out haha.

I love this treadmill! I've had it for a week and have used it for 30 minutes for 7 days. At first, the belt was very squeaky, but after my hubby adjusted it and I've used it, the noise seems to be going away. The display is easy to read and the water bottle holders can also hold your earphones when they're not in use. I've not tried to fold it up as it sits in my room in it's "usable" position. I love this machine!

The worst customer service!! I was trying to match up the screws as I called I got pictures sent which was fine. I asked about a specific screw by number and they didnât know where it goes. My holes was not lining up and I got hung up on twice without any call back. Plus it turned on but didnât start Iâm sure customer service couldnât help with that either. Needless to say Iâm retuning it because if Iâm having issues with customer service now I can just imagine.

Good trademill so far (after 1 month use).
The trademill was well protected in the shipping box. Easy to assemble, easy to fold, not the easiest to move around.
Monitor is basic / speed control on the side handles too. Change on inclination from the screen not possible but you can change manually when you start the workout. No Bluetooth
It doesn't have space to hold water bottle or dedicated phone space (you can hold phone only vertical and it's unstable)
Overall good, works fine, great value

For the money there's really nothing bad to be said about this. It's a steal of a deal! It works great, was super easy to assemble, and seems built well. I'm 5' 7", and I can imagine that for large people this may not be the best choice since the track would be narrow, and the console a little low for someone big. But for the average person it's perfect!

Totally pleased. It folds, which is nice. Plus I put it on carpet slides. So I can move it around as need be. I'm a senior, pretty light weight, and only use the Sunny to walk, but it does the trick - especially in bad weather when I am shut in.

I've had it for three months and used it a few times a week. The treadmill freezes at one speed and all of the console and handle buttons stop working, forcing you to pull the emergency cable to stop the unit. It then won't work for several hours. This has started happening every time I use it, regardless of the speed I'm on, and it has begun to happen seconds after beginning my workout. A completely miserable experience. I bought the warranty along with it and I'm hopeful that they'll be able to resolve it or give me a refund. Just utter trash.

The engine used rarely died after a year.
Customer service offer me, "a new motor cost $80.00 plus $20.00 shipping and the invoice is sent via PayPal."
Do not trust the product "Sunny Health & Fitness SF-T7603"
nor in the company "Sunny Health & Fitness"
or Customer Service "support@sunnyhealthfitness.com"

I got this to get some steps in during lock down. It's a great little machine that does the job. It tracks your distance, time, and calories. You can grab the side rails for your heart rate. It gets decent speed and you can manually adjust the incline. Easy to fold up and move around the room. Easy assembly. I'm really pleased with this purchase. I walk about 5 miles a day on it while watching tv. Treadmills can go for a much higher price tag so this was worth every penny

The treadmill worked for about 18 month and the platform under the belt cracked when my 15-year old daughter was using it. Iâve left five emails and two voicemails with Sunny and nobody will contact me with advice on how to fix this and whether there is a replacement part I can order. It is out of warranty. Iâve never had a treadmill break like this, let alone from use by a 5-foot teenage girl. Bad product and worse service.
Been using it every day for a week. Super great product so far. I have long legs so I was worried about my stride being too long, but itâs just perfect.

My mom (age 69) is actually the person who uses this. This is her review:
I've been using this product since April 2018 and I love it. I walk on it every morning and usually around noon also. It is easy to use. Just this last month, the belt started having an issue. Because of their manufacturing warranty, they actually ended up sending me a new machine. They were so helpful when I contacted them! They took the time to explain to me what I needed to send them information on, walked me through every step, and were very patient even though I have such difficulty hearing. While all of them were great, Victoria T. was absolutely delightful. I appreciated how kind and helpful everyone was.
The only con for me is that I wish the belt had more cushioning, but I think that is due to the arthritis in my feet.
This was a great treadmill for 10 months, until the motor quit! I never folded it, so I canât answer that. Was fairly easy to put together. Iâm disappointed it only last 10 months.

Great size. Easy to move. I am not disappointed at all with this purchase. As other reviews state....the cup holders were poorly designed. You can set your phone on there.....but be careful.
UPDATE: this treadmill has worked great......until now my son is few inches taller than me and also a bigger muscled build. He said this is too narrow now. He wants a wider treadmill .... But still using this one. As I am a 5 ft 4 in (125 pounds) female this still works great for me.

I stayed with the Sunny Health and Fitness line since I purchased a stationary bike the year prior. Their equipment is very sturdy when exercising and easy to assemble. Both the bike and the treadmill were equally easy. The treadmill is much heavier so it took two people to carry to itâs location. Iâm hoping that Sunny can send a replacement cover for the broken part. It really is just a plastic co er of all the mechanics. There is a lot of packing to prevent damage but not enough in the corners. I had read this in prior reviews so I really wasnât totally surprised. The four stars were given because of the damage. Otherwise five stars easily.

This is a very high quality treadmill for the price. As opposed to other cheaply made treads in this price range, I find this one to be sturdy, minimal to no belt shift, good for long strides, good for running (not only walking), steady use, easy to assemble with decent assembly instructions that anyone can follow. The parts all fit correctly. The console holds a water bottle or iPhone. The pause mode is a good feature other treads in this price range often do not have. For home use, it really is an excellent value and a well made product. I actually own two of these. I tried another one for a little less money, and returned it because it was a very poor product.

Happy, easy to use and love the upright storage, perfect for small spaces. Easy to put down to use and not flimsy. I'm 5.10 and 260- big girl:) It is fine for me, I'm careful not to come down so hard with streps, more of a power walker/stretch walker otherwise I would be to big for this machine. happy
This is the perfect treadmill. Very simple to operate, comfortable to jog on, and I think, after doing a lot of price-checking, a great buy for the price. My wife and I both love it.

if you need to lose weight at home or maintain weight and health during busy schedule this is perfect works very well i run at 3.5-6 but can go faster and weights almost nothing. easy to move compared to full size. has narrow track though but if you dont mind great purchase i got used to it

I love this treadmill. Its compact and incredibly easy to move and put together. Im 5.5 and I had not trouble putting together and then moving it to the place I wanted it to be. It doesnt have IFIT etc for for a basic workout its great. I have previously owned treadmills with all the bells and whistles and found I really didnt need them to do a basic walking jogging workout. I would highly recommend this product.

For the price you can't beat it. Well made, sturdy with a useful functional control panel. Speed is much faster than you would ever need. I use it for fast walking, no rattling or shaking. I haven't tried jogging because of a bad hip but it seems like it would be fine provided you maintain recommended weight. Doesn't take up much room and fold up feature works very well.

This is a good treadmill for beginners. It was easy and quick to assemble. It has adjustable speeds, and controls. It can also be tilted for incline It take up little space and so far has worked great for walking exercise and even jogging. It is quiet and smooth running (doesn't wobble)
I wish it did have a place at the very top for a phone or ipad to rest. The only spots to hold items and bottles is on the side of the console.

I needed a treadmill that did not take up much space but I also needed one that was durable and would last a long time. This machine is very steady and will absolutely go faster than you can ever run on it. The platform is a little narrow but it is plenty wide for walking jogging and running. The display is easy to read and is easy to program. I don't think you can find a better treadmill for the price. I am very satisfied.

I don't run on it...but I could, yes the length might me shorter, I'm 5'3 and 150lbs and I walk fast on it for an hour watching TV, Live in TN and it's way too hot to walk outside and I'm too lazy to get up super early while it's still cool so this is perfect. Great money's worth.

I am 5'10 inches and weigh 169 pounds. This machine is exactly what I needed for my workout regime. Not too loud, the treadway is long enough, it is sturdy and big enough for my body size. This machine has a lot of the characteristics of a much more costly machine. I love it!!! Very heavy but easy to assemble and move around after folding

For a compact treadmill at this price point, itâs easy to lift and the hydraulic release is appreciated. Perfect for an older women like me who walks about a mile each time I use it. I walk at 2.5 mph for most of the time on and move it to 3 mph for 5-7 mins.

I have owned this treadmill for about two weeks now and love it. I use it daily for a 2 mile run/walk alternating between 3 and 5 miles per hour.
Delivery- Damage to the box, but the treadmill itself was fine. Easy to put together, lubricate, and adjust.
Cons-
1. It is loud at the 5mph speed.
2. I use Zwift to track my run and there is no place for my cellphone. I ended up buying a pop socket and some Velcro to mount it above the screen.

Overall this is a good treadmill for what I was looking for. I wanted something basic, but reliable, to do my daily walks on. This does the job! Upon unboxing, however, we noticed a pretty good dent in one of the arms. Also, thereâs an odd patch on the belt, and the bottom of the frame appears to have been welded crooked. None of this affects the functionality of the product. I did contact Sunny Health and will update after they respond. Iâm going to keep it, but slightly disappointed in some of the defects.

Very happy with this treadmill. The treadmill was very easy to assemble. I finished it within 30 minutes and that was with 2 young children running around and interrupting me. It did take some time for me to adjust the track so it stayed centered but again, not hard following the directions that came with the treadmill. It is relatively quiet and I definitely feel I have enough space to run (I'm 5'5" and weigh 170lb). It is easy to move around as well. I can not rate on longevity since I have had it for only 2 weeks. I run 5-10 miles per week so hopefully it will continue to please.

If you're looking for an inexpensive treadmill that actually works, this product does the job. Pay attention to the weight limitation and run time limitation (As I recall the manual suggests you do not run it for more than 2 hours before giving it a 1 hour cool down). Other than that, it is very reasonably priced and very easy to set up. We purchased this as our standby treadmill and used it for nearly two weeks (10+ miles per day).

So far it has kept up with everything I have wanted it to do. It handles my 200 lb. weight well and the speed variations are great for me. It was easy to put together also. My biggest problem with it is the fact that the handles are a little short so to use the pulse meter you have to be really close to the front, which then there is a plastic piece that covers the belt that could be smaller.

I am thrilled with this! I was dreading the set up but it ended up being so easy. I have no problems folding it up to put away and moving it. Lowering the deck is on a hydraulic pump so it ends up lowering itself to the ground. The treadmill works great, pretty quiet and smooth. It will be getting a lot of use this winter!
Compact but sturdy. Control panel a little short for 6â1â me but still usable.

Great product. Wires were crossed wrong when I first received it so it took a bit of troubleshooting on my part to get it turned on but customer service was prompt. Lost 20 lbs in 2 months on this treadmill, ran almost every day and it still held up as good as new with no problems! It is a smaller treadmill, so walking with your arms down isn't the best idea (unless you want to smack into the handles) but a great product! Very quiet, too.

Incredible as it sounds it is indeed really compact!
I would not call it fully portable but it is much smaller than the packaging let you think!
Super easy assembly not even an hour in total!

Surprisingly good! We purchased this treadmill after our gym got shut. I would say that itâs not as fancy as the gym treadmills but it does the job! It was easy to assemble and so far, works very well! We are pleased with our purchase!
Desde que la comprÃ© hace mÃ¡s de dos meses la uso casi todos los dÃ­as y he rebajado como 20 libras esta muy buena y fÃ¡cil de ensamblar

I love this treadmill is very easy to assemble works great and easy to move around not too heavy definitely one person can move it around happy with my purchase noise level is what you can expect from any machine

I needed something cheap and simple to use while watching shows, and this fits my needs. I love it for the most part. The only 2 things that bother me are that my hands sometimes hit the handrails and it's a narrow track. So I don't recommend this for big or tall people. For installation, I'm pretty handy so it was about an hour and a friend helped hold a few pieces a couple of times. I recommend reading the instructions regarding lubrication.

Oh my! I love this treadmill. I use it to walk several miles a day and find it plenty sturdy. It works well in a small space and has excellent easy-to-use settings. I needed a treadmill that could be carried upstairs to a loft and would not take TOO much room. Am delighted that I ordered this.

Almost a month later,
1. It is a walker's treadmill
2. Best if you weigh less than 150 lbs
3. Remember to invest in a heavy mat under product
4. It is cheap= you get what you pay for
Treadmill stopped working after a year and a half. I've bought 2 over the last 4 years and both stopped working around the same time. These treadmills are not for everyday use, wear out easily.

Just what I was looking for! I had to have a neighbor help me get it inside my apartment because it's heavy, but once it was in there it was easy as pie to set up. It durable and sturdy. It has wheels for easy mobility, it folds up to save room, and it come down with just a push on the bar. Easy peasy!

I just received this treadmill today. Assembly was easy. It helped to have two people to take the main unit out of the box. It is very quiet and goes faster than we will need which is good. I did have to center the belt but instructions for that are provided. I'm impressed by their packaging that got it from the factory all the way to our home in perfect shape. I'll update this further after using it for a while. Nice product.
Treadmill hard to start, slowed, surged, failed to run at all in 6 mo. Service answered 3 emails in about 3 weeks. Advice to re calibrate didnât work. Asurion Protection Plan provided refund.

The screen has gone blank twice and I've had to turn it off and lost my info. I am not sure if I touched something or what. It's definitely narrow and I have bruises on my wrists and hands from hitting the handles. I could be walking like a monster though. There isn't a place for my Ipad and the cup holders are extra small. But overall it was cheap and does the trick!
My Wife wanted a treadmill that can fold and she can put together easy. And she got both with this product. She love's it. I can't keep her off it. Thank you. It was worth every penny.
For the price it's great, BUT when you fold it it jams into the left arm and it's tearing it up. I cannot find anywhere to adjust this in the manual.
Slowing falling apart. Surprised it still works.

This is perfect for the bedroom or office for adding a run or walk indoors. I've had trouble with trying to fold it so I just leave it as is. The speeds are quickly adjusted and it can hold a heavier person while running. My bf is 223lbs and can run on this no problem. It's affordable and small without sacrificing quality.
This is amazing for the price! But honestly it doesnât fold all the way into anything compact. Itâs only worth it if you will keep it open.

We purchased this treadmill and initially it was fine. We had the treadmill for less than one year (within manufacturer warranty) and it completely broke. It will not turn on, just makes beeping noises. We have contacted the manufacturer and sent them the requested videos to see what may be wrong and then they just stopped responding! We have tried reaching out to them and we are constantly ignored! Do not buy - faulty product and they will not help you!

I love this treadmill, it's small so doesn't take up too much space in my small apartment so it's perfect for me. The setup was soooo easy, probably took me 20 minutes, it practically put together for you all you have to do is screw in the bolts... It did come with a crack in the base but that is probably from the shipping
