Sunny Health and Fitness makes one of the better packaged cheap treadmills on the market. The refinement of the look reminds us of the look of several units we started seeing in Wal Mart stores years ago. We bought another Sunny Health and Fitness treadmill last year and pointed out some of the shortcomings of that treadmill, especially in the safety department and as far as we can tell, the apple hasn't fallen far from the tree with the SF-T7603.
As you can see in the first photo, this treadmill has very smart, good looking packaging in regard to fit and finish and the ergonomics of the machine. The horror story comes alive when you remove the motor cover and look under the hood. The motor is shown as a 2.2 HP "peak rated" motor which is just smoke and mirrors because there is no accepted standard for rating "peak HP" in the treadmill world. I've been repairing treadmills for over 30 years and the only accepted standard is the NEMA definition of continuous duty. If this motor were exposed to that standard, this would be a fractional HP motor which means it has far less than 1 HP if rated on an accurate scale.
Some of the clues to their trickery, as you can see in the second photo, is they are using the numbers to "game the system" by showing the rating at 18 amps which a normal household outlet will have trouble maintaining and the high RPM figure of 5400 RPM's. The reason I say these are clues is that in rating all DC motors, the formula gives you a higher rating with the more amps and RPM's that you use so if you can inflate these numbers artificially, you can justify putting a higher rating on the motor than what it will actually achieve in regular use.
The mechanical system of this treadmill is another clue to the horror that lies within. When you measure the friction coefficient between the belt and deck, you find that these aren't nearly as freely moving as some of the other cheap machines on the market, notably those from Icon, the biggest producer of fitness equipment in the world. What this will do is eventually cause the motor to overheat, the controller, shown in the third photo, to overheat, and the heat build up between the belt and deck will wear out the drive system prematurely.
The good thing about this machine is the simple design and the console, which is shown in the fourth photo. This is a very simple and easy to read console and from both of the Sunny Health and Fitness treadmills we have bought in the past year, we have had no troubles from the console portion of the machine. Hopefully you won't have a problem with this part of the machine.
Overall, if I were buying in this price range I would go with an Icon make which is made under the brand names Weslo and Gold's Gym but even these machines have some incredibly serious shortcomings. It is like having the best house in the worst neighborhood.

I have been looking for a good treadmill for under $700 for some time. However, looking at the reviews of those under this dollar amount, I was disappointed as most received a three and one-half star rating. Almost all the reviews spoke of receiving damaged equipment and short life spans. I recently noticed that the Sunny Health and Fitness treadmill received a very high rating for such an economical unit. I decided to try it and must say that (1) it was delivered well packed and with no damage, (2) I cannot imagine another treadmill being easier to assemble than the Sunny. I had it unpacked, assembled, and running in less than 1 hour, (3) it is very quiet (which is astounding for an economical unit), and all features worked as advertised. If this treadmill proves to be reliable and long lived, it must definitely be a first choice among treadmills costing less than $1000. Thus far, I am completely satisfied and feel I have made a good investment.

rev_det.name:
Assembly - I was very pleased with how easy this treadmill was to assemble. It was literally just six bolts. However I did make a big mistake. I didn't discover the cross bar beam until after I had moved the treadmill to its permanent location. So I had to undo a couple of bolts to get the cross being into the holes and secure it. This made the entire console much more sturdy and it already was. I assembled the treadmill to its upright position by myself with no help. If you are just a little handy, then you should have no problems assembling this. But I uploaded a video which does not include the crossbar being installed. So don't make the most same mistake I did. Hopefully my video will help somebody assemble treadmill faster when they receive it.
Function- I've had the treadmill for more than 2 weeks now, in fact almost 3 weeks. I've used it almost daily. I have tried some of the pre-programs that it came with but mostly I just use the quick buttons to get to my desired speed which is 5 mph. I treadmill is a little longer than another treadmill that I have. It is also a very quiet and smooth treadmill even when jogging on it. I also set the incline to 5Â°. I love that it has quick buttons on both of the handles as well. The console is very sturdy and can hold a cell phone or tablet. The speakers on the console are not the loudest and are the same as my other treadmill.
They treadmill folds up really nicely and folds down very easily. It also has wheels in case you want to move it around when done and store it. I am just keeping mine in a permanent position in the garage. It is really deep cup holders which are nice for my water bottles. I purchased a small little battery operated fan which sits on the console and pulls me down. This is a really good mid-ranged treadmill with a lot of presets in it. And if you have a tablet the retractable holder is another nice feature that my other treadmill does not have. The longer tread on this treadmill versus my other one also makes me feel a little more secure on it. Couple of things that this treadmill is lacking which my other treadmill is also lacking is that the USB port does not charge. Not a deal-breaker but that would have been nice if I could charge my cell phone or tablet from the console. Also the calorie counter on this and speed seem to be a little generous compared to my other treadmill. But I really don't use these because I have a Garmin fit watch it tracks my fitness and heart rate. So the most important thing and features on this treadmill are the time counter which is important because I do 45 minutes on it every morning and 45 minutes every evening. I've gotten in a lot better shape and can really push the incline and speed on this treadmill. I have also lost a lot of belly flat this past 3 weeks thanks to this treadmill. In summary I definitely recommend this treadmill especially at this price point. It's great deal and it's very smooth and quiet.

Was looking for a treadmill that I could use at home but that wouldn't break the bank. The box is not light but managed to move it into the basement myself. Setup was easy and the machine worked fine.
The treadmill is functional. It is narrower than gym ones but not an issue for normal jogging. It is a little shorter so you have to be careful about not falling off if you slow down your pace. is reasonably quiet. The running surface is not too hard.
Based on the price, this is a great deal to help exercise at home.

Great treadmill. Even being 240 lbs it does a pretty good job of sustaining me!! I like that thus machine has incline up to 15 degrees which is nice. And as you can see on my video it is super easy to mover around with little to no effort.

The primary user of the treadmill is my wife. She likes the convenience of it being in our home so that she can use it whenever time permits rather than having to schedule time to go to a fitness gym. It's an awesome home treadmill. Delivered on time and the package was extremely good. Looks like straight from the factory. Having read various reviews of the treadmill setup one suggestion that stood out was to read the setup instructions before starting the process. I did that and it paid off. Clear instructions and easy to assemble. Took me half an hour.
The shock absorbers on the deck work great and the speed settings and incline settings are fantastic. Very stable surface even with my 200lb+ body running. Wonderful equipment. While we have had the treadmill for only a few weeks, we are well satisfied with its operation and expect it to serve our needs for a long time.

I have just received the treadmill it arrived early in the morning and I paid to have it setup the delivery people were great and very helpful in setting the treadmill up.I have found the treadmill very easy to use and found it to be very well made would definitely recommend it.

Was somewhat apprehensive about purchasing an exercise bike but after 3 weeks use, delighted with purchase. Particularly useful on these bleak wet winter days when it is impossible to get out. good price, easy to assemble and folds up when not in use. And it can be easily moved by the transport wheel at the bottom. Easy to store and save space.

I absolutely love this product which I bought to replace my rather basic one which stopped working. Feel really safe when running on it and actually look forward to my daily run especially during this cold weather when the thought of running outside fills me with dread. I would definitely recommend.

This treadmill is a great buy! I wanted one with auto incline and this fit the bill. All of its functions work perfectly and I especially like the handrail controls for speed and incline. Helps to make my workout seamless! It is compact but very sturdy and is much quieter than my last treadmill. I can watch T.V. with the volume at a normal level which makes my husband ( who has his office in the next room) happy! My son easily assembled this treadmill in less than an hour with no problem.
Iâm very happy with this treadmill, it has all the bells and whistles of the very expensive treadmills seen in gyms! Well worth the purchase!
I ordered this a month ago and it came quickly with free shipping. Everything is there and works great! Would recommend!
Great treadmill for the money! Love this
Iâm a senior lady and this treadmill is perfect for me.
I love this item. I use it every day. Was very easy to put together and works very good. I am pleased for the item for its cost.

I have a small home and needed a fold-up treadmill. The shipment arrived quickly but the box was damaged. It was packed so well there was no damage to the product. Set up easy. 15 minutes and I was walking. So quiet and sturdy. I am 5'4â the deck length is great for me. amazed for the price.

A bit shaky once speed gets to â5â & you jog a bit. The speakers are terrible..better to use headphones.
The âauxâ & âusbâ plugins are antiquated & useless.
Excellent customer service and product
this treadmill made a noise. It's going to break one day But Value for money is excellent!

Purchased one on April 1, 2021...now I get a E6 message on the screen and the treadmill stopped working...filed a claim with Amazon...denied...appealed...denied...attempted to contact manufacturer...no phone number and no email address...the pamphlet that comes with the treadmill has no contact information in it yet says manufacturer has a one year warranty...SCAM...
I loved the fact it was really easy to assemble and it works really great. Also easy to fold up after workout. In summary my wife is really happy to have it.Would definitely recommend this product.

rev_det.name: Was really excited to get this treadmill. It was super easy to put together, however, it came with a few washers but no instructions on which screws they went to. The programming is easy once you figure out the instructions. I also love the fact that it has ports so that you can play your music through the speakers! The only cons my husband and I have noticed so far is that there is a squeak when he is running. We think this is just due to him weighing more, but it is a little annoying. The other con is that the incline goes up to a 15, but the actual incline isn't much. Overall we are happy with this purchase!

This treadmill was a great choice. It was very easy to assemble, with just 3 steps and clear instructions. It features great programs, yet is very simple to use. It is very quiet. The soft drop system is amazing, I haven't seen something like that before. It makes lowering and lifting up the deck so much easier.
I've used this almost every day since I got it, and I'd definately recommend it to others.

First, I bought this and it arrived at my house shattered in pieces like the box had exploded. What a nightmare getting a return scheduled for this thing, which I had to lug in pieces into my house in the pouring rain while I waited the few days it took to get a pickup for the return. But, amazon is awesome and they made it as easy as they could. I was still so set on this particular one, that I went ahead and ordered a new one. Second one also arrived with a banged up box and with lots of plastic pieces broken. But this time, it still functioned, thank goodness. Now the machine. Whoever engineered this should think about a career change. There is no Bluetooth as advertised, instead there is an mp3 jack. See image. There is a start/ stop button on the hand rest, exactly where you would happen to rest a hand which SUCKS to accidentally press while youâre in the middle of a run and it is extremely easy to accidentally do! See image. Also, the two hand rests are strangely narrow and an I've never had a problem with whacking my hands/ arms on any other treadmill but I have that issue here. The pulse rate doesnât work... every time I use it, it bounces from 79-82 while my apple watch shows 160. Thatâs not just a little off. Also, it sounds like itâs going to break when I run in it. Iâve tried to ensure all is level and nothing is loose, but it sounds like itâs going to snap with every step I take (reassuring, eh?) Otherwise the speed and elevation work, but Iâm not sure how accurate they are. They seem ok.

I was hesitant when the box arrived because it was half open and all tore up but the delivery guy just left it so I decided to open it. All was well inside and the treadmill was easy to put together.
It works well for our family. My husband and I are both over 220 and we can walk/jog on it just fine with no issues. We use it 4-5 times a week each. My 14 year old son runs on it at max incline at 8-9 mph for an hour and it works great for him too.
It fits nicely in our spare room and has become the preferred price of work out equipment for our family. Itâs not a top of the line treadmill, but it is more than capable of satisfying our familyâs needs.
The only negative is the placement of the on/off switch. It is on the handle and we have all accidentally bumped it while working out and turned the machine off. No a fatal flaw, but frustrating if you are in a rhythm.
Overall, I would recommend based on our experience.

Basic but excellent. Great for basic home workouts. If you are just looking to walk or incline walk, maybe light jog then this works great. If you are looking to run fast or are a heavy stepper, or are looking for top of the line bells and whistles,this is not for you. Speakers sound like walkman speakers and the area to run is minimal. Even though it folds it still takes up some room in an awkward kind of way. Its wayyyy better than cheaper models, but if you want more options or a solid look ,spend some more money on a better model.
If you have a spare room and like to walk or very lightly jog, or even just incline walk then this thing is great for that!

The package arrived without any issue (I saw other complained about packaging). There is no good enough packaging to prevent careless handle. It was very easy to assemble from the instruction. I was please with the mobility of the equipment as I had to move and it went without a hitch. The incliner mechanism is smooth and silent. The controls are simple, well it has only a handle full of programs to select from. We just use the manual speed and incliner controls to make the training more or less challenging. Overall a good machine for homes with limited space.

I received this treadmill a few months ago. it was delivered on time and was not missing any parts. It also was easy to assemble. Sofar I am really happy with it. I wasnât sure how accessible it would be for me as a blind user but it has buttons that are easy to use. I also like that it has an app to track my distance. My husband and I both use the treadmill. We have not been able to figure out how to use the speakers with Bluetooth yet but that is not very important for me to use since I regularly have my phone with me anyways on the treadmill. This is a great treadmill for anyone that is looking for a simple treadmill that is easy to use.

Very pleased with this treadmill. It has some good features and is easy to use and set up. I highly recommended it!
When I received the box it was in poor condition (thanks FedEx). After getting the treadmill put together I found two broken plastic pieces that fit in the end of the treadmill. I contacted the seller and they were very helpful. They gave me some money back and shipped the (easily replaceable) plastic pieces to me. However, they did initially ship those pieces to the wrong address/state. Once I informed them of their mistake they quickly shipped the pieces back out. My wife and I are very pleased with their service.

This treadmill is great quality for the price. I had someone come and assemble it so I can't speak to how easy that is but it works just fine. It does make noise and is a little creaky when I speed up or adjust the incline but it's nothing too bothersome. I can't even hear it over my headphones when they're turned up so that should give you some insight into how loud it is.
If you're on the fence, I definitely say go for it. As someone who is easily disappointed and satisfied, I'd recommend this -- just be realistic that this is not anywhere near compared to a gym-level treadmill. It's just a nice, little piece of equipment you can use here and there.
Full disclosure: I've used it maybe twenty times so I can't speak to how sturdy it is for long-term use.
Purchased this treadmill and had some issues however the company did reach out and offer assistance &took care of the problem
I received the product damage and broke , I did a return product and is taking more than a month to bring the other one? Is this correct?

This treadmill is awesome! We recently got it to add to our Covid workouts. Itâs super easy to move and to open and close. Goes up to 15 incline. I have never ran faster than 9.5 on it and it definitely handles it fine!!!! Highly recommend, especially for the price, you are getting a great product.

I actually waited for a few weeks before i wrote a review. This is nice and simple to use. Great for the price. I love the Auto- Incline and simple dashboard. I got this model because it had a Higher Max weight load (285lbs). As i am a 6ft man and 210lbs. Works very well and i like that it has no fancy gadgets. Nice and easy quick speed and incline buttons. Has quite of few of programmed workouts. Simplicity in this model is what i like. So far so good.
Box and treadmill were damaged. Could not reach anyone for a replacement part. Feels cheaply made. If it wasn't so big and we had a box to fit it we would have sent it back.

I truly wanted leave comment only when I am satisfied with the product so I am writing this after using this for 5 months.
Completely satisfied with motor performance . Whether its running or jogging or walking treadmill gives its best . Initially had few challenges to know how to use built-in Bluetooth but managed it from online resources.
Its gives same feeling as the one I use in public gym no difference in the different preset modes . Lot more option for weight loss , cardio and trekking. Compact to fit your room. Weight is average to carry . East to assemble . I did it in 30 mins by reading the manual. Good quality.
I recommend buying this product.

I've only used the treadmill a short time, but it works perfectly. Other reviewers have had problems with broken pieces due to shipping, but this device came in pristine condition ready to use. I highly recommend this treadmill to anyone wanting to stay in shape or get into better shape!

First one arrived in a box that was torn open and so badly damaged, that we didn't accept delivery. Ordered another, and that box was pretty dinged too, but not as badly, so we kept it.
It has decent features for the price, but we used it 2-3 times per week, and the motor went out in less than nine months.

Good treadmill for the price. Not easy to find one that has the soft lower function and power incline. I like that I can connect my iPad and watch with the treadmills speakers.
Company very responsive and readily sent a replacement part that was cosmetically damaged by shipping.

We received the treadmill and it was pretty easy to put together. Looks good and sturdy. We tried it to see if it ran and worked OK, but will not using it until we receive more information from SereneLife. The manual did not note these things: where we put lubricate, how often we have to apply it, and what kind of lubricant to use. They did send a little bottle of a lubricant but it didn't have any labels on it. So right now waiting to hear from SereneLife to answer our questions that we emailed to customer service before we start using the treadmill. We will write more to this review when we start using it.
This is easy to use and has built in programs. It is easy to use and doesnât take up as much room as some of the bigger treadmills. It has a smooth movement and we really like it.
This treadmill is great for anyone who is looking to make an at-home gym during quarantine. I really love that it folds up so it can fit great in smaller rooms or studios.

I waited some time to really use the treadmill before posting a review. Overall, it is a good piece of equipment if not really into hardcore indoor running and used more for walking. When increased speed, it shakes/ moves very easily. I donât like that you cannot pause your progress. Stopping is the only option and once you do, all calories/ distance is lost. The other disadvantage Iâve found is the length of platform. My stride tends to be long and I have to be cautious not to step on the end of it when using.

Thus far, I am very pleased. I read the other reviews and was intimidated by the concept of the heavy equipment delivery. The package did arrive with a sizable gash in the box, but no sign that it had reached the equipment inside. Set-up was easy, and it was out of the box and operational in 30 minutes, with just one person. Had time to get in 2,5 miles on my lunch!

Customer service for Pyle is excellent I had an issue with the unit I received and they sent me a replacement almost immediately. As for the treadmill it is perfect for what I need and very easy to assemble and operate. I would definitely recommend this company and the treadmill. A++
This product is great. I was able to assemble myself. I love the auto incline and mph this machine offer. For the price this treadmill was well worth it.

I find that the SLFTRD35 Foldable Treadmill was easy to assemble and lightweight. Also, small enough to fit in my bedroom at the side of my bed. I use it on average at least 3 times a week and am very happy with how it performs. You can also store it away in a larger closet if you wanted. I am very pleased with the SLFTRD35 Foldable Treadmill.
Vivian Forbord

This is a fantastic treadmill for someone who wants space saving workout equipment. The treadmill is very quite and works great. My one complaint is that it did come damaged but still works. Scratches on the screen and the base frame is bent in the front. Sadly Amazon will not work with me to remedy the issue. I love the treadmill otherwise. It is great for a working mom who has to get up early and get her workout in.

Huge disappointment. I bought this last year and guess what? It doesn't work anymore... very interesting that this machine becomes useless right after the guarantee expires. I regret purchasing this. Is not worth it, i rather buy something that will last years instead of this crap that only lasted 1.
I bought this treadmill for the office, we enjoy it almost every day, great product. was very easy to assemble and is highly recommended
Good purchase

I purchased this treadmill 2 days ago and started using it. I walked for 30 minutes and my feet started sliding. The surface developed a smooth track and this is causing my shoes to slide.
I have to keep holding on to the hand bars to keep from falling.
Is at only 3 steps installation and its ready to use, have many workout programs to choose.

Amazon package delivered on time and with no damage to treadmill or box. Assembly was easy. Questions to technical support about operation were immediately answered. Cold weather in Texas has delayed much use to date but I look forward to using it daily.
Very well built, easy to assemble and to move around.
Treadmill broke shortly after purchase, but it was replaced under warranty with little hassle.

Not a very good product at all especially for what we paid for it... the magnetic piece that makes it start kept popping out.... the blue tooth or the aux port does not work.... I was looking forward to getting it.... Huge disappointment!!! I do not recommend it

It says it is app enabled. The app it says to use runs in KM while the machine uses miles. it doesn't covert so trying to run a program it runs at 1.6 times the speed. Plus the Bluetooth is only for the apps. you have to use a jack to play music through it.

This treadmill was very easy to assemble. I have been using it for over a year and got a tear on the belt, when I contacted customer service they were very quick to respond and correct the issue at no charge. Best experience ever with this type of purchase!!

Nice to have in the summertime when itâs a 100 degrees outside so I can still take a walk
Works great
Still havenât figured out how to use the Bluetooth
I received the treadmill a few days ago and so far it seems to be a really great treadmill. I really like all of its features.
Very easy to assemble. I am not a big âworkoutâ person and this treadmill is right for me. Many different settings you can set for the workout. Overall, great product.
Easy to assembly
Just what we were looking for to workout at home. Well-made, easy to assemble and easy to use.
Product arrived and packaged well. Installation was easy ... the treadmill was ready for use in under 30 minutes. The console is easy to understand and the first workout went well.
The treadmill was damaged during shipping. It has sent all over it but it works.
Good value for the money
This treadmill was a great addition to my home gym. Easy to set up and has all the features that I needed.
I just received my treadmill today. I love it! It was very easy to put together. It has everything that I wanted and more. I definitely recommend this treadmill.
Very easy to use assemble and use
It is a good trend mill to exercise at home
The belt is made of poor quality and it does not work properly, when jogging you feel unsafe.
I live my new SereneLife treadmill. It was an easy assemble which allowed for a quick start to get ne back to healthy.
Easy to assembly, Sturdy construction
This was a great purchase. It has all the functionality of the gym equipment with the convenience of being at home.
Received this treadmill a little over a week ago and so far itâs great!! Work exactly as described and is not nosiest at all.
Horrible and cheap garbage. I will sell you mine. If you weight 180 or more than really dont buy.
I just opened this treadmill, it was so easy to assemble and love the way it works... highly recommended!!
Construction is very cheap, but it does the job.
This treadmill stopped working after only five months. I can't reach customer support...very disappointing.
Super easy to assemble, sturdy feel, and great features for the price.
Very easy to set up! I am excited to try this out on the days that it is too cold to run outside.
This treadmill is easy to assemble, sturdy, and simple to fold away when not in use.
Great treadmill. Smooth belt, very quiet
amazing product, and amazing service!
Easy to assemble!
Love my treadmill

This is good for low income but it started squeaking after a couple of uses which means it is rubbing somewhere. I'm going to put oil on it to fix it but I have to find out how and where. Wouldn't have to worry about this with a higher cost unit. I wouldn't attempt the highest weight they say.
Very light, folds, and good. seems like the low horsepower makes the mph off by 0.1mph.

The treadmill works well, and is getting a lot of use. When I wrote back to the US distributors for instructions on how to lubricate, the service was excellent, although unfortunately the fulfillment department in Mountainview NY was less than stellar. Overall, however, the customer service person got things organized, and I am very happy with the machine. Thanks!

SereneLife treadmill is very durable, easy to assemble and easy to store. I purchased the treadmill about 9 months ago and it has worked very well for me so far. It's also much easier on me knees than some treadmills I have used in a gym. Even when I had an issue with a cracked deck I was provided a replacement without any sort of pushback whatsoever from them. All other parts have shown no wear and tear including the belt. Great customer service from the vendor and it is a great product!

Very easy to use and to assemble. It have Bluetooth with an app from the play store that you could use. The machine have 12 preset programs as well it have auto incline, and emergency clip that you could use. Is a well all around treadmill.

Love the price of the product it goes great with the durability. I highly recommend this product as I am a big guy 5'10 265lbs and it holds up very well for me. (Since getting this product down to 235lbs). Shipped very fast and came in a box took me 25mins to setup by myself and it was good to go! Very easy to fold up and keep it out of the way when not in use. Highly recommend.

I have been using this product for 2 months now. No complains. Assembly was easy. Easy to move around. The speed range is very satisfying and the solid build of the product makes me a happy person to own it.

THIS A FINE MACHINE MEETS ALL MY WORKOUT NEEDS ,FOR A 94 YEAR OLD MALE.
JAMES BROHMAN
This was easy to assemble and set up great product for the price arrived on time good size for my small space.
Super easy to assemble
Good soild well built treadmill. Easy to move and easy to put together in 10 mins

I almost never write reviews but I'm more than happy to write one about the customer service I received from Serene Life. My treadmill broke and I notified customer service. First, I got an actual person who responded to me, second, the actual person, Caleb Breis kept in contact with me until the issue was resolved. Caleb was friendly and professional. I would HIGHLY recommend Serene Life products. The treadmill is working beautifully and we are very happy with it. Caleb should get a raise.

The delivery of this treadmill took a week longer than it originally stated. When delivered we were not notified or called, it was just left outside our apartment door for anyone to grab. The box arrived damaged.
Once we opened the box, the corner of the motor cover was broken off. We were only given a half a bottle of the treadmill oil. The digital panel looks like it was owned previously as the USB port looks worn.
It was easy to assemble, and works good. Best feature is its sturdy and folds up nice.
Overall experience was poor.

A complete disaster. Save yourself the trouble and hassle of it all. I should have really paid more attention to the other reviews. The item got lost and then showed up to my doorstep. Hauled it downstairs and setup, only to discover, I received a used item the digital panel portion in particular, that looks like it was locked in someone's garage or basement for a while. Complete waste of time, energy and effort.
*Update: This has been the worse purchase experience on Amazon for me. The customer service from Amazon themselves was especially dreadful and terrible. It has truly been an ordeal. I will most likely cancel my Prime membership after this experience.
motor doesnt work, the running belt stands still no matter which button is pressed. Trying to find the technical support...

When the item was delivered it was obvious it was damaged as the box was all destroyed on the one end. I set it up and plugged it in and it did not work. I pressed the reset button and it caused a large spark, electrical shock and tripped the circuit breakers in the house.
Absolutely unacceptable as it is clear after I opened that this product was damaged prior to being delivered to me.
Junk++

A lot sturdier than I thought it would be. Itâs quiet and very smooth. I live in an apartment and was worried it might be loud but itâs perfect. Barely have to turn up the volume on my tv while using it. Definitely recommend it

I have used this treadmill every day for the past 2 months and I am impressed. It is more solid than I would have expected, very quiet and the motor seems strong (even with someone over 250 lbs).
It was easy to assemble and everything works perfectly. Even the app with the ability to start the treadmill from your phone is a convenient feature.
Only 2 things to mention that could be improved:
1) For someone my size it is not quite wide enough. I have bruises on the top of my hands from hitting the side rails regulary.
2) The instructions are minimal and not well translated to English.
Other than that, I highly recommend this as a quality treadmill at an affordable price.
It was promised 2day delivery but it was over a week late. Had it for one week and happy with it so far.

I was a little concerned ordering this based on some previous reviews. All were wrong. My new treadmill was delivered by a wonderful man...white glove service. He insisted that he check the product first (all wearing masks). He unwrapped it...all perfect. My 86 year old husband set it up--easy peasy..it works beautifully. This is a fantastic product. 5 stars for sure.

Easy to put together took very little time. But not enough instructions how to start it up and set up Bluetooth. As Bluetooth doesnât work and speakers arenât very loud. Sound is muffled and scratchy. It is beautiful just have to figure out how to oil it and get it to work. Was heavy but I think it was worth my money so far. I love the cup holders and the fact you can hook your equipment up to it. Be careful though Iâm not sure about this rebate they offer not sure if itâs real.

HORRIBLE! I purchased this treadmill less than a year ago and it already burnt down leaving the entire house with an extreme toxic smell that wont go away. This product was sent 3 months late!!!! When i tried to cancel i had no way of doing it either. TERRIBLE PRODUCT! You feel like you might break it with every step even if you're 50kg. You're better off spending another $1000 and getting something that will last you more than 8 months or about 40 slow walks. Also if you try actually running on it, it feels like its going to break down the middle. I do not recommend this product.

I uses it instead of going to the gym. We love that treadmill, store easily and lots of programs and adjustment to suit you, We have no regrets buying it and the price was reasonable for us, We search lots and compare; this model had more to offer for the price than any other ones compared with. Highly suggest it

I was more than happy with this machine! Went together very easily. Lots a great features! Exceeded my expectations especially at this price point! So far loving it!
Only negative would be the way it was packaged. It wasn't tied down where the piston is so as soon as we unboxed it, it sprung up. We had to fold it down, tie it and move to the location we wanted. Other than that it was a great experience!

Treadmill is easy to assemble.
Everything works as expected.
The fitness app is easy to use.

I bought this hoping I would be able to use it for running (which I do daily) and it doe NOT have the power to get up to any kind of decent speed. It would be okay if you were just looking to walk or do some light jogging, but over and above that it just just not have the power.

This product was very easy to assemble and is perfect for small spaces. I would highly recommend this product to anyone who is looking for a treadmill for great value! I also had to contact the manufacturer and received exceptional customer service and had all of my questions answered promptly.

Great value for a treadmill with power incline, many others are $1000+. Easy to put together, runs very smoothly and gives enough cushion to help alleviate the impact on your knees. The only con so far is that hubby finds the speakers sound tinny, but we didn't buy it for the speakers, it was just an added bonus. Very happy with our purchase so far.

This treadmill is large enough, so we can run on it easily. It's stable and so far (about a month of usage) reliable. The only weak point is a fact that pre-set programs don't change incline, even programs like "Mountain climbing", so original programs are very easy. But incline can be easily added manually.
Great treadmill. Easy to assemble and use. Quiet. Easy to fold. Arrived onetime. Use it everyday. Highly recommend this treadmill

Very... Very bad experience... 1- the machine not wort it $ .
2- Amazon have unexpriece customer service and supervisors to handle there mistakes on return items.
That's not what we expected from Amazon... Will never buy big and expensive items from Amazon.

Treadmill is not working. When I switched it to electric socket, shows light on on/off button but no sign on panel. So please have it fixed or take it back and refund the money. The phone number you have provided for manufacturers is wrong.
Just arrived. Easy to install. Perfect size.

The screen or face plate is scratched as photo shows
Manual is the worst. No instructions on how to turn on.
Or operate Bluetooth
Not happy
Great product and excellent customer service. Treadmill is robust and easy to operate. I really recommend.
Very nice machine. Smooth and quiet. Instructions did not mention how to lubricate belt.
It is not a huge clunker in your basement
Packaged securely, easy to setup with minimal assembly. Treadmill options easy to use and of good quality.
No instructions came with the machine, no information on lube and belt maintenance , like tension
Good product. Easy to assemble. Fast delivery. Good value for price paid.
Very easy to assemble and fold up
good product good price
a
Easy to setup

Was really excited to get this treadmill. It was super easy to put together, however, it came with a few washers but no instructions on which screws they went to. The programming is easy once you figure out the instructions. I also love the fact that it has ports so that you can play your music through the speakers! The only cons my husband and I have noticed so far is that there is a squeak when he is running. We think this is just due to him weighing more, but it is a little annoying. The other con is that the incline goes up to a 15, but the actual incline isn't much. Overall we are happy with this purchase!

This treadmill was a great choice. It was very easy to assemble, with just 3 steps and clear instructions. It features great programs, yet is very simple to use. It is very quiet. The soft drop system is amazing, I haven't seen something like that before. It makes lowering and lifting up the deck so much easier.
I've used this almost every day since I got it, and I'd definately recommend it to others.

First, I bought this and it arrived at my house shattered in pieces like the box had exploded. What a nightmare getting a return scheduled for this thing, which I had to lug in pieces into my house in the pouring rain while I waited the few days it took to get a pickup for the return. But, amazon is awesome and they made it as easy as they could. I was still so set on this particular one, that I went ahead and ordered a new one. Second one also arrived with a banged up box and with lots of plastic pieces broken. But this time, it still functioned, thank goodness. Now the machine. Whoever engineered this should think about a career change. There is no Bluetooth as advertised, instead there is an mp3 jack. See image. There is a start/ stop button on the hand rest, exactly where you would happen to rest a hand which SUCKS to accidentally press while youâre in the middle of a run and it is extremely easy to accidentally do! See image. Also, the two hand rests are strangely narrow and an I've never had a problem with whacking my hands/ arms on any other treadmill but I have that issue here. The pulse rate doesnât work... every time I use it, it bounces from 79-82 while my apple watch shows 160. Thatâs not just a little off. Also, it sounds like itâs going to break when I run in it. Iâve tried to ensure all is level and nothing is loose, but it sounds like itâs going to snap with every step I take (reassuring, eh?) Otherwise the speed and elevation work, but Iâm not sure how accurate they are. They seem ok.

I was hesitant when the box arrived because it was half open and all tore up but the delivery guy just left it so I decided to open it. All was well inside and the treadmill was easy to put together.
It works well for our family. My husband and I are both over 220 and we can walk/jog on it just fine with no issues. We use it 4-5 times a week each. My 14 year old son runs on it at max incline at 8-9 mph for an hour and it works great for him too.
It fits nicely in our spare room and has become the preferred price of work out equipment for our family. Itâs not a top of the line treadmill, but it is more than capable of satisfying our familyâs needs.
The only negative is the placement of the on/off switch. It is on the handle and we have all accidentally bumped it while working out and turned the machine off. No a fatal flaw, but frustrating if you are in a rhythm.
Overall, I would recommend based on our experience.

Basic but excellent. Great for basic home workouts. If you are just looking to walk or incline walk, maybe light jog then this works great. If you are looking to run fast or are a heavy stepper, or are looking for top of the line bells and whistles,this is not for you. Speakers sound like walkman speakers and the area to run is minimal. Even though it folds it still takes up some room in an awkward kind of way. Its wayyyy better than cheaper models, but if you want more options or a solid look ,spend some more money on a better model.
If you have a spare room and like to walk or very lightly jog, or even just incline walk then this thing is great for that!

The package arrived without any issue (I saw other complained about packaging). There is no good enough packaging to prevent careless handle. It was very easy to assemble from the instruction. I was please with the mobility of the equipment as I had to move and it went without a hitch. The incliner mechanism is smooth and silent. The controls are simple, well it has only a handle full of programs to select from. We just use the manual speed and incliner controls to make the training more or less challenging. Overall a good machine for homes with limited space.

I received this treadmill a few months ago. it was delivered on time and was not missing any parts. It also was easy to assemble. Sofar I am really happy with it. I wasnât sure how accessible it would be for me as a blind user but it has buttons that are easy to use. I also like that it has an app to track my distance. My husband and I both use the treadmill. We have not been able to figure out how to use the speakers with Bluetooth yet but that is not very important for me to use since I regularly have my phone with me anyways on the treadmill. This is a great treadmill for anyone that is looking for a simple treadmill that is easy to use.

Very pleased with this treadmill. It has some good features and is easy to use and set up. I highly recommended it!
When I received the box it was in poor condition (thanks FedEx). After getting the treadmill put together I found two broken plastic pieces that fit in the end of the treadmill. I contacted the seller and they were very helpful. They gave me some money back and shipped the (easily replaceable) plastic pieces to me. However, they did initially ship those pieces to the wrong address/state. Once I informed them of their mistake they quickly shipped the pieces back out. My wife and I are very pleased with their service.

This treadmill is great quality for the price. I had someone come and assemble it so I can't speak to how easy that is but it works just fine. It does make noise and is a little creaky when I speed up or adjust the incline but it's nothing too bothersome. I can't even hear it over my headphones when they're turned up so that should give you some insight into how loud it is.
If you're on the fence, I definitely say go for it. As someone who is easily disappointed and satisfied, I'd recommend this -- just be realistic that this is not anywhere near compared to a gym-level treadmill. It's just a nice, little piece of equipment you can use here and there.
Full disclosure: I've used it maybe twenty times so I can't speak to how sturdy it is for long-term use.
Purchased this treadmill and had some issues however the company did reach out and offer assistance &took care of the problem

rev_title.name: Smaller than average but great value!
Basic but excellent. Great for basic home workouts
Easy to use with raised buttons for controll
Value for Money and Perfect fit for small houses ( compact to fit )
Power incline, great for my home gym.
Just received, easy to setup, waiting for a few questions from company on lubricating before using
Smooth working and just the right size and price!
Fast and easy to set up, survived shipping
Great machine for your home gym.
Walking mat is very poor quality.
Use is as simple or as complex as one wants
Not worth what we paid for it
not app enabled or fully Bluetooth enabled
Great product and amazing customer service!
Looks like I thought it would
Easy to assemble, easy to use
Good value for the money, a little small
It is very convenient to use at home
Reliable product and great customer service
Its a sturdy product. Solid build.
crash on the first day, very sad
Received a returned and damaged product
Great machine especially at this price!
Is exactly as advertised. Great treadmill
Very Bad experience and waist of money and time ......
Great product and excellent customer service.
I love the size & the auto incline feature
Smaller than average but great value!
Basic but excellent. Great for basic home workouts
Easy to use with raised buttons for controll

rev_det.name: Honestly I really and I mean truly wanted this to work, but from the very first day I noticed that I am going to have a problem with this. I was only on it for 2 mins before the belt started going to the left side. No matter how many times I tried to center it it will go back to left to the point that it just just folded on me. I managed to get it unfold but the damage was done the left side was completely frayed which resulted in it getting stuck in the roller in front of the treadmill. I spent more time trying to center it than using. I just want to return it

The treadmill is heavier than i expected, but overall it's a very good product. Specially for small spaces. Fully expanded its about double the width of my standing desk. Which is normal. Once i'm done using it i just fold it up and its about the same width as my standing desk. I don't bother putting it away since its not a bother. I just keep it folded up.
The walking pad itself is very good. With covid, i haven't been going out as much and i take about 30 minute walks on this thing. It's nice when its too cold/too hot or when it's raining. I haven't had any trouble and everything is working as expected.
The remote is pretty cool too. You can control everything with the remote. However, you do need to have a small stand/small table nearby to place it on when you're walking. Otherwise you'll be holding it the entire time.
Overall, for the price and space savings, i can't complain. I'd buy it again since a normal treadmill would cost 2X or 3X more and take up at least 3X the space. (I don't run though so this is perfect for me)
I love this walking pad. I was hesitant at first because i thought it would be noisy and too small. It turned out to be the perfect size and minimal noise. It works perfect under my standing desk.

I needed to get active and yet I have very little space. This treadmill was foldable and easily slides under the couch or bed. The fact that I also have a choice betweenusing a remote or my phone is a great plus in my book.

Love my walking pad and it folds up nicely! It's a bit heavy but it does have wheels. It stops working if you step off and you lose your tracking. I like that I can slightly jog and I recommend using the manual version and not automatic. When you plug it in, and use manual, you have to click the middle button to start it. Also, I recommend using a bar stool or something to hold on in case you lose your balance. The fastest speed is 3.75 mph.

This walking pad is an excellent addition to our house - this folds away nicely under my bed. I do not have to worry about bad weather (hot or cold) - I can reach my step goal from home. The remote works fine for average pace walking. You do need to install the app to "unlock" top speed. I like that as a safety measure, as 6 KMPH can be fast. If you choose to use full speed, I recommend using it next to somewhere when you can hold it in case of an emergency. Overall, highly recommended!

I really wanted to love this walking pad, but it had issues. The treadmill was heavier and more difficult to move than expected. The app was completely useless. I had to turn the treadmill on and off a couple of times before the remote would register and began to operate the treadmill everytime I used it. At times the speed would revert to a slower speed even though it was in manual mode. I think I received a lemon. I had to return it.

Treadmill is very small when folded, good quality and works well. Gets pretty fast but I wouldn't say a running pace. I had a hard time connecting it to the app at first but ended up getting it all set up. Next step lube the belt and adjust the alignment. So far so good, recommend.

So convenient. Mosquitoes love me so this is perfect for me to stay indoors. Pretty quiet. You barely notice the noise. It is very heavy when you try to bring it in the house. Get a friend to help you if you can. Once you get it out of the box, the wheels do make it easier. But it's still pretty heavy.

I love the fact that the treadmill came inside two boxes to protect it from damage during storage and shipping.
Initially the Auto mode was not working. When I switch to Auto mode, the remote would say WAIT but the treadmill wonât run. I called support to troubleshoot and we tried some very basic troubleshooting like pressing the buttons or power the device on/off but none of it helped. The support staff told me sheâs escalating my case to a different team and I should expect an email from them.
Two days later my very first call to support, Iâm still waiting to hear back regarding my case but the good thing is that Auto mode just mysteriously worked on itâs on.
Other than my issues with the Auto mode, I love the product. The design looks great, itâs easy to use, small footprint and relatively easy to move around

I was able to place next to my bed. Great for small apartments. Easy to set up and use. The app was a bit wonky at first, but after I did the novice review which connected with the remote, it was fine. Great way to get in exercise while watching tv.

Having a bit of an issue with the âautomaticâ feature, but overall have been very happy with the purchase. Instead of sitting all day I can keep moving. I have ADHD and have noticed a huge improvement in focus and clarity walking while working - not totally sure the science behind it but definitely recommend trying it!
Plus itâs crazy small so you can put it in almost any space!

Remote control cheap. Should have been better quality for the price.
The remote control almost immediately broke.The off/on button stuck and the display went crazy. Then died altogether. I was able to download the app to make the machine run. Not at all happy that I cannot change settings to miles instead of kilometers. I like that it folds and itâs easy to use with app.
Nice product. Fits under my work table â great home office add-on.

Recently purchased this walking pad to use while I work from home. I was pleasantly surprised by how easy the set up was, how compact it is when folded, and the sleek design. Iâve only tried it a few times so far but thus far has worked well. I especially like that you can sync the app with your phone for easier tracking.
The perfect way to get my steps in while working! Love it so far...hope it holds up through this journey.

I really wanted to like this product but it is a mess. I have had it less than 2 weeks and have spent most of that time trying to calibrate it and in turn the belt has been chewed up. I contacted customer service 2 days ago and they said someone would get back to me and no one has. I am trying to return it and get my money back.

Runs Well
Remote is nice and high quality
Like that, I can pair my phone for statistics or remote use.
I like that the remote isn't needed as I can just step on and use and it auto starts and stops.
This treadmill is amazing for small spaces! So excited we have this in our new home!
This walking pad so quietly.

rev_det.name:
Do NOT buy this machine. Major liability! This treadmill is complete JUNK! The METAL Frame CRACKED & SNAPPED on both my original treadmill after 2 months and my replacement one. I also had problems with the incline motor on both machines, constant issues and now waiting to hear back from Sunny Health and Fitness regarding what they plan to do for me. Pure insanity!
Please put your safety first. Check under the hood every so often donât let this happen to you. No need to completely removed the screws just loosen them and lift the lid off the motor and inspect that no cracks are forming. Stay safe!

I mainly bought this product for the incline, folding, and ability to move it.
I can move it in front of a window or the tv.
I'm a walker not a runner. Streaming a 2 our movie and walking in front of the tv is what I will do.
The ability to walk on an incline was very big for me.
Pros:
1) Incline up to 12%
2) Up to 8 miles per hour speed
3) 2 Cup holders
4) arm controls (speed and monitor)
5) Pad / magazine holder
6) controls are user friendly
7) depending on your running style - good shock absorber
Cons:
1) can get load on high speed may want to get a floor pad
2) It is a little hard to move even with the wheels, but one person can move it
Just a note:
the instruction suggests a 250 pound limit.
I'm not sure if the frame can handle much more at least for running, but for walking seems to be pretty awesome.
Received today, assembled and started. Immediately there comes a lot of noise from the motor and gets louder increasing the speed. Please see the video. Very very upset.

At first this product seemed like a good buy. Now eight months later the unit just stopped working. The instruction manual is useless as no error codes are being displayed. I also noticed that the price dropped $97 dollars since I purchased. I have contacted support but since the electronics and motor units are only warranted for only 90 days I am not very hopeful. Will update if support provides reasonable assistance.
UPDATE:
Increase from 1 star to 3 stars. Support was awesome!, I would give them 5 stars. They asked a few questions and sent a new electronics board which only took about 30 minutes to replace and everything works again. Won't give more than 3 stars though because the review is for the product and it was upsetting that this happened in less than a year and I don't know if the same thing will happen again.

So you may blame this on me but I purchased it in November of 2018 but my wife and I had just had a baby and had zero energy or time. This was our first and she had a heart condition (it's manageable but was very scary at first - Long QT Syndrome) so it was all very exhausting. Anyway, I never bothered putting it together so it just sat in my basement. Finally this past weekend, 4/25/20, I got to putting it together.
But I could not put it together because the box was missing the necessary hardware to assemble. You know your basic screws, nuts, and bolts. Literally pieces that cost them a couple bucks, at most, to manufacture. I contacted them and let them know the issue but since it's out of warranty, they won't honor it and just send me the parts. Parts that were never included because they can't verify they weren't in there. Now honestly, if I was trying to scam them, why the hell would I care about the stupid screws and bolts. The chat careperson essentially just said sorry too bad.
Oh and I happened to buy the extended warranty through Amazon's partner, Square trade. That should help, right? No, it was useless because it doesn't cover missing parts. Just got more of the sorry, too bad.
The phone number for customer service is not working for me to talk to someone (probably because of the COVID-19 pandemic so I did email them as well. I'll update this if they decide to do the right thing but until then, I'll make it my mission that everyone knows about their complete lack of customer service and just plain old decency and "doing the right thing".
***Update - I had to buy the parts. These folks are complete jerks and would never get my business ever again. I highly recommend NOT purchasing from them.

I was kind of weary buying this when it had no reviews, but I'm super happy I got it. It basically already came put together, you just need to put some screws in to hold it up. Took me and my dad about an hour to set it up. It's so easy to fold since the belt isn't really that heavy. I'll include a video showing how it folds. Awesome treadmill for the price! Also it's very sturdy and I'm not such a tiny person! Also sorry for my bare feet in the video haha

Defective after only 4 months. I have been using this machine for 30-45 minutes about 4 times a week, and I have followed the instructions it came with to the letter of the law. Just recently, somewhere around the 18 to 20 minute mark the machine seizes up. The screen goes blue and the belt just HAULTS to a complete stop. No warning. The first time it happened I was actually running pretty fast, and I almost broke my arm when this happened. I luckily caught myself. The second time this happened I was walking uphill and it happened again. Machine just seized up, screen went blue. The end. Everytime I power it down for a full day and start it back up the same thing happens. I get about 18/20 minutes of walking and then bam... off it goes and will not work again. I knew this was a cheap piece of equipment, but I'm hoping my email to their tech service department doesn't go on deaf ears. I REALLY liked this machine from the start. Easy to put together. Loved the size. Love the cup holders and simple features. I was hoping it could at least last two years!! Hoping it can be fixed!

First picture shows the Treadmill condition from out of the Box to 10 days later . The mixed bag is that while the Sunny Customer Service is responsive and decent . Having to replace the face panel for a new treadmill is disappointing . I ordered this treadmill to replace a 5 year old Gold's Gym Model that I could not find again . Anyway , this model had similar features and a few more . I was a previous tradesman with decent mechanical and electrical skills so replacing the panel myself presented no problems . But for many it might be a problem to just receive the new panel in a box with a thank you card . The center pictures are of what you have to unhook/ hook up and the last picture is what it should have looked like 10 days ago . My evaluation is that the Safety key hook up and switch was faulty . As that is what the screen looks like without the safety key .

a total bargain! Fits nicely in my 8x10 sq ft guest room. I do recommend you buy a pad.
It's quiet, cool features and easy to operate. Love the holders on the tray, the sensors on the handle bars.
Had issues with display which was replaced after some troubleshooting on my part. Customer Service was top notch!

I wanted to get a decent machine, but under 1k. A lot are not very good until you get over that mark (like 1.2k +) but this one does ok, just a couple things to consider:
Pros,
-Has auto incline feature. A lot of lower models do not. there is either no incline or you have to manually set it. I like changing my incline as I go.
-Display screen shows speed/time/distance/level/calories at same time. So you don't have to push buttons or wait for it to cycle through.
-I'm taller and it holds my stride.
-Easy to lift up and down.
-Pretty quiet.
Mid
-Its more compact than some (good) but its more compact than some (bad) because if you are a little 'bigger' or your walking balance goes from side to side, you can hit sides quicker which could be dangerous. After a time or two I adjusted and like the smaller size due to room constraints.
-Yes, it has quick touch buttons, but the incline is by 3 degrees (3,6,9 etc) and the speed is by 2. It would be great -if you could either program them or just have single degrees. I assume they did this to save money and still claim these features.
-Pulse meter does ok.
Cons,
-The calorie count is not correct and no way to adjust. I finally had to calibrate based on my Fitbit and the treadmill calorie show is about 2.6 times LESS than Fitbit. Good to know...
-The music feature is not worth it at all. it sounds worse than just playing your phone speaker. I wish it did work as I like having the controls right there, but its dead weight. Just have Alexa close by.
-Due to the compact size, the handrail positions are easy to hit with your swinging arms. Again I had to learn to keep mine close so as not to beat myself up.
-Not really a deal-breaker, but the silver gives it a more cheap look. It thought about covering it with some type of vinal, but nagh.
So bottom line: not your gym's treadmill, but for a decent smaller unit that auto inclines and gets you your workout, this works.

This treadmill is exactly what I wanted. I didn't want to spend $1000 + but didn't want a cheap little thing that felt like it would fall apart when I ran on it. This treadmill feels solid, has a decently wide belt, and best of all incline.
My one concern with buying a cheaper treadmill is how long it would last, and three months in that fear was realized. However, I need not have worried. Sunny Fitness has outstanding customer service. They worked with me to get it back up and running at no cost to me. All I had to do was reach out and they were very proactive in troubleshooting the issue.

After doing my homework on a couple of different treadmills for my home... i chose this one. (Keeping in mind a few important points: cost, size, incline capability, sturdiness and of course reviews) I believe this was the best one in my $500 or less budget and it has been great so far. Pretty cool that you can plug in ur phone via aux port and have your music playing thru the speakers...& the handle controls are super convenient!
The set up was fairly easy... my fiance set it up by himself in less than an hour. Heâs not a big muscley guy either (6â2, 180lbs). Iâve been using it for about 2 months now....& so far so good! I am 5â4 and 180lbs and it works perfectly! I do mostly fast paced walking but i also jog on it... and it feels sturdy enough when i do run a little harder. The arms placed at a pretty good height and width. you definitely have enough room to swing your arms a bit.
The only thing that bothers me a little is that when i walk on incline.... it creaks. i have my headphones on usually so its okay... no big deal.
Overall im am pretty pleased with my purchase. i gave it 4 stars because of the creaking.... maybe because its new and is getting âbroken inâ but ill update my review in a few months.

I am 70 years old. I had to pay someone to get it in the house and put it together. It does not work. So now Iâm supposed to pay someone to take it apart and get it to the UPS store? I will be calling Amazon.

I used this treadmill once and the next time I attempted to use it, it stopped working. Working with product support has not been easy. I don't think it's unreasonable to expect that if you buy a product it will work. Based on the conversation with product support, they commonly ask the purchasers to "rebuild" it by putting in new parts. Extremely disappointed, especially given how hard this product was to lug up to my second floor.

Arrived quickly but wow this this is HEAVY. Almost 150 lbs I feel sorry for the shipping carrier, I don't know how they got it on my porch but the box was still in fairly good condition. It was packaged pretty well and there was no damage. Getting it out of the box was hard and will be ideal with at least two people, but once it is out is is pretty easy to put together. The thing is already assembled really all you have to do is pull the arms and control panel up and bolt it in, and bolt the control panel into the upright position. Seems really sturdy and I imagine it should hold up well.
My wife and I have only used it once so far, I'm 5' 11" and 175 lbs and she is 5' 0" and 210 lbs and it seems fairly comfortable for both of us. Although her arms are more bent holding the handles where mine are pretty much straight. The incline works great although it is quite slow to go up and down but that is ok. I thought the max 8 MPH was going to be too slow but it actually isn't... 4 MPH is a decent jog for me and really all that I want out of it so I imagine 8 MPH should be more than enough for most people.
The only thing I don't like so far is the speakers for playing music. I thought they sounded really tiny.
Overall though we are pretty happy. I hope the thing will last. I will absolutely post back if I have any problems with it.

Excited to receive the unit, relatively easy to assemble, but then after turning on, no signal!
What makes it worse is there's no one answering at customer service when I called the phone number. It's work at home during corona virus, I get it but given today's technology they can't route the calls to someone at home to answer them?! Email sent to support got a reply many days later, and it was for me to check to make sure all wires are connected properly.
I order this so that the whole family can exercise during the stay at home order. But here you have a brand new treadmill not working! How is that possible! Got to question the way the company is run and the basic quality of their product.

Easy to set up. Minimal screws and adjustments needed to get it in working order. Box was in tact and it was delivered in pristine condition. It took me less than 30 minutes to open and set up. Narrow belt, but thatâs to be expected with a home gym treadmill unless you move towards a more commercial model. I am sure this will due the job of helping us get in more steps throughout the day while having kids at home. Since we can not always leave home this will make that habit easier to apply.

DO NOT BUY THIS. This is my first ever review on Amazon ever....this is garbage in a box. Not only did the first one not work but customer service had me replacing the motor as if Iâm a treadmill mechanic. 2nd one came (replacement) and it is broken also....back on with customer service and they are going to have me hookup a new console....NOPE not today satin back they both go. They weigh a ton and setup is a pain save yourself the trouble and donât buy this. To be honest they should take these off the market!!!!!!!!!!

I thought it was great, at least for the time it lasted. Good speed and incline for the price but after only using it for an hour a day for less than three months, the motor went. My dad took a look at it and said he believes it was bad bearings in the motor. Very unfortunate.

I was in my home office one day purchased 11/17 and the Bluetooth made a weird noise, since I had not hooked it up yet I was concerned. So I tried to turn off everything, had to unplug it! Any one need a dead boat anchor, cause my tread mill is dead So glad they have a 90 day warranty. Boat anchor anyone?

Do NOT buy this machine. Major liability! This treadmill is complete JUNK! The METAL Frame CRACKED & SNAPPED on both my original treadmill after 2 months and my replacement one. I also had problems with the incline motor on both machines, constant issues and now waiting to hear back from Sunny Health and Fitness regarding what they plan to do for me. Pure insanity!
Please put your safety first. Check under the hood every so often donât let this happen to you. No need to completely removed the screws just loosen them and lift the lid off the motor and inspect that no cracks are forming. Stay safe!

I mainly bought this product for the incline, folding, and ability to move it.
I can move it in front of a window or the tv.
I'm a walker not a runner. Streaming a 2 our movie and walking in front of the tv is what I will do.
The ability to walk on an incline was very big for me.
Pros:
1) Incline up to 12%
2) Up to 8 miles per hour speed
3) 2 Cup holders
4) arm controls (speed and monitor)
5) Pad / magazine holder
6) controls are user friendly
7) depending on your running style - good shock absorber
Cons:
1) can get load on high speed may want to get a floor pad
2) It is a little hard to move even with the wheels, but one person can move it
Just a note:
the instruction suggests a 250 pound limit.
I'm not sure if the frame can handle much more at least for running, but for walking seems to be pretty awesome.
Received today, assembled and started. Immediately there comes a lot of noise from the motor and gets louder increasing the speed. Please see the video. Very very upset.

At first this product seemed like a good buy. Now eight months later the unit just stopped working. The instruction manual is useless as no error codes are being displayed. I also noticed that the price dropped $97 dollars since I purchased. I have contacted support but since the electronics and motor units are only warranted for only 90 days I am not very hopeful. Will update if support provides reasonable assistance.
UPDATE:
Increase from 1 star to 3 stars. Support was awesome!, I would give them 5 stars. They asked a few questions and sent a new electronics board which only took about 30 minutes to replace and everything works again. Won't give more than 3 stars though because the review is for the product and it was upsetting that this happened in less than a year and I don't know if the same thing will happen again.

So you may blame this on me but I purchased it in November of 2018 but my wife and I had just had a baby and had zero energy or time. This was our first and she had a heart condition (it's manageable but was very scary at first - Long QT Syndrome) so it was all very exhausting. Anyway, I never bothered putting it together so it just sat in my basement. Finally this past weekend, 4/25/20, I got to putting it together.
But I could not put it together because the box was missing the necessary hardware to assemble. You know your basic screws, nuts, and bolts. Literally pieces that cost them a couple bucks, at most, to manufacture. I contacted them and let them know the issue but since it's out of warranty, they won't honor it and just send me the parts. Parts that were never included because they can't verify they weren't in there. Now honestly, if I was trying to scam them, why the hell would I care about the stupid screws and bolts. The chat careperson essentially just said sorry too bad.
Oh and I happened to buy the extended warranty through Amazon's partner, Square trade. That should help, right? No, it was useless because it doesn't cover missing parts. Just got more of the sorry, too bad.
The phone number for customer service is not working for me to talk to someone (probably because of the COVID-19 pandemic so I did email them as well. I'll update this if they decide to do the right thing but until then, I'll make it my mission that everyone knows about their complete lack of customer service and just plain old decency and "doing the right thing".
***Update - I had to buy the parts. These folks are complete jerks and would never get my business ever again. I highly recommend NOT purchasing from them.

I was kind of weary buying this when it had no reviews, but I'm super happy I got it. It basically already came put together, you just need to put some screws in to hold it up. Took me and my dad about an hour to set it up. It's so easy to fold since the belt isn't really that heavy. I'll include a video showing how it folds. Awesome treadmill for the price! Also it's very sturdy and I'm not such a tiny person! Also sorry for my bare feet in the video haha

Defective after only 4 months. I have been using this machine for 30-45 minutes about 4 times a week, and I have followed the instructions it came with to the letter of the law. Just recently, somewhere around the 18 to 20 minute mark the machine seizes up. The screen goes blue and the belt just HAULTS to a complete stop. No warning. The first time it happened I was actually running pretty fast, and I almost broke my arm when this happened. I luckily caught myself. The second time this happened I was walking uphill and it happened again. Machine just seized up, screen went blue. The end. Everytime I power it down for a full day and start it back up the same thing happens. I get about 18/20 minutes of walking and then bam... off it goes and will not work again. I knew this was a cheap piece of equipment, but I'm hoping my email to their tech service department doesn't go on deaf ears. I REALLY liked this machine from the start. Easy to put together. Loved the size. Love the cup holders and simple features. I was hoping it could at least last two years!! Hoping it can be fixed!

First picture shows the Treadmill condition from out of the Box to 10 days later . The mixed bag is that while the Sunny Customer Service is responsive and decent . Having to replace the face panel for a new treadmill is disappointing . I ordered this treadmill to replace a 5 year old Gold's Gym Model that I could not find again . Anyway , this model had similar features and a few more . I was a previous tradesman with decent mechanical and electrical skills so replacing the panel myself presented no problems . But for many it might be a problem to just receive the new panel in a box with a thank you card . The center pictures are of what you have to unhook/ hook up and the last picture is what it should have looked like 10 days ago . My evaluation is that the Safety key hook up and switch was faulty . As that is what the screen looks like without the safety key .

a total bargain! Fits nicely in my 8x10 sq ft guest room. I do recommend you buy a pad.
It's quiet, cool features and easy to operate. Love the holders on the tray, the sensors on the handle bars.
Had issues with display which was replaced after some troubleshooting on my part. Customer Service was top notch!

I wanted to get a decent machine, but under 1k. A lot are not very good until you get over that mark (like 1.2k +) but this one does ok, just a couple things to consider:
Pros,
-Has auto incline feature. A lot of lower models do not. there is either no incline or you have to manually set it. I like changing my incline as I go.
-Display screen shows speed/time/distance/level/calories at same time. So you don't have to push buttons or wait for it to cycle through.
-I'm taller and it holds my stride.
-Easy to lift up and down.
-Pretty quiet.
Mid
-Its more compact than some (good) but its more compact than some (bad) because if you are a little 'bigger' or your walking balance goes from side to side, you can hit sides quicker which could be dangerous. After a time or two I adjusted and like the smaller size due to room constraints.
-Yes, it has quick touch buttons, but the incline is by 3 degrees (3,6,9 etc) and the speed is by 2. It would be great -if you could either program them or just have single degrees. I assume they did this to save money and still claim these features.
-Pulse meter does ok.
Cons,
-The calorie count is not correct and no way to adjust. I finally had to calibrate based on my Fitbit and the treadmill calorie show is about 2.6 times LESS than Fitbit. Good to know...
-The music feature is not worth it at all. it sounds worse than just playing your phone speaker. I wish it did work as I like having the controls right there, but its dead weight. Just have Alexa close by.
-Due to the compact size, the handrail positions are easy to hit with your swinging arms. Again I had to learn to keep mine close so as not to beat myself up.
-Not really a deal-breaker, but the silver gives it a more cheap look. It thought about covering it with some type of vinal, but nagh.
So bottom line: not your gym's treadmill, but for a decent smaller unit that auto inclines and gets you your workout, this works.
The only REVIEWS you NEED to read are the ones WARNING you this product will STOP WORKING within a few months. I had mine for a little under six, and it just stopped working.

Just received today. Fast delivery. Box was beat up when it arrived but the actually treadmill was in perfect condition. Quick and easy set up, just a few screws. My husband tried it out on max speed and incline and it held up great. Pretty quiet. Heâs 6â0 and this leg strides were a little long for this treadmill. Iâm 5â2 and I just walked on this treadmill at 3.0 with incline at 8 and it was very comfortable. The reason I chose this treadmill was for the price with the automatic incline. I love the automatic incline. Speakers are just ok, a bit of a static sound. Overall seems great.

DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!! IT IS CRAP! I ONLY HAD IT FOR 2 WEEKS AND THE SCREEN BLACKS OUT. I CALLED MANUFACTURE WHO SENT ME AN EMAIL TO TROUBLESHOOT. COME TO FIND OUT IT WAS ASSEMBLED INCORRECTLY (THE BELT SIDE WAS IN INSTALLED BACKWARDS AND WAS LITERALLY RUBBING A HOLE IN THE PLASTIC). THIS WAS MY CHRISTMAS GIFT AND I AM SO UPSET!!!

I waited a good month before writing this review.
I have been using the treadmill almost daily since I bought it and by and large the experience has been positive. The treadmill does not boast of many bells and whistles and itâs price reflects that. It works as promised and helps me sweat it out in the comforts of my home. Itâs motor is not very powerful and itâs running board feels a bit narrow even for a medium built person like me. But no complaints on those counts as it was a conscious decision on my part to buy a treadmill with the advertised specs.
