There are some irritants, though. For one, the running belt keeps gravitating to one side or the other so much so that I see myself trying to correct it almost on a daily basis. I called the company and the person on the phone did try her best to help me out but I think she also did not have much of a clue. Probably because of my daily tinkering to ensure belt alignment the belt has become a little loose and it tends to stall when running at low speeds.
Secondly, I wish they had speed and incline buttons with increments of 1 instead of 2 (for speed) and 3% (for incline) respectively. Then there are these pre-set programs and 3 customizable workout options. I find none of the speed/distance combinations in the preset programs is of my choice. And the customizable programs take ages to get set up and even then you may not like what you end up with. Much better to go with a simple phone app.
Finally, the dashboard is pretty small - if you keep anything bigger than a phone on it, all the dashboard information gets obstructed.
So was it a bad purchase? No. Should I have paid a bit more and bought a bigger - size and motor capacity - treadmill? Yeah, for sure.

I bought this to battle the "Fifteen from Quarantine". It was high time I did some sort of exercising, so I searched high and low for a used treadmill to get me going, but I couldn't find one that was decent for less than this cost. I'm so glad. I really love this thing. It's SO easy to adjust your speed, I love the mileage tracker AND the timer. I can track my progress to see how long it takes me to walk a mile today as opposed to a week ago (shaved 2 minutes off!). I'm not in good enough shape yet to use the incline, well at least not the "real" incline. At level one, you can barely notice it, you have to go up to about level 4 to feel it. I plan to wait a bit before I do that. I've been walking between 1.5 and 2 miles on this almost daily for the last 5 weeks and haven't had a single problem with the machine. It feels solid, it's got cup holders on either side (one holds my drink, the other my hand weight). I haven't used the speaker yet because I prefer headphones. All in all, a VERY good purchase. It got me off the couch, and that's praise from on high, lemme tell ya.

I purchased mine back in June to exercise while working from home. It was pretty easy to assemble but I get electrical shocks from day one. The manual provides step by step to check what can be wrong, which I did, but nothing worked. Manual says to make sure the homeâs outlets are properly grounded. So I had an electrician come over to my house to make sure everything was fine and he said it was.
At this point I started contacting Sunny Customer Service. Sometimes I had to email them 3 times over the course of 10 days to get a response. They provide poor information. When I am finally tired of waiting for a response to my emails I call them. They requested pictures of the motor and control panel to check if it was defective. When they finally responded, they suggested that I try things that âcustomers sometimes tryâ to apply fabric softener on the belt and anti-static spray. I called back their customer service. They said they have more calls and emails that they can handle right now so it takes quite some time to get a response. They promised to escalate my issue but even worse - they said their warranty DOESNT include the option of sending a technician to peopleâs houses. They can only provide guidance via email / phone.
In a nutshell, this is not worth your time and money. My stress just goes up every time I use it.
As far as my escalated ticket, I am still waiting for their response.
I should have spent a little more and bought a product of better quality. Stay away!

I saw where other people had problems with assembly needing 2 people. I did not find that. The only time I needed another person was to lift it out of the bottom part of the shipping box. I later realized that with a box cutter, I could have just cut the edges of either end of the box and rolled it out since the back of the belt platform has wheels. But assembly was easy with just a few bolts to screw in place, two covers to screw into place where the uprights meet the base. Easy peasy. I found the "fold down" just needed me to keep my foot on the shock absorber and gently give the base a little urging to fold down and then it took over. It has the heart rate monitor, plenty of speeds for me and enough inclines to get this old body huffying and puffing. Timer, distance and calories burned which are never enough for the effort I find. It's solid. Apparently you can plug in a music machine of some kind but I use it in a room with a TV and radio so I don't need that. The bottom construction and raised bars for the control panel are solid. Moving it around takes a little getting used to to get it to tilt back and roll on its rollers. This might be where you need someone to help steady the unit if you are not especially strong. Now I only just set it up today, checked every function over and did a bit of a walk at different speeds and inclines so I cannot attest to its durability over time. So only time will tell. I expect to use it every day or my 35 minutes walk with cool down and my wife sill do the same. Definitely order an extra bottle of lubricant. The one small bottle that came with it was just enough to get it started but had nothing left after application. Seems to be a good solid unit and after reading all the problems with the closest competitor the Nordic track that sells for $100 more and discovered the support problems then reading how most people with this one enjoyed good support, I am happy with my decision to buy.

When I started looking for a replacement treadmill, I suddenly realized how nice my old one was. The Sunny Health & Fitness SF-T7515 Smart Treadmill with Auto Incline was the closest replacement I could find for a reasonable price. I struggle coming to terms paying hundreds, if not thousands, of dollars for a product that is basically a motor with a belt that goes around in a circle. The price justification seems to be driven by size of the motor and walk belt, as well as add-on features such as auto-incline, and built-in electronics, connectivity and monitoring. This product seems to do everything it claims pretty well. However, I'm surprised by the absence of a couple of things. First, I'm driven by a daily goal of at least 10,000 steps. The electronics on this treadmill measure time, distance, calories burned, and even heartrate....but not the number of steps. This is a feature that I miss from my old treadmill. The other thing that is truly surprising is, Sunny provides no process for registering the purchase of their products. Almost every manufacturer asks buyers to register their purchase, no matter how inexpensive. I am concerned that Sunny has no documentation regarding my somewhat sizable purchase. It has electronics and motorized parts that can be subject to failure. Since Sunny has no information regarding this purchase, I'm concerned what level of support I will receive, if any, if there is a problem in the future.

This treadmill sucks. I waited a week to get it. I assembled the part and as soon I turn off the machine the digital part has white spot everywhere that doesn't allowed to read anything. The heart rate is not working and overall is a piece of junk. I tried calling amazon and it is impossible to speak with anyone. They expecting me to carry the machine and return it. It impossible the box is gone and probably weight 200 pounds. I want my money back over 400$ and they can come in my house and pick it up. Very unhappy with the product! With all these going on i thought some exercise will help to release the stress, but unfortunately i will not be able to use it.

Of course, it depends on what youâre looking for in a treadmill. Iâm comparing this to my Proform 590QS that just quit on me after many years, and overall Iâm happy with this purchase. I think this would be a great treadmill for a smaller space because itâs pretty narrow. The belt itself is 16.5 inches wide, and the entire machine is a little over 28 inches at its widest point.
PROS
Quiet
The distance seems accurate
Sturdy
Great incline
Screen is backlit
Easy to assemble
The clock resets at 99:59, which I think is standard, but the belt will keep going and the your distance will continue to track. I thought this was cool. My old treadmill would just shut off at 99:59.
CONS
Speakers sound pretty bad (this wasnât really important to me since I always use headphones anyway)
Seems like the pulse is off- it read a lot lower than my Fitbit
I usually run on the treadmill 4-5x per week so as long as it holds up, Iâm happy with it!

I also would NOT get a treadmill without auto incline. Doing it manually means getting off the treadmill and manually adjusting a plastic piece at the rear of the treadmill.
Belt width on this treadmill is 16.5", length is 49.5". I'm 5' 10" and if not careful (and my feet move towards the rear of the treadmill a little). I can feel where the belt is joined. Staying a little forward avoids that.
Very easy to assemble comprising 6 bolts with lock washers and 4 screws. Their screw driver isn't much good, I would use your own. They provide two allen wrenches of slightly different sizes but only one size is needed.
The treadmill appears very sturdy, easy to fold up, easy to let down again. Bluetoothj speakers work OK to my Android phone. Not great speakers but wouldn't expect them to be great (after all, it is a treadmill). The speakers are certainly listenable to.
The treadmill motor is very quiet also.
I did purchase the mat by Sunny that the treadmill sits on.
Per the instructions, I did lube under the belt before use. Probably worth ordering more when you order the treadmill. Using more than 5 hours per week...they recommend lubing monthly.
All in all, a very good treadmill (not that I am any expert <g>).
Update 2/21/2021
Iâve used this for the last several weeks now. I really like the treadmill. Seems to be well made, was well packed. The only very minor gripe I have is that between my phone volume control and the volume control on the treadmill it is a little difficult to get the volume just right. Either a little too soft or a little too loud. Not a big deal. The treadmill really needs a more granular volume control.
Update 2/27/2021
I don't take any stock in the pulse readings. I see wildly fluctuating numbers given during various times during my walking sessions. I walk 2.5 miles at 3.5mph 6 times per week. I see pulse fluctuations from the 80/90 mark after, say 1 mile, and release my fingers or thumbs from the handles. 20 or 30 seconds later, when testing again, I see figures in the 120/130 range and once as high as 170. 20 or seconds later it is back to 80/90. Doesn't make sense to me.
Update 4/1/2021
I sent an email to the manufacturer about 4 weeks ago. I had an observation about the display showing "Fat" and the manual showing "BMI" as well as asking a question about programming custom treadmill programs. As of today, I have had NO REPLY. Makes me wonder what would happen if I had a warranty claim (I don't ATM). Still not a good indication of support from the company. Lowering the rating to 3* due to this.

I believe this was a good value. Says it has a 12% grade. Speed of 8mph. I bought to walk uphill, which I think is the best exercise. Got it running within an hour of opening box. I think this is 25% of the price of a machine that has a higher grade and higher speed. Petite too. We had an older one that was bigger and 20 yo. Remember to lube, use a surge suppressor, and their is a hard power button in the back. Lube often I bet good maintenance will go along way. I'm pretty sure I saw another reviewer who liked this too. 50 yo man here.

Arrived today, and all of the necessary parts for assembly are missing. What I got was:
Main Frame (No.71)
Safety Key (No. 1)
MP3 Wire (No. 2)
Right Side Cover (No. 66)
Left Side Cover (No. 67)
Silicone Oil (No. 86)
What I didn't get was:
Cross Recessed Pan Head Tapping Screw (No. 12) - 6pcs
Half-Roundhead Hex Bolt (No. 15) - 4pcs
Serrated Gasket (No. 18) - 6pcs
Half-Roundhead Hex Bolt (No. 84) - 2pcs
Spanner with Screwdriver (No. 85)
Allen Wrench (No. 87)
Allen Wrench (No. 88)
The instruction booklet said the missing pieces would be in a carton of some kind, but there was no carton. Just some plastic bags with the first list of stuff. I waited a month for the treadmill to arrive, but, as of right now, the treadmill is completely unusable. Company really needs to up their quality control so stuff like this doesn't happen.

I'm so pleased with this treadmill. I opted to get the 16 1/2" tread belt instead of the 15" and it's definitely worth the extra money. While certainly not as wide as a standard gym treadmill, the 16 1/2" belt is comfortable to run on and the long tread is very nice. I have a medium frame (5'5", 150 lbs) and was always comfortably in the middle of the track.
It was as easy to assemble as other reviews indicate. I was able to assemble it myself in less than an hour. All that's required is to lift the console and screw into place. It also comes with belt lube, which is nice and kept me from having to make a separate purchase. I will say that while it folds easily, it's heavier to move than I expected. I was comparing to a much smaller, cheaper treadmill and the difference is pretty obvious. It won't fit through my smaller bedroom doorways without some maneuvering but I'm sure I could make it happen if I tried hard enough.
I am a medium user - I run 3-4 days a week for 45 minutes to an hour at a time. I tend to move between 3.5 and 6 on the speed scale and a 2 on the incline. The treadmill feels very stable and solid. Footfalls don't make excessive noise and I was able to hear the tv easily while jogging. Towards the end of my first jog, I did notice a squeak somewhere in the undercarriage on foot strike but I'm hoping that will clear up.
I was nervous about buying something as big as a treadmill from Amazon but all in all, super satisfied with the product and very worth the price.

When the box arrived I said a silent prayer hoping that I wouldn't have to return this treadmill cuz it's a monster at about 200 pounds! Finally got it out of the box and set up which actually went fairly smooth! Plugged it in, pushed the power button and power light came on, then pressed start! Nothing happened, reread the instructions and double checked everything! Swore at Amazon, Sunny Health & Fitness, and UPS! Called customer service at Sunny Health and got someone on the second ring, shocking! The guy was great and best customer service I have experienced in years! He said it would probably be faster to return the treadmill to Amazon rather than wait for replacement parts! He ran me thru an electrical diagnostic check which showed a bad controller circuit board ! Since I dread an attempt to repack this thing and return it to Amazon, I have opted for a parts replacement, but they are not sure how long it will be, so I may be forced to return it to Amazon anyway. I now have a large treadmill in my family room that serves no useful purpose or function!

I wanted something for my home gym that wasn't going to break the bank. This treadmill exceeded expectations. I thought I might have to use it just for walking, not for running, but I was wrong. Sometimes a cheaper treadmill isn't comfortable for running. It was super easy to put together, but you def need more than one person. It's VERY heavy and you need someone to hold up the top part while someone else screws in pieces. I love that there is incline. I love there are a lot of different levels. These were important factors in my choice. Things to know: it's not quiet. Most treadmills are not. It's not louder than others but just be aware it's not quiet. And it's narrow. If you are very wide this is probably not for you. There is a max weight of 250 and it's more narrow than say, a gym treadmill. The good news about that is that it is a space saver! It's very sturdy. I'm happy with it.

This reason I got this treadmill was the price and it had auto incline. With auto incline I can burn more calories in less time and i don't has to run to burn more calories.
This tread is a little heavy at 121lbs. So you will need 2 people to move it to the place of use. It come with wheels so one person can move it around. Assemble is very easy. All you need is to put the screws in and oil the belt and you are ready to go.
It's very quiet and uses a small space and works very well so far.
I hope to get many year from it. I can cancel my gym membership now.
If you are a lazy person. Place the treadmill by the T.V and watch the pounds melt away.
Great investment.
It great for days when it really cold or there is snow outside.
The Bluetooth work great also.
The only thing i don't like the calories count is lower than regular treadmill. And even worst than the phone app.

Worst buy ever! Had for four months, stopped working. With only a 90 day warranty you are sol. They did send replacement circuit board & incline motor, still does not work. Very expensive to not work after 4 months. Now I either have to pay hefty for a repairman or cut my losses. So disappointed, would give no stars

This is going to be interesting....first off my husband takes 45 mins to put it together. He plugs it up and it doesn't work. While searching the web for a video with any input on what may be wrong with the panel, he finds that the EXACT item is on WAL-MART'S website for $400 CHEAPER!!! I was in shock. I call amazon (on hold for 45mins) to speak to a rep about the pricing. She says Amazon doesn't do price match. The ou thing that can be done is return it. Seriously?!?! My husband just spend 3 hours trying to make this thing work. Now, he has to dismantle it all over again and rebox it!!! And it's super HEAVY!!!!
I was highly disappointed with AMAZON for not price matching and with the manufacturer for sending a faulty item...

Received the treadmill and noticed box was damaged but didn't notice the damage on the plastic rail.
It was very easy to assemble but them I saw the plastic rail next to the tread had a hole in it and the piece of plastic fell inside the rail.
Couldn't tell what other damage may have been done so I returned.
It appeared to be ok but from damage, didn't want to take a chance on the performance.
The one star is due to quality, not sure of the performance.

I got this treadmill to continue my PT exercising at home. It came a day early, and was delivered to my front porch (up 8 steps. Wish I'd seen the guy so I could have tipped him!) My sister and I got it unpacked-packed VERY WELL. Comes with a good instruction book, and requires nuts and screws in just 2 places. It's pretty heavy-we moved it with those slidy "moving-men" thingies. Got it together, plugged it in, oiled the tread and the rails, per the instruction booklet. When we tried it for the first time, we noticed a squeak in the right rear of the machine. Tried some more oil, but the squeak continued. I contacted customer service via their website, and explained that there was an annoying squeak that make the machine unuseable, and could they point me in the right direction. They answered back that they needed the model number, which I'd given them in my e-mail, the serial number, with no indication where I might find that. The Order Number, which I told them I did not know, as there was no packing slip included in the shipment. They needed my phone number (why??), the purchase documents (there were none) and a video of the problem. Hard to video a squeak. My point being, if I have one of their products, and ask a very simple question, they should be able to answer it without my providing anything but the model number and a description of the problem. They should want to keep their customer base happy and it costs them NOTHING to answer back to try this or try that. Are they saying that they'd be unavailable for any assistance if I'd bought this at a swap meet? Pretty P-Poor Customer Service, IMO.

After my son and I used the treadmill for 2 weeks, we began to notice that the elevation brackets began to bend. My son and I are both 5â10, 175 LBS. We both walk for 30 minutes at 4mph, at 10 degree elevation. We noticed the treadmill shifting to the left and looked underneath and can see the brackets bending. It seems like these need to be beefed up as we are both 50 LBS under the machine limit and we are not running. We are still using it but not sure if they will eventually break.

Easy to assemble -just takes one person. But read the directions carefully before doing ANYTHING. Took about 30 minutes. Needed my electric screwdriver to put in the small screws that hold on the corner plastic covers. The tool they send to do that looks like a smashed nail - worthless. But you need it later to make adjustments. Note that the whole carton weighs 168 pounds. The Amazon delivery man hoisted it out of the truck, put it up one one shoulder and walked uphill on my driveway and up on the front porch. He kindly brought it inside and left it. Repeat, one-hundred and sixty-eight pounds! On one shoulder, like it was a sack of potatoes. Dude must compete in Ironman.

Have had for a month it is working perfectly. Assembled by myself but two would have been easier for sure. Automatic incline/decline are a great feature in this price range. Quality also seems above what you may expect in this price range. Very happy overall. Only drawback, a minor one probably, is that the hand grips are not easy to keep hold of when in max incline mode. I'm 5:10 and feel it was made for someone shorter than me. Feels as though I'm sliding off the hand grips. But I think does tend to make me grip harder and thereby work on my forearm muscles. Oiling the track also is a bit cumbersome. Don't know that it would be any bittern other treadmills. I would rate this item a best buy, especially at under $500.00

I was worried about the bad reviews but decided to get it anyway. So far so good but I just received it yesterday and just used it for the first time. I love having my phone set up to it so I don't have to wear ear buds to listen to my music. It is very quiet and the auto incline goes to 12. My old one was loud and the auto incline only went to 10. I am 68 and like to hold on when I do 3.0 because I tend to sway to the side if not holding on and I use the incline raising it up 1 level every minute and then down every minute. I wish there was more room on the handle to hold on to other than the pulse meter. I seem to only be able to hold on at the very end unless I want the pulse staying on the whole time. I can see why some reviews say that if you put a book or tablet to look at you won't see the screen but I don't do anything but watch my screen because I time my inclines. At this time I give it 5 stars because I haven't had a problem yet. Not sure how long that will be but I am super happy right now.

I have been really missing the gym since quarantine and I can't get out to run like I would like due to my small kids and bad knee. So far this treadmill is exactly what I wanted. It's a bit heavy (to be expected) but Me and hubs were able to get it to its place. It has wheels for 'easy' rolling maybe, but you can't tip it very high to move it like that. It was simple to put together and a pretty small sized treadmill, but perfect for me. My only complaint, this is probably just a me issue, is the rails on the sides are short, so when I get to swinging my arms when walking fast, I tend to wack my hand on the edges. I added some foam to stop this so hopefully that helps. Again I don't know if that is a design flaw or just a my own body design flaw. This has happened to me on other treadmills with short rails. Overall I am very happy with this product so far. I will do my best to keep up with maintenance and hopefully it will last me a long time.

I am 5' and the treadmill was perfect for my size. When it was delivered, it came with chipped pieces but I figured it was good enough to use. I've only used the machine less than 15 times and it no longer works. This is by far the worse purchase I've made by far.

I wanted to give this a few weeks before I wrote a review. Originally I had purchased a treadmill that was about $100 cheaper and the darn thing broke a couple weeks after I got it. I decided to spend a little bit more and try this one, and I'm glad I did. It's solid. It doesn't come in a million pieces. You just lock the handle bars in place and you're ready to go. And best of all, the instructions are clear cause unless you've ever owned a treadmill before and know exactly how to stop the belt from shifting to one side or other, then trust, clear instructions are crucial. I use it for walking 4 to 5 times a week. I absolutely LOVE the auto incline feature. The only reason why I gave it 4 stars is because 5 star reviews can seem fishy, and also because the preset workouts are terrible. They go from a slow walk to running from a crazed dog in a flash with nothing in between. But let's keep it real, this isn't the fancy sorta treadmill at the gym that costs thousands, this is a reasonably priced home model. If you've been debating on which one to get, trust me, spend a little bit more and go for this one. It was worth it.

This is a very heavy treadmill. It was difficult getting it out of the box so you will need help. I suggest having the box close to where you want it and cutting the box open. Once it has been taken out it is very easy to put together. A couple of the screws were difficult to align but I was able to finally get it. I havenât tried everything on it but the speed and incline are great. I love that the incline is not manual and that there are controls for both right on the handles along with a pulse monitor as well. Makes it so worth it.
Unfortunately, I had a negative experience with the shipping. First of all it wasnât even delivered to my house. Luckily the neighbor it was delivered to brought it over. Also, after opening I noticed there was damage on the side of the treadmill. I absolutely hate paying out hundreds of dollars for damaged goods. There just doesnât seem to be any quality goods anymore cause this tends to happen quite often when ordering online anymore. So disappointing.

The walking track is not long enough and very noisy when u walk or run. Having to readjust the walking belt frequently, due to the belt keeps shifting. The blue tooth connection was easy to set up. The cost was the best. The sound from the built in speakers sounded poorly,the MP3 cable when inserted had a lot of static. The lower speed button does not function on the right arm area. You have to use the up and down speed buttons on the main console. I will see how this treadmill works out for now

The product works well and is easy to assemble, but when delivered it came with a hole in the plastic siding. I used Gorilla Glue to patch it up and will have to paint over it with black paint. I think itâs a hassle to send back for a return being a large item and since with COVID Iâd like to get on that at-home workout. If I received a partial refund that would honestly be awesome, because the box itself came torn in corners and in the center, so it might have been damaged in transit to my doorstep. If received Iâll gladly give the product 5 stars.

I love this treadmill. The incline and speed adjustments are easy, on both the display and the handrails. The phone is easy to pair with the bluetooth, not that I cared much about that, but it's a neat extra. I especially appreciate the hydraulic let down that keeps the treadmill from unfolding too quickly, because I have pets and a toddler and don't want them getting squished. I got features on this treadmill like the higher weight limit and speed that I only saw together in treadmills that cost 600 and up.

Treadmill arrived undamaged and went together easily, BUT it is very narrow. I have had it barely a week my hands are black & blue from smacking them on the arms of the treadmill whether or not my arms are bent or straight. I am not a big person so I didn't think the treadmill being narrow would be an issue. I try and stay conscious of my arm placement, but then you get into the workout (and lost in the music) next thing I know - WHACK!! - I do fear a bit I might someday break a bone. I have owned many treadmills over the years. This is the first treadmill I do not like. If I'm lucky, maybe it will breakdown soon and I can get another. Next time the $$$$ will not be a factor.

I bought this treadmill due to my gym closing down during the pandemic. Reviews were mixed, but took my chances due to shortage of equipment nationwide. The treadmill is good for my daily use. The deck is a little hard for a light run, but it's definitely doing the trick. Some reviews spoke of Sunny customer service. I too was unable to reach anyone when call the 800 #, however they were VERY responsive through email. Apparently the motor for the incline went out/quit working. Sunny was very helpful in troubleshooting the problem with me. Once determined the troubleshooting didn't correct the issue, they shipped me out a new incline motor. I installed the motor myself and I'm back in business! I would buy another Sunny treadmill

Itâs a decent treadmill for the price. I run on it almost every day and itâs got a decent bounce to it (suspension). Itâs a lot easier to run on than the road or side walk.
I only have two issue so far with it...
1. The tread keeps moving to the left and Iâm not sure why. Iâve adjusted, aligned, and tightened it to the specs in the manual but it keeps sliding once I start running.
2. I keep getting shocked by the handles. This is the worst part so far. Technically it is the metal screws on the bottom that my fingers touch when gripping the handles. But a few times Iâve been shocked by the heart rate monitor. A little annoying but also a little worrisome. I turn it off and unplug it every time I finish just to make sure my little one doesnât get shocked by it... because Iâm not talking about a little static shock... itâs definitely a jolt!
Anyways... I will update if I can find a solution to these things.
Happy shopping.

I assemble the machine in about 20 minutes, It is easy to use and versatile with preprogrammed routines or I can customize my routine. I measured the belt length and counted the RPM's to check the accuracy of the distance indicator and it was accurate to within 1%. I did not try the blue tooth feature since I have a TV that I watch instead of listening to music from my phone. The pulse monitor is all over the place and seldom correlates to the pulse monitor on my Polar Vantage watch which I have checked by hand measuring my pulse at different heart rate zones and found to be accurate. The pulse monitor works slightly better once you start sweating, probably because you have better connection with the terminals when your hand are wet.

It's quiet, easy to assemble, works great. The controls and display are intuitive, and the Bluetooth connected instantly without any trouble. I don't recall the description mentioning that it has a heart rate monitor, but it does, on the handrails. I like the ability to control the speed on the handrails too. I considered buying a less expensive treadmill with manual incline, but I'm glad I spent the extra money to get this quality product.

I like this treadmill! I bought this treadmill because it has an auto incline, which I wanted. It has rollers so it can be moved while it is folded, do not get the idea this a lighter weight portable treadmill it is not. It is easy to fold, and unfold with the hands off "slow" drop, once started it will unfold on it's own, it will not crash to the floor. It even looks nice. It came well packed, and in good shape with nothing broken, wonky, or missing. It took longer to read the instructions than it did to assemble it. Yes...it can be assembled by one person. It comes with a 1oz bottle of silicon oil for lubricating the running belt and the running board. Watch a few YouTube videos on oiling the belt and board. Also buy a larger bottle of silicon oil you will need it eventually. I have not had any problems with the belt or the motor. OH!...It really is quiet/silent!

I'm so happy that I bought this as a gift for myself! I was able to get it paid for with my hsa savings (highly recommend you look into that if you have end of year funds available). It's pretty easy to use, but I haven't bothered with the speakers or phone functions, so no comment on that. I selected this because it has the auto incline and great ratings, so far I'm not disappointed! I'm putting together a home office in my basement and LOVE being able to get in a quick walk or run throughout the day while I'm working...it's truly been life changing!

Since the gym is not an option during Covid, I bought this treadmill. It looked like a great deal...big mistake! I mainly used it for walking for about 30 min, 5 days a week. It was fine for the first couple of months and then the squeak started. I have oiled it and tightened the screws, but still the loud squeaking. I called Sunny Health Fitness many times and continuously got a message stating the voice mail was full. I emailed and over a month later I received a response asking for proof of purchase and details of problem. I provided this information along with video and it's been another month and still no reply. After many calls to Sunny Health Fitness, I continue to get the same voice message saying their mail box is full. The video attached is of me walking at a slow pace. The faster I walk or run the louder the annoying squeak! I must now pay someone to come out and repair the treadmill, since it would be too much of a hassle to try and return it. I would not recommend this treadmill to anyone. Spend more money and get a product from a company with better customer service.

Good
Price - we got it for under $500 which seemed ok.
Features - up to 8mph and 15* incline (maybe it was 10*
Smooth and quite - after applying the oil that came with it, itâs a smooth walk/run and is as quite as a treadmill can be I guess.
Bad
Box came very damaged - isnât a big deal but I think this was part of the reason the plate that covers the motor was cracked and why the screen seemed to bleed ink internally after using the treadmill for a few minutes.
16.5â wide mat - for this price point, this is about as wide as the mat gets. Itâs ok, you just have to be aware of your feet placement as you walk/run. Iâm 5â8â so it was ok for me but I could imagine taller people not having a great time on the machine.
We ended up returning it because Amazon did not have the parts for it in stock and we didnât want to swap out for the same one.
We would have just kept this one if it worked the first time around.
Recommendation
If buying on amazon, buy one that is sold by and shipped by amazon. They make it as easy as they can to return it. I just had to wrap it in plastic bags - they scheduled a truck to pick it up a few days later.

Seriously I plugged it in and used it for a minute and it shuts off. Wonât even turn back on and i didnât even increase the speed, I just increased the incline. I shouldâve bought the stupid warranty because I donât know what Iâm going to do now. Just donât buy this.

If it would allow me to give this item ZERO STARS, I WOULD. DO NOT ORDER THIS PIECE OF CRAP!!!!! I ordered it once, got it out of the box, and pieces were broken off on the left side on the piece you step next to the belt. Put in for an exchange, got the new one today, and this was had pieces broken off ON BOTH SIDES IN TTHE SAME PLACE!!! words cannot describe my level of frustration right now!! Also, when I originally ordered this treadmill, it was $399. Now, it is $499!! I got the exchange for the price I paid, of course, but BUYER BEWARE.

My last treadmill died after 7 years of daily use, but I didn't want to spend that much right now so I went with this model and brand I wasn't aware of based on the reviews. It works really well overall. I love that I have the 12 options for incline, the buttons on the side rail to increase the speed and incline is also handy. The deck is more narrow than the ProForm I had, but seems to work out just fine for me. The front cover of the walking deck is actually better positioned as I don't find my feet hitting it like I did with my ProForm. As others stated but I didn't understand, the arm rails are short in length. They are at a decent height for me at 5'5" but they do not extend as far towards me as I prefer so I look slightly hunched when I use them. Not enough of an issue to return but something to be aware of. The shape of the arm rails is also awkward and took getting used to as it's a skinny rectangle which is not comfortable for my hands like my previous treadmills that had round handles. Overall the price was great, delivery was easy and my husband didn't have any trouble putting it together. It is quite heavy though so carrying it down stairs just the two of us did have me tweak my back - so make sure you have more arm strength than I do and you'll be fine.

I am pleased with the Sunny Health & Fitness SF-T7515 Smart Treadmill with Auto Incline after having used it for the past couple of months.
The treadmill was packaged very well to prevent damage during transit. The box had some damage when I received but the treadmill was well protected.
I do not really use the bluetooth capabilities at this time but I have plugged my Amazon HD tablet into the sound port and watched videos while walking briskly. Helps pass the time while exercising.
This thing is heavy so you may need someone to help get it in the house and to where you are going to use it. The assembly was very easy and only a couple of pieces to put together. Take your time and enjoy. make sure to lubricate the belt. Let it warm up to room temperature if it was delivered when cold.
I am happy with this purchase and recommend the Sunny Health & Fitness SF-T7515 Smart Treadmill with Auto Incline if you are looking for a treadmill.

Initial review: For a relatively lightweight treadmill that can fold up, this seems to be a pretty good machine. The directions could use a bit better details and plug would be safer from getting injured in shipping if it detached from machine. Packing was not great as not enough padding. one bar was bent during shipping so cosmetically it isnât perfect. It works okay though and fir the money I am grateful. One other thing to note, the wheels are more decorative than useful for moving. A shame as seems like an easy fix. Will check back in a year and let you know how it holds up .

SO SO SOOOOO squeaky!! On every setting and incline level. This is ridiculous. It wasnât so bad the first few times, but now itâs absolutely unusable. Iâve tried everything. EVERYTHING. And nothing will fix it. Upon inspecting the areas that may have needed lubrication, I found that a piece of the plastics where one of the bolts is, chipped off, and that both bolts on each side were coming loose. Mind you I have only used this a handful of times since I got it. Such a waste of money. It was easy to put together, but thatâs the only positive thing I have to say. If I didnât miss the return window, I would send back

Easy to put together. It's heavy (121 lbs) so you'll need 2 people to move it. Once we got it in the desired location, it was assembled in about 30 minutes. It's a big heavy machine with many plastic parts that ships in a cardboard box. You can absolutely expect that there will be pieces broken off when you unpack it. In our case, there is a large crack on the console and now a hole in the piece that runs along the belt. I would have been okay with that because I expected that it could happen in shipping. I got on it for the first time today and after 8 minutes, the display went blank. I turned it off and turned it back on, tried again. Same thing. I saw another review that someone else experienced the same thing. I'll be reaching out to Sunny to request support - but from what others have said about the support, I'm not really hopeful.

I have been using it every other day, and following instructions to carefully apply silicone oil to the track on a regular basis according to the instruction chart of use. Last month, after applying the silicone my tennis shoes started 'slipping' on the track as I was speed-walking. I hurt my back continuing to use it that week, and haven't been able to use it since. I can now see a slight 'oily' film along the track where I walked--as if the silicone 'bled' through to the top surface. I've tried emailing customer service to figure out what I can do to fix this, and got a ticket# but have had no response! Way too much money for an unusable device after a short time!!!

I bought this treadmill because I wanted one where it would increase or decrease the incline without getting off of it to adjust it. This one accomplishes this requirement without issue. I enjoy being able to press a button and the incline increases or decreases. The unit has programmed workouts which are printed out in the manual. I would like to have seen them drawn out graphically because I donât like trying to figure them out. Yes, I know itâs human nature to know what is coming so we can prepare for it.
The unit is quiet and I do have on the mat for it. However, when the unit was moved it make a noise. I simply raised it and lowered it. I havenât hear the noise sense. There is no noise when the incline is being used there is also no noise. This unit holds a consistent speed regardless if the incline is used or not. Iâve had the issue with the old Reebok treadmills speeding up and slowing down which caused issues.
Assembling the unit was easy to accomplish! I will give some advice. One, cats love boxes and to help therefore you may want to put them in another room. Second is do the assembly on a mat or cardboard. Sliding it around the floor may scratch it.
I did have an issue where the unit where the control panel went out. I called their support number and was immediately assisted with getting this matter resolved. The issue was it took almost two weeks for the unit to arrive! Once the new control panel arrived I had to wait a day for it to warm up because it was Winter time. The console was easy to replace and the treadmill as a whole has worked without issue since the control panel has arrived.
Even with the control panel going out and the long shipping time I have recommended this unit to other people. I use it twice a day and when Iâm not using it my cats use it as a bed! It was worth the investment.
This treadmill just picks up speed on it's own and I don't know what to do with it I need help.

This is an entry-level household treadmill. Overall, I'm satisfied with it so far, but there are certain limitations to keep in mind before deciding to purchase.
First, and most importantly, it's small. The treadmill itself is narrow, so it is easy to get off the path, which means you really need to stay focused while running.
Second, the display is hard to read, as it doesn't have especially high resolution. In addition, there's no flexibility in which information is displayed. I have a Sunny Fitness rower, and that seems to be a regular problem with them.
Finally, don't get too excited by the idea of Bluetooth speakers. They are tiny and tinny-sounding, and it's pretty obvious they'll blow out sooner rather than later if played at full volume.

I purchased this in order to circumvent the use of a loaner from a family friend that was basically shaking so hard our house was shaking with it.
This machine is fairly light, very easy to assemble move and store. The bluetooth is a great feature with plenty of space for water and other items you might need handy.
Functionally the unit runs great. It is quiet and well put together. Doesn't make any rickety noises. The additional controls on the side of automatic incline and speed adjustment are also great.
So far I've only has this a week and it's been used almost every day.
Great thing to have to complete your Covid Home Gym.
Worse treadmill ever. Don't buy this, I have this for a month only used it for 2 times never been adjusted and wheel move to one side and shredding. I'm asking for refund now!

So ordered this device solely based on reviews & price range since had noway of viewing prior. This treadmill had overall good reviews & negative seemed to be more due to shipping issues (damaged or something not working properly out of the box). Delivery guys brought the box just inside my door & box was in great condition (unlike some reviews).
Taking it out of the box is a project, but install was simple. Only issue few of the screws were tough trying to screw in the pre-drilled holes.
Definitely following the instructions which call for oiling before use which was also easy to do.
Only tried it once after setting up for about 15 minutes, but everything works & seems relatively quiet IMO. The incline is definitely a nice feature especially in this price range. The display is ok, speakers arenât anything special but there if you want to use them.
The motor seems ok for 2.2HP
Display belt dimensions 49.5L * 16.5â (would of liked belt tad wider but doable especially for walking)
Weight of treadmill 121 lbs (yes it has wheels but not the easiest to move around).
Max weight supports up to 240lb.
Warranty - Think they could of done little better here. âBelieveâ itâs only 180 days on parts, labor is up to you doing it yourself or hiring someone when outside of California or something along those lines. Plus 3 year on structure (frame).
Bottom line, due to Covid & just wanting something during winter months to remain active & get some steps in. Hoping to least get a few years out of this unit, but time will tell.

Ignore the audio stuff - it's not worth the time.
It's a great treadmill for the price. The auto-incline is great to have. It's reasonably quiet. It does make some noise when you are running on it - of course. Walking is very quiet.
I had some minor difficulty aligning the belt at first. It would be right down the middle with no incline, then would slide to one side when I inclined it. The fix was simple - I moved it a few inches, lifted it all the way up and let it settle, then realigned, and it's been perfect since.
Go ahead and order another bottle of good quality oil - you'll use the included bottle very quickly. After the first full oiling it lasts a long time.

I purchased this particular model for a few reasons: size, features, and best of all, price! This is a great entry-level treadmill for walkers or light joggers. The treadmill is quite heavy out of the box (take note), but took only 30 minutes to set up once we got it upstairs. It folds up easily for storage against a wall and is easier to move in the upright position. The auto-incline option is my favorite as I can change my exercise routine on the fly and don't have to stop to adjust or worry about pinched fingers! There are "quick buttons" on the display for changing incline and speed, or you can do it manually in small increments using the buttons on the handles. I don't feel that the heart rate monitor is accurate, but that's of little concern to me. I did purchase a mat to put underneath the treadmill to help protect the floor. I've used this treadmill almost daily for the last 2.5 months and highly recommend it!

I've had this treadmill for 5 weeks and have put 35-40 miles on it. So far it is great! If you're looking for a functional treadmill to hop onto for a run or walk and don't need all of the bells and whistles, this is it. Easy to put together by yourself, took me about 40 minutes unpacking, fiddling, and checking the track for adjusting. It would be much easier to move the package with two people. What's great: It's solid, with it's weight it does not move around when you're running (i have it on a berber carpeted floor). The power incline is great. The running track is not flimsy, feels good to run on - be sure to apply the lubricant! The pulse monitors are good, kind of have to move my hands around a bit to get an accurate reading, but it's accurate. It's small dimensions are great if space is a concern -- I don't even fold it up. I have folded it up a couple times just to test it out, and the track lifts easily. It took a bit of poking to get the lock to disengage to lower the track, but I was being cautious. The track lowers slowly by itself. The display is lit and easy to see. Things to consider about this treadmill: It is small. I'm 5'7" and the running track is just long and wide enough. I think if I were any bigger or had a longer stride this treadmill would not be comfortable to run on. Depending on the incline and how fast you're going, there will be some squeaking sounds, which is to be expected. The treadmill itself is reasonably quiet, and even running on it at lower speeds isn't too noisy. Above 5 mph, the track and foot noise gets loud enough to where I have to turn up the tv volume higher than usual. Connecting a phone over blutooth was really easy, but I don't use it. The speakers do not add anything, they sound about the same as your cell phone speaker(s). Overall, it has been exactly what I hoped it would be -- a decent, reliable, low-cost treadmill!

Very basic treadmill. Arrived damaged which seems to be a problem as you can see with other reviews. This is a small treadmill not for Running! Incline is not comparable to other models. I do like the screen because it shows speed incline distance and calories all at the same time. Sunny fitness as a company was highly recommended on fitness sites. Maybe for below average equipment but not for average equipment I had a Gold Gym treadmill that was far better equipment. Sunny needs to up their game.
Motor does not work; came broken as well

My husband and I were able to get this unboxed and set up. It was delivered to the entrance of our home and we unboxed it and got it down a hallway before setting it up on a Sunny mat. Adjusting the belt to run straight is the only part we had to revisit but the instructions on how to do this are easy to follow. The actual moving surface is narrow so we both find ourselves very attentive to keeping our strides on the straight and narrow. Using the built in programs is easy. Mostly I follow a Peloton app class and my guy does his own program. Important for us was the size of the treadmill and the fold up ease, both of which we are happy with.

A little awkward to remove from box. Packaged with that cheap styrofoam that leaves particles everywhere so be prepared for that.
Assembly was straightforward and easy.
The folding is easy, however the wheels on the frame are mostly obstructed by the corners of the metal they are mounted in, making moving this unit over carpet a little more difficult - would be better if these wheels were exposed more.
The Bluetooth audio function is mediocre at best. The volume doesnât get loud enough, and it is tinny, with zero bass to back it up. When youâre running at speed you might as well get a higher power Bluetooth boombox or use earbuds because I gave up trying to listen to music over the sound of the motor/belt/my feet, after about one song.
The incline function is nice, however a little slow to change.
Overall not bad. Maybe a little overpriced, Iâd like to see this model at the $600-even range.
Running and walking on it is nice however, and thatâs of course the main reason I bought it so Iâll give it four stars.

This is a very nice and easy to use treadmill. Itâs very heavy and hard to move once assembled because the rear raises up when you try to lift up on the back to roll around it on its front wheels, so you end up dragging it around on the rear skids. We put a small rug under the back, then lifted up on the front in order to skid it around the house. Here is what I do like, the unit can be moved from room to room because it is narrow enough to slide through standard 30 inch doorways inside the home. I highly recommend this treadmill, itâs very quiet and itâs the perfect size for my 5ft 5in wife, whether she walks or jogs.

So after many weeks of looking at various options, I decided to order this treadmill from Amazon. I've been using it average 3 times per week for about 3 months and I have no regrets! It runs very smoothly, the incline works like a charm. I'm not a huge runner but I walk using the max incline for 30-40 min at a time and I always feel great afterwards, no knee or ankle pain. The belt is decently long/wide for me. My husband is 6'1" and he also has no problem using it. I have done intervals of running on it as well and that was comfortable too.
The only thing I would say to consider ahead of time is that this is pretty heavy. When the box came to our house it was difficult for my husband and I to carry inside. We were putting it in our basement and had to take all the pieces out of the box to fit them down the stairs. The main large piece is super heavy and we struggled a bit to get it down the stairs. But once we had everything where it needed to be, the set-up was very easy.
We did receive a small bottle of belt lubricant but I just ordered more online because I noticed the belt not running as smoothly (which is expected with how frequently we use it).
Overall I am super happy with this purchase. I think it's a very nice at home treadmill for the price.

Iâm not sure how this product got this many likes and one of the reason for me purchasing this product. This treadmill have program like prog1, prog2 which is stupid also the programs work dumb. My wife complained of having statics when working on this treadmill which is really bad. Iâm going to return this item.

We use this product to excercise at least three times per week. It was easy to set up. It is easy to operate. There are workout programs that are pre-set; however, we usually program it manually. I have only elevated the machine 5% but it goes higher. In my opinion, it is not a cheaply made product. Itâs sturdy and works well. We are satisfied with our purchase. It seems to be worth the money we paid for it. I purchased the mat you see in the picture separately from Amazon.

We had it out of the box and set up ready to go within 10 minutes. Treadmill is sturdy. Bluetooth is nice. Speakers are not the best quality, but when you start up the treadmill it goes unnoticed. My only real complaint is thay when you finish a workout it disappears on the screen immediately.. we adjusted by taking a picture to review it. Definitely worth the price.

This is a nice, heavy duty, treadmill with good features and it runs very quietly. It is very heavy, but the assembly was minimal and very easy. If you have carpet, it isn't easy to move, so get the box in the room where you want it and assemble from there! Love the push button incline and it's a good length, at least for two 5'8" people. Bluetooth works ok for phone. We had one speaker that was not working when it came, but the company did respond to emails and are sending a new one to try to fix it. Not like they are any kind of fancy speakers anyway, so you can always use your own speaker for music. Folds up easily and has a slow release and drop to put down. We are very happy with this purchase and the sturdiness of this treadmill.

I bought this treadmill over a month ago. I wanted to wait and use it before I wrote a review. I am very happy with this item. It came in perfect condition. Easy ten minute set up. I love all the features. The speed and incline controls are located perfectly. A large easy to read display gives me all the information I need when exercising. The instructions for adjusting and lubricating the belt are clear and easy to do. It is very quiet. I can listen to the radio or watch tv with normal volume. Incline motor is very quiet. I am 5' 8" tall and the walking area is perfect for me. I do not know how it would work for a very tall person with a long stride. I would recommend this product.

I received my new treadmill two days ago. My son, as usual, took charge of the assembly, with me holding things in place while he worked. He is one of those people who always reads the instructions before assembling or using any item. He was thrilled with the packaging, labelling and written instructions. He said he had never seen anything like it. Most of the time the packaging and instructions look like an afterthought, and the writing appears to be mistranslated, just gibberish. Not so with these. These are very clearly written.
The treadmill itself is sturdy enough for my purposes. I need daily cardio. There are enough controls to allow me to vary my workout, and there are niceties like cup holders, a tablet or phone slot, speakers, etc. The footprint isn't huge, but the machine is big enough for my 6' son to use. I am very happy with this purchase.

I love this little treadmill so hard! I wanted something for getting my steps and I wanted an incline to get a good workout. I'm 5.5" and I don't think this would be the right machine if I was taller than 5.10 or if I had a very long gait, but this works perfect for me and I am constantly impressed! I've had it for about a month now and I'm in love!

The assembly for the Sunny T7515 treadmill was quick and easy. everything about this machine was made to be easy and simple to follow. But don't be fooled just because it's easy to assemble and a breeze to run. It's definitely built strong and I love all the features this treadmill has to offer. you get all the bells and whistles without the cost. It is everything you said it would be, and much more. I would definitely recommend this product to all my friends and family

Great I'm so Happy ! I'm always hesitant about leaving reviews about a product until I have had it for awhile I have had this tread mill for over a month and I love it!, great price and good quality, & incline is good really good! I mean it's not like nordictrack or Jullian Micheals treadmill- crazy steep. but its high enough trust me. I wanted auto incline but every tread mill I looked at was so expensive.. i used a offer amazon had for a credit card and got $150 off the price! got the 3 year protection plan from asurion and I have made the best choice in a long time. this is a great product if your on the fence go for it! Norwegian Spa Easton Pa.

The design of this machine makes it impossible for regular sized people to enjoy a work-out without falling. The handles are too short and there're buttons on them, so you couldn't hold on to them for support. YOu wouldn't be able to hold on to the top either because it's too short.

Easier than expected installation, professional GYM panel features, suitable belt area (width is important), so easy to sync to Bluetooth, auto incline, easy belt balance adjustment, very stable on the ground with reasonable weight, 750w wattage is not high, good quality and good price!
The package is heavy about 150lb (?), delivery guys are nicely placed it inside the room. A small bottle of the lubricate in the pkg is not enough. Before the delivery come in, get more 100% silicon lubricate with applicator tube and floor pad ready.
Enjoy.

The only problem I have with it is that the pulse monitor is inconsistent. Sometimes it doesn't start tracking until you're almost ready to get off. I bought the service plan when I bought the treadmill, but when I called them to come out, they said they couldn't come out until my seller's warranty was up. So I called the seller, and a very nice lady tried to give me instructions on how to take the console apart to make sure the wires were connected (and since everything else works I doubted this was the problem), but I told her that I am a senior and can't do jobs like that. Believe it or not, she actually told me to bring the treadmill in to be checked out. So if I can't take apart the console how can I left the treadmill and hike it down a flight of stairs, not to mention fitting it in a car. Anyway, I need a pulse monitor as I have to watch my heart rate, so I stay hooked up to my BP monitor, which also tells me my pulse. This is a good value for the money, except for that.

I looked for a solid week for a treadmill with an automatic incline AND could fold to move that wouldnât cost me $800 and this was the perfect purchase. It operates smoothly and is quality made. Could not have been easier to assemble- unpacking from the box was harder than actual assembly. Nice sturdy frame and works perfectly! So easy to move around if you need to move it as well. Could not find a better deal than this with an auto incline.

After 2 weeks of use it seems solid so far. Not loud and it is very easy to operate. The quick speed and incline selects are convenient and more so the controls on the arms. Love the Bluetooth for audio and the speakers are decent, not tinny, though I haven't tried at high volumes. Two bottle holders are good - one for the bottle and the other for your phone. The phone does not rattle when running. The unit is quite heavy so you definitely need an extra pair of hands to move up or down steps. Overall happy with the purchase to date.

I was very excited to finally receive my machine, days after the delivery date. The instructions were fairly straightforward and there were not too many steps to assemble. The problem was that the motor cover pre-assembled came broken in many spots. The manual said to contact the company before returning the machine. My husband placed this call only to be told to send an email. I have sent NUMEROUS emails as well as pictures of the damage and have never heard anything back from them. If you are paying full price for an undamaged treadmill, do not purchase from this company. They obviously do not stand behind their products. The one star is the result of their professionalism.

After 11 months of moderate use, the buttons on the console refused to start the belt or raise/lower the running surface. So I called the support number listed, and much to my surprised, was connected directly to a support person without going thru the typical voice mail tree.
Steven was knowledgable and walked me through a couple simple diagnostics. (Hope you have a philips screwdriver ;-) ). He was patient and easy to talk to. Sent me a followup email of things I could try and asked me to call back after I did. After stepping thru, I found the problem and everything is working again.
Lets be clear, if you buy a treadmill for less than $1k, don't expect the same durability that you see at your local gym. But to get support at this price point is amazing. Bet you don't even get this level of support if you buy the $5k treadmills.

I used the sheet music stand from my keyboard to hold my laptop. The only thing I didn't really care for is the holder does not support my laptop in pad mode. Best treadmill for under 700 in my opinion.
Pros
Decent track size
Auto incline
Simple
Hand rail incline and speed adjustments
Feels pretty sturdy for price
The lip to hold a rack to hold my laptop
Easy adjustment to track
Easy to assemble. 10min
It is quite compared to others in this price range
Bluetooth in the case of a mid work out call
Cons
The speakers are really bad, not that I would ever use them. Maybe for calls only.
It does take some time out of box to adjust track to say centered. Minor set back.

I read quite a few reviews on many different treadmills including this one and was sold on the speed of delivery, the ease of construction and the soft drop feature. Let me not forget the Bluetooth and aux cord capabilities as well! I read that this one doesn't compare to gym models, but the compact and slim design are perfect for the home environment! I actually love the slender look of the belt. When you're running and/or walking, you don't want to be all over the place, and this slender design keeps you in place easily.
My only drawback, when you are in a good running stride, you have to make sure you're not too close to the front of the treadmill, otherwise, your balled swinging fists, will hit the arm grips, and OUCH! Lol. Also, the display flickers when you jog/run. Other than these few things, I'm quite satisfied with my purchase.

I bought this treadmill on 12/12/2020. Today 3/31/2021, the screen is already defective. Since day one, whenever you touch any metal part of it, it shocks you back, when you place your phone in order to listen to music there is static noise. The return window through Amazon closed on 3/16/2021. This treadmill has been barely used and it has been used with extreme care; therefore I am afraid this is only the beginning of many other issues. I have contacted Sunny Health & Fitness directly with the hope that they will allow me to return it and be issued a refund. I will be contacting Amazon as well to see if they can make an exception and extend the return window. Wish me luck!

Fitbit gifts has gotten everyone motivated to "get their steps in" this year. Living in Florida and being in our 60's, walking around in the summer, or rain, or when mosquitos are dive bombing you can be an uncomfortable experience that can quickly drain your motivation.
I did not want to spend an arm and a leg, but I did want a treadmill that had a good amount of incline, but I wanted incline that I could change on the fly without getting off and having to make adjustments manually like a lot of decent treadmills have. After days of research and reading reviews, I decided on the Sunny Health & Fitness 7515.
It has a ton of great features. Heck, I don't even care I can sync my phone to it through Bluetooth, answer it and talk through the built in microphone, or play music through the built in speakers. Two large cup/bottle holders is a great plus! Easy to read display, and the ability to control incline and speed from either the keypad itself or buttons on the hand rails. It's pretty darn quiet for a treadmill that is under $500. Mine is in a carpeted bedroom, and also sits on a basic treadmill pad, and when it is running you can barely hear it in other rooms when the door is closed. I like to watch TV when I'm walking, and even with my old ears, I don't have to turn the TV up load to hear it over the treadmill. It has 12 built in programs that will change the speed and incline of your workout, and 3 blank programs you can set up yourself. The level 3 program kicked my butt.
Assembly was really easy. The toughest part is getting it out of the box. It folds very easily as well, and when you "kick" the leg to drop it, it drops VERY slowly which is nice and "safe". The "rollers" seem more designed for a hard floor or a very low pile carpet. It didn't want to roll on the mat sitting on a carpet. One thing I will state is go to the manufacturer's web site. They have some videos that you may find helpful. Specifically on how to lubricate the belt for the first time. The instruction booklet was kind of vague on it, but the video was very specific on how to do it.
So far, this product has lived up to the positive reviews I have read on Amazon. Based on the negative feedback I have read, I recommend you carefully read and follow the instructions carefully. There are video's on the website, and the instruction booklet has instructions for the most common issues, such as the belt sliding to one side. Mine has not done that yet, but if it does, I know what to do to fix it! :) Seriously, this is a great product for the price.

Perfect addition to our garage gym. If there is one positive thing to come out of the year 2020 for me-it is that I have a fully functional garage gym now. The treadmill completed the gym. Now I can easily do my street parking workouts-no need to sub running when itâs raining or smoky (from wildfires) outside.
Treadmill looked intimidating to set up. However once I removed all the items from the box, it took only about 30 minutes to put together.
I have used for a week thus far-with a mixture of walking/jogging/sprinting. Works great.
Water bottle fits perfectly-does move slightly when running, but not a distraction. Phone sits on tray near screen. Phone does slightly cover screen, not bothersome to me though.
The incline isnât as high as I would have liked, but for the price it is perfect. The incline still creates a great burn.
The OCD in me would prefer when you hit âstopâ that the timer stop counting. Instead you hit stop and the time/distance continues until the belt has stopped moving.
Pros: affordable, can now walk/run indoors, easy to set up, footprint doesnât take up much space, can pause and restart where you left off, auto-incline (much preferred over manual incline), spot to put phone/iPad if watching program.
Cons: shipping was a disaster (no fault of amazon or Sunny), would prefer to not have incline/speed on the handles (if Iâm sprinting I prefer to grab the handles when stopping).

First I appreciate the supplier for getting it to me faster than expected. Extra cudos for that. It is good to work out on. It has time working out, distance, calories used, pulse (pulse reading might be off sometimes). I would hope like to pass on and stress to be sure NOT to release the belt strap before assembly. It snapped open and added 30 minutes to set up. Otherwise I would guess about 15-20 minutes to set up. It is a little narrow and less supportive than gym machines but they probably cost about $2000 + more. You can hear your footsteps while listening to music and being a little narrow, a grade of A. If compared to a gym machine costing $2500 or more A-.

Received with a gash on the side and it didn't work. Went to contact company but it said I would have to pay for return shipping, got someone to look at it and a plug had come loose I assume during shipping. Now it works. Although the gash is cosmetic it is on the right top running board so it is very noticeable. all in all it does what its supposed to do but I will read a little more closely next time.

This treadmill arrived the other week very quickly (a day earlier than expected) and the poor delivery man helped bring it in for me because of how heavy it was. After that I was very nervous to assemble since it's only me, but the hardest part was getting it in and opening it all up and getting the parts out of the box. It's doable to put together alone but definitely easier with another person. I was impressed with how little I had to do to screw in everything - it's basically 75% already put together for you. I really like the incline and speed options - it is very straightforward and for the price you pay worth it, and I like how narrow it is so it can fit nicely along a wall even in the smallest of spaces. Only complaints so far are is it is pretty loud as I walk and it gets louder the more I incline but nothing some headphones can't fix to try to tune it out. Also it is extremely heavy, again to move alone, and the wheels are kind of useless, but it is easy to fold up and fold down. And to note, I bought this the week of 1/4, and the following week after it arrived I saw it was marked down substantially. Now checking today it is even more so. Perhaps if you are ready to pull the trigger here, just give it another week or so because of the price fluctuations. Amazon couldn't credit me back for about 80 bucks difference which was upsetting, however all in all this is a great purchase that I enjoy using, especially working from home!

Ordered this because I weighed 224 lbs and wanted a wide enough walking path. I also liked what I read about assembly. I can't blame any antics from the delivery guys. It's not cool to be able to ship this assembly but it was almost on my porch and it's no worse for wear because it's actually a good product. I don't ask much. I walk on it for about a mile, fold it back up. The hydraulics are impressively smooth when pulling the deck down or lifting it up. I put moving pads under it to be able to push it around the hardwood floor. Haven't used incline or Bluetooth yet but I haven't needed to. I'm glad I got it. It's adequately powered, comfortable for my size and weight and I feel safe on it. I surf the web on my phone and walk and I have not been dissapointed.

This is a solid purchase for the price. It is relatively easy to assemble (some of the pieces didn't line up correctly and required some manhandling to make it work), it is easy to use, and it feels solid. The thing I truly love is the auto incline adjustment. I can't imagine having to do that manually.
Main issue is the sound system. Terrible to say the least. Speakers buzz unless you adjust cord just right (and then the vibration from running will get it out of whack again). The sound controls on the treadmill do not work, and the sound is generally bad. For me, not a deal-breaker. Just disappointing. Also, there is an occasional squeaking in the treadmill that is irritating but, again, not a problem so far. One thing to be aware of, though. The track is narrow. It is fine for me and my daughter, but my husband hits the sides pretty regularly.
Like I said, fine for the price. But all three of agree that next purchase will be a big upgrade. We wanted to test the treadmill-use waters, and this was a great first purchase.

So far I like it. I run and walk. I have noticed with use, a little more creaking/noise but it comes and goes and it's not too overly bothersome to me. It sounds more creaky at the lower speeds I've included a video for any one interested. I've had it for a little over a month now, both my husband and myself use it. My husband is about 220lbs and I am 175llbs. I like the controls on the handles for both incline and speed. Phone connects and you can make calls. My mom said it wasn't too loud on her side. I also like the length and width, it's not too big or too small. Hope the review helps you make your choice! Happy shopping!

Revised. Amazon sent me wrong model. The review below is for the smaller model
Iâm 6â0â 230lbs and was looking for a treadmill to walk on so I didnât need all the bells and whistles.
Be careful w weight limit. Advertised as 240 max limit but machine has a warning of 220 max
Pros:
Light weight, brought down the basement by myself
Easy to assemble - took 20 min
Seems pretty sturdy and fold up easy
Cons:
At my size and weight I would not feel comfortable running on it
Water bottle holders are useless, poor design
In my opinion if you are under 200lbs and want something simple I would recommend. This machine seems well built but does not offer the bells and whistles more expensive machines offer

Sturdy built. Very heavy. At this price one pf the very few machine which has auto incline, that too 3% to 12%. Work flawlessly but makes little mpre sound when you have incline >3% and speed is 6+ miles / hour.
Other than that no issues at all. Bluetooth connectivity and easy handle controls. Recommended if you donât want to spend more on a home gym.

Update: LOVE the auto incline!!!! Love the speed adjustability. Sturdy! Quieter than expected. Bluetooth sound is not loud at all. Heart rate is incorrect. Original post: So far this treadmill exactly what I was looking for! It arrived 2 days early!!!! It was very easy to unbox and assemble. I think it took 40 minutes to an hour from the time we started and boxing until it was set up. Itâs small enough to tuck away in a corner, but plenty large and sturdy to walk on. The soft drop system is great. Love the monitor. The only thing we found difficult was rolling it after folding. I thought it was white, but it is light gray.

Espere tener al menos un mes usandola para dejar un comentario, la mejor compra que he hecho soy muy TOC con eso de buscar productos y debo estar 10000% segura de la compra despues de ver precios, caracteristicas y opiniones, cuando empece a buscar en noviembre una caminadora buscaba algo bonito que se viera real y resistente y que tuviera velocidad e inclinacion, ya que las de gym son muy bellas pero son 4 veces el costo y ni hablar del tamaÃ±o! esta entro completa en mi hab. Materiales de buena calidad, muy buena calidad, habia visto muchas que parecian de plastico ngreo brillante d ejuguete con decir que no pesaban y eso me asustaba, ya que es muy mecanismo que debe ser pesado y resistente. La recomiendo es buena solucion calidad precio.

I wanted a quarantine treadmill and didnât want to spend a ton on it. This guy did the trick. It works well and I was able to assemble it completely on my own. I donât use the speaker so I canât speak to that but everything else is great!

I bought this treadmill in Dec and I have been using it regularly. It's everything I wanted, I love the speed controls and incline. It's relatively quiet for a treadmill. I wish it was easier to move around but it's just so big and heavy and the wheels are tiny but that's really my only complaint about it.
It does fold up nicely and I like that it has a slow drop for it to unfold, otherwise it could be dangerous with pets or children. It came quickly, was well packaged. Definitely a great value!
Update: It started making a rattling noise today,barely 3 months in. I contacted Amazon and they're going to let me return but I'm getting screwed out of $100 in the process. Don't buy this piece of crap.

Really wanted to give this five stars but there is one thing holding me back...and thatâs speed.
Everything else is great. Itâs smooth, easy to use, great features with auto incline. My only complaint is that it only goes up to 8mph. Most other treadmills in its class go up to 10 mph. At a top speed of 8 mph it just doesnât quite give me what I need when interval training. Feels like a fast jog. The only saving grace is that it goes up to 12% incline so that helps make the 8mph feel faster. If I had to redo it I would have purchased one that went at least 10mph. I believe this is a huge deciding factor. Now if your a person who walks or jogs only then this is a great treadmill and you wonât be disappointed.

Bought it recently (a month or so) and so far it doing good. Assembly will require 2 people die to its weight and itâs pretty straight forward. I use it 2-3 times a day and it works just fine. It doesnât look branded though but does it job. I expect a better finish of the product and possibly a hand rest close to the screen for those who does hardcore jogging or speed walking. provides more support IMO.
At this time needs zero stars. Wish I could write a review. Delivered without bolts to assemble and don't see anywhere can report problems???

It should be 0 stars. I bought this because the reviews were good and I wanted a more budget friendly option. This came in and seemed fine. It's a bit narrower than most treadmills but fine for our tight space. I set it up and was excited for my first run. The screen seemed cheap but as expected for the price. Everything worked fine until about 1/3 mile and it died as if I pulled the emergency cable. I reset it and started again. The screen was starting to bleed a bit. I could still read it but something was off. I tried to run again and it jammed again after about a quarter mile or so. I reset it and this was the screen. No physical damage and it was completely fried. I tried everything and then had to send back and fight for my refund. It was a pain in the ass to repackage and haul back up from the basement with my wife. Didn't even make it a full mile before dead.
