Spend the extra $200 and get the Nordic Trac option that I've been very happy with.

The bels constantly needs adjustment and it staggers. It drifts to the right within a few minutes on running and makes wired noises . I am requesting to have it returned as I am unsure of my safety if I continue to use it.

It's hard to find a treadmill at a decent price that has auto incline and not manual. The only problem I'm having, is that belt keeps drifting to one side when I'm on it. I've gone through the adjustment procedures several times, but you can't be on it while adjusting, so it straightens out when no one is on it. You get back on it, it drifts again. Getting frustrated!

I just got it last week and I put two and a half hours on it, easy to assemble, but heavy to move around, I doubt it only weighs 108 pounds, it took me a while to get it in place. It is definitely loud and also no cushion at all, but way merciful than the concrete curb, love the automatic incline it is the way to go. DO NOT BUY MANUAL INCLINE, you will regret it, as for longevity we will see, all in all I recommend this treadmill.

I love my Sunny Health & Fitness treadmill! It was fairly easy (with two people) to assemble the treadmill. It has all the features I was looking for without being too techy. The Bluetooth speaker will do in a pinch, but I choose to use my own speaker. If you need a very good home treadmill, this is it!

Its ok. its got great features for the price. the auto incline and blue tooth are great. My issue is my unit has a long drag and pull until you get over 2.5 mph. I like to walk on an incline and do little low speed circuits so this is not an option for me as it pulls and jerks me until i am at 3 mph. So if you are a speed walker or runner this is probably great. If you are a walker/lunger you may want to spend a bit more.

Very disappointed- I received my treadmill on Thursday, and hired a professional to put it together. However, neither the handy man, my husband or me were able to turn it on. We also tried the tips on YouTube from Sunny to get it to work. I called the company 5 or 6 times, and the phone continued to ring. My husband sent an email to customer service on Thursday. They responded asking for more information. I sent the information over, still havenât received any feedback, and have a brand new broken treadmill on my hands.

Overall this unit has worked well. Iâm primarily using it for walking and will not be returning it. Three primary issues however: 1) Noise: when elevating the treadmill squeaks like an old Ford truck with rusty springs. Itâs like the shocks need lubricating. It doesnât happen when level, only at elevation. 2) The treadmill is a little narrow and a little short for someone with longer legs. This was my first treadmill so I didnât know that would be an issue. 3) Not a big deal, but the treadmill squeaks so much that I canât turn the speakers up loud enough to hear the movies or the news Iâm watching while using it. The company requested a video of the problem which I sent. Still waiting to hear back. Itâs not the motor, itâs the âshocksâ. I need to take it into Grease Monkey for a lube.

I was unable to assemble the treadmill due to non-matching holes for the screws. See the photos. Called the manufacturer the same day I received it, since I didnât want to return the item to Amazon. The Manufacturer confirmed the defective craftsmanship, they said itâs due to âincorrect welding.â They said that they did not have a replacement part in stock and it would take a month or two for them to ship it to me. After getting the replacement part, the treadmill would need to be taken apart, the wires reconnected, etc.
Aside from the above defect (which makes this treadmill dysfunctional), there were other issues as well. The LCD monitor was angled in a way that the info on it was only visible if you are super short. Iâm 5â10â and was unable to read anything on it unless I leaned down significantly. Also, the treadmill base was not centered with its âlegs.â One leg had more space from the base than the other.
Therefore we decided to return the treadmill and purchased a more expensive brand.

I do not notice any issues with the treadmill as of yet but clearly it's been dropped or something prior to being delivered. I'm a visual person so the damage is annoying to look at daily but the treadmill works fine..... For right now.

I ordered this treadmill for my friend who wanted to get into shape. The damn thing BROKE on her third run! Sheâs by no means a tall person, nor is she heavy enough to fully break a treadmill on a light jog. She was thrown nearly clean off the treadmill and the company wonât replace it, only want to send parts and have her try to repair the machine herself. Waste of money, pick a different treadmill.

After reading alot of reviews I was nervous to buy a treadmill on line.. I really wanted to see it in person.
I was really nervous but once our package came in I was happy to see all the extra protection and care that was given to make sure our treadmill was perfect. It didn't take long for my husband to get it up and running. Love the incline,looks great... if I had to get picky I would say the belt is not as wide as our last one and the speakers on the tread mill sound like broken tweeters. We are excited to put it in good use. Over all I'm happy with our pick.

I love this treadmill! I researched treadmills that were under $600.00 and this was the one I liked best. It has auto incline, speed goes up to 8 MPH, has pre-programmed workouts, and can connect to your phone so you can listen to music through the speakers.
I ordered through Prime and had it in 2 days. My boyfriend got it down to the basement and said it only took a few minutes and a couple of screws to get it together.
I did notice the belt seemed a bit loose and was kind of was a trip hazard (especially for klutzy me), so he did tighten it up. It still seems a bit loose but he said it's fine.
Very easy to unfold and fold up when storing.
Overall, very happy with this purchase as it exactly what I wanted.

Arrived late package was 2 weeks late it was lost and I had to cancel it and reorder. They have me 10% refund and $80 gift card only toward Amazon brand items only. Once I got it I was so happy it was super easy to assemble there is only 6 screws nothing else the rest is put together in one box. So donât hire anyone. Amazon also has a number you can call to get âexpert assembly helpâ for free once you get the item the option will appear in Amazon app to have them call you. What I did not like is that the belt had few weird lines on it probably from package making an imprint they said it will smooth out as I use it we will see. Does not look cheep and itâs very quite you canât hear when it is turned on or being used!!

I was researching for a treadmill for months. I wanted something with an automatic incline, inexpensive, durable and reliable. I'm a review reader so I decided to go with this treadmill.
Here's my thoughts: Delivery was great it actually came a day early. I can't speak on the assembly because my husband put it together while I was out. The only thing he mentioned was it was small. He's 5"8 and I'm 5"0 it works perfectly for me.
I tried to attached some pictures so that you can kinda get a look of the actual size of the treadmill. The treadmill isn't loud when it's running but when I walk it tends to be slightly loud and that could be because of my weight. . . IDK. The pulse rate monitor so far is okay but you have to have the palms of your hands flat and gripping the handles for an accurate reading. I wear my Fitbit so that's not a biggie for me. The display screen is bright and visiable no complaints there. I added a picture to show you where I place my tablet in front of the display screen. I love all the extra amenities such as the bluetooth, the volume is loud and the sound is clear. The bottle holders are wide enough for my phone, keys, and bottle of water. The treadmill is easy to move and fold.
Working out on this treadmill is easy. You can use the 10 pre-programs that's preset or personalize your own. The incline is great! I'm happy with this product thus far, I've only been using it for a week consistently.

I was looking for a quality treadmill for a reasonable price. I don't need anything fancy and if my husband was going to use it, it needed to meet the 250 lb mark. This treadmill fits the bill and I'm pleased with my choice. Don't use the speakers though. My iPhone sounds just fine and the treadmill was designed for exercise not sound quality.

Itâs nice. It works. I purchased NEW however I believe Iâve received USED âGOODâ. Not sure, trying to see what can be done. Itâs a nice size but it is heavy to bring in the house. Due to COVID-19 deliveries this size are left outside or picked up. Broken plastic all around, dents and rust on bars. Smooth and very nice but NOT NEW.

Great treadmill for me! Iâve had it for about 3 weeks, Iâve used it everyday for about 30-45 minutes at a time and itâs done all Iâve expected. Love the controls on the handles for incline and speed. I am also 6â0 and I have no issues with it being too short. In my opinion, you canât beat this treadmill for the price.

Hope treadmill last? So far doing well. No issues. Folds very easily, incline is great feature! LCD display with back light. Motor is not loud. Setup Bluetooth was a breeze. I use treadmill for power walks and intense jogging. I'm 6.0' 220lbs. Have done walking with long strides with no issues for me. Delivery was great! No issues. Easy to assemble in 20 minutes. Was looking for treadmill that would not take up much space and within my budget.
Update 1-18-21: I have no complaints about the treadmill. It's still working well and definitely worth the purchase.

Update! After a week of using everyday an annoying Click got worse and worse the MFG seemed overwhelmed so Amazon is sending a new one.
Love the fact their not pushing me to buy a iFit membership. When I use my bike I read a book and when I treadmill I watch GMA, don't need to pay every month for some membership. I passed on the ProForm treadmills because of this. I purchased a ProForm recumbent bike for our Florida Place thinking it was going to be like the one I purchased several years ago. The thing came with some useless built in programs that had absolutely no information. Had to find out by trial and error that there were no programs suitable for rehabbing my knee. The Sunny Health & Fitness SF-T7515 by contrast came with 12 programs that are well documented and cover a wide range of difficulty. The SF-T7515 was super easy to assemble (like 6 bolts and 4 screws) and seems super rugged. I've only done one workout out so far but it was smooth and quiet. I love the automated incline and how its implemented in the programs. If I have had to change one thing it would be to make the grip bars round or more rounded than they are. Other than that for the money I think this is a great treadmill for the average person. Definitely thinking about checking out their recumbent exercise bikes as I can still return the ProForm!

I am enjoying this treadmill. It was easy to assemble, doesn't take up a lot of room and seems pretty sturdy. I like having the speaker built in, one less item I need to remember to grab. It's easy to get started, while it is programmable, I prefer to adjust speed and incline on my own. I also like the pause button, it picks right back up after hitting start so you don't lose your place. I read a Kindle while walking and wish the tray area was up a tad bit higher ( I am 5'5). I also wish the incline and speed buttons on the bars weren't there, I hit them on accident frequently. All in all, good product for the price.

This treadmill is exactly what I was looking for. For a treadmill under $500 it has a lot of bells and whistles. It is heavy as expected but very easy to assemble with only four bolts to insert and very stable when in use. I use it daily to walk 3 miles. It operates really well with no glitches. I really like the time, distance and calorie counter modes where it shuts down when you reach your alotted goals. In addition the user designed programs are handy and easy to set. It does MPH in the US and not KPH as some units do. I would highly recommend this product.

Great compact treadmill. Gets the job done. Not super quiet but has enough features to get a good work out in. Great price point. My husband is 250lbs and he uses it just fine. Easy to assemble because itâs pretty much ready to go out of the box besides screwing some foot holders on the bottom. Easy to fold up for storage.

I live in AZ and so 4 months out of the year it is too hot to do anything physical outdoors, so my walking every day 4 miles is stalled, I bought this treadmill knowing it will be a nice substitute. I was pleasantly surprised, it a very nice machine, having all of the bells and whistles of the ones costing 3 times as much. I would recommend it to anyone.

Love it!!!
Sunny Health & Fitness SF-T7515
When I first put it together, I plugged it in and turned the power on, and the screen was blank, it wouldnât do anything. I turned the power off unplugged it, and took the two screws out and found the wire that had came apart, put it back together and it has been working good since then, that was just about one week ago. I really like the looks of this treadmill, I did a lot of research before choosing this one, but Iâm glad I did it has so many features that I wanted in a treadmill like speakers, auto incline, big cup holders, a place to put, your keys, phone, also a place for your tablet. I like the big display, all the features, the pause on it, heart rate. Itâs very heavy duty, sturdy, and quite. I also like the safety feature on it. Even if it quit working I would want to exchange it for the same one, it has everything I wanted in a treadmill for the price, I donât think you could beat it.

I received the treadmill. It is heavy and unpacking wasn't easy though its assembly was simple. The main problem was from day one that the power switch cannot be turned off! I have to unplug the power cable to turn it off. Amazon was nice enough to give me a $50 credit. Anyone I call says they want $200 to fix. I contacted the manufacturer through their email. They responded after 3 weeks only saying "give us the part number". What is that supposed to mean? I sent them the part number for the power switch from their diagram. They have not responded again. But how is that going to help me? I don't know how to replace the power switch. I wish I could return it. But how am I supposed to pack and return its when I can hardly move it? And am I supposed to unpack and reassemble? I had to pay the janitor in the apartment building $20 just to help me carry it to my apartment.
My recommendation is to avoid buying the treadmill or anything else from this manufacturer.
Very simple to use and serves its purpose.. until it doesnât. It lasted 2 1/2 years. (Go figure, the warranty was for 2.) The start button stopped working. Itâs kind of an important button.

This machine is awesome, love the idea of Bluetooth so can listen to your favorite music while walking working out , speaker in it isnât bad at all , love the incline by a button , east to set up , I did it all by myself female ,the main walking board folds up easily and put down , all I can say is itâs works awesome am very happy of my purchase, it also came in a big box and was very heavy , and received 3 days after I ordered it .. love that , Thanks Amazon

Love this and use it almost every day. The only reason Iâm giving it 1 star is because of the huuuuuuge security flaw I discovered. The Bluetooth has no password (that I can find), do anyone can connect to it. I discovered this when I heard random music blasting through the speakers, not my music. With the treadmill having a microphone, thereâs a risk of someone being able to tap in and listen to your conversations without you knowing. And there was no way for me to disconnect the strangerâs speaker, so I had to unplug the entire thing. Leave it unplugged when. It in use to help mitigate this issue. This huuuuuuuge security issue.

This is a no frills treadmill that also allows for incline and is the best priced unit for incline capabilities. While not recommended, I was able to slide the treadmill downstairs by myself and put it together in 30 mins - 1hr. The unit was mostly pre-assembled and setup was a breeze. Sure this treadmill doesnt have a fancy colored screen that shows images of you running through downtown San Francisco, but who really needs that to get their cardio in? I've only had the unit for 1 month so I cannot speak to the durability, but based on other reviews I expect support on this to be pretty sufficient. If you need a treadmill that just works, I highly recommend this treadmill!

I bought this to get a few additional steps in a day and i really like it. With working 100% remote right now i'm not moving as much as i did when i was in the office and traveled. In the evening i'll go on it for 20 to 30 minutes and listen to a podcast. I don't run on it so i can't say how it would perform with running but for getting steps in and using the Incline to get your heart rate up - it works perfect for me.

I needed a new treadmill, one with automatic incline. I researched machines on-line and in-store for about 3 months until I finally decided on this one. I read all the reviews, some were lemons but most were positive. It was easy to set up, it is smaller than the last one which is great due to my limited space, it is quiet compared to the last one and it seems to be an "easier" walk. So far I love this machine and would recommend it.

Did a lot of research before I purchased this. Rated one of the top ten treadmills for the $.Has auto incline button. Others you have to adjust on your hands and knees. Wanted to have something close to what I had in cardio rehab.Works for me. I suggest do your research for what your needs are.ð

Impressive! Excellent value, I thought I had to spend 4 figures on a decent treadmill. Of course itâs not as nice as the gym, but for the money itâs about twice what I expected. I donât use the speaker and Bluetooth functionality and never will, so no info there. Assembly about as easy as it could be. Lifetime who knows, I worry about breakdowns and having this stuck in the basement, but so far awesome. Electronic grade is a huge plus.

I loved my Sunny treadmill for the past 9 months! I had a great routine going and itâs been an awesome treadmill this past year. Then one day the screen quit working. It comes on fine and then turns black. I am trying to ignore it... the blue tooth still works but itâs sparks now. I tried contacting Sunny and they have yet to respond back. Iâm really disappointed. Iâm currently shopping for a new treadmill. I wouldnât recommend this treadmill.

This treadmill works perfectly! I opted for it to be delivered in my threshold. My husband was able to easily install it. My only suggestion is be sure you have someone to help you move it. Getting it downstairs was really tough. Itâs heavy and doesnât fully fold.

I had read all the reviews, and hoped I would have no problems with this treadmill like others have. When the 1st one arrived it worked fine for a week, after it started making a noise, which within a few more uses it got louder, and more constant. There was something wrong with the motor. I contacted Sunny Health, and their customer service is horrible, and did nothing to help me out (the reviews are right). Amazon send me a replacement, and the replacement arrived damaged with broken parts. I contact them again, they weren't much help, so I called Amazon, and ask for my refund. The replacement was scheduled to be picked up on a scheduled date, and they didn't show up, so I had to reschedule for another pickup date. Sometimes we give the benefit of doubt to companies like Sunny Health, hoping our situation won't be like the bad reviews we read about, but they were right, I should of not bought it. It was not worth the time, hassel, nor the money. Sunny Health does a poor job on checking their products before sending them. They need to make sure they work properly and are not damaged.

This was easy to assemble, but getting the box down to our basement gym was a task as itâs heavy.
This is a good treadmill for the price, weâve been using it every day for about 2 weeks now with no issues.
It would be nice if the walking strip was a little wider, but then again this isnât a $2,000 treadmill either.
Weâre extremely happy with the product so far. Donât be afraid to buy it to add to or start your home gym.

It pretty much delivered assembled already. All I had to do is to stand and screw the control panel in place, centered and lubricated the belt and itâs in operation. The whole family take turns to use it.

The mechanics of the treadmill works fine. . However the treadmill mainframe is out of alignment to the support arms that prevents the treadmill to be able to fold. See photo. Over 2 weeks ago, We called Amazon support that was going to contact Sunny and call us back. We have yet to hear from anyone.

Item was as described, packaged very well to prevent damage and super easy to assemble. My wife and I have both used and the only negative would be a wish for the display to be a bit brighter. You have to be in the correct height and or distance in order to see numbers. Other than this it is so far so good
Just the worst. It was also already cracked by the time it delivered.

I would give this five stars throughout however, Iâve had this treadmill for less than a month. Used it maybe ten times. I bought it because I had a serious shoulder surgery and can walk outside or go to the gym as I canât get a sports bra on. Less than a month and about two weeks in the screen cracks. It still works so itâs not a huge deal but I paid for it, brand new and it looks used. For that kind of money I would expect the screen to last a lot longer. I havenât moved it because I canât. It stays out and down. Sometimes the crack appears to not be there and sometimes itâs huge. The crack is under the display, behind the glass. I love everything else about this treadmill. The crack is just super disappointing!

This item arrived ahead of schedule. Packaging was slightly damaged. Upon inspection, a chunk of plastic on the ramp edge was gouged out, but not anything that would affect performance, so not worth returning. Very easy to assemble, I did it largely myself with a little assist from husband to lift it out of the box and hold as I stabilized the arms. Took about 45 minutes. I would strongly advise purchasing a bottle of lubricant as the lubricant that comes with it does not go very far. Had to re-center it but I am sure after shipping, things can get a little out of whack. Re-centering was easy and covered in the instructions. All in all, a sturdy piece of equipment for my needs to get some extra steps in every day. Worth spending a little extra money for a reliable product/vendor as the first one I ordered never arrived.

The treadmill itself was a good buy, the incline feature was my most favorite. The fastest speed is just up to 8 mph so it won't be good if you're training for a speed-running. The motor itself is relatively silent whenever it is operating. The pulse sensor feature is cool but the monitor only shows the speed. Bluetooth speakers are working well though sometimes the machine needs to be turned on/off to estblish a connection. Overall, the device is easy to assemble but you may need help moving it as it is quite heavy. The major issue I had was that the end caps of the running pad as well as the motor cover was broken due to shipping (my apartment being on the second may have aggravated this). Customer service has to be improved as the contact number rarely have someone to speak with. Also, when I was able to finally talk to the customer service through phone, the first person did not follow through. To summarize I beleive the machine is a good buy but company needs to improve both their system of packaging to avoid shipping damage and their customer service needs more people so they can help more customers with their machine issues.

I couldnât believe how easy it was to assemble. It took me longer to get it out of the box than it did to assemble! The treadmill is easy to use and relatively quiet. If it doesnât break in 6 months Iâll consider it to be one of the best purchases Iâve ever made.

This was purchased to go into our family room and we needed something that was of good quality and sturdy, while compact at the same time. After looking at many other models, we decided on this one as it fit the range we were willing to spend. While not full of all sorts of bells and whistles, it is a very solid piece of equipment and has performed will for us. Everything works smoothly. It's easy to adjust speed and inclination on the fly. The only minor issue is that because it is not a super wide treadmill, the handles are in a position that they can be hit with your hands when walking (hands at side.) When running this isn't an issue with your hands held high.

This treadmill fits moderate use and does not consume much space by treadmill standards- not built for large people.
however one plastic side cover was missing and one was broken and after contacting Amazon and Sunny Health I have not heard anything and do not expect to ever get the correct and replacement parts.
Poor service from Sunny Health!
Too bad Because the treadmill works good- it just looks ugly Sunny!

I was very hesitant to buy this treadmill because of some of the bad reviews. But I am so glad I just bought it. This treadmill is great for someone who doesnât want to spend over a 1,000 bucks on treadmill. Because of COVID I wasnât able to go to the gym anymore so I brought the gym to me! This treadmill isnât top notch but it has all the features I was looking for. It has auto incline!!!! For the price itâs amazing!

I am a 78-year old male, diabetic and overweight. I live in a hilly area that is beautiful but no longer conducive to walking alone. I bought this machine to get back on the trail, so to speak. In a month's use, I have yet to stress the machine, but I have made steady progress in extending walk time and distance traveled. The machine was easy to assemble unassisted and has performed smoothly and flawlessly. My only user criticism is due to my 6'3" height. The 'handlebars" are too low for me to use comfortably for any length of time and are not adjustable. I have resorted to adding an inch of padding to the top of each bar end to make them comfortable. Other than that, I would not change a thing.

Honestly..this treadmill is great!! I pulled it into the house and set it up on my own. I did watch a you tube video on adding the lube to the belt.
I completed everything within an hour and worked out on it today. I loved it!! The speakers are loud and clear (I plugged iny iPod). The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because I do not like the buttons on the arms. I like to hold onto the arms and I kept accidentally pressing the speed buttons.
My house is small (900 sq ft) and built in 1925 so I couldn't get one that is big and heavy. This one is perfect size!
I've only had it a day so I just hope it stays this great!!

Bought this brand new treadmill thinking it will come handy for a 30mins run daily..
After diligently finishing all the steps from the 22 page user manual, turned it ON and started walking at a speed setting of 3. Noticed noise coming out of the treadmill so much that my can't hear a thing on TV , after putting max volume .
Changed my Mat, reapplied lubrication on the belt, thinking it will resolve the issue. no luck.
Tried Walking at an Incline rather than Running., noise continues. On phone for more than an hour and now Sent an email to customer support. Will keep posted as i hear more from Sunny team.

As pictured, the running area leans more to the right, which causes the sides to rub against the rails when running on it. I assume this is a assembly defect. The rubber comes off because itâs torn. The speaker has bad static. UPS did a crappy job of shipping it (damage to the box). Contacted Amazon to do a replacement (awesome customer service BTW)
Assembly was real easy... just unfold and screw together. Decent machine for decent price.

The unit in general works fine, but one of the buttons - the Stop button of all things - didn't work right out of the box. Tech support is useless. I gave them all the requested info - serial number, model, proof of purchase, etc. and all they ever did was ask for all of that info again without providing any support.
Look elsewhere if you want any support should your treadmill fail in any way!

I was looking for a middle of the road treadmill, one that auto inclines and I can run up to 7.5 mph, and I didn't want a program or membership with it. I've only used it for the past week but it met both of those requirements and so far so good. My only knock would be the sound quality for the blue tooth speakers is not good, but I can do without. And set up was a little bit of a struggle, but then again I was doing it by myself and moving around a machine that weighs the same as me so I don't fault it for my stubbornness. Overall, I would recommend it to those that want a good middle of the road treadmill.

The treadmill is fine for a good workout. However, the arm that lowers the unit into operating position broke within the first 2 weeks. We had to remove it to be able to use the treadmill. I contacted the seller for a replacement part since its still under warrantee. They had me fill out a form and submit photos of the part. I haven't heard from them for weeks and they aren't replying to my emails. Luckily, Amazon Customer Service was great about taking care of this and offered a partial refund on the unit. I was hoping to find the replacement part online, but no luck. I can't recommend this due to the faulty part and lack of seller response to correct the issue.

Easy to assemble. Assembly will be easier and quicker with two persons but its doable on your own. I really like being able to program in my own workout. Bluetooth works well. Not too large or bulky. I use a strap on HRM and I've never used the sensors on the handles, so I can't comment on how well they work. LCD screen started to distort after I placed on phone in the device holder during a workout. It isn't so bad that it hinders my workouts, but is a bit annoying. Overall satisfied with my purchase.
The treadmill starts wearing off with little shreds coming off after running with 6mph.

On a scale of 1-5 stars I give this a 10. Iâm a very picky person & this device is amazing!!! Iâm 6â1 210lbs the screen is a little faded standing straight up but overall itâs great well worth the price! Let me shut up & take my money lol.

We love it! It has everything you would want with options, durability and quality. Can't beat this treadmill at this price. The size is just right. I'm 6'2" and 200lbs and it this treadmill is just perfect for me and my wife.

We bought this simply for walking during the winter months and in bad weather. I comes pretty much pre-assembled and the assembly for the rest took no more than a half-hour. The directions are straight-forward and and instructions for use are equally simplified. I do not run on it, as I have bilateral total knee replacements, but it works quite well for my wife and me. I use it as a change-up for my indoor bicycle trainer.

I researched quite a few treadmills from the least expensive to the outrageously expensive. You can't beat the price 400.00 for the features that this treadmill provides, most importantly the 12 levels of auto incline. I can't stress enough of how important that feature really is when wanting a more extensive workout. I have enjoyed using this treadmill, it is sturdy and fairly quiet and small enough not to fit in a smaller location in your home, mine is in the bedroom. would recommend if you are looking to spend less but still wanting first class quality.

This is my 3rd Sunny workout product purchased & I was not disappointed! I was immediately impressed with the sturdy materials used for packaging. My 13 year old daughter & I were able to move it into the area for set up easily. It comes mostly assembled which was huge, just a couple screws & it was ready to go. I received it on Friday & have already gotten in 4 great workouts in. It works seamlessly - I was considering the cheaper version w/out the auto elevation but it is well worth it to have this adjusted with just the touch of a button.

Most of it was preassembled so it was fairly easy to do the rest. The package delivered is pretty heavy so try to have it delivered close to where you want it. We used a bed sheet to drag it inside the house and slid it carefully down one set of stairs to where we wanted it. Once assembled, itâs a pretty good treadmill for the $$. I like the controls on the arms as well as on the screen. Worth it.

I bought this for my mom who is in her late 60s so she could walk even if it's winter time. She also wanted it to incline. The incline is great. Set up was easier than I expected.
This is heavy though. So if you are going up/downstairs be careful. Like my mom and dad would never have been able to carry this themselves into the house. My brother and I took care of that.
Mind you no one is running on this machine just a speed walk at most.
I tested the machine to see and I'm around 270ish on a bad day and I didn't feel any bad drag on this. I was able to walk with the incline set to max and it treated it like nothing. mind you if I attempted running IDK but its great if you want to start walking/keep walking. Fix some of that couch potato vibes you have set like myself.
I like the fact that it was really easy to put together but it make a lot of noice and itâs too narrow but besides that I try to manage because it it too heavy to return.
I'm still fat :(

Perfect size and enjoy the many features! Love the adjustments for speed and incline on the handles! Monitor is easy to read. Quiet, able to have a conversation while working out with normal voice. Great that you can view the preprogrammed workouts and select which one meets the goal of my workout for the day and that I have the options to create my own workout!

I bought this a year ago 3 days ago and I loved it but here we are a year later and it randomly goes from running at a 6 to dead stop. This is ridiculous. Iâve maybe used it 15 times. Save your money or invest in something more. You get what you pay for.

Iâve had the machine for less than a month. Within the second or third time using it, the screen started showing black spots. The spots go away after use but they are getting worse overtime - itâs getting very hard to see the screen. Also, the machineâs music blue tooth feature is useless - the sound comes in too faint. Iâm working with Amazon to get the machine replaced but Iâm not super hopeful that the next one wonât have the screen issues. I definitely think itâs overpriced for what you get.

This machine ceased functioning after we had it for 3 weeks. Communication with the company who made it is difficult. Can only communicate via email, which is answered in a less than timely manner. Attempts to reach them by phone have not been successful. The phone is answered by a recording which does not give you an option to talk with a real human, nor leave any message. Very disappointed to have spent this amount of $$ and have nothing but a machine that will not work.
Muy buena, mi esposo y yo estamos encantado de la maquina.

I was looking for a light weight Treadmill for most low impact walking while I watch TV during dark months. Now that I don't get as much sunlight, the Dog and I aren't getting as long of walks as we are used to. This treadmill, has a whole lot for a great price. The auto incline feature, speed and incline controls on the handle bars. Beverage holders, blue tooth, and MP3 jack. Folds up nice and moves fairly easy. Heart rate monitors, every thing you expect in a higher end treadmill for a really reasonable price. The only thing that is negative is it is lightweight, its rated for 220lb or lower in the ad. Although my paperwork says 250lb. That said, I wouldn't do high impact running on it if you are close to that weight. I'm 200lb and plan to use it for mostly walking. So this unit is perfect for the price range.

I was so excited for this treadmill because it had gotten really good reviews and it sounded like a quality piece of equipment. Then we received the treadmill and my husband and I were immediately disappointed. When we opened the box there were several pieces of the plastic that were already broken off. We decided to continue to assemble the treadmill hoping that it would still be a good purchase. We started the treadmill and my husband was unable to walk or run on it as it would not hold his weight. We tried tightening and loosing the belt but it was still not strong enough for him. He weighs 200 lbs. and it claims to be able to support up to 250 lbs. I even noticed that when I use the treadmill it is a bit jerky which feels dangerous like I might fall off. I weigh 140 lbs so I am not light but I should not be too heavy for this treadmill. Not sure if the machine we got is just finicky and the other treadmills are better quality but so far I am not super pleased with this purchase.

UPDATED REVIEW 6/14/21 ZERO STARS
Without explanation, the treadmill will periodically refuse to turn on or will shut down while in use. During these times, some or all of the buttons will not respond. One time, the belt continued to run, yet the stop button did not work. Thankfully, the emergency stop did work. Another time, the belt suddenly increased from 4mph to 8mph. Currently, for the last two days, the treadmill refuses to start, even though the display and most of the buttons work.
The, there is the issue with its inability to maintain the incline. The ramp will increase to the height I want, but over the next 30 to 60 seconds, it will always drop down to 3%.
Customer service is non-existent. I have tried contacting the seller by email, phone, through Amazon, without any response. The user manual does not have any useful information. There is no reset button on this. This unit has become a $500 clothes hanger. A complete waste of money. I will never buy from this company again.
Updated review 1/30/21 TWO STARS:
We have used this treadmill for more than three months. We average 15 hours a week on it. It has done an adequate job. It is beginning to squeak or whine, intermittently.
I downgraded this from 4 stars to 2 because of customer service. A few weeks ago the treadmill suddenly died. It had been used for an hour, there was an hour break, and then I went to use it again. It started to run, but died when I tried to raise the incline. No warning, no reason. The bluetooth connection and speakers still worked, the screen worked, but the motor would not run.
I made innumerable calls to the customer service line without any ever picking up the phone. It just rang endlessly each time. Neither the website nor the manual had any answer for this problem. I used Sunny's online inquiry since there was no other way to reach the company. They sent an automated messaging advising it would be 6-10 business days before we would get a response. Nope, it was 21 business days before we got a response and it was less than helpful. All they did was ask for the model number, sales receipt, etc - this was all information that was required on the initial submission and which we had provided already. The response gave us no clue at all about what to do.
Fortunately, after the machine sat unused for a day, it suddenly came back to life. All I could figure is that sweat seeped into the controllers on the arms, and shorted out the circuitry, and that a day of rest allowed it to dry out.
Now, I have little faith that this unit will last long term, and I am absatively confident that when it does conk out. Sunny will give zero support, leaving us with an large, expensive piece of trash that we must dispose of.
ORIGINAL REVIEW from October 2020 - FOUR STARS
This treadmill has exceeded expectations. It is sturdy and works well. In brief, this makes a good home walking/light jogging treadmill with nice features and at a reasonable price. If you want gym quality, you will need to spend at least 2x as much. For a home gym, it is solid and a good value.
Assembly was simple. It took longer for me to move it into my house or to unpack, then it did to assemble. I have no handyman skills, so this was a pleasant surprise that I assembled it in minutes and without any difficulty. They provide all of the tools needed, and the directions were clear. The unit was very-well packed; perhaps too-well. Between the Styrofoam, reinforced cardboard, and wooden bracers, it should not get damaged during delivery or bringing into the home.
I am 204lbs and had concerns whether this would handle my weight. That was not a problem. The frame is made of steel and there are stabilizers to keep it grounded. There is no movement in the unit when walking and no creaking when I lean on the handles. There is sufficient room between the handles for me to fit, which was another concern. My hips do not come any where close to the machine's arms. The walking tread is long enough for a fast walking or slow jogging stride. This is not designed for runners with long strides.
The amenities are good. My only gripe is that I cannot input my BMI or weight, unless I am using a program (though there might be a way, but I am not aware of it). The display is easy to read, showing time lapsed, distance in miles, calories burned, speed, and inclination. The auto-incline was flawless, raising/lowering quickly and without difficulty. Changing speeds was simple. It is nice having speed and incline controls on the arms, but too often I accidentally changed speed or incline. The heart rate monitor is convenient and accurate. Connecting a blue tooth device is simple. The speakers are mediocre, at best, for listening to music, but adequate if you are streaming a movie on your tablet. The control deck fits my 10" tablet nicely. The cups are large enough to hold 24 ounce bottles and larger.
Simple raising the walking deck is easywith the hydraulic assist. Lower the deck is easy, but it is very slow dropping due to the hydraulic release. It is not advised to force the walking tread to lower faster.
A big gripe about the arm controls. I am frequently, accidentally hitting the speed increase or ramp up. More than once I accidentally sent this from a comfortable 3.5mph to well over 4mph, risking injury to myself.

After about 3 months of use, this treadmill started making a knocking noise that is quite loud. I reached out via email to Sunny Health, who, although responsive and suggested things to try, nothing worked. I asked if they had any local service staff that could come and look at it and the answer was no. I guess I should have read more of the reviews before purchasing. Although it was the size treadmill that I was looking for...it was a waste of money.

I bought this treadmill back in October of 2020, despite waiting 2 MONTHS!! to receive it, it finally came. Assembly wasn't an issue and everything was working perfectly until 3 weeks in. After 3 weeks, I started noticing some screeching sounds coming from the treadmill. Not thinking much of it, I just added some lubricant thinking I hadn't put enough the first time. However, after a week later, the treadmill started to vibrate and shake violently.
I tried contacting Sunny but with no luck, so I contacted a treadmill repair company in my area, in which they told me that the back roller needed to be replaced and that they only way to get one is through Sunny. Now here's the best part, being that Sunny is a US company, their guarantee only applies to those who reside in the US, not in Canada. After multiple failed attempts to get a hold of them through the phone, I sent an email. I HAVE NEVER SEEN WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE IN MY LIFE!! It takes them at least 2 weeks to answer my emails and disregard any updates I ask for. I've been trying to get a part shipped for the past 2 months yet their lack of communication makes it impossible!! I haven't been able to use my treadmill and with every day that passes by I get more frustrated that they don't answer. One star for horrible customer service!! Never buying anything from them ever again
